Ayssi comensan las paraulas de Albucasim .	Ayssi comensan las paraulas de Albucasim.
O, filhs, pus yeu he a vos complit aquest libre, le qual es le derier de la sciencia de medicina, per le compliment de lu so consequit la fi en lu, e per las exposicios de lu, e per las declaracios de lu, es a mi vist que yeu complesca aquel a vos am aquest tractat, le qual es partida de la operacio am ma, so es cyrurgia.	O offspring, know that I have completed this book for you, which is the last of the science of medicine, for the praise of it, and for the praise of its practices, and for the pronouncements of its author, it is because I wish to instruct you in this book that which is part of my art, that is surgery.
Quar la operacio am ma es prostrada en nostre regio e en nostre temps de tot privada, entro que fort leu peric la sciencia de lu, e le vistigi de lu es ostat; e no romasero de lu sino alcunas petitas descripcios en les libres dels Antics, les quals mudero las mas e endevenc ad aquels error e heyssitacio entro que son clausas las entencios de lu e es elonguada la forsa de lu e l’art.	For surgery is very rare in our region and in our time, so that it is a thing that is almost lost; and its knowledge is very little, and the greatest part of it has perished; and it remains only a few small descriptions in the books of the Ancients, which change most of all and bring about those errors and hesitations that exist until their causes are understood and the force and the art are prolonged
E es vist a mi que yeu vivifique aquela am ordenacio de aquest tractat en aquela segon la via de exposicio e de declaracio e de abreviacio; e per que vengua am las formas dels ferramentz de cautheri e dels autres instrumentz de la obra cum sia per addicio de la declaracio, e per preparacio de lu, la qual causa es necessaria.	And it is seen by me that I have composed this treatise in such a way as to follow the way of exposition and declaration and abbreviation; and that it should be added to the forms of the instruments of cautery and other instruments of the work, as well as for the addition of the declaration, and for the preparation of it, which is necessary.
Mays la causa per la qual no es atrobat bo artifex am la sieua ma en aquest nostre temps, es quar la art de medicina es longua, e que cove le sieu actor denant aquo esser excercitat en la sciencia de anotomia la qual recontec Gualia entro que sapia les juvament dels membres e las formas de aquels, e la conjunctio e la separacio de lor; e haia la conoyssensa dels osses, dels nervis e dels lacertz, e·l nombre de aquels, e la egrecio de lor; e de las venas pulsatils e de las quietas, e dels locs del eyssiment de lor.	The cause why no good artist is found in this our time for the surgery of the hand is that the art of medicine is long, and that it covers many actors who have not been exercised in the science of anatomy, who do not know the bones, the nerves, and the lacerations, and the number of them, and their structure; and the knowledge of the veins and arteries, and the places of their origin and termination.</start_turn>
E per aquo ditz Ypocras que am u nom es mot, mays en l’obra petit, e majorment en la art de la ma.	And thus says Hippocrates that I have no name, but in the small work more than in the great work, and especially in the art of the hand.
Mays nos ja avem dit de aquel en l’introit de aquest libre; quar qui no es scient aquo que li avem dit de anotomia, no es evacuat que no caia en error per la qual siran mortz les homes, ayssi cum yeu he vist trops de aquels, quar alscus son formatz en esta sciencia e gettan se de aquela ses sciencia e ses experiment.	And indeed we have already said in the introduction of this book that whoever is not learned in anatomy is not worthy of being called a physician, for they will cause the death of many men, as I have seen in many instances, for many of them are formed in this science and depart from this science and its experiments.</start_turn
Quar yeu vi un metge folh e enperit aver incidit un apostema escrophilos en le colh de una femna, e incidic alcunas arterias del colh per que fluic gran sanc entro que la femna cazec morta entre las mas de lu.	For I have seen a foolish and inept physician who has incised a scrofula on the heel of a woman, and has ligated some arteries of the heel so that there flowed great blood within her, and the woman died between her thighs.
E vi un autre metge que pres que el traguera una peyra d’un home le qual avia procesit en sa etat, e la peyra era gran, e venguet a lu e trayssec aquela peyra am un tros de la vesiqua, per que aquel home al tertz dia es mort.	And I have seen another physician who thought he could pull out a stone from a man’s belly which had been there for a long time, and the stone was large, and he came to take it out with a hook, and the man died on the third day.
E yeu ja apelat fuy a estrayre aquela, e vi que per la grandesa de la peyra e per la disposicio del malaute conogui subre lu que morira.	And I have already mentioned this, and I saw that because of the greatness of the stone and the condition of the patient, he knew that he would die
E vi un autre metge le qual prenia stipendic de un duc de nostra terra per cyrurgia, e endeven a un crastrat negre le qual era deves lu fractura en la coyssa de lu; e perparec le metge am la sua ignorancia, estrayssec la fractura, sobre la plagua, am pulvinas e astelas am forta strectura, e no layssec a la plagua espiracio.	And I have seen another physician who took charge of surgery for a duke from our land, and he entrusted him with a black slave who was his servant; and the physician, in his ignorance, opened the fracture, over the wound, with sponges and sticks of great strength, and did not allow the wound to breathe.
E aprop le desliet segons los sieus desiriers, e aprop le relieg, e aprop le leyssec per alcus jorns e comandec que nos deslies le liament; e estec ayssi entro que la coyssa e·l pe foro apostematz, e pervenguet a perdicio.	And thus I forbade him according to his desires, and I released him, and I commanded that he should be relieved for a few days and be given rest; and this happened until the wound burst out, and he perished
E yeu fuy apelat a lu, e aparelhegui a desliar le liament, e conseguida es tranquilitat e enayssi amermet de sas dolors.	And I went to see him, and I saw that I had to take away the ligature, and there was peace and an end to the pain.</start_turn><end_turn>
Mays empero ja corrupcio era confermada en le membre, per que no pogui refrenar aquela, e no cessec perambular la corrupcio en le membre entro que·l malaute peric.	But indeed corruption was already confirmed in the limb, for I could not restrain that, and I did not cease to wander the corruption in the limb until the patient perished.
E vi un autre metge le qual perforec un apostema cancros, e fo ulcerat aprop alscus dias, entro que foc magnificada la malicia de lu am lo senhor de lu.	And I have seen another physician who perforated an abscess of cancer, and it bled profusely from the beginning, until the malignancy of it grew greater than that of the master of the house
La qual causa es quar le cranc caut es pur de humor melencolic, lahoras no cove que pervengua a lu am ferr de tot, sino que sia an membre le qual suffertes que de tot fos hostat.	The cause of this is that cancer is pure melancholic humor, and that it does not suffice to remove it from the limb in which it has settled, but that it must be treated in the limb in which it is to be found.
E per aquo, filhs, necessari es a vos que la operacio am ma sia devisada en dos devesios: so es en operacio a lu qual es associada salut, e en obra am la qual es perilh en las majors disposicios.	And thus, offspring, it is necessary for you that the surgery of the hand be divided into two parts: that is, in surgery which is associated with health, and in work which is perilous in the greatest precautions
E yeu ja he exsitat aquo en tot loc de aquest libre en le qual venc opperacio en la qual es error e temor; per que necessari es a vos que guardetz aquo e layssetz aquel, per que les folhs no atrobo via a parlar e a vos desonestar.	And I have already spoken of this in all places of this book in which I have mentioned surgery in which there is error and fear; for it is necessary for you to retain this and to leave that, so that the fools do not find fault with you and you do not become discouraged.
E donc prenetz las vostras armas am sollicitut e am proteccio de Dieu , e les vostres malautes am falicitat e am fermetat.	Therefore take the rest of the arms in the request and in the protection of God, and the rest of the diseases in the facility and in the firmness.
E usatz de la milhor via per la gracia de Dieu perdusent a salut e a lausabla successio, e laysatz las malautias terriblas de difficil sanacio, e ostatz las vostras armas de aquo que vos fa temer, per so que ysitatio en vostra fe e en le vostre nom no vos evasisca: quar mays es remanent a la vostra gloria, e pus aut en le mon e en derier a las vostras sanctitatz.	E use the way of the Lord in grace, and praiseworthy succession, and lay aside the grievous diseases of difficult healing, and finally the other weapons of that which you fear, so that your salvation may rest in your faith and in your name: for may your might remain to your glory, and above all in heaven and behind the saints.
Gualia ja diyssec en alcunas sieuas monicios:	Indeed, I have already mentioned several times in various discourses:
“No mediquetz malautia mala, per so que mals metges no siatz nompnatz”.	“There is no medicine for a bad disease, so that no doctor will be called by that name”.
E yeu ja he devesit aquest libre segontz tres capitols.	And I have already discussed this book according to three chapters.
Comensa la divisio del libre, e primier de la primieyra partida.	Begin the division of the book, and first of the first part
Le primier capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, en las formas dels instrumentz e en les ferrementz dels cauteris, e de aquo que necessari es en la opperacio.	The first chapter deals with the parts of the foot, in the forms of instruments and the utensils of the cautery, and what is necessary for the operation
La divisio de la segonda partida.	Division of the second part
Le segon capitol, de siccio e perforacio, e de ventosas, e de plaguas, e de extractio de sagetas e de semblantz ad aquelas, tot capitolat e ordenat de las formas dels instrumentz.	The second chapter deals with swelling and perforation, and of blisters, and of wounds, and of the extraction of arrows and similar to those, all categorized and ordered by the forms of the instruments
Divisio de la tersa partida.	Division of the third part
Le tertz capitol, de restauracio e de dislocacio, e de curacio de torcio e de semblantz ad aquels; capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, e de las formas dels instrumentz.	The third chapter deals with restoration and dislocation, and with the care of fractures and similar to those; the chapter is categorized from the head to the foot, and by the forms of the instruments
De cauteri am foc e am medicina aguda e rememoracio de la opperacio.	Of cautery and acute medicine and reminder of the operation
Am aquel comensa le tractat de tot le libre.	In that in which the treatise of all the book begins
Cove que yeu digua la qualitat dels juvamentz de aquel cauteri e dels noccumentz de lu, e en qual compleccio sia prohibit cauteri.	So I say what is the quality of the instruments of that cautery and of their documents, and in what combination it is prohibited to cauterize.
Donc dic que·l sermo de la qualitat del juvament de cauteri e del noccument de lu es sermo lonc e prolixs, e subtil per sciensa, e secret amaguat; e ja de lu a parlat gran multitut de savis, e de lu se son desacordatz, et a mi abasta un petit dels sermons de lor, temen perlonguacio.	Therefore I say that the speech about the quality of the cautery instruments and their documents is a long and elaborate one, and subtle for science, and a secret hidden; and already many savants have spoken greatly of it, and they have disagreed with each other, and to me it seems that a small part of their speeches is sufficient, fearing prolongation.
E donc dic que cauteri comfereys a tota compleccio universalment la qual es am materia o ses materia, exceptat dos compleccios, las quals son compleccios caudas ses materia .	Therefore I say that cautery is permissible in all its universality with regard to its matter or its matter, except for two qualifications, which are qualifications that refer to its matter
En la compleccio cauda e secca am materia se desecordero; quar alcus dyssero que cauteri es juvatiu ad aquela, e les autres dyssero le contrari de aquel, que cauteri no es convenient en malautia la qual es per qualiditat e per siccitat, quar natura del foc es qualiditat e siccitat, e enconvenient es que malautia cauda e secca am aquo que es caut e sec sia sanada.	In the cold and dry matter there is disagreement; for some say that cautery is useful for that, while others say that it is harmful for that, because the nature of fire is quality and dryness, and it is inconvenient that the disease be cold and dry along with that which is being cauterized and dried.
E diysec aquel que ditz le contrari de aquel, que per cauteri es fayt juvament en tota malautia cauda e secca que ve en les cors dels homes, quar quan tu comparas le cors de home e las humiditatz de lu a la compleccio del foc, atrobas le cors de home freg.	And those who say the opposite, that by cautery is useful for any cold and dry disease that is in the bodies of men, because when you compare the body of a man with the humidity of his body with the quality of fire, you find the body of a man cold.
E yeu dic per le sermo de aquel, que esperiment aquo ja a mi alscunas vetz a descubert.	And I say concerning this speech that I have already experimented with it several times and discovered it
Mays empero no cove que vengua sobre aquo aquel que ja es exproat e excersitat en le capitol de cauteri per derier exercici, e a conogut la diversitat de la compleccio dels homes e la disposicio de las malautias en lor meteyssas, e las causas de aquelas, e·ls accidentz de lor, e l’espasi del temps de aquelas.	But I do not say that everything that is said above is to be taken for granted; for it is necessary to know the practice of cautery after exercise, and to be acquainted with the diversity of the qualities of men and the disposition of diseases in their bodies, and the causes of those, and the accidents of those, and the time space of those
Mays en las autras compleccios, no es sobre vos temor, e majorment en las malautias fregas e humidas, quar ja totz les metges se son acordatz sobre aquels, e no so desecordatz en le juvament am cauteri en aquelas.	In other qualifications, it is not about you to fear, and especially in cold and humid diseases, for already all doctors have agreed on those, and they do not disagree in the usefulness of cautery in those
E sapiatz, filhs, que del secret de curacio per cauteri am foc e de la bontat de lu, so sobre cauteri am medicina comburent, es quar le foc es simple, la accio del qual no perven sino al membre le qual es cauterizat e no notz al autre membre am lu ajustat sino am petit nocument.	And know, children, that the secret of curing with fire cautery is not in the power of fire, but in the gentleness of fire, for the action of the fire does not reach beyond the part which is cauterized and does not touch anything else except for the small document.
Mays la accio de medicina comburent perven ad aquel en les membres le qual de lu alunhat, e fort leu fa venir en le membre malautia de dificil sanacio e fort leu ausit.	And the action of external medicine reaches only to that part of the limb from which it is applied, and it makes it strong for the diseased part of the limb of difficult healing and makes it strong to leave
Mays le foc, per la sua sublimitat e de la sua substancia bontat, no fa aquo sino que superfluisca E ja es a nos conogut per experiment e per longitut de servitut de studi am l’art sobre le veritat de las causas; e per aquo yeu so excusat de la longitut del sermo E si no fos que no es legut al mieu libre en aquest pausero a vos secret amaguat am le foc, e la qualitat de la operacio de lu en les cors e de la sieua expulcio per la qual expellis las malautias, am sermo philosophic demostratiu, le qual siria acuit en las vostras pessas.	But the fire, for its smallness and for its gentleness, does nothing other than what we already know by experience and by the length of our studies concerning the truth of the causes; and for this reason I am excused for the length of this speech, for it is not fitting for me to reveal this secret of yours concerning fire, and the quality of its operation in the bodies and the safety of its expulsion for which it expels diseases, as a philosophical demonstration, which would be acute in the remaining passages.
E sapiatz, filhs, que els se desacordan del temps en le qual es convenient far cauteri e pausan le milhor temps de primaveyra.	The best translation is:
E yeu dic que cauteri es convenient en tot temps, per so que le nocument per le temps accident es submergit en le juvament de aquo que am le cauteri es atirat, e majorment si le cauteri es per dolors o de dolors necessaries, fortz e fistinas, las quals no suffertan tarditat per so que es temut de aquelas que vengua malicia, que es major que petit nocument entrant per lo temps.	I say that cautery is suitable at all times, for thus it does not harm the time of the accident when it is immersed in the benefit of water that makes the cautery more painful, especially if the cautery is for pains or necessary pains, which do not suffer from delay, for it is feared that those that come late will bring malice, which is greater than the slight discomfort of coming at the right time.</end_of_turn>
E aysso no catz en vostras pessas, o, filhs, aquo no estiman sino le poble vulguar e les fols metges, so es que ad aquela malautia que es sanada per cauteri no es redicio tot temps, e pausan aquel consequen.	I do not deny, friends, that sometimes the people of the vulgar sort, or rather the fools of the doctors, do not esteem anything except for the common people and the poor peasants. So it is with that disease which is cured by cautery, for it is not ridiculous at all times, and one should stop at that consequence.</end_of_turn>
E la causa no es ges ayssi quo els cuydan per aquo, quar cauteri no es sino en loc de medicina la qual altera la compleccio e esicca las humiditatz las quals son causa per que veno las dolors.	And the cause is not that they give it for water, for cautery is nothing but a medicine that alters the composition and dries the humors which are the cause of pain.</end_of_turn
Mays empero cauteri superflueys sobre la medicina per volicitat de la sua valitut e vertut de la sua operacio e grandesa del sieu senhor.	Moreover, cautery surpasses medicine for the delight of its value and the virtue of its operation and the greatness of the Lord's mercy.</end_of_turn>
E es possible que la sua malautia retorne en alcuna hora del temps, segon la compleccio del malaute e la locacio de la sua malautia, e la vertut de lu, e aquo que es preparat en le cors de lu de la agreguacio de las superfluitatz en lu, e aquo que es pervengut a lu en la sua acquisicio en viandas e semblantz de aquelas causas; sino que la malautia en la qual sia aministrat cauteri sia malautia subtil en membre de paucas superfluitatz e humiditatz, ayssi cum cauteri de dent per dolor e semblantz ad aquel, possible es que en lu no retorne aquela dolor, mays aquo se fa en petitz.	It is possible that the disease will return at any time of life, according to the composition of the disease and the location of the disease, and the virtue of the treatments, and what is prepared in the body from the abundance of humors in the body, and what is brought to the body in food and drink, and from those causes; but when the disease is treated with cautery, it is a subtle disease in a few superfluous humors and moisture, just as if it were cautery for toothache.
E mays sermo vulgar es que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, e es sermo dreyturier, no ad aquo que els entendo en lu, quar els crezo que no es curacio que aprofieyta am medicina ni am autra causa aprop cauteri.	Therefore it is better to speak vulgarly that cautery is the last remedy of medicine, and is a speech of great prudence, not as those understand it who do not know it, for they believe that it is not a cure that uses either medicine or any other cause except for cautery.
E la causa es en contrari de aquo; e la entencio que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina no es sino quan administram las manieyras de curacio en alcunas malautias, e aquelas medicinas no conferieysso, e aprop en la fi de la causa aministra hom cauteri, e aprofieyta ad aquela.	On the contrary; and the understanding that cautery is the last remedy of medicine is true only when the methods of treatment of certain diseases are administered, and those medicines do not suffice, and when the cause is in some way overcome, it is appropriate to administer cautery, and to take advantage of that.</end_of_turn
E lahoras de aqui cat16 que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, no segon la entencio la qual entendo les vulgars e trops dels fols metges.	And thus it is clear that cautery is the last remedy of medicine, not according to the understanding which the vulgar people and the fools of the doctors have of it.</end_of_turn>
E diyssero les antics que cauteri am aur es milhor que cauteri am ferr, e no diyssero aquo sino per la equalitat del aur e sublimitat de la sua sustancia.	The ancients say that cautery with gold is better than cautery with iron, and I do not say anything else except for the equality of gold and the subtlety of its substance.</end_of_turn>
E diyssero que le loc de cauteri no fa brac, cum aquo no sia absolutament vertat, quar yeu ja he aquo proat e he atrobat que aquel no fa aquo sino en alcus cors ses les autres, e cauteri am aquel es bo e milhor que am ferr ayssi quo els diyssero; mays empero quan tu fas cauteri am foc am de aur, no es a tu declarat, quar es egnit segon la quantitat que tu vols per la rugor de l’aur, e quar prepara a recebre freg; e si ajustas sobre lu ignicio se fon l’aur per le foc, e caso en le foc alcunas laminas per que le artifex catz per la occupacio de aquel.	I say that the place of cautery does not make it harmful, as some falsely believe, for I have already seen that it does no harm to any limb except for the other, and that cautery with gold is better than that with iron; however, when you make cautery with fire from gold, you must take care that the fire is not too strong, for if you adjust too much fuel to the fire, the gold will burn for the fire; and if you take away some of the fuel, the operator will burn his hands for lack of fuel.
E per aquo es fayt cauteri am ferr deves nos pus leugerament e pus propdanament a rectitut de operacio.	Therefore, when you make cautery with iron you must place it more gently and more cautiously on the rectitude of the operation.
E yeu ja he ordenat aquest capitol en le cauteri segon capitols, et he ordenat aquels del cap entro les pes, per so que aleugo le demandant aquo que vol de lu.	I have already arranged this chapter on cautery according to chapters, and I have arranged those that are between the feet so that I may satisfy the request of those who demand it of me.</end_of_turn>
De cauteri de dolor de cap per frigiditat e humiditat.	Of cautery for the headache from cold and moisture.</end_of_turn
Le capitol primier.	Chapter one.</end_of_turn>
Aquesta cauterizacio confereys a la humiditat e frigiditat sobre le servel accident de la qual so doas causas, so es causa de soda e multitut de flux raumatic, apelat corissa, del cap a las partidas dels huelhs e de las aurelhas fluent, e multitut de dormir, e de dolor de dentz e del guolayro, e universalment de tota malautia que ve per fregiditat, ayssi cum paraliticament, sodo e apoplexio, e semblantz en aquelas malautias.	This cautery confers relief from cold and moisture concerning the accidental cause of the which two causes, so is the cause of soda and the multitude of rheumatic fluxes, swelling of the marrow, of the head to the limbs of the heels and the flowing urine, and the multitude of sleep, and toothache and gut pain, and universally of all diseases that arise from cold, even as paralysis, suffocation and apoplexy, and is similar in those diseases.</end_of_turn
La forma de aquesta cauterizacio es aquesta, que primieyrament comandes al malaute que sia evacuat am medicina lacsativa le cap mondificant, per tres o per quatre nueytz, segon que exhigeys la vertut del malaute e la edat de lu e la sua costuma.	The form of this cautery is as follows: first command the patient to evacuate with laxatives for three or four nights, according to the excess of the virtue of the disease and the age and custom of the patient.</end_of_turn
E aprop comanda li que raza le sieu cap am razor, e aprop fay aquel sezer entre las tuas mas sobre una banca cayrada e que pause las suas mas sobre le pietz sieu.	And then command him to shave his head with a razor, and then do that which must be done between your thighs on a fallen bench and that you place your hands on your feet.</end_of_turn
E aprop pausa la razit de la tua palma aprop le pous sobre la razit del nas entre les huels sieus.	And then hold the razor of your palm near the root of the nose between the toes of your feet.</end_of_turn
Mays empero, cum le tieu dit del mieg loc es pervengut, signa aquel loc am tenta, e aprop igneys le cauteri olivar del qual aquesta es la forma:	May be, since the sick person has mentioned the area of the ankle is affected, the sign of the ankle is that the fire is there: and immediately ignite the olive oil of which this is the shape.
E aprop pausa aquel sobre le loc senhat am tenta, a manieyra que descent, am la qual la tieua ma sia constrengida petit a petit, e tu revolveys aquel.	And immediately stop that over the area that is affected, in such a way that it slowly descends, and your hand is slightly constricted, and you will rotate that
E aprop leva la tua ma leugerament e reguarda le loc, e si veses ja del os esser descubert alcuna quantitat del cap, ayssi cum la quantitat de gra de errs, lahoras eleva la tua ma, e si no torno la tua ma am aquel ferr, am autre de aquel, si es enfrigidat, entro que sia vist del os aquo que yeu he dit a tu.	And immediately lift your hand slightly and support the area, and if you see that already some quantity of the head of the bone is exposed, as much as the quantity of barley grains, then elevate your hand, and if you do not turn your hand away from that side, from the other side, if it is cooled down, enter until you see that amount of bone that I have told you about.
E aprop pren un petit de sal e disolveys aquel sobre le loc e leyssa aquel per tres jorns.	And immediately take a little of salt and dissolve it over the area and let it stay for three days.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto enbegut en boder e leyssa aquel sobre lu entro que sia destrusida la scara del foc.	And immediately stop over the knee bent in the border and let it stay until the burn of the fire is destroyed
E aprop cura le loc am anguent tetrafarmacon entro que sia sanat.	And immediately apply the four remedies to the area until it is healed
E ja diyssero que quant la plagua roman uberta, tant mielhs geta le brac, per que es milhor e mays juvatiu.	And indeed when the plague remains open, better take off the sleeve, for it is better and more useful
E diyssero alcus de lor que sia cauterizada la codena entro al os, e sia tengut le cauteri entro que sia adhurida alcuna partida de la specitut del os.	I say to you all that the heel must be cauterized until the bone, and must be held cauterized until every part of the substance of the bone is consumed.
E aprop sia ras aquo que es adhust del os, e aprop sia curat.	And immediately both that which is pressed against the bone and that which is cured
E diyssero autres que am lo cauteri pervengua al derier, entro que enprema en le os forta enprecio entro que le os caga, e aquesta es la forma de alphecati petit:	And I say to you that it must be cauterized behind, until it almost reaches the bone, so that when it is pressed against the bone it makes the bone strong, and this is the way of making an incision that is not too deep.
E estiman de aquel loc expiran la vapors del cap.	And it is estimated that from that area the vapor of the head escapes.
E sia tenguda la plagua uberta per lonc temps, e aprop sia curada entro que sia consolidada.	And if the plague remains open for a long time, and finally it is cured, it must be consolidated
Mays a mi no so vistas aquestas doas specias de cauteri de tot, sino en alcus homes segon via de temor; e layssa aquel, deves mi, milhor es am salut, quan es; quar le cap es develitat per solucio de continuitat de lu ayssi cum havem testificat en les autres membres, e majorment quan le cap del malaute es de freul natura.	I do not see these two ways of cauterizing in all my life, but in some men for fear; and leave that, you must know, is better for health than to cause the head to be swollen by continuous application, just as we have testified in other members, and even more so when the head of the patient is of a cold nature
E la specia de cauteri primieyra es mays salva e milhor deves mi; e de aquela husi e am aquela obra am salut.	The first way of cauterizing is better and more useful, you must know; and from that one I have seen better results in this work than from this one.
Capitol segon.	End of text.
Del cauteri del cap.	Of the cauterization of the head.
Quan en tot le cap accideys dolor cronica e longua e aquo es en le malaute prolonguat, e usa de gerras e de cochias e de capipurges e de emplaustres e de guatz e de cadels e de gualinas e de semblantz, e majorment si ja es cauterizat am un cautere le qual recontam e no aprofieyta a lu deguna de aquelas causas, lahoras considera quar si le cap del malaute es de fort creacio en la sua natura; e no es freul et atroba mot gran freg, lahoras aquel cauterisa am autra cauteri dejos aquel un pauc.	When in all the head chronic and long-lasting pain occurs and the disease is prolonged, and you use herbs and poultices and compresses and patches and sponges and garlic and onions and vinegar and mustard, and especially if it has already been cauterized with a cautery that reports and does not benefit from any of those causes, then consider that if the head of the disease is of strong constitution in its nature; and that it is not cold and finds no great heat, then you should cauterize with another cautery leaving a little space between them.
E aprop cauterisa aquel sobre le corn del sieu cap am cauteri entro que la codena es partida.	And immediately cauterize over the heel of the foot until the bone is fractured
Incisa la codena e sia descuberta del os la quantitat la qual havem recontat e cauteriza aquel am un cauteri en la partida deriera del cap en le loc le qual es apelat vas, — e es aquel loc en le qual es pausada ventosa.	Cut the bone and uncover from the bone the quantity that we have recounted and cauterize that which is in the lower part of the head in the area where the veins are closed, — and that is the place where the wind is stopped.
Et alleuja la tua ma en aysso, e no descobras le os, quar le malaute per aquo atroba mot gran dolor diversa de la dolor de totz les autres cauteris del cap.	And withdraw your hand quickly in support, and do not uncover the bone, for the disease by that will find great pain different from the pain of all the other cauteries of the head
E yeu diyre aquest cauteri en son loc, quar cove que·l cauteri am le qual so cauterisatz les corns del cap e le occiput es pus subtil cauteri que aquel am le qual es cauterisat le mieg loc del cap; e aquesta es la forma de lu.	I say this cautery in this place, because it covers that which must be cauterized with the one which has already been cauterized, that is the corn of the head and the occipital bone is more subtle a cauterize than that which is cauterized in the middle of the head; and this is the way of doing it

De cauterisacio de emigranea no-antiqua.	Of the cauterization of an ancient hernia.
Quan endeve en la partida del cap dolor sodo, o es stenduda dolor entro al uelh, sia evacuat am medicinas le cap mondificantz, e sia aministrada l’autra curacio, la qual yeu he dita en las devesios de las malautias; e tot no aprofieyta, lahoras cauterisacio en lu es en dos manieyras: o cauterisacio am medicina acuta comburent, o am ferr.	When inside the head there is soft pain, or is prolonged pain in the groin, evacuate immediately with medicines that strengthen the head, and administer the other treatment which I have mentioned in the conditions of diseases; and if that does not help, then the cauterization of the area is in two ways: either with acute medicine that burns, or with a needle
Mays cauteri am medicina comburent es que tu prenguas una dolsa de alh, e escorgas aquela e abcindas las extremitatz de lu de amdos les caps.	Better is the cauterization with acute medicine than that with alcohol, for you take a spoonful of vinegar and expel that and remove the extremities of it from both heads
E aprop incideys le loc de la dolor en la templa am una lanceta lada entro que sia en lu feyt loc dejos la codena, entro que sia occultada.	And thus strike the area of the pain on the temple with a lancet that is in the area of the pain itself, so that the cordene is not visible.
E aprop strenh sobre lu am stopada per descent constreccio, e layssa aquel per le spazi de tres horas; e aprop deslia le e tratz le alh, e laysa la plagua per dos o per tres jorn, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto submergit en boder entro que le loc fassa brac.	And keep pressure on it for a while to constrict, and leave it for three hours; then remove the ligature and take away the dressing, and leave the wound covered for two or three days, and keep your hand over it until the pain subsides.
E aprop cura aquel am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And care for that which is engorged until it is healed
E si tu voys, fe aquo am alcunas medicinas comburentz las quals yeu he scriutas en le douse tractat de medicinas comburentz.	And if you wish, know that there are many medicines that combat these which I have written in the previous treatise on medicines that combat them
Mays la cauterisacio am ferr segon aquesta manieyra: igneys per cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	May the cautery be done with iron in this manner: fire for the cautery of which this is the form:
e es apelat claus clavilhs, quar le cap de lu es ayssi cum forma de clavel en le qual es alcuna curvitat, e·n le mieg loc de lu es eminensia petita.	and is called closed clamps, which has a head like a nail in which there is a small prominence in the middle.
E aprop pausa sobre loc de la dolor, e rete la tua ma — per que no sia adhurida la arceria la qual es dejos — e revol le ferr petit a petit am velocitat.	And keep your hand over the area of the pain, and hold your hand – that the dressing is not torn which is left – and slowly rotate the iron little by little with speed
E si la quantitat de lu que es adhurida per la specitut de la codena ayssi quo la maytat de lu, e elava la tua ma per so que la arteria no sia adhurida la qual es dejos, per so que no vengua flux de sanc.	And if the quantity that is adhered by the specification of the cordene is as much as most of it, elevate your hand so that the artery is not torn which is left, so that there is no flow of blood
E aprop enbibeys coto en aygua de sal e pausa aquel sobre le loc, e layssa aquel per tres dias; e aprop pausa coto mulhat am boder, e aprop cura am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And immerse the wound in salt water and leave it on the area for three days; then cover the area with a dressing and care for it until it is healed
E si voys, cauterisa am la extremitat del cutellari segon cauteri, e guarda te de incisio de arteria en aquesta emigranea propriament no-antiqua.	And if you wish, cauterize at the extremity of the cuticle according to the incision, and keep the incision of the artery in this outward movement properly not antiquated.
Capitol quart.	Chapter four
De cauterizacio d’emigranea antiqua.	Of the cautery of the inward movement of the artery
Quan tu curas emigranea am aquo que havem dit de la curacio precedent, e aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias, e no aprofieyta la curacio, e vezes per la malautia que no abasta a lu aquo que havem dit del primier cauteri am medicina o del cauteri am foc, lahoras cove que tu igniscas le cauteri cutellar entro que sia albificat, pus que significas sobre le loc de la dolor am linha de longuesa de la qual sia la maytat del dit, o quays aquel; e depausa la tua ma per una veguada e strenh aquela entro incidiscas la arceria e pervengua entro al os.	When you have cured the artery according to what has been said of the previous treatment and what has been said in the divisions of the diseases, and you do not profit from the treatment, and sometimes for the disease that does not suffice for it as much as the first treatment with medicine or the cautery with fire, then know that you must ignite the cautery of the nail until it is white, for it signifies that over the area of the pain along the line of length of which is the greatest part of the finger, or whatever; and withdraw your hand for a while and hold it until you have inciscated the artery and arrived at the bone
Empero necessari es a tu que guardes de la continuacio de la mandibula, la qual es mauguda deves la masticacio, e que le lacert no sia adhurit e le nervi le qual mau aquela, e que no s’endevengua espasme.	However necessary is that you guard the continuity of the mandible, which is praised for chewing, and that the nerve not be torn and that the muscles not be damaged, and that no spasm occur
E si es sobre la custodia e cautela de flux de sanc de l’arteria que es abciza, quar en la abcizio de lu es temor, e majorment ad aquel le qual ignora aquo que fa e no es studios e esproat; e layssa la operacio en lu al comensament.	And if it is about the custody and care of the flow of blood of the artery that is being cauterized, because in the cautery of it there is fear, and especially for that one who ignores what is done and is not studied and is reckless; leave the operation to the beginning
E yeu vindre am rememoracio del regiment de flux de sanc accident de la arceria segon la sieua manieyra, en le sieu loc de aquest libre.	And I come to remind you of the regimen of the flow of blood concerning the accident of the artery according to its custom
E si veses de aquesta malautia que no abaste aquest cauteri e veses le cors del malaute tollerable, cauteriza aquel en le mieg loc del cap ayssi cum havem recontat, e cura la plagua entro que sia sanada.	And if you see this disease that does not benefit from this cautery and you see the body of the patient tolerable, cauterize that in the middle of the head as we have recounted, and care for the wound until it is healed
E si voys, aministra le cauteri le qual havem dit en le capitol de streccio de arceria am cauteri havent dos cotels, e es milhor cauterizacio aquesta e mays conferent.	And if you wish, administer the cautery which we have said in the chapter of the stretching of the artery with two clamps, and this is better cautery and more reliable
Capitol .v.	Chapter five
De cauterisacio de las dolors de aurelhas.	Of the cautery of the pains of the heel
Quan en la aurelha ve dolor per freg e es curat am causas lacsativas e am l’autra curacio la qual he dita en la divisio, e no es remauguda la dolor, lahoras igneys le cauteri, e es aquest le qual ha nom puncta, del qual aquesta es la forma:	When in the heel there is pain from cold and is cured by means of lacatives and by the other treatment which I have mentioned in the division, and the pain is not relieved, then know that you must ignite the cautery, and this is the one that has no point, of which this is the form:
E aprop puncta aprop la ignicio, e sia menat al enviro de tota la aurelha ayssi cum roda es revolguda, o en le circuit de quascuna essemps si la dolor es en quascuna. E si le cauteri de detz puntz en tota aurelha, e quays aquela, e aprop cura les locz entro que sian sanatz.	And if you have made ten points all around the heel, and what is that, and care for the wounds until they are healed
Capitol .vi.	Chapter six
De cauterizacio de turtura.	From cautery of the torus.
Turtura la qual es curada e am cauterizacio no es sino de las specias las quals veno per flecma, segon que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias.	The torus which is cured by cautery is not anything other than the species which cause inflammation, as we have said in the divisions of diseases.</end_of_turn>
Esquiva cauterizacio de la specia que endeve per siccacio o per spasme del nervi.	Avoid cautery of the species which must be dried or whose nerves are spastic.</end_of_turn>
Quan tu curas aquela specia de turtura am jerras e capipurgi e guarguarismes, e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas le malaute am tres cauteris: la i deves la razit de la aurelha, e·l segon un petit dejos le sieu templar, e le ters deves la conjunccio de doas labias.	When you have cured that species of torus, immerse the limb in hot water and cover it with oil, and keep it warm, without removing the dressing, until you have cauterized with three cautery instruments: the first you must touch the root of the nail, the second a little beyond the nail, and the third at the junction of the two lips.</end_of_turn
E pausa lo tieu cauteri per le contrari de la partida malauta, quar mollificacio no ve sino en la partida que apar sana.	And keep the cautery away from the opposite side of the painful area, because mollification does not take effect except in the part where the pain is healed.</end_of_turn
E la forma de cauterisacio es que cauterizas aquel am le cauteri en le dreyt de la extremitat de la aurelha pus sobirana un petit sobre le corn del cap, e en le templar autre, la longuesa del qual sia segon la longitut del dit pous, e depausa la tua ma am cauteri entro que sia comburida la quantitat de la maytat de la specitut de la codena.	And the manner of cautery is that you cauterize that which is black in the root of the nail while you hold a little over the head of the toe, and in the temple another, the length of which is according to the length of the finger without going beyond. Stop your hand with the cautery until the quantity of the matter of the species of the code has been consumed.</end_of_turn
E aquesta es la forma del cauteri, e es specia del cutellari, la forma del qual es denant mesa.	And this is the form of cautery, and it is the species of the cautery, the form of which is like a knife with a flat blade.</end_of_turn
Mays empero pus subtil es que aquel un pauc ayssi co vesas; e cove que cotel en lu de superflua groceza un pauc.	More subtle is that one which a little always sees; and cover in it of excessive thickness a little.</end_of_turn
E aprop cura le loc am aquo que es denant procezit entro que sia sanat.	And keep the area around the limb in water which is like a bath until it is healed.</end_of_turn

Capitol .xiiii.	Chapter XIV.</start_of_turn
De cauterizacio de fetor de nas.	Of the cautery of the smell of the nose.</start_of_turn
Quan tu medicas aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no aprofieyta la tua medicacio, lahoras tu aparelha e dona en beure al malaute las cochias per tres noytz; e aprop ras le cap de lu, e cauteriza le am cauteri migier am cauteri olivar.	When your physicians have done what we have said in the division and do not profit from your medicine, then you shall appear and give to the patient to drink for three nights; and then cleanse his head and cauterize the middle with the olive oil.</start_of_turn
E aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri clavelh am dos cauteris sobre les dos sobrecilhs dejos les cabels un petit.	And cauterize that which is cauterized with the clove with two cauteries over the two eyebrows leaving the hair a little.</start_of_turn
E guarda te de la arceria que no incindas aquela.	And guard yourself from the burning that you do not burn that.</start_of_turn
E del cauteri clavilh aquesta es la forma.	And this is the form of the clove cautery.</start_of_turn
Capitol .xv.	Chapter XV.</start_of_turn
De cauteri de mollificacio de palpebras dels huels.	Of the cautery of the softening of the eyelids of the eyes.</start_of_turn
Quan la palpebra del huel es mollificada per malautia o per humiditat, lahoras cauteriza aquela palpebre1 am un cauteri am aquest cauteri lunar; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	When the eyelid of the eye is softened by disease or humidity, then you cauterize that eyelid with a cautery with a lunar shape; and this is the form of it:
E si vos, cauteriza aquel sobre les dos sobrecils un petit am dos cauteris en tota partida, e sian elonguatz de las timporas.	And if you wish, cauterize over the two eyebrows a little with two cauteries throughout, and they will be elongated from the temples.</start_of_turn
E sia la longitut de quascun cauteri segon la quantitat del sobrecil.	And the length of each cautery should be according to the quantity of the eyebrow.</start_of_turn
E no premas trop la tua ma am le cauteri, mays segon la quantitat que la tersa partida de la palpebre sia adhurida.	And do not press too much your hand with the cautery, but according to the quantity that the third part of the eyelid is adhered.</start_of_turn
Capitol .xvi.	Chapter XVI.</start_of_turn
De cauteri de la palpebre del huel quan les pels so convertitz a las partidas dedintz e punho le huel.	Of the cautery of the eye when the pupil is converted into parts and the pupil is put out of the eye.</start_of_turn
Quan les pels del huel son convertitz a las partidas dedintz ayssi que pungo le huel, cauteri en aquels es segon dos manieyras, quar cauteri o es am fer o es am medicina comburent.	When the pupils of the eye are converted into parts as soon as the pupil is put out of the eye, cauterize in those two ways, either by making or by medicine that burns.</start_of_turn
Si am cauteri de lu am foc, comanda al malaute denant aquo que leyse les sieus pels ayssi cum aquels les quals les mundan, entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz; e si punho aquel deves le lor naysement, lahoras tu strenh les huels de lu am una benda per so que no sia maugut entro que·ls pels sian nascutz.	If you cauterize with fire, command the patient to drink while the pupils are reading those that move them, until they are prolonged and equal; and if you put out the eye, then strengthen the eyes of the patient with a bandage so that it is not painful until the pupils are born.</start_of_turn
Donc cum siran nascutz e engualhatz, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop senha sobre la palpebre dels huels de lu am tenta, am senhal le qual sia segon la figura de fulha de merta, e sia le comensament del senhal prop dels pels.	When the pupils are born and equal, then you pause the head of the patient in the gut and approach again over the eye of the patient with your hand, with a signal that is according to the figure of the holly leaf, and that is the beginning of the signal at the edge of the pupil.</start_of_turn
E aprop pausa coto enbegut en album de huou o en mucillatge de ptilli sobre le huel.	And approach slowly from behind with a bandage of wool or with mucus of fish over the eye.</start_of_turn
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma de lu.	And approach quickly the cautery of which this is the form.</start_of_turn
E aprop cauteriza sobre la figura la qual as senhada, petit a petit, em motas veguadas, entro que sia comburida la superficia de la codena la qual es ayssi cum fuelha de mirta, tota aparent propriament.	And approach cauterizing over the figure that you have signaled, little by little, in burnt patches, until the surface of the bone that is just like a holly leaf is completely burned out, quite openly indeed.</start_of_turn
E senhal de sanetat de la tieua obra es que tu vegus la palpebre de l’huel ja esser contrayta e·ls pels de lu esser elevatz deves la punctura del huel.	The sign of safety in your work is that you see the pupil of the eye already contracted and the eyelids elevated above the puncture of the eye.
E donc eleva la tua ma e laysa aquel per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eredicada la scara.	Therefore raise your hand and place it there for three days, and keep your hand resting on the edge until the wound is healed.</end_of_turn>
E aprop cura aquela am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And take care of that which is swollen until it is healed.</end_of_turn>
Mays si retorna per les pels alcuna causa aprop lor naysement e la palpebra es mollificada, lahoras fay autra vetz le cauteri sobre aquel tot ayssi cum avias fayt primieyrament.	Maybe if it returns for any reason, then immediately remove the swelling and soften the pupil, for the hour will come again when you will make the puncture once more.</end_of_turn
Mays si les pels so en la palpebra dejos, lahoras cauterisa aquela entro que sia elevada al sieu loc natural e sia engualhat e que les pels no punhan le huelh.	Maybe if the swelling is in the pupil, then immediately cauterize that until it is raised to its natural level and is equalized, and that the pupil does not touch the eye again.</end_of_turn>
Mays le cauteri am medicina comburent aquest es que comandes al malaute que leyse les pels entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz, e aprop sia fayta de carta de drap la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	Maybe the cautery will suffice for the medicine because you command the patient to rest the swelling until it is prolonged and equalized, and you will make the mark of the cautery in the form of a leaf of ivy.</end_of_turn
E aprop pren de sabo conogut e de caus viva ana unc. .i., o quays aquo, e aprop mescle3 aquelas causas be, e fay aquo am festinacio per so que no sia enfregidat; e aprop expandeys de aquo sobre la carta la qual es fayta ayssi cum forma de fulha de mirtra, e pausa aquel sobre la un huel od amdos; e pausa dejos le huel coto enbegut en album de huou, e el cap del malaute sia en le tieu se.	And take a piece of lint with a little bit of ointment and put it in the wound.</end_of_turn> namely.</end_of_turn> Or what you will, mix these things together, and make a fasting for so that it is not inflamed; and expand a little of that over the mark which is made like a leaf of ivy, and place that on the eye or both; and keep the eye covered in a bag of wine, and the head of the patient is in the thigh.</end_of_turn
E pausa le dit sobre le medicina e prem aquela un petit e no la mauguas entro que lo malaute senta la mordicacio de la medicina, quar mordicacio es en lu ayssi cum de foc.	And keep saying about the medicine and give it a little bit and do not touch it until the patient feels the bitterness of the medicine, which is in them just like fire.</end_of_turn
E donc cum percevera aquo que el atrobo mordicacio, lahoras leyssa la medicina e mau aquela am le tieu dit; donc cum cessa la mordicacio, lahoras remau la medicina he lava le huel am aygua; e lahoras considera si vezes la palpebra ja es levada ayssi cum es lavada deves la costriccio am foc o am incisio, quar lahoras esta be; e si no torna sobre aquela de la medicina sobre le loc en le qual no ha empremut la medicina e no se denigra entro que sia engualhada la tua operacio e sia contrayt le huel.	Therefore when you perceive that the other bitterness has ceased, then read the medicine and do not touch it until I tell you that; when the bitterness has ceased, then remove the medicine and wash the eye with water; and consider that sometimes the pupil is already raised just like after being washed over the constriction caused by fire or incision, for the hour this is good; and if it does not return from the medicine over the area where you did not imprint the medicine and it does not fall down until the operation is healed and the pupil is contracted.</end_of_turn
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eradicada la codena de la adhustio, e aprop cura aquel am enguent deafinicon o am autre entro que sia sanat.	And keep your hand resting on the edge until the swelling of the wound has disappeared, and take care of that which is swollen again until it is healed.
E es necessari a tu, deves la tua operacio que guardes am pervigil diligencia que en le huel no caia re de la medicina, e si la palpebre aprop alscus dias es mollificada e alcuna causa dels pels punh en le huel, lahoras itera la tua medicina sobre aquel loc le qual de la palpebre es mollificat, e propriamen ayssi quo as fayt al comensament, e aprop enaviro lu entro que sia sanat.	It is necessary for you to know that you must keep your eye on the eye so that no more medicine falls into it, and if the pupil is somewhat days softened by any cause of the swelling of the eye, then repeat your medicine over that area which was softened, just as you did at the beginning, and do not delay until it is healed.</end_of_turn
E aquesta es la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	This is the form of a ivy leaf.</end_of_turn
E sapias que les huels dels homes son diversificatz segon la magnitut e la parvitat, e donc segon aquo es fayta la tua contraccio.	You know that the humors of men are diverse according to their magnitude and their thinness, and therefore according to what is useful for your contraction.</end_of_turn>
E no sira amaguada la via de rectetut ad aquel al qual es studi en aquesta art.	And do not be ashamed of the way of proceeding in this art.</end_of_turn
Capitol .xvii.	Chapter XVII.</end_of_turn>
De cauterizacio de fistula que es en le lacrimal de l’huel.	Of cauterization of the fistula that is in the lacrimal of the eye.</end_of_turn
Quan tu curas fistula am aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias e no confereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas aquela segon aquesta manieyra: comanda al malaute que pause le cap sieu en le tieu se, e tengua le cap de lu alcun ministre entre las tieuas mas en tal manieyra que no sia maugut ni agitat am le sieu cap.	When you treat the fistula with that which we have said in the divisions of the diseases and you do not confide your care, then you must know that you must cauterize that in the following manner: command the patient to keep their head down in the thigh, and hold the head of the patient by any minister between the thighs in such a manner that it is not stifled or shaken at the head of the patient.</end>
E aprop pausa coto enfus en album de huou o en mucellage de ptilli sobre le huel de lu.	And keep the eye covered in a bag of wine or in mucus on the eye of the patient.</end_of_turn
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	And take the cautery of which this is the form:
le qual sia conquau, ayssi cum es forma de cana o de pena de voltor, de la una extremitat am la qual es fayta lo cauteri.	which is conquered, like the shape of a cane or of a pinwheel, from one extremity to the other where the cautery is to be made.</end_of_turn
E si voys, sia penetrant entro a la autra extremitat.	And if you will, penetrate through to the other extremity.</end_of_turn
E si vols sia sort ayssi cum tenta.	And if you wish, you can also remove it like this.</start_of_turn
Mays empero aquel que es concau es milhor a la tieua obra.	However, that which is conquered is better for the work.</end_of_turn
E aprop prem la fistula si es uberta, e tra de lu sania et exsicca aquela.	And immediately close the fistula if it is open, and bring healing to it and dry that.</end_of_turn
E si no es uberta, lahoras obre aquela e extratz la poyredura de lu.	If it is not opened, then open that and extract the purulent discharge from it.
E aprop pausa sobre lu le cauteri le qual sia be ignit, e te am aquel la tieua ma un petit deves le cauteri del huel a la partida del nas, per so que no erre la tua ma o le malaute sia enquietat, e lahoras pausa le cauteri en le grays del huel e corrompas aquel.	And if it is necessary to make points on the surface of the foot, then do so with a pointed cautery. And hold your hand a little below the nose, so that your hand does not move or the patient becomes agitated, and when you have finished, remove the cautery from the wound and close it up with whatever is necessary.</end_of_turn>
E donc si al comensament del tieu cauteri perve entro al os, bo es; e sino, lahoras itera le cauteri una veguada o dos, si mestiers era; e layssa aquel ayssi per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre aquel coto am boder e enviro lu am enguent exsiccatiu entro que sia sanat.	Therefore, if at the beginning of the incision the bone has already entered, it is not good; but if not, repeat the incision once or twice, if necessary; and leave that for three days. And then place your hand over that area around the border and send it out dry until it is healed.</end_of_turn>
Mays si eran passatz xi dias e no es sanat, lahoras pausa sobre lu medicina aguda corrosiva entro que l’os sia descubert e sia ras segon que conveneys en le sieu capitol.	Even if it has been several days and it is not healed, then place over it corrosive acute medicine until the bone is uncovered and is as it should be according to what is said in the capital chapter.</end_of_turn>
E es autra manieyra de cauteri de fistula la qual alscus primiers diysero: enten al loc de la fistula e fen aquela e aprop pausa en aquela fissura camaen subtil del qual es la forma de lu: E fon en aquela la quantitat de i unc de plom fundut; e te la tua ma am camaem am bona retencio, e no sia maugut le malaute per so que le plom fundut no pervengua al huel de aquel; e cove que pausas sobre le huel del malaute coto enfus en album de huou o en aygua, quar plom adhureys le loc de la fistula e sana aquela per sanacio meravilhora.	And another way of cautering a fistula is as follows: enter the location of the fistula and make that opening and then place your hand in that rough cavernous space of which is the form of it: and put in that the quantity of the black pepper seeds that are found; and hold your hand firmly in place, so that the patient does not faint due to the smell of that; and cover the face of the patient with a cushion filled with hay or in water, so that the pepper seeds do not reach the nose of that.</end_of_turn
E si la fistula es sanada am aquo que havem dit del cauteri e de la curacio, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari aministrar trauc del nas e reduzir la fistula al cors del nas segon que vindra en son loc propri.	And if the fistula is healed with what has been said of the cautery and the treatment, it is not good; but if not, it is necessary to administer medicine through the nose and reduce the fistula to the root of the nose according to what is appropriate in that location.</end_of_turn
Capitol .xviii.	Chapter XVIII.</end_of_turn>
De cauterizacio de la fendedura des potz.	Of cautering of the wound it is said.</end_of_turn
Motas veguadas accideysso fissuras en las labias, e majorment en las labias dels enfantz.	Many times accidental incisions occur in the lips, and more especially in the lips of children.</end_of_turn
Donc cum tu curas aquelas fissuras am aquo que nos havem dit en las divisios e no aprofieyta la tua cura, lahoras igneys le cauteri petit cutellar segon aquesta forma que s’ensiec:	Therefore, when you cure those incisions with what has been said in the divisions and do not neglect your treatment, then do the following:
E sia la conquavitat de lu segon la subtilitat de cotella.	And be the concavity of it according to the softness of the flesh.</end_of_turn
Aprop pausa aquel init cuytadament en aquelas fissuras entro que·l cauteri pervengua al preon de las fissuras.	And hold that firmly in those incisions until the cautery reaches the base of the incisions.</end_of_turn
E aprop cura aquel am cerotz entro que sia sanat.	And take care of that until it is healed.</end_of_turn
Capitol .xix.	Chapter XIX.</end_of_turn
De cauterizacio de fistula en la boca.	Of cautering of fistula in the mouth.</end_of_turn
Quan en la razit de uvula o en le paladar o en las razitz de las dentz endeve apostema e aprop fa brac, e aprop es rompuda, e aprop es antiquada, e corr brac e es fayta fistula, e aprop tu curas aquela e no aprofieyta a curacio, lahoras cove que tu igniscas cauteri segon la quantitat que sia receubuda en la fistula, e aprop met aquel ignit en le trauc de la fistola, e te la tua ma entro que pervengua le ferr ignit al preon de lu, e al derier de lu fazen aysso una veguada o dos; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que nos havem dit de la curacio entro que sia sanat.	When in the root of the uvula or on the palate or in the roots of the teeth there is swelling and it is broken, and it is old, and there is a fistula, and you neglect the treatment, then cover that and do not neglect treatment. Then ignite the cautery according to the quantity that is received in the fistula, and put that flame in the opening of the fistula, and hold your hand over that until the flame reaches the root of it, and after that do it once or twice. And take care of that until it is healed.</end_of_turn
E donc si la sania es abscindita e es sanat, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari de descubrir le loc e hostar le os corrumput segon que vindra en son capitol.	Therefore, if the healing is abscesses and is healed, it is not good; but if not, it is necessary to uncover the location and host the corrupt bone according to what is appropriate in that chapter.</end_of_turn
Capitol .xx.	Chapter XX.</end_of_turn
De cauterisacio de las dentz e de mollificacio de las angivas.	Of cautering of the teeth and of softening of the arteries.</end_of_turn
Quan las angivas son mollificadas per humiditat e las dentz son maugudas, e curas aquelas am medicinas e no confereys, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra aprop aysso, enayssi que tu pauses la quanula sobre la dent e entromet en aquela le cauteri ignit festinantment, e te la tieua ma un petit entro que·l malaute cente la calor del foc a la razit de la dent esser pervenguda.	When the arteries are softened by humidity and the teeth are blackened, and you treat those with medicines and do not confer them, then place your hand over the patient's cheek in the neck and do the following: ignite the cautery in the shape that will come to you, and while you are holding that place your hand over the tooth so that the flame does not reach the root of the tooth being cauterized.</end_of_turn
E aprop leva la tua ma, e aprop itera le cauteri alcunas veguadas segon que vols.	And then take away your hand and repeat the cautery several times as you wish.</end_of_turn
E aprop le malaute huompla la sua boca de aygua de sal e tengua aquela per una hora, e pueys stupa aquela, quar la dent mauguda es fermada e la gengiva mollificada es strenguda e la humiditat corrompuda es exsiccada.	And then rinse the patient's mouth with salt water and keep it there for an hour, and then remove it, because the blackened tooth is stopped and the softened gum is strengthened and the humidity that was corrupted is dried up.</end_of_turn
Capitol .xxi.	Chapter XXI.</end_of_turn
De cauterisacio de dolor de dent.	Of cautering of toothache.</end_of_turn
Quan dolor de dent es per fregiditat, o en lu es freg o verm, o no comfereys la curacio am medicina, lahoras cauteri en aquela es segon dos manieyras: o cauteri am boder de vacas, o cauteri am foc.	When toothache is caused by cold, or if it is cold or warm, or if you do not comply with the treatment with medicine, then the cautery is used in two ways: either at the edge of the cows or at the fire.
Cauteri am boder es que tu prenguas boder de vacas e bulhas aquel en culhe de ferr , e aprop pren coto e envolopa le sobre la extremitat de la tenta, e aprop enmergeys aquel am boder bulhit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolorosa festinantment entro que sia enfregidat.	The cautery is applied at the edge of the cows (lip of the tooth) or at the fire (hot iron).
E aprop itera aquela alcunas veguadas entro que la vertut del foc pervengua a la razit de la dentz.	And thus repeat the process until the force of the fire reaches the root of the tooth
E si voys, submergeys lana o coto en le boder desus dit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolent, e pausa sobre aquel ferr ignit entro que·l ferr pervengua al preon de la conquavitat de la dent.	If you wish, immerse wool or cotton in the border of the tooth and place it over the painful tooth, and place your hand over the iron until the iron reaches the depth of the cavity of the tooth.
Mays empero la cauterizacio am foc es que tu atendas a la quannula de eram o de ferr, e sia en le cor de lu alcuna grocesa e la acuitat del foc no pervengua a la boca del malaute.	However, the cautery with the iron is more dangerous than with the cows or the flame, for it must be observed when the air or the iron is too hot, and that in the belly of the patient there is any swelling or pain.
E aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra, e pausa aquel sobre la dent e te la tua ma entro que·l cauteri sia enfregidat; e fay aquo alcunas veguadas quar la dolor sira remauguda o en aquel dia o en l’autre dia.	And thus remove the form which comes from the cautery, and place your hand over the tooth until the cautery is cool; and do whatever it takes for the pain to disappear, whether on that day or the next day or the day after
E cove que per empressio de aquel cauteri que·l malaute umpla la sieua boca de bon boder e tengua aquel per una hora e aprop scupa le; e aquesta es la forma del cauteri.	And so it is commanded that the patient should fill his mouth with good butter for an hour and then remove it; and this is the way of the cautery
E cauteriza am qual que tu voys extremittat segon que a tu es possible.	And cauterize as much as you are able according to your means
E aquesta es la forma de la cannula:	This is the way of the cannula:
Capitol .xxii.	Chapter XXII.</start_of_turn>
De cauterizacio de extrophulos.	Of the cautery of exostoses.</start_of_turn>
Quan extrophulos so de flecma e de humors fregas e no so hobedientz a digistio per medicinas e tu voys la digistio de aquelas leugerament, lahoras tu igneys le cauteri conquau la forma del qual es aquesta seguen, havent dos extremitatz hubertas per que yesca le fum deves le cauteri per l’autra extremitat, e pausa aquel ignit sobre aquel apostema una veguada, e autre si indigeyses de aquel, entro que pervengua al preon del apostema.	When exostoses are of flexibility and cold humors and do not submit to digestion by medicines, then you must cauterize them slightly. For this purpose, hold two fingers closed so as to protect the surrounding parts from the fumes of the cautery, and place the ignited iron on the apex of the excrescence for a single herb, or two if you think it necessary, until the iron reaches the depth of the excrescence.
E si l’apostema es pauca, lahoras pausa le cauteri segon la quantitat del apostema, e aprop leyssa le per tres jorns e pausa sobre lu coto enfus en boder entro que sia remaugut aquo que·l foc ha comburit.	And if the excrescence is small, then pause the cautery according to the quantity of the excrescence, and apply a compress for three days and place your hand over it covered with butter until it is consumed what the fire has burned
E aprop cura aquel am enguent e tentas e draps entro que sia sanat.	And take care that the gum, the nails, and the clothes are not damaged until it is healed
E la forma de la cannula o deu cauteri a tal es comveyter.	And the way of the cannula or gives the cautery in this way.
Capitol .xxiii.	Chapter XXIII.</start_of_turn
De cauterizacio de rauquiera de votz e de constriccio de ale.	Of the cautery of the voice and the constriction of the throat
Quan las humiditatz veno sobre le quanal del pulmo, e majorment quan aquo es am fregiditat de compleccio, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia evacuat al comensament am medicinas laxativas, e aprop cauteriza aquel deves la razit del golayro en le loc depremegut.	When humidity is over the root of the lung, and especially when it is of cold composition, then it is necessary to evacuate the patient with laxatives at the beginning of treatment, and then cauterize that which is under the edge of the epiglottis in the depressed area.</start_of_turn>
E guarda te que no pervenguas am le cauteri al golayro ni no comburas de la codena de lu sino un pauc.	And take care that you do not reach the epiglottis with the cautery or that you do not burn the cord of the voice, but only a little.</start_of_turn>
E cauteriza aquel am autra cauteri deves la junctura del col en le derier espondil de lu.	And cauterize that which is another cautery to be made at the junction of the cartilage of the collar with the last vertebra of the neck.</start_of_turn
E·l cauteri de lu sia clavilh sego la maniera precedent.	And the cautery of the collarbone is carried out as before.</start_of_turn
E aprop cura aquel am aquo que es precedit entro que sia sanat.	And take care that what precedes is done until it is healed.</start_of_turn>
Capitol .xxiiii.	Chapter XXIV.</start_of_turn
De cauterizacio de malautia del pulmo e de tos.	Of the cautery of the pulmonary disease and cough
Quan tos e malautia de pulmo so de humiditatz fregas e le malaute no ha febre ni tisic e es malautia antiqua, lahoras cauterisa aquel am dos cauteris sobre la furcula en les locz depremegutz leontz e buoytz; e am autra cauteri en le mieg loc del pietz entre dos mamillos; e sia le cauteri clavilh segon la forma precedent.	When cough and pulmonary disease are of cold humidity and the patient has neither fever nor chills and is an old disease, then cauterize twice on the furcula in the depressed areas of the lung and between two nipples; and make the cautery of the collarbone as before.</start_of_turn>
E si vols, sia la tua cauterizacio punctan am le cauteri que es apelat puncta, la forma del qual precedeys en la ponctacio de dolor de aurelhas.	And if you wish, make the punctures with the cautery that is called punctate, of the form which is described in the puncture of heel pain.</start_of_turn
E sian puntz entro cays ad aquels; e aprop cura aquel am aquo meteys que es precedit entro que sia sanat.	And do the punctures inside the cavity as well as outside; and take care that what precedes is done until it is healed.</start_of_turn

De cauterizacio del stomac.	Of the cautery of the stomach.
Quan veno en l’estomac freg e motas humiditatz entro que aquel extrazo de la sua compleccio e so multiplicatz raumases a lu, e si tu continuas las manieyras de curacio e no confereyso, lahoras cove que le malaute sia sobre le sieu dos ressupinat, e extenda las suas mas e las suas coysas, e aprop cauteriza aquel am tres cauteris: an un cauteri dejos le pietz per la quantitat d’un dit am cauteri clavilh, e am dos cauteris dejos del dos costatz del cauteri, entro que vengua la figura de cauteri triangulada; e elonga entre els que no sian ajustatz que faran poyredura.	When there is cold and moist humors in the stomach that cause swelling and multiply the worms in it, and if you continue your treatment methods and do not confirm them, then you must make the patient lie face down, extend their limbs and buttocks, and make three cauteries: one on the heel leaving the toes for the amount of a finger at the head of the cautery, and two on the two sides of the cautery, until the triangular figure of the cautery is formed; and lengthen between those that are not adjusted that will make the wound less painful.
E si la profunditat del cauteri la quantitat de les dos terses de la grocesa de la codena.	And if the depth of the cautery is the amount of two-thirds of the thickness of the heel
E sia la figura del cauteri segon aquesta forma ses addicio, E si vols, cauteriza am gran cauteri en le mieg loc del estomac segon aquesta forma; et aquest sia un cauteri segon la forma de cercle segon aquesta forma:	And the figure of the cautery is as follows: these are additional cauteries. E sia cauterizat l’estomac punctan ad aquel que de aquest cauteri es spaventat: e es que tu senhes sobre l’estomac punt segon la quantitat que voles am tenta, e aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri en les puntz; e aprop cura aquel am la curacio qu’es precedita entro que sia sanat.	And the stomach should be cauterized point by point at that point where it is most sensitive. And you should mark on the stomach point by point according to the amount you wish on the hair, and then cauterize at those points; and take care of that which precedes until it is healed.

De cauterizacio de plauresi.	On cauterizing of the pleura.
Diyssero les antics cauteri de las razitz de aristologia a plauresi frega segon aquesta manieyra esser fazedor, e es aquest que tu prenguas de las razitz de aristologia longa secca una razit pun longua que es trobada, e sia de la grossetut del dit.	I say that the old cauteries of the roots of Aristotle towards the pleura are to be made according to this manner: take from the roots of Aristotle a long thin splinter that is found, and that is of the thickness of a finger

De cauterizacio de fistolas que son faytas en la natura derie en las partidas de lu.	About the cautery of fistulas that are useful in nature in the parts of the body.
Quan la natura no obeziys a la obra la qual havem recomtada en son loc, e·l pacient es espaventat per aquo, sia sanat am cauteri.	When nature does not obey the work that we have recommended in its place, and the patient is frightened of it, whether it is healthy or not

De cauterizacio dels ronhos.	About the cautery of boils

De cauterizacio de la vesica.	About the cautery of the bladder
Quan accideys en la vesica debelitat e mollificacio per freg e per humiditatz ayssi que·l malaute la urina no retengua, lahoras cauteriza aquel en la partida pus dejos sobre la vesiqua, la hon comensan les pels del pentenilh, e cauteriza am un cauteri en la partida dreyta, e am autre en la senestra de lu.	When there is inflammation of the bladder due to cold and humidity as well as urine retention, then cauterize in the most distant part over the bladder, the hair of the scrotum, and cauterize with a nail cautery on the left side and on the right side
E sia la longitut de quascun cauteri segon la cantitat dels not del pous; e cauteriza aquel am cauteri en la partida pus bassa del dos, o am dos cauteris si es necessitat.	And the length of each cautery is according to the amount of the patient's pain; and cauterize with a large cautery in the lower part of the thigh, or with two cauteries if necessary
E sia cauteri clavilh segon que es procesit.	And do it like a nail cautery.
Capitol .xxxix.	Chapter XIX
De cauterizacio de la mayra.	About the cautery of the uterus
Quan veno en la mayra freg e humiditatz, e per aysso es prohibida enpreignacio, e son corrompudas las mestruas de lu, e es tardada la provocacio de lor, e accideys dolor deves le haveniment de lor, lahoras cove que·l loc sia cauterizat am tres cauteris en le circuit del ombelic, ayssi cum havem dit en le cauteri de la vesica; e am cauteri sobre le loc pus dejos del dos, o am dos cauteris, e sia le cauteri clavilh.	When there is inflammation of the uterus due to cold and humidity, and it is prohibited to take nourishment, and the monthly periods are corrupted, and their provocation is delayed, and there is pain due to the lack of them, then cover that the area is cauterized with three cauteries around the navel, as we said in the cautery of the bladder; and with a nail cautery on the lower part of the thigh, or with two cauteries, and do it like a nail cautery

De cauterizacio de la dislocacio de l’anqua.	Capital. xl.
Quan humiditatz moucozas so efundudas a la partida de la anqua, e so faytas causas del yssiment del sieu loc, e senhal de lu es que la coyssa es prolonguada sobre l’autre quan so comparadas entre lor.	When mucous humors are effused to the part of the ankle, and are the cause of swelling of the sole of the foot, the sign of it is that the swelling is prolonged on the other side when compared with them.</end_turn
E le loc de la dislocacio es atrobat en lu quays boyt.	And the place of dislocation is grasped in them where it boils.</end_turn
Adonc cove que cauterizas le malaute sobre la partida de la anqua de lu am cauteri a sercle semblant, pus que tu auras senhat am tenta en le cercuit de la partida ayssi cum es revolguda, e per so que la partida caia el mieg loc del cercle.	Then cover that you cauterize the disease on the part of the ankle with a pointed cautery, because you have seen that it is necessary to make a circular incision around the part to avoid that the part falls flat.</end_turn
E sia le cauteri del qual precedit la forma en la cauterizacio del estomac.	And the incision which precedes the cautery is of the kind which is made in the cautery of the stomach.</end_turn

De cauterizacio de la vena sciatica.	From the cautery of the sciatic vein.</end_turn
Quan dolor ve en la partida de anqua, e so causa de lu freg et humiditatz, le malaute es curat am aquo que havem dit e no confereys, e aquo es antiquat, lahoras cove que tu lacses le malaute de humors grosses am pillulas fetidas o am pillulas artificials o semblantz; e aprop cauteriza aquel.	When there is pain in the part of the ankle, and it is caused by cold and humors, the disease is cured with what we have said and do not confer, and when it is old, that you remove the disease from the humors with solid pills or artificial or similar pills; and do the cautery.</end_turn
E la manieyra del cauteri en aquela es segon dos manieyras: o cauteri am medicinas comburentz, o cauteri am foc.	And the manner of the cautery is in two ways: either with medicinal substances that consume, or with fire.</end_turn
Sira segon dos manieyras scientas, de las quals es la una que cauterizes aquel sobre la partida de l’ancha de lu am tres cauteris triangulatz segon aquesta forma; e fay am aquels bona profunditat.	The other is that you make three triangular incisions on the part of the ankle according to this form; and do with these good depth.</end_turn
E sia le spazi le qual es entre cascun cauteri la quantitat de la grossitut del dit e si le cauteri olivar o gran.	And the space which is between each incision is as much as the thickness of the finger and if the cautery is olive or large.</end_turn
Mays alcunas veguadas sia le cauteri sobre le mieg loc sobre le cap de l’anquan per que son quatre cauteris.	Many people see the cautery on the middle of the ankle over the head of the ankle because there are four cauteries.</end_turn

E aquesta es la manieyra de cauteri in ciatiqua quan dolor es adherent al anqua e no es estenduda entro a la coyssa.	And this is the manner of cautery in sciatica when the pain is adhered to the ankle and does not extend into the swelling.</end_turn

E si le cauteri cutellar, e sia la profunditat del cauteri segon la quantitat de la ispicitut de la codena.	And if the cautery is burning, and the depth of the cautery is according to the quantity of the spiciness of the thigh.</end_turn
