E si le malaute envireys dolor esser dejos le donolh ves la coyssa, lahoras cauteriza aquel aqui am un cauteri cutellar.	And if the disease sends that the pain is left when the swelling is seen, then do the cautery here with a burning cautery.</end_turn
E guarda te en tota cauterizacio que no ultimes am le cauteri en tant que comburas nervi o gran arceria, e que per aquo a tu es sobre le malaute mal noccument o contraccio.	And keep this in mind in all cauteries that you do not finish with the cautery while you burn nerves or great arteries, and that for which reason you must be over the disease without causing any damage or contraction.</end_turn

E aprop accidic fort solucio de ventre, e aprop aquo la mort.	And take strong solution of vinegar, and thus the death.</end_turn

And say the wise men of the cautery of the ankle that the circle should be like a circle of iron whose circumference is the size of a palm; and should be deep like the seed cavity according to the thickness of a date seed or less.</end_turn

De cauterizacio de podagra e de dolor de juncturas.	Of the cautery of gout and of joint pain

De cauterizacio de rompeduras.	On cauterization of fractures.
Quan endeve rompedura en les angonars e diysendo les budels denant l’atela al genetiu, e aquo es comensan de aprop, lahoras cove que tu mandas al malaute layssar la sua comestio en le sieu dia e que use de causas leniens per so que la fenda deyssenda del sieu ventre.	When a fracture has occurred in the ankle bones and saying the bones are loose from the heel to the knee, and when it begins to approach, order the patient to lie still in bed and use soft pillows so that the wound does not open from the belly of the knee
E aprop segua le malaute entre las tuas mas sobre le sieu dos, e comanda a lu que tengua le sieu ale entro que sia foro getat o aparesca l’atela o·l budels.	And immediately follow the patient between your thighs on both sides, and order them to keep their thighs inside until the bone is fractured or the heel or the bone is seen to be loose.
E aprop retorna aquel am les tieus ditz e senha am tenta la ruptura sobre le os del pentenilh am senhal la extremitat del qual sia semblant a la maytat de cercle a las subiranas partidas del cors. E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And immediately apply the cautery in this way:
entro que sia mot rog e gete cintilhas.	Until it is neither red nor blue
E aprop reduzeys le budel o l’atela a la sua conquavitat, e aprop pause la sua ma sobre le loc per so que le budel no yesqua.	Then return the intestine or hernia to its cavity, and place your hand over the area to prevent the intestine from coming out.
E tu ja has ubert entre las coyssas del malaute e dejos lu as pausat un coyssi, et autre servent sia sus las cambas de lu, e autre sus le pietz de lu, le qual tengua las suas mas.	You have already opened the space between the patient's thighs, placed a cushion under them, another servant on their legs, and another on their chest, holding their hands.

E observa saviament del ysiment del budel en la hora de la tua cauterizacio, que no comburas aquel budel per so que sobre le malaute no vengua in mort o autre gran malicia. E sapias que quan tu am le cauteri no atenhas le os, no confereys la tua operacio.	And remember that when you are doing the cautery do not neglect the bones, do not trust your operation

De cauterizacio de lepra.	Of the cautery of leprosy.</start_of_turn>
Les lebros alcunas veguadas am cauteri per mot gran juvament, e magerment si la specia de lepra que es fayta per putrefaccio de flacma e de melencolia.	Several books speak of cautery for great joy, but management is necessary because of the species of leprosy that is useful for the putrefaction of fat and melancholy.</start_of_turn
E donc cum tu vols cauterizar aquel, considera si la lepra es comussan e as aquela curada am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no deysen, ni esta, e temes sobre le malaute que la corrupcio comprehenda tot le cors de lu e tota la compleccio de lu, lahoras cauteriza aquel sobre le cap am v cauteris: am un en le mieg loc del cap, e am le segon pus dejos de lu, eves le front a la fi dels cabels; e amdos sobre dos corns; e am un detras, sobre la nuca o servitz.	Therefore, when you want to cauterize, consider whether the leprosy is spreading or has already healed in what has been said in the division, neither of which should be, and fear that the corruption will embrace all the limbs of the body and its entirety. Therefore, cauterize on the head with two cauteries: one in the middle of the head, and one at the back of the head, on the forehead above the eyebrows; and two on the cheeks; and one on the back, on the nape of the neck or on the shoulder.</start_of_turn
E ultima la tua ma am le cauteri un pauc entro que emprema en le os una petita empressio, e de lu sian deslocadas las scorsas, per so que la expiracio de grossas vapors sia alleujada de lu; e cauteriza sobre la melsa segon que es precesit.	And finally, lay your hand over the cautery a a little distance from the bone, so that the scales fall off from the bone; and cauterize the mass according to need.</start_of_turn
E si la lepra es ja expanduda sobre le malaute e apar manifestament, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas aquel am aquels cauteris les quals havem ditz en le cap; e am cauteri sobre la extremitat del nas, e am dos cauteris sobre las doas maysselas, e am dos cauteris sobre dos spondils del col, e am vi cauteris sobre les spondils del dos, e am un gran sobre les spondils prop de la coeta, e un sobre la cotea , e am dos sobre las anquas, e am un sobre quascuna anqua, e am dos sobre les donols e un sobre quascun donolh, e am dos sobre les coydes, e am dos sobre les muscles, e am dos las teneretutz del sieu pietz; e cauteriza aquel sobre totas las juncturas dels ditz de las mas e dels pes, e sobre quascun talon dels sieus pes, e sobre les foscils de las suas mas.	If the leprosy has already spread over the body and appears evident, it is necessary that you cauterize in addition to the previous cauteries mentioned in the head; and two cauteries on the bridge of the nose, two on the two upper teeth, two on two vertebrae of the neck, five on the vertebrae of the chest, one on the breastbone, two on the ankles, two on the calves, two on the thighs, two on the buttocks, two on each armpit, two on each elbow, two on the wrists, and two on each finger and toe; and cauterize on all the joints of the hands and feet, and on each nail of the hands and feet, and on the hair of the body.</start_of_turn

E alcunas veguadas es cauterizat am un cauteri sobre le os del pentenilh e am autre sobre la boca del stomac, e autre sobre le fietge.	Several books cauterize with one cautery on the fifth toe and another on the mouth of the stomach, and another on the heel.</start_of_turn
E sapias que quant mays ajustas cauteris, tant es mays juvatiu e mays conferent; e sapias que le malaute no ha en le cauteri dolor, ayssi cum han les sas, per so quar le cors de lu ja es stupefayt.	And know that the more cauteries you make, the more joyful and effective it will be; and know that the patient does not feel pain during the cautery, as has been said before, so that the body is already stupefied.</start_of_turn
E cove que les cauteris sian grans o paucs segon les membres e las juncturas segon que es precedit de las specias dels ferramentz.	And know that the cauteries should be large or small according to the limbs and joints according to what is preceded by the species of instruments.</start_of_turn

De cauterizacio de fluex de sanc accident per incisio de arceria.	Treatise on the Cauterization of the Sinus of Sanctum Affected by Incision of the Artery.</end_of_turn

And when the sinus has been expelled from the orifice of the artery when you withdraw the thread that you call the end of the suture and squeeze the cauteries, then take another cautery cautiously among the previous ones that are in the fire, and do not cease until the sinus is retracted.</end_of_turn
E guarda te que no comburas le nervi que aqui es, e que vengua sobre le malaute autra malicia.	Beware that you do not burn the nerves that are here, and that you depart from the patient with other malice.
E sapias que quan de l’arteria flueys sanc, lahoras no es possible en aquels restrenge la sanc, e majorment quan l’arteria es gran, si no am una de quatre manieyras: o am cauteri ayssi quo dit havem, o am extraccio quan no es extrayta, quar quan es extrayta las extremitatz de lu miels son comburidas e es restreyt le sanc, o que sia liat am fiel o am liament per fort strectura, o que sian pausadas sobre lu medicinas de las quals la vertut es restringir la sanc; e sian strengudas am pulvinar am costriccio decent.	Beware that when arteries flow freely, it is impossible to restrict them, especially when the artery is large, unless one of four methods is used: or you cauterize as we have said, or you extract it when it is not extracted, because when it is extracted the limbs become burned and the circulation is restricted, or that it be ligated firmly or tied with a strong suture to keep the structure firm, or that you apply some medicines that can restrict the circulation; and that you strengthen the area with powder or packing downwards.</end_of_turn>
Mays aquel que aministra restriccio decent de lu am liament e am strictura am draps o per posicio de causas comburentz e de semblantz, no comfereys sino tart.	May he who gives downward restriction of the limb with tight ligation and stricture of the drape or position of causes that burn and irritate, not cause pain but rather tartness.</end_of_turn>

We have already said in the first chapter that in all disease in which cautery is convenient and medicine is comburent, and the occasions and causes of it, and the instruments necessary for it, and the forms of cautery; and we order the chapters of the sovereign part of the head to the feet.</start_of_turn

De la curacio de aygua la qual es contenguda en le cap dels enfantz.	Of the care of water that is contained in the head of children.</start_of_turn

Another method of incision is to consider the magnitude of the swelling and the collection of water, as some veins are more swollen in the occipital region, or in the front, or on the right, or on the left; therefore attend to the incision where the swelling and collection of water appear, and drain the water as much as possible.</end_of_turn

De la cura de cors de lagremas agudas e aciduas dels huels.	On the care of body ailments caused by sharp and acidic humors in the joints
Quan so lagremas aciduas, e es le cors de aquelas venas las quals so sobre le test del cap deforo, e no comfereys en aquo alcuna causa de la curacio de medicina, e vezes la cara del malaute ja enrogesir e sent en le sieu front deambulacio ayssi cum si era deambulacio de formiguas, e·ls huels de aquel so extenuatz, humitz enayssi que ja les pels de lor son conodutz, e las parpelas so scalfadas per la acuitat de las lacrimas, les antics agro mesties en la curacio de aquelas de aquesta operacio, e nompnero aquela curacio am spassa.	When the humors are acidic, and the cause of this is the veins that are over the head of the femur, do not interfere with any medical treatment, for sometimes the face of the patient already swells up and sits in front of the walk like a walk of ants, and the joints of that limb are swollen, humored more than before, that is to say that they are known to have been hurt before, and the nails are scratched by the sharpness of the tears, which is an old custom in the treatment of these things, and now that treatment is finished.

E aprop stratz ne aquest spatum e entromet en la primieyra inscizio autra vetz un autre instrument le qual es apelat cutellar, agut de una part e del autre no agut.	And immediately after take away this pad and insert into the first incision another instrument that is called cautery, blunt from one side and sharp from the other side
E pausa le latz de aquel agut deves la carn annexa deves la codena, e le latz de lu leon dintz le os, e empelley aquel entro que pervengua a la fissura migera, e abscindeys am aquel totz les vaysels que descendo del cap als huels.	And stop the bleeding from that sharp side towards the flesh of the tendon towards the bone, and grasp that part that comes down to the incision, and fill up that until it reaches the inner part, and ligate all the blood vessels that go down from the head to the joints
Mays que sia continuada la inscizio ad aquo appar de la codena, e aprop fay aquo en la fissura migana entro al autra fissura.	May be continued the incision until the tendon is reached, and immediately make that in the inner part of the incision within the other incision
E pus que corr del sanc quantitat engual, exprem les locs de las pessas del sanc congilat.	And when the bleeding stops, press the area of the patient's foot with a bandage
E aprop pausa en quascuna fissura calgua de coto vielh, e pausa sobre aquels polvils enbegutz en vi e oli e vi agre, e vegas que no endevengua apostema caut.	And immediately stop in any soft wound of old age, and place over those dusts covered in vinegar and oil and vinegar again, and whatever does not stick to the cautery burn.
E en le tertz dia deslia le liament e aministra gran enfusio de aygua cauda o tebeza, e aprop cura aquo am enguent bazilicon am oli rozat e autres entro que las plaguas sian sanadas.	And on the third day remove the ligament and administer great effusion of lukewarm or cold water, and take care of it with ointment of beeswax with oil of rosemary and other things that will make the wound heal
Capitol .v.	Chapter five
De la cura de lagramas per catartz e als huels descendentz de las partidas dedintz del cap.	On the care of tears for cats and dogs that descend from the parts that are behind the head
Quan ad alcu veno catartz agutz e continuantz, e vezes les huels del malaute extenuatz petitz, e ja le reguardament de lor es debelitat, e las palpebras ulceradas e de lor cazo les pels, e en le preon del cap es dolor aguda ledent e extrenutacio consequent, lahoras sapias per aquestz accidentz que las materias e catartz no veno sino de motas venas de las partidas dedintz procedent.	When there is some acute catarrh and the continuous flow of tears, and sometimes the joints of the patient extend slightly, and it is already known to them, the ulceration of the eyelids and their rubbing against the nails, and in front of the head there is acute pain of the teeth and subsequent sneezing, which is the cause of these accidents that the matter and the catarrh do not flow but from the veins of the parts that come from behind
E la milhor curacio en aquels es aquesta: que comandes al malaute que raza lo sieu front, e aprop inscideys en aquel una fissura al mieg loc del front, un petit per la latitut (e comensa am la fissura del templar senestre entro al dextre templar; e sia inscisio entro al os; e eslongua la tua ma dels lacertz del templas lesquals son maugutz deves la mastigacio), entro que sia le os descubert.	And the best treatment for these is this: that you command the patient to scrape the nails against the front, and immediately make an incision in the middle of the face, a little for the width (and start from the left temporal bone to the right temporal bone; and the incision is from the outside of the bone; and extend your hand from the teeth that are maimed by chewing), until the bone is exposed
Exsicca tot le sanc am espongua o am drap secc e aprop repleys entre las doas labias de la fissura am coto vielh o am draps de li.	Extract all the blood with a sponge or dry cloth and immediately replace between the two lips of the incision with old cloth or gauze
E aprop estrenh desus am polvils enbegutz en vi e oli per so que no endevengua apostema caut.	And immediately remove any dust covered in vinegar and oil to prevent the cautery from sticking
E quan deslias aquo e veses que l’apostema ja es diminuit, lahoras cove que fregua le os entro que comensa en lu nayser carn, e aprop cura aquel am regiment exsiccatiu le qual fassa neysser la carn, ayssi cum si tu prenes de farina de froment dos partidas e de colofania quatre partidas e mescla o, e de lor sia fayt emplastre e sia aministrat en aquestas plaguas a de la carn nativitat.	When you see that the swelling has diminished and the pain begins in the nails of the fingers and toes, then you must treat that which causes swelling, as if you were taking two parts flour and four parts colophony and mixing them together, and of these make a plaster and apply it to the swelling that has occurred.
Capitol .vi.	When you see that the swelling has diminished and the pain begins in the nails of the fingers and toes, then you must treat that which causes swelling, as if you were taking two parts flour and four parts colophony and mixing them together, and of these make a plaster and apply it to the swelling that has occurred.
De la cura de aquo que catz en las aurelhas.	When you see that the swelling has diminished and the pain begins in the nails of the fingers and toes, then you must treat that which causes swelling, as if you were taking two parts flour and four parts colophony and mixing them together, and of these make a plaster and apply it to the swelling that has occurred
Tota causa que catz en las aurelhas es una de quatre specias, quar o es peyra mineral o causa semblant a peyra, ayssi cum ferr e veyre, o es de planta ayssi cum ceze o fava, o es causa fluxtibla ayssi cum aygua e vi agre e a lor semblantz, o alcuna bestia.	Every cause that exists in the ankles is one of four kinds, either a mineral stone or something resembling a stone, like iron or lead, or one of vegetable origin like rue or bean, or one that is variable like water and vinegar or similar things.
E donc quan peyra catz en l’aurelha o autra causa semblant de aquelas causas que no ajustan ne creysso en l’aurelha, e pausa la aurelha al solelh, e si vezes la peyra, lahoras distilla en aquela alcuna causa de oli violat o sizami, e aprop aministra la extraccio de lu, e fay le stornudar am condizi, e oppila las nars deve le aveniment de stornutacio.	And therefore, when a stone is in the ankle or another cause resembling those that do not adjust or grow in the ankle, and the ankle is pressed to the sun, and sometimes the stone, when it is distilled out in any of those causes of olive oil or vinegar, then administer the extraction of it, and make it vomit, and apply pressure to the area where the vomiting occurred
E aprop pausa en le circuit de la aurelha alscunas pessas de drap o lana, e dextendas la aurelha a las partidas desus, quar motas veguadas es foro-getada am aquestas causas.	And therefore, when the ankle is pressed to the sun, some pieces of wax or lint are left behind, and the ankle is stretched to the roots of the hair, because the things that are causing this swelling are often soft and fatty in these causes
E si no n’es getada, lahoras aministra extraccio de lu am le instrument apelat gesti epicicarios subtil del qual aquesta es la forma:	And if it is not softened, then administer the extraction of it with an instrument called epicicarios subtil, which is like this:
E si es foro-getada am gesti, bo es; e sino, lahoras aministra la extraccio de lu am onci subtil de pauca duplicacio.	And if it is softened by the hand, it is good; otherwise, administer the extraction of it with a little sponge.
E donc si no es foro-getada per aquo, lahoras fay una canula de aram e entromet la extremitat de la canula en le trauc de la aurelha e claus a l’enviro de la canula am cera e am oli mollificada per so que no sia ubert sino la canula.	And therefore, if it is not softened by water, then make a needle of gut and insert the extremity of the needle into the hole of the ankle and close around the needle with wax and olive oil so that nothing is injured except the needle itself
E aprop extratz am le tieu vent am fort atraccio, quar tropas veguadas cum aquo que havem recontat.	And then extract from the belly with great attraction, because these things are soft like water that we have mentioned before
Mays si no es foro-getada en aquesta manieyra, lahoras pren de halka alumbat o de vecz aparelhat am le qual son preses les ausels una patita quantitat, e pausa aquel en la extremitat de ray, e aprop envolopa sobre aquel coto decentment pausat.	Even if it is not softened in this way, then take a lukewarm bath or a cold compress that appears with a swelling in the heel, and take as many eggs as you can hold in your hand and put them on the edge of the wound, and cover that area appropriately with a bandage.
E aprop entromet aquel en le trauc de la aurelha am facilitat, e aprop excicca la aurelha de la humiditat.	And then insert that into the hole of the ankle easily, and then dry the ankle of moisture.
E donc si no es foro-getada am totas las causas las quals havem recontadas, lahoras tu coyta a talhar aquela denant que endevengua apostema caut o espasme.	And therefore, if it is not softened by all the causes that we have mentioned, then you should consider that the swelling is due to a cold burn or spasm.
E la manieyra de talhar aquela es que tu al comensament sancnes le malaute de la vena sephasica e extratz del sanc segon la mannieyra de la vertut de lu, e aprop fay aquel cezer entre las tuas mas e converteys l’aurelha a las partidas desus, e fen am petita fissura en la razit de la aurelha deves lo greys de lu en le loc be premegut de lu.	And the way to treat that is to touch the painful area of the vein of the ankle and extract from the root according to the virtue of the things, and then make that disappear between your hands and convert the ankle to the roots, and make a small incision in the heel of the ankle where the black spots are, between the bones that are soft in that area
E sia la fissura de figura lunar entro que pervengua a la peyra, e, la peyra atrobada, osta aquela si podes am instrumentz apropriatz; e aprop cos la fissura en aquela hora am velocitat, e cura aquela entro que sia sanat.	And if the incision is of a lunar figure, enter it until it reaches the stone, and the stone being grasped, hold that back with the instruments that are appropriate; and then close the incision in that moment with speed, and cure that within that time that it is healthy
E si la causa cazent en la aurelha es un dels gras que creysso e so inflatz, lahoras aministra la curacio e la extraccio de lu; mays si no obezeys a tu ad eyssiment, lahoras tu pren spatum teune subtil segon aquesta forma:	And if the cause of the swelling in the ankle is one of the fats that grow and infiltrate, then administer the cure and the extraction of it; but if you do not obey this order even then, the doctor will take a sponge from you in this way:
e aministra am aquel la abscizio de aquel gra lo qual es cazut en l’aurelha.	And give that sponge to the fatty substance that is causing the swelling in the ankle.
E no fassas aquo quan cogitas que aquel ja es humectat per la vapor del aurelha, e pausa aquel en motas pessas, e prop extratz ne aquelas am les oncis o am gesti subtil, o ab inscizio ayssi co dit havem, quar es alleujada la extraccio de lu.	And do not delay when you think that that is already moistened by the vapor of the ankle, and put that in large pieces, and extract from it with nails or with a sponge, or by incision as we have said, because the extraction is alleviated
Mays en l’aygua la qual es intrada en l’aurelha cove que·l malaute use de sternutacio am condizi al comensament, e omple la sieua aurelha am alcu coto vielh, e jagua sobre aquela aurelha en la qual es l’aygua, e si per aquo es foro-getada, bo es; e sino, lahoras pren tropas peyras teunas e leons segon la longitut del dit, e calfa aquelas en le foc un pauc, e le pacient entrometa una de aquelas en le trauc de la sua aurelha e saute sobre la un pe sieu de aquela partida e percussia am una autra peyra sobre la peyra la qual es dintz la aurelha.	But in the water in which it is introduced into the ankle, cover that the pain uses vomiting with condiment at the beginning, and fill the ankle with a little old cloth, and pour over that ankle in which the water is, and if by water it is softened, it is not good; otherwise, take three or four stones of the size of a barleycorn and put them on the foot of the patient, and make them crush in the fire a little, and the patient shall put one of those in the hole of his ankle and jump over the other foot on that side and beat with the other foot on the foot that is causing the ankle to swell
Donc no cesse aquo am peyra entro que tota l’aygua sia foro-getada.	Therefore do not stop until all the water has been drained out.
E ja l’aygua sira foro-getada enayssi que tu prenguas de papier o de gonc .i., e met la una extremetat de lu en l’aurelha e estendas l’autre extremitat am foc entro que sia comburit le may de lu.	And when the water has been drained out, take paper or gauze to soak up any remaining liquid And put one extremity in the heel and extend the other extremity over the fire until the pain is gone
E prop met i autre gonc e fay aquo tantas veguadas entro que tota l’aygua sia foro-getada, e stratz aquel am canula ayssi co desus es dit de la peyra extrasadora.	And put the other gauze there and do it as many times as necessary until all the water has been drained out, and then draw out that which is called the extractor of the stone.
Mays en la extraccio de bestia intrant en aquela aurelha, si es a petit cos, ayssi piussa e a lu semblant, cura aquel ayssi cum havem dit en la divisio; mays si es de gran cos la qual causa apar al sen del vezement, lahoras aministra la extraccio de lu am gesti e oncis, e la causa de lu es pus leugiera de totas las autras causas que cazo en l’aurelha.	More in the extraction of a beast that is inside that heel, if it is of small size, it is enough to press and hold it, but if it is of large size which causes pain at the same time, then administer the extraction with the hand and nails, and the cause of this is less severe than all the other causes that cause pain in the heel
Mays en la extraccio de verm engendrat en la aurelha, quan tu curas aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e en le tractat de distillacios e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu reguardes la aurelha al solelh.	More in the extraction of worms that are hatched in the heel, when you have cured that which we have said in the division and in the treatise of distillations, and do not neglect your care, then it is necessary to cover the heel with the sun
E donc si apar aqui alcuna causa dels verms, lahoras extratz aquel am gesti o am onci subtils, mays si no apar deguna causa, lahoras pren una canula dejos streyta e desus ampla de la qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And therefore if any cause of the worms appears, then extract that which is in the hand or nail subtile, even if no cause appears, then take a needle and draw out the stone wide from which this is the shape of it.
E entromet la extremitat subtil en la aurelha segon la quantitat la qual suffertar puesca le malaute; e aprop sucgeys am aquela per succio fort, e fay aquo motas veguadas, entro que totz les verms sian foro-gitatz.	And insert the delicate extremity into the heel according to the quantity which suffers from the pain of the disease; and then press on that with your thumb, and do it with many compressions, until all the worms have been expelled
Mays si no obezeysso a tu al ayssiment, lahoras tu opila e claus en le circuit de la canula am cera ayssi cum havem dit; lahoras aministre distillacios las quals han ja esproadas les antics en la curacio dels verms, e atrobaras aquo en le tractat de distillacios.	If you do not obey my advice, then I will punish you and close the circuit of the needle with wax just as we have said; then administer distillations which have already been mentioned in the care for the worms, and you will find them in the treatise of distillations.
E sia la tua efusio am la qual efundas les olis medicinas en la aurelha am aquest strument del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And be your effusion with which you administer the medicinal oils in the heel with this instrument of which this is the shape:
E fay aquela de argent o de eram, dejos streyt, en le qual sia un petit trauc, e am pla desus.	And make that of silver or gold, wide and straight, in which there is a small hole, and place your thumb there.
E donc sia cum empellent a que es en la conquavitat de la canula de continent aqui on sira necessari.	And therefore be like when you insert it into the cavity of the continent here where it is necessary
E si vols, pren le ray e envolveys en la extremitat de lu decentment coto, e aprop gieta oli en la concavitat del auziment, o suc de alcuna herba, o aquo que vols de aquestas medicinas en la canula — e aquela es en la aurelha —, e aprop entromet le ray am coto desus e exprem am la tua ma aquel am compressio temprada de lu entro que l’oli sia expellit en la concavitat del auziment e le malaute senta le oli dedintz.	And if you wish, take the tweezers and wrap it around the extremity well enough to hold it, and then pour oil into the cavity of the ailment, or juice of any herb, or water of these medicines in the needle – and that is in the heel – and then insert the tweezers again with the thumb holding the compression properly until the oil is expelled from the cavity of the ailment and the pain is relieved by the oil remaining in the heel
E aquo que sia enfundut en la aurelha sia ja scalfat am foc un petit.	And that which is infused in the heel is already scorched with fire a little
E guarda te que la causa la qual distillaras en l’aurelha no sia trop frega, quar las medicinas de aurelha no suffertan aquo.	And keep that the cause from which you distill in the heel is not too hot, because the medicines for the heel do not suffer from it

De curacio de opilacio de aurelhas.	Of the care of the oil of the heel.
Alcunas veguadas alcus enfantz yeysso dels ventres de lors mayres no-perforatz, e aquo ja accideys en alcus homes, opilacio en le meat de la aurelha per plagua o per carn nada en aquela; e aquesta opilacio alcunas veguadas es fayta en le preon del trau de la aurelha la qual no consiec le vezement, e alcunas veguadas es en las partidas defora.	Some girls and young women suffer from the bites of worms that are in the large intestines of men; and that which has already happened in some men, oil in the meat of the heel for pleasure or for nothing in particular; and this oil is useful in the preon of the groin of the heel which does not succeed in the time, and some in the distant parts
E aquela que accideys en le preon de lu, la qual no comprehen le vezement, es en las majors disposicios de dificil sanacio.	And that which happens in the preon of the heel, which does not succeed in the time, is in the greatest dispositions of difficult healing
E en aquela en qual consegueys le vezement, cove que tu pauses la aurelha del malaute al solelh e reguarda en aquela.	And in that in which you succeed in the time, cover that the heel of the patient is exposed to the sun and rest in that
E donc si vezes oppulacio apparent, obre aquela am espatum subtil del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And therefore if sometimes oil appears, open that which is like a sponge of the thumb of which this is the shape:
Si’ la extremitat de lu en la qual sia petita la latitut, del qual la una partida sia aguda e l’autra no; e le spatum sia de dos latz leon per so que no fassa lizio al aurelha.	If the extremity is small in the width, of which one part is acute and the other is not; and the sponge is of two lion's feet so that it does not make a wound to the heel
E donc si la opilacio es per carn nascuda en la aurelha o en le meat de lu, lahoras te aquela am oncis subtils e incidiys aquela vehement facilitat entro que sia ostada tota la carn.	And therefore if the oil is for a wound born in the heel or in the meat of the heel, then take that which is delicate and cut that with great ease until all the wound is gone
E si opilacio es en le preon de la aurelha, lahoras pren ray subtil leon e escalfa aquel am foc un pauc, e aprop met aquel en le meat de l’aurelha.	And if the oil is in the preon of the heel, then take tweezers of lion's feet and burn that which is a little, and then put that on the meat of the heel
E donc si as scentit oppulacio am aquo que le malaute atroba am facilitat, per gravetat de ausir, esforsa la oppressio de lu am facilitat; e guarda te que no plagues les nervis del aurelha.	Therefore, if you smell a population of humors in the water that the patient drinks, because of the gravity of the disease, encourage the expulsion of the disease with ease; and take care that you do not damage the nerves of the heel.
E aprop pausa en l’aurelha drap de li segon la quantitat del ample del trauc lo qual tu as envolvutz en l’enguent egipciac; e fay aquo per alcus jorns entro que sias segur de la consolidacio de la plagua; o que prenguas qualgua e enfon aquela en ayguaros e pulveriza sobre lu segi trissat e usa de lu; e si vezes la aurelha ja esser apostemada, lahoras cove que tu estraguas la qualgua e permutes aquela am autra qualgua la qual tu envoloparas en cerot que sia fayt am oli rozat, entro que sia le apostema caut cedat; e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And if the swelling of the heel has increased in quantity, according to the extent of the disease which you have enveloped in the Egyptian unguent; do this for a few days until you are sure of the consolidation of the disease; or that you take some of the infection and mix it in oil and sprinkle it on it and use it; and if sometimes the heel has already hardened, then leave the infection out and exchange that which you have enveloped in wool for another which you will wrap around it until the caulking softens; and take care of that until it is healed.</end_of_turn>
Mays si accideys flux de sanc, lahoras submergeys esponga o drap en aygua frega e pausa sobre la aurelha, e usa del autra curacio la qual restrengeys le flux del sanc, la qual es dita en le tractat de distillacio.	Perhaps if blood flows too much, immerse sponge or cloth in cold water and place it on the heel, and use another remedy which restricts the flow of blood, which is mentioned in the treatise on distillation.</end_of_turn>

Cura de grandeyssa que veno a las palpebras dels huels.	Treatment for large ulcers that appear on the eyelids of the toes.</end_of_turn
Motas veguadas endeve en las palpebras dels huels alcuna causa la qual es asemblada a grandissa en sa fortalicia e duricia, e per so grandissia es apelada.	The nails grow on the eyelids of the toes due to some cause which is similar to a large wound in its strength and hardness, and because of this it is painful.</end_of_turn
E es agreguacio de humiditat grossa en la palpebra dejos e desus.	And it is an accumulation of thick moisture in the lower eyelid and pus.</end_of_turn
Donc la opperacio en lor es que consideras lahoras si la grandissia es procedent en lu en aquo que apar de la palpebra e es mauguda a tota partida; e la causa de lu es leugiera.	Therefore, the operation in them is that you consider if the greatness is derived from them in the water that comes from the eyelid and is widespread; and the cause of it is slight.</end_of_turn

De la cura axcirnah en la palpebra desus del huel.	Treatment for the external wound of the oily substance of the eye.</end>
Axcirnath es grays le qual es engendrat en las tunicas de la palpebra desus, e majorment endeve als enfantz, agrava les huels de aquels et accideyso a lor catartz le mayti; e no podon reguardar la claror del solelh per aquo quar lagremas se coytan ad aquels.	The axcirnath is gray that is generated in the layers of the eyelid outside, and mainly in children, aggravates the nails of those and causes them to thicken; and it does not allow the sun's clarity because the tears are trapped by those.</end_of_turn
E per so tu vezes aquels jaser sobre les lors caras tot temps, e sobre les lors caras dormen; e so a las palpebras de lor dejos les sobrecils humidas, las quals ja ha cuberta imflacio, e iminencia de accernac apparent es en l’uelh; e que quant tu premes le loc am les tieus ditz, tu centes accernac entro aquels. De la cura de ehacratir la qual ve en la palpebra desus.	Chapter XIII.
Quan ve en le huel ehacratir, e es contraccio de la palpebra quan es contrayta en sus, o a dextra o a sinistra partida, per mala consolidacio de plagua o de seccio o de cauteri, e es apelada leporina, e aquesta ahercrati o es natural o accidental, e es fayta per consolidacio de plagua o de seccios o de cauteri, o per semblantz a lor malcuratz. Capitol .xix.	Chapter XIX.

Capitol .xx.	Chapter XX
De reduccio de la eminencia del huel.	Of the reduction of the swelling of the limb

Capitol .xxii.	Chapter XXXII.
De curacio de alconati.	Of the care of gout
Aquesta malautia que es apelada alconati no es sino sania la qual es ajustada en le huel semblant a aygua dessendent e no es aquela.	This disease which is called gout is nothing but a swelling which is adjusted in the oil resembling water descending and not that one.
Mays la manieyra del obrar en ela es que fasses le malaute sezer sobre la sela aparelada e dreyta, e aprop pren le cap sieu en las tuas mas de doas partz e mau aquel entro que veias la sania pervenir a las partidas dejos, e aprop sia siccada e no descenda, e sia ostat le lum, e·l malaute veia las causas ayssi cum vezia.	More than the work of the craftsman in it is that you make the patient lie down on the painful area and stretch, and indeed take hold of his head with your hands more than those that you see the swelling depart from those parts and that you dry it and do not let it fall, and put a lamp on it, for the disease sees its causes just as it used to.</start_of_turn>
E si no descendra en jos, sapias que es aygua.	And if it does not fall down, you know that it is water.</start_of_turn
Mays si no es preparat le descendement a la sania am aquo que havem dit, lahoras fay le malaute sezer entre las tuas mas e aprop pren spatum subtil e fen am aquel sobre le pannicol cernent un petit deves la continuacio de la conjunctiva am la tunica cornea en la corona (entro al loc vuet), entro que sia fora-getada la sania. E aprop sia curat am las autras causas entro que sia sanat.	And do so also with the other causes until it is healed.</start_of_turn>

D’eradicacio de dentz.	Of tooth extraction.</start_of_turn
Cove que tu cures la dent de la sua dolor am tot engen e tardes en tota eradicacio de lu, quar no es denguna causa que suplisqua la veguada de lu quan es eradicada, quar es sustancia sublima entro que es excusacio en la eradicacio de lu.	Therefore you must care for the tooth from its pain until its total eradication, because there is no cause that replaces the bleeding when it is eradicated, which is a sublimed substance except in the case of its extraction.</start_of_turn
Mays cove quan le malaute es forsat aquela dent eradicar, que fermament deves tu sia certificat quala es la dent dolent, quar motas veguadas la dolor descep le malaute e cuga que sia en dent sana, e tu eradicas aquela e aprop la dolor no cessa entro que la dent malauta e dolent sia eradicada, quar nos ja havem vist aquo per operacio dels barbies.	Therefore when the disease is urgent that the tooth be extracted, you must certainly confirm that it is the painful tooth, because many bleeding cause the pain to disappear from the disease, and it is in a healthy tooth that the pain does not cease until the painful and diseased tooth is eradicated, as we have seen in the operation of the barbers.</start_of_turn
Donc cum deves tu es sertificat qual es la dent dolent, e que o sabes be, lahoras cove que tu scarifiques en le circuit de la dent am spatum en le qual sia alcuna vertut, entro que sia dissolvut de la dent de la gingiva de tota partida, e aprop mau aquel am les tieus ditz, o am forfexs subtils al comensament petit a petit entro que aquela concucesquas.	Therefore when you must confirm that it is the painful tooth, and that you know well, then cover the area around the tooth with cloth or with forceps, until the tooth is completely detached from the gum in all its parts, and then remove the tissue that is above or around it with small forceps or fine scissors little by little until it is softened.</start_of_turn

E guarda te que no fassas aquo que fan alscus ignorantz barbiers en lor fistinacio e audacia sobre la eradicacio de lor, ses que no aministran aquo que nos havem recomtat; quar motas veguadas fan venir sobre les homes malautias grans las quals son pus dificils que sian trinquadas, e las razitz de lor remaugudas totas, o alcunas de aquelas, o que extrayguas aquela am alcus osses de la mandigula ayssi cum motas veguadas havem testificat. E aprop la eradicacio de lu sia lavada la boca am vi caut o vi agre am sal.	And for the eradication of these things, let the mouth be washed with wine that is cold or wine with salt.

E sian ayssi cum vezes de gros manubre entro que quan estrenhas am aquelas no sian dobladas, sian breus extramitatz.	And so sometimes with a broad handle, as when you first grasp them, they are not bent, but when you have grasped them for a long time, they are short handled
E sian faytas de ferr de India descentment faytas de dreytas extramitatz, e en las extramitatz de aquelas sian dentz de las quals las unas intron en las autras e estrenhan per constriccio descent fort, e alscunas veguadas las extramitatz de aquelas sian la forma del bec d’un auzel le qual ha nom ciconia, so es guanta, e son de fort constriccio.	And these are the nails of India, descending, and those of the tweezers are extended, and in the extension of these there are teeth that enter one into the other and strengthen the descent firmly, and some of them extend the extension of these so that it looks like the beak of a heron, that is, so wide, and they are of great constriction
Capitol .xxxi.	Capital. xxxi.
De erradicacio de dentz e d‘estraccio dels osses de las mandibulas trincadas.	About the eradication of teeth and the extraction of the bones of the fractured mandibles
Quan deves la eradicacio de dent le qual es trinquat roman alcuna causa, lahoras cove que tu pauses sobre le loc coto am boder per un jorn o per dos entro que·l loc sia mollificat; e aprop entromet algesti o tenalhas las extramitatz de las quals so asembladas al bec de un auzel apelat ciconia o guanta, la forma de las forceps:	When the tooth is fractured and remains any cause, then cover the area around the wound at the border for a day or two until the area is softened; and at the same time apply an emollient or bandage to the extraction of which is assembled like the beak of a heron called ciconia or guinea, in the form of forceps:
Las extramitatz de lor sian faytas dedintz ayssi cum lima o alfagi.	The extractions of these are done with teeth like a file or knife
E si no obediys a tu a eyssiment am aquestas forceps o tenalas, lahoras cove que tu caves sobre la razit e descrobas tota la carn e entrometas le instrument le qual ha nom atali, so es palanca petita del qual la forma es aquesta:	And if you do not obey these instructions with these forceps or pliers, then cover the reason and remove all the flesh and put the instrument that has no name, that is, a small lever whose form is this
E sia de breu extremitat grossa un petit, e no sia enbegut per so que no sia trinquat.	And be of a short handle, a little one, and do not be afraid so that it is not fractured
Donc si per aquo la razit es foro-getada, bo es; e sino, ajuda te am aquestz autres instrument dels quals aquestas son las formas: la forma del primier instrument es de triangulada extramitat en la qual sia alcuna grossesa:	Therefore if for this the reason is deeply embedded, do not; but if so, help me with other instruments of which these are the forms: the shape of the first instrument is triangular with a handle of any thickness
La forma del segon instrument es que sia de triangulada e de pus subtil extremitat.	The shape of the second instrument is that it is triangular and of more subtle handle
E ja so ajudatz am aquest instrument havent dos ramps del qual aquesta es la forma aprop la seguent:	And already with this instrument you have two slopes of which this is the form following:
e am autres instrumentz les quals precidero en rasura de dentz; quar juvament es fayt am aquest instrument le qual es asemblat a onci gran, e aquesta es la forma:	And with other instruments that precede in the shaving of teeth; for the help of this instrument which is assembled like a great wheel, and this is the form
de la triangulada extremitat torta o curta, la qual sia alcuna grossesa, e no sia enbegut per so que no sia trinquat.	Of the triangular handle that is thick or short, of any thickness, and do not be afraid so that it is not fractured.
E otra sapias que·ls instrumentz de las dentz motz so e semblantment les autres instruments.	And other things that must be known about the instruments of teeth are similar to the others.
Mays le artifexs savi e subtil en l’art, atroba per si mateys segon aquo que a lu significa la operacio e las malautias diversas; quar son de las malautias a las quals les antics no diysero ni pausero propri instrument, per las formas de diversas specias.	And the skillful artists and subtle in the art, finds for themselves means according to what they understand of the operation and the various diseases; for these are the diseases for which the ancients did not say or even recommend any specific instrument, for the forms of various species.
Mays si es trinquat l’os de la mandibula o dels autres osses de la boca, o si poyreys, lahoras sia pes curat sobre aquel en son loc am aquo que es a lu convenient dels instrumentz e de las forceps las quals havem dit en la extraccio de las razitz de las dentz, e ajuda te am gesti del qual aquesta es la forma:	And if the bone of the mandible or of the other bones of the mouth is fractured, or if you are afraid, then be careful over that in its place with the instruments and pliers that we have mentioned in the extraction of the roots of the teeth, and help me with the management of which this is the form:
E sia en lu alcuna grosseza petit a petit, e sia instringida o tenguda am la boca per que no evasesca o fuga entro que l’os de tot sia foro-getat; e aprop restaura le loc am medicinas convenientz ad aquo.	And be of any size, small or large, and be tied or held with the mouth so that it does not escape or run away until the bone is completely healed; and then restore the area with appropriate medicines as soon as possible
Mays si en l’os es petita poyredura, lahoras ratz aquel de aquela poyredura e de la sua negror, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	If the pain is slight, reduce the [treatment] somewhat; for in this way the pain in the foot will be lessened. Care for that which is within that which is healthy.

De la cura de las dentz eminentz sobre las autras.	About the care of prominent teeth over the others.
Quan las dentz so eminentz no segon lor cors natural per aquelas la forma es laga, e majorment quan endeve a las femnas, e majorment a las piuselas venerablas; donc cove que tu consideras: si dent es nada aprop autra dent, e no es possibla sarradura ni linament de lu, lahoras radica aquela; mays que no sia annexa am autra dent, lahoras tu inscideys aquela am aquest instrument del qual aquesta es la forma; e es semblant a morr de porc, e sia feyt de ferr de India de extramitat mot aguda.	When teeth are prominent and do not conform to their natural shape, they are jagged and especially when they extend towards the women and the revered girls; therefore you must consider: if the tooth is not at all adjacent to another tooth, and it is not possible to extract or ligate it, then leave it alone; but if it is not annexed to another tooth, you must cut it off with this instrument whose form is like that of a shark's tooth and which is made of Indian steel of the highest quality.
E sia la tua inscizio am la qual inscideyses aquela en trops dias per la duricia de la dent, e que no sia comauguda autra de las dentz.	And let your incision be at the place where you are cutting and that it is not like that of other teeth.
E si es dent eminent expausat a limadura, lahoras lima aquel am lima de ferr de India del qual aquesta es la forma:	And if the prominent tooth is exposed to wear, then cut that with the Indian steel file whose form is like that of a file.
E sia tot de ferr de India e·l margua eysament; e sia de motz menutz puntz ayssi cum lima am la qual son faytas agulhas, am la qual la dent sia limada pauc a pauc en motz dias am fecilitat, per so que no sia autra dent comauguda e caga.	And it must be of Indian steel, the mark clearly evident; and of such a size that when you file with the file with which needles are used, the tooth is filed little by little in several days with ease, so that no other tooth is damaged or falls out.
E aprop lineys aquela en la fi, e ratz aquela am alscus razoris.	And when you are finished, line up the area again and remove the instruments of sawing.
E si es dent del qual una partida es trinquada e lideys la lengua, lahoras cove que tu limescas aquel entro que l’aspretat de aquela fraccio sia ostada e engualhada, e sia aplenada per so que la lengua no ledesca ni la paraula no corrumpa.	And if there is a chipped piece of the tooth and you have licked the tongue, then you must cover that area until the biting edge of that piece is lost and equalized, and that it be filled so that the tongue does not bleed or the word does not corrupt
Capitol .xxxiii.	End of document.
De restauracio de dentz maugudas am fiel de aur o de argent.	On the restoration of teeth marred with gold or silver.
Quan accideys a las dentz devant concussio e remossio per percussio o per cazament, e le malaute no pot strenher sobre aquo que manga, e tu has curat aquel am medicinas stipticas, e no ha valgut la tua curacio, lahoras per so que no cagan es engen en aquelas que sian strengudas am fiel de aur e no de argent, quar argent se fa vert e aprop se poyreys aprop alscus dias, mays aur nul temps no es mudat.	When accidents occur to the teeth before concussion and loosening by percussion or extraction, and the patient does not suffer from that, and you have cured that with medicinal substances, and it has not been of any use, then in order that they do not fall out you must bind them with gold, not with silver, because silver turns green and soon becomes poor in a short time, while gold never changes.
E sia le fiel en tal subtilitat e grocesa segon la quantitat que puesca entrar entre las dentz; e la forma de la reccio es que prenguas le fiel e pren lo doble de lu entre doas dentz sanas, e aprop que cresques am doas tortuositatz del fiel entre doas maugudas, o si’ una o motas, entro que pervengua la tela a la dent sana del autra partida.	And the gold must be of such fineness and grain as to enter between the teeth; and the shape of the restoration is that you grasp the gold and double it between two healthy teeth, and that you make it grow between two curves of the gold between two marred teeth, or if one or two, until the cloth reaches the sound tooth on the other side
E aprop itera le teyssiment entro a la partida de la qual comenciest, e strenh la tua ma am facilitat e savieza entro que no sia mauguda.	And finally, repeat the process inside the part from which you started, and strengthen your hand with ease and knowledge until it is not marred.
E sia la tua striccio am la qual strenhas le fiel deves las razitz de las dentz que no evasesca.	And let your incision be at the root of the teeth that you do not avoid
E aprop inscindeys las extramitatz del fiel superfluens am las forceps o tosoyras, e agregua aquelas en quascun loc am gesti, e converteys aquelas e las occulta entre la dent sana e la dent mauguda, per so que no fassa lesio a la lengua.	And when you have inserted the excess of the gold into the forceps or tweezers, add them to each area in the mouth, and convert them so that they are hidden between the sound tooth and the marred tooth, so that it does not cause injury to the tongue.
E aprop leyssa aquela ayssi streyta cum roman.	And thus lay it so that it is firm like Rome.
Mays si es desliada o rumpuda, strenh aquela o aquelas am autra fiel en tal manieyra en tot son temps.	But if it is loose or flexible, strengthen that or those with the other gold in such a way that they remain firm at all times.
E aquesta es la forma de las dentz e la figura de la rectacio de doas dentz sanas e de doas maugudas, ayssi cum vezes aquestas liadas:	And this is the way of the teeth and the figure of the restoration of two sound teeth and two marred teeth, as well as when these are linked:
E quan se fa que retorno una dent o doas aprop le cazement de quascuna en lors locs, e sian recrescutz ayssi cum havem recomtat, e que remauguan.	And when you return a tooth or two back towards the place where they were lost, and they are reduced as we have recommended, and that they remain fixed.
E no fa aquo sino bo artifexs e savi.	Do not do anything but a good craftsman and a wise man.
E alcunas veguadas es aptat alcuna causa dels osses de vaca, e es fayt de lor ayssi cum forma de dent, e es pausada en loc en le qual defayl la dent, e es strengit ayssi cum havem dit, e reman e serveys am aquel per lonc temps.	And many are suitable for the cause of the bones of the cow, and it is useful for them as a form of tooth, and is placed in the place where the tooth is wanting, and is strengthened as we have said, and remains and serves for a long time
Capitol .xxxiv.	End of Document.
De inscizio del liament le qual ve en la lengua e prohibeys loquela.	On the incision of the ligament that is in the tongue and prevents that which is spoken
Aquest liguament le qual ve dejos la lengua alcunas veguadas o es natural am le qual hom nays, o accidental e accideys per plagua la qual ja es consolidada.	This ligament that is left behind the tongue has some veins or is naturally such that people do not know it, or it is accidental and occurs due to an injury that has already consolidated
E la operacio en lu es que huobres la boca del malaute, le sieu cap existent en le tieu se; e eleva la sieua lengua, e aprop inscideys aquel liament nervos segon la latitut entro que sia solvuda la lengua de la sua recencio.	The operation in it is that you open the mouth of the patient, remove the existing scab in the gut; and elevate the tongue and in that place you make the incision of that nerve according to its width until the tongue is free from its recession.
Mays si en aquela es alcuna duricia o denodacio, e aquo es stat per consolidacio de plagua, lahoras tu gieta unci e scindeys aquel per la latitut entro que aias inscindit le liament e sia dissolvuda la nodacio.	May it be so that in such case there be any hardness or bony protrusion, and that it be for the consolidation of the plague, that you yield once and split that apart until you have incised the ligament and dissolved the nodulation.
E guarda te que no sia fayta fissura en le preon de la carn e que scindas aqui arceria e vengua flux de sanc.	And keep in mind that you must not make a cut in the sole of the foot and that you should split here the nerves and let blood flow of safety.</end_of_turn>
E aprop sia lavat le vestigi de la inscisio am ayguaros o am vi agre o am aygua frega; e aprop pausa dejos la lengua licini; so es meca la qual tengua le malaute dejos la lengua en quascuna nuoyt per so que no sia consolidat autra veguada.	And immediately wash the remnants of the incision with either oil or vinegar or cold water; and then leave the tongue loose; for this is the cause which the patient has left the tongue in any night so that it is not solidified or softened again.</end_of_turn>
Mays si accideys flux de sanc, pausa sobre le loc vetriol trissat; mays si le sanc ventz, lahoras cauteriza le loc am cauteri lantiginos le qual conveneys ad aquo.	May it be so that blood should flow out, pause over the bruised area treated; may it be that the blood clot has gone, for in this case cauterize the area with a pointed cautery which you moisten with water.</end_of_turn>
E aprop aquel cura am las autras causas entro que sia sanat.	And immediately take care of the other causes so that it should be healed.</end_of_turn>
Capitol .xxxv.	End of Document.
De extraccio de ranula dejos la lengua.	The extraction of wisdom teeth leaves the tongue.
Alcunas veguadas accideys dejos la lengua apostema asemblant a nomla petita prohibent la lengua de la sua operacio natural; e fort leu es magnificada entro que huempla la boca.	Some doctors have observed that after these operations the tongue is left hanging like a small nail, hindering its natural operation; and this is greatly lamented until the mouth is emptied.</end_of_turn
E la operacio en lu es que huebras la boca del malaute sesent devant le solel e considera le apostema.	And the operation in this case is that you make the patient sit facing the sun and consider the hanging nail.</end_of_turn
E si tu le vezes de fusca color o de negra, dur, al qual le malaute no atroba sentiment, lahoras no toques aquel quar es cranc.	And if at times you see a yellow or black spot, rough, to which the patient does not feel pain, then do not touch that which is rotten.</end_of_turn
E si es declinat a blancor, en le qual es humiditat, lahoras tu met le onci en lu, e inscideys aquel am spatum subtil, e inscindeys le de tota partida; e si sanc te ventz en la hora de la tua operacio, lahoras tu pausa desus zegi trissat, so es vetriol, entro que sia restreyt le sanc.	And if it is pale, in which there is moisture, then immediately put on the thumb, cut off that part that is soft, and cut off the whole thing; and if there is blood in the hour of your operation, then immediately stop the bleeding by pressing down on the wound, even if it is bruised, until the blood has clotted.</end>
E aprop retorna a la obra tua entro que lo haias trayt am compliment de lu, entro que sia lavat am vi agre e sal; e cura aquel am l’autra curacio ad aquo entro que sia sanat.	And immediately return to your work until you have completed it, until it has been washed with vinegar and salt; and take care of the other care for the water until it is healed.</end_of_turn
Capitol .xxxvi.	End of Document.
De extraccio de apostema de doas aurelhas e de aquel que es nada en le golayro e de las autras apostemas.	The extraction of wisdom teeth from two angles and that which is nothing in the palate and of the other wisdom teeth.</end_of_turn>
Quan endeveno en le golayro godat, so son glandulas las quals son asembladas algodat, las quals accideysso deforas e son nompnadas doas aurelhas, las quals quan tu las curas am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no es sanat, lahoras tu considera si le apostema es dur, de fusca color, de pauc sentiment, lahoras no toques aquel am ferr.	When the wisdom teeth are embedded in the palate, these are salivary glands which are placed together in disorder, which cause them to deviate two wisdom teeth, which when you treat them with water as we have said in the division and it is not healed, then you must consider if the wisdom tooth is hard, yellow, or with little sensation, for in that case do not touch that which is rotten.</end_of_turn
E si es de roga color e la razic es grossa, lahoras no toques aquela am ferr per le flux del sanc; abantz layssa aquel entro sia madurat, e lahoras o tu trauqueras aquel, o sira romput per si.	And if it is of yellow pus and the root is large, do not touch that which is rotten for the blood; remove that which is decayed either by force or by means of an instrument, or if it is broken by itself.</end_of_turn
E si es de blanqua color, radon, e la razit de lu es subtil, lahoras aquel es que cove esser inscidit.	And if it is pale, soft, and the root is thin, then that which must be cut off.</end_of_turn
E la operacio en lu es que consideras, denant la tua operacio, si ja ha repausat le apostema de lu caut am repaus complit o si es deminuit am alcuna deminucio; e lahoras fay sezer le malaute denant le soleyl, e·l cap de lu sia en le tieu se, e huebre la boca de lu, e le servidor prenent entre las suas mas prema la lengua de lu dejos am instrument mot noble del qual aquesta es la forma:	And the operation in this case is that you consider, before you begin your operation, if the wisdom tooth has already healed completely or if it has diminished in any way; and the hours you make the patient sit facing the sun, and the head of the patient is in the chest, and you open the mouth of the patient, and the servants take between their hands the tongue of the patient from the instrument without any noble instrument of which this is the form:
E sia fayt de argent o de aram, e sia subtil cum cotel.	Either of silver or of gold, and be thin like a coat.</end_of_turn>
Donc cum tu premes am aquel la lengua e es mostrat a tu la apostema, e catz sobre aquel le tieu vezement, lahoras pren onci e fica aquel en l’amenla, e tira aquel a las partidas defora tant quant podes.	Therefore when you touch that with your thumb and you show it to me the wisdom tooth, and you place your hand on that which is in the meat, the hours take the thumb and stay there, and pull that which is outside as much as you can.</end_of_turn
Otra aquo que tiras alcuna causa de las tunicas, e aprop incideys aquela am instrument del qual aquesta es la forma:	And another which you must pull out of the clothes, and immediately cut that with this instrument which is like this:
e es asemblat a forceps, empero las extramitatz de lu son corvadas, ayssi que l’orrifici de quascuna de aquelas es en le endreyt del autra, mot agudas, le qual sia de ferr indi enbegut.	And it is assembled like forceps, however the stems of these are curved, so that the orifice of each of these is at the bottom of the other, not sharp, which is of iron inside and outside.</end_of_turn
Mays si aquest instrument no es a tu present, lahoras inscideys aquel am spatum del qual aquesta es la forma de lu: E sia agut de la una part, no agut del autra part.	May it be so that if this instrument is not at your disposal, the hours cut that with this sponge which is like this: And it is sharp from one side, not sharp from the other side.</end_of_turn
E pus que has inscidit una mella, inscideys l’autra segon aquesta meteyssa manieyra de inscizio, e aprop la inscizio le malaute guarguarise de aygua frega	And having cut one cavity, cut the other according to this manner, and immediately after the cut the patient should rinse with cold water.</end_of_turn
Mays si endeve flux de sanc, guarguarise aygua de decoccio de scorsa de milgrana o de fuelha de mirtra e semblantz ad aquel de las causas stiptiquas entro que·l flux del sanc sia restreyt, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	May the blood flow freely, preserve water of decoction of poppy seed or of myrrh flower and keep it similar to that of the causes stipulated until the blood flow is restricted, and then care for that which remains healthy.
E alcunas veguadas naysso en le guolayro autras apostemas otra aquelas doas aurelhas, e inscideys aquelas segon que yeu e dit en la inscizio de doas mellas engualment.	Every vein now becomes swollen in the groin, others afterwards in those two heels, and incides those according as you wished and as I have said at the beginning of these matters
E yeu ja fu medicat una femna de apostema le qual era nat en le golayro de lu, le qual apostema tendia a color fusca, de pauc sentiment, le qual ja havia claus le golayro de lu, e la femna respirava am meat streyt, e ja havia prohibit a lu comestio e beure de aygua, e ja era pervenguda a la mort si mays agues stat per un dia o per dos.	And I have already treated a a woman of apostemas who was born in the groin, who had a yellow apostemas, little feeling, which had already closed the groin of her, and the woman breathed with difficulty, and I had already prohibited her from eating and drinking water, and she was on the verge of death if more water had not been given for a day or two.
E l’apostema ja tant havia pugat que havia mezes dos ramps entro que eyssiro per dos traucs.	And the apostemas had already swollen so much that there were two ramps between which I had to make two incisions
Donc yeu me cuytegui fisturalment e fiquegui en un de lor onci, e tiregui aquel, e atirada es de lu gran porcio, e aprop yeu incidigui aquela de on comprendegui del autre trau, e aprop yeu obrigui la boca de lu, e compremegui la sua lengua, e aprop yeu fiquegui le onci en aquela apostema.	Therefore I stitched fistulately and remained on one of them, and pulled out the other, and when I had taken out a great part of it, I incisioned that which did not comprehend the other side, and I opened the mouth of it, compressed its tongue, and remained on that side of the apostemas.
E aprop yeu abscizi gran partida de lu, e no corria de lu sino un pauc de sanc.	And I evacuated a great part of it, and did not bleed from it except for a little blood
Donc absolut es le guolayro de aquela femna, e comensec tantost beure aygua, e aprop presec vianda, donc yeu no cessegui inscidir de aquela apostema motas vetz per lonc temps, e succesia apostema en loc de aquel, le qual inscizia entro que es prolonguat aquel.	Therefore the groin of that woman is absolutely cured, and she began to drink water immediately, and I prescribed her no food, therefore I did not cease to make incisions of that apostemas for a long time, and afterwards there was another apostemas in place of that, which I incisioned as long as that one lasted
Donc yeu engen agui e cauterizegui le guolayro de lu, donc astec de addicio; e aprop yeu perambulegui e no saubi que fec Dieus de aquela aprop mi.	Therefore I went quickly and cauterized the groin of her, so as to prevent recurrence; and I went away and did not know until now that God had taken her from me.

De inscizio de huvela quan es apostemada.	From the beginning of this illness when it is apostemated.
Quan catarr deysen a la huvula, e es apostemada e es longa, lahoras ela es nompnada perpendicular; e si es en la partida dejos grossa e redonda, e lahoras ela es apelada buba.	When the swelling of the limb is upward and is apostemated and is long, the hour it is called perpendicular; and if it is in the lower part wide and round, and the hour it is called buba
Mays quan es curada am aquo que havem dit en la divisio, e no comfereys la tua curacio, e eyssament ja vezes que apostema caut ja es ostat de lu e es subtil, lahoras cove que tu inscidas aquela que es agreguadas redonda; e si es ad aquela longitut, e es sanguina, de fusca color o de negre, e no es a lu centiment, lahoras cove que tu temtes la inscizio de lu, quar en aquela es temor sobre le malaute.	When it is cured with the things that we have said in the division, and you do not neglect your treatment, sometimes the apostemas disappears by itself when it has shrunk; in that case you must know that it must be sutured around, and if it is of that length, and is bloody, of a yellowish or blackish color, and is not firm, you must fear that there is danger of the disease.
E quan tu vezes aquela segon la manieyra que yeu he dita de la sua blancor e longuesa, que tu fassas sezer le malaute e premas la lengua de lu am instrument del qual procesic la sua forma e aprop fica le onci en la nuva, e tira aquela en jos e inscideys aquela am un de dos instrumentz les quals e ditz en la inscizio de dos mellas.	And when you see that according to the manner that I have said of its whiteness and length, that the pain has disappeared and the tongue has become limp, which is an instrument with which it proceeds, and you leave the mark of the instrument on the new one, pull out that which is in the old one and incision that with one of the two instruments which are mentioned at the beginning of two mellas.
E cove que no inscidas aquela sino aquo que es ajustat sobre le terme natural ses addicio, quar si tu inscides de lu mays, lediyras le sieu parlar.	And you must know that you must not make the incision except as is adjusted to the natural term of its addiction, because if you make the incision too much, you will make it worse
E aprop la inscizio, usa de aquo le qual havem recomtat en la inscizio de dos mellas, e cura aquela entro que sia sanat.	And at the end of the incision, use the thing which we have recommended at the beginning of two mellas, and care for that which remains healthy
Mays si era le malaute espaventat per la inscizio de lu, cove que use de engen en la cauterizacio de lu ses temor, e la manieyra del cauteri en lu no es sino am aygua aguda, e es que tu pauses le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop prem la lengua de lu am le instrument le qual havem dit, e aprop pren de l’aygua la qual havem dita en le capitol de cauterizacio, e comfeys am aquela caus viva, e pausa aquela no spessa ni subtil, e de aquela omple la concavitat de l’estrument del qual aquesta es la forma:	When the disease is feared by the incision, know that you must use force in the cauterization of it, and the way of making the incision is nothing but with acute water, that is to say, you must press the head of the patient down, and at the same time grasp the tongue with the instrument which we have mentioned, and then take some water which we have mentioned in the chapter of cauterization, and comfort that which is alive, and stop that which does not expand or contract, and from that fill the cavity of the instrument which is like this form.
Sia la extramitat de lu conquavitat en la qual sia pausada la medicina ayssi cum la conquavitat de culher de ray, e pausa le strument am la medicina sobre la vula, e·l malaute jagua sobre le sieu latz per so que corro saliva o musellage de la boca de aquel per la intrinscequa medicina, per so que no deyssenda de aquela deguna causa sobre le golayro de lu e que ledesca aquel.	Like the extraction of the cavity in which the medicine is stopped just like the cavity of the heel of a ray, and stop the instrument with the medicine over the lip, the pain will go away over the side of the teeth so that it will secrete saliva or mucus from the mouth of that thing for the intrinsic medicine, so that it does not remain from that any cause over the groin of it and that it escapes from there.
E aprop te la tua ma am la medicina, e exprem aquela sobre la uvula per l’espazi de miega hora entro que vegas aquela esser denegrada e sedada per la mordicacio de la medicina.	And then put your hand on the medicine and press that against the uvula for the space of a quarter of an hour until that which is being treated has been made pale and quiet by the bite of the medicine.
E si vols, prengues coto e envolopes aquel sobre la extremitat del ray, e submergeys le coto en la medicina, e entrometas le ray am le coto en una canula de sobre entro que·l coto adheresca en aquela canula, e fay aquo tantas vetz entro que consiegues aquo que vols de la cauterizacio de la uva, e aprop leyssa aquela quar ela se seccara e cayra aprop tres dias o quatre.	And if you wish, take a sponge and cover that over the limb of the ray, and immerse the sponge in the medicine, and put the ray on the sponge in a tube so that the sponge adheres to that tube, and do that for as long as it takes until you achieve what you wish from the cauterization of the heel, and then remove that which has dried up and fallen off by itself within three or four days.
E si indigeysses que iteras la medicina, itera aquela, e aprop la cauterizacio abstergeys en le circuit de la uva am coto enbegut en boder, e mondifica am aquel aquo que es en le circuit de lu de la medicina, e sia lavat am aygua frega, e sia curat deforo am embrocacio, e dedintz am guarguarismes entro que sia sanat.	If you suspect that the medicine is inadequate, repeat it, and apply the cautery again in the circumference of the navel towards the breastbone, and modify that which is in the circumference of the medicine, and let it be washed with cold water, and let it be cured with unguents, and leave it under guard until it is healed.
E aquesta especia de curacio es pus salva que inscizio e pus long de temor.	This kind of treatment is more safe than rash and takes less time.
Alcunas veguadas es curada la uvuola am aquo que es pus subtil que cauteri e inscizio, quar es curat am subfumigacio en aquesta manieyra: recipe calament, ysop, origua, ruda, scicados arabic, camamilla, broyda e semblant ad aquels de las erbas, e ajusta totas aquelas causas, o alcunas de lor, en una ola, e sian submergidas am vi agre, e bulhan; e la ola sia be lutada am lut decentment, e sia en le mieg loc de la ola un trauc, sobre le qual sia pausat un instrument conquau de aram segon aquesta manieyra; sia fayt de argent o de aram.	Some herbs are cured with water which is more subtle than cautery and rash, which is cured by fumigation in this manner: prescribe calamine, broth, origanum, rue, bitter almonds, chamomile, barley and similar to those herbs, and adjust all these causes, or some of them, in a dose, and let them be immersed in strong wine, vinegar and broth; and the dose should be shaken well, and in the middle of the dose put a sponge, over which is placed an instrument of iron according to this manner; let it be made of silver or iron.</end_of_turn>
E sia entromesa la extremitat en la boca del malaute entro que la vapor poge a la uvula sobre la quanula, entro que la uvula sia mot ofuscada.	And let the extremity be introduced into the mouth of the patient until the vapor reaches the uvula above the tonsils, until the uvula is not obscured.</end_of_turn>
E aprop itera sobre aquela motas veguadas entro qu’es secca, e guarda te que no fassas aquesta curacio al comesament de l’aveniment de apostemas, quar trop ajustaria en le apostema, e no cove que tu fassas aquo, sino deves la declaracio de apostema de lu caut.	And repeat the treatment above until it is dry, and keep that you do not perform this treatment at the beginning of an attack of apoplexy, because it would be too strong for the apoplexy, and do not think you should perform it, but declare the apoplexy from it.</end_of_turn

If you do not have this instrument, then take a tube and put a pledget of wool in the extremity of it, so that the mouth of the patient is moistened, because the pledget of wool prevents the vapor from burning the mouth.</end_of_turn
E aquesta curacio es bona am salut.	This treatment is good for health.</end_of_turn>

And so, prepare a basin filled with cold water, open their mouth with that, and wash their mouth with that; and do not allow anything to pass from their mouth for an hour, and drink water an hour later with your hand, so that the blood sugar should be as much as when the water was poured.

E si no catz, lahoras tu itera la subfumiguacio motas vetz, e abstengua le malaute de beure, e mange causas saladas e alhs, e no begua aygua, e ayssi necessari es que am aquest regiment sia fora-getada.	And if it does not fall out, then repeat the fumigation many times; abstain the patient from drinking, and give them salt-laden foods and others, and do not drink water, and if necessary, do this for a long time.
