En le qual es la suma del sermo en apercio de apostemas e en seccio de lor.	In which is the sum of the sermon in the opening of apostemas and in the section of them.
Les apostemas so motas specias, de motas manieyras, segon que ve rememoracio de lor, de quascuna en aquest libre.	The apostemas are many species, of many methods, according as you remember them, from some in this book
E so diversas en perforacio e seccio de lor per doas manieyras, de las quals la una es per la specia de apostemas en si meteys; e per aquo que comprem de las humiditatz.	And they are various in perforation and section for two methods, of which one is for the species of apostemas in themselves; and for what they grasp of humidity.
E la segonda manieyra es prop les locs en les quals accideys del cos, quar le apostema accident en le cap es autra de la apostema accident en le cul; e le apostema en le loc carnos accident es autra del apostema accident en junctura; e a quascun de lor es son juguament per operacio.	And the second method is for the places in which the accidents of the body occur, for the apostemas that happen in the head are different from those that happen in the buttocks; and the apostemas that happen in the fleshy parts are different from those that happen in the joints; and each one of them must be treated differently for the operation
E mays de apostemas so alcunas las quals cove que no sian perforadas sino aprop maturacio de la sania en aquels o compliment de lor.	And indeed, some apostemas should not be perforated except at the proper maturity of the blood in those or in their complement
So autras apostemas les quals cove que sian traucatz quan son cruzes, e no son maturatz segon lor compliment, ayssi cum apostemas que son propdas a las juncturas, quar apostema quan ve prop junctura, lo esser de lu es prolonguat entro que·s poyreys aquo que es en le circuit de lu, e fort leu son corromputz les liamentz o les nervis de aquela junctura, per que es fayta causa de contraccio de aquel membre; o es apostema prop de membre principal, e si tu tardas la perforacio de lu entro sia madurat nosira al membre principal; o es prop le cul, donc perfora aque no-madurat; e no cove que·l perforas cru, de no-complida degestio, sino aquel que es prop del cul, per so que no poyresca le preon de lu e sia elonguat a las partidas dedintz del cul, e sia fayta fistula, o que sia fayt en le terme de lu que no sia sanat.	And other apostemas should be ligated when they are crossed, and are not mature according to their complement, as well as apostemas that are proper for the joints, for an apostema when it is near a joint, is prolonged until it has reached the liquid that is in the circuit of it, and when it is corrupted it corrupts the ligaments or nerves of that joint, because it is a harmful cause of contraction of that limb; or it is an apostem of the main limb, and if you delay the perforation of it until it is mature it will not benefit the main limb; or it is proper for the buttocks, therefore perforate it only when it is not mature; and do not perforate it cruelly, except for the one that is proper for the buttocks, so that you do not cause a fistula, or that it is not healed in the end that it is not healthy
Mays cove que tu sapias la hora de la perforacio de la apostema, e aysso es quan es maturat.	Indeed, you must know the time of the perforation of the apostema, and that is when it is mature.
E sapias que es madurat quan es la cedacio de la dolor e la cessacio de la febre, e aprop la diminucio de la rogor e de la pulsacio, e la acuitat del cap del apostema, e les autres senhals.	And you must know that it is mature when it is the cessation of pain and the cessation of fever, and almost the diminution of rigor and pulse, and the sharpness of the head of the apostema, and the other signs
E quar cove que sapias la perforacio cazer en le loc pus dejos del apostema e de pus venient de curacio de la eminencia.	And you must know that you must perforate in the place furthest from the apostema and where the cure comes from the prominence
E perforacio tostemps sia per le lonc de la carn o del cors, si las apostemas son en las partidas de las mas o dels pes, e en loc dels lacertz, de las cordas dels nervis, de las arcerias; e, al derier, en totz locs enguals en les quals no es reflecio; quar en aquels que so reflectitz, usa de perforacio segon aquel membre.	The perforation must always be done through the length of the bone or the body, if the apostemas are in the parts of the head or the feet, and in the places of the lacerta, of the cords of the nerves, of the arteries; and finally, in all the places where there is reflection; for in those where there is reflection, use the perforation according to that limb.
Mays quan le apostema es en loc carnos, lahoras miels es que leysses la perforacio de lu entro que sia confermada la digestio de lu segon compliment, ayssi quo havem dit; quar si tu perforas aquel denant aquo, es prolonguat le cors del poyre de lu e de mota sordicia, e fort leu las labias de lu so enduradas e la profunditat de lu.	When the apostema is in a fleshy part, then you must wait before perforating it until its digestion has been confirmed according to its complement, as we have said; for if you perforate it before that, it is prolonged the time of suffering and of great harm, and it makes the lips of the limb stiff and the depth of it
Mays alcus apostemas so perforatz segon la latitut de la carn o del cos deves la necessitat, o segon aquo del qual lo membre indigeys.	The wound must be punctured according to the width of the limb or the extent of the swelling, or as much as is necessary for the part which is suffering.
E cove que administres petita perforacio , e·n les apostemas grans gran perforacio e ampla o motas seccios segon la diversitat de la grandesa dels apostemas.	And thus administer a small puncture, in the large abscess great puncture and wide or several sections according to the diversity of the size of the abscesses.</end_of_turn>
E autras so dels apostemas en les quals cove que la codena sia conquavada e sia encidida, quan es fayta ayssi quo pan e fayta es en terme que ja stigua, ayssi cum aquel que accideys en trops de dubelec e de bubos.	And thus are the abscesses in which you must make the cordena concave and inflamed, when it is necessary to prevent that it should burst, as it is in the case of boils and carbuncles.</end_of_turn
E de aquels so que so insciditz am seccio havent tres angles; e de aquels es en le qual es inscidit ayssi cum figura de fuelha de mirtra, ayssi cum las apostemas dels angonars. E de lor so en les quals es administrada seccio redonda e seccio lunar, e semblantz ad aquels.	And of those which are incised with round section and lunar section, and resembling these.</end_of_turn>

And concerning those to whom it is not possible thus as are superficial abscesses, cover that you perforate only the superficial puncture, or flatten only.</end_of_turn
E cove quant le apostema es gros e ya ha colligit mota sania, que perfores aquel e no te coytes que extraguas tot le poyre en aquela hora; habantz extratz de aquel una partida, e aprop opila le apostema entro al autre dia, e aprop extratz una partida major, e aprop fa aquo motas veguadas segon graduacio entro que sia foro-getat.	And concerning the abscess which is large and has collected a great amount of pus, that you perforate it and do not fear that you will extract all of it at that moment; having extracted a part, place the abscess back into the other day, and extract a greater part the next day, and so gradually remove what is pus-filled until it is forgotten.</end_of_turn

And more if the patient is of cold temperament, or female pregnant, or a young child, or old in decrepitude, for the animal spirit of pus is resolved with the evacuation of the pus, and it is very good that the patient should recover from the illness, and you perform the operation.</end_of_turn

Be careful with this chapter, and when you puncture these abscesses, cover that you extract the purulent matter and consider therefore if the purulent matter of the abscess is little, or if it is a flat section, when you administer which of the two or both as an antidote; and if the abscess is great and the tears of the puncture are many, cover that you stop meandering in every place until they grow together.</end_of_turn

And if in the abscess a part of the cordena has been ruptured or has been flattened in the circuit, cover that you join it with old or new cloth or silk thread, just as when you have treated wounds or ulcers, its humidity; and stretch it on the third day; and thus proceed with it and care for it until the inflammation has gone away.</end_of_turn

And if there should happen to flow pus during the operation, cover that you administer cold water and vinegar in which there is a thread of silk, and stop that on the area of the flow of pus excessively purulent.</end_of_turn

De seccio de apostemas les quals veno en la codena del cap.	Of the section of abscesses which occur in the groin of the head.</end_of_turn
En la codena del cap petitz apostemas, e so de specias de nodes les quals conteno tunicas que so a lor factz ; e las specias de lor so motas.	In the groin of the head there are small abscesses, and they contain fatty substances which are their substance; and the substances are many.</end_of_turn
E de lor son pingas, e de aquelas so que conteno humiditat semblant a lima.	And of these there are pins and those which contain humidity similar to lime.</end_of_turn
E de aquelas so las quals conteno humiditat semblant a pols, et asemblantz a lor; e de aquelas so que son lapideas, durs.	And of those which contain humidity similar to pus, and resembling them; and of those which are soft and brittle.</end_of_turn
E en la seccio de totz, e en la extraccio de aquels no es temor, cum deves la exteccio de aquels no fa contrariat arceria.	And in the section of all of them, and in the extraction of these there is no fear, as you must know the extension of these does not cause damage to the artery.</end_of_turn
E la operacio en seccio de aquels es que tu esproes aquels am instrument la forma del qual ve aprop aysso, le qual es apelat entromes, entro que sapias que contengua.	And the operation in the section of these is that you expel them with an instrument of the kind which you see here, which is called an entrome, until you believe that it contains.</end_of_turn

E aquesta es la inscriptura del sermo de aquels.	This is the inscription of the sermon of these things.</start_of_turn>
Mays en les homes haventz esquinencia, cove que sia esquivada la extraccio del epilhot, cum per aquo no sia fayt juvament per so quar totas las venas e las majors del malaute so aqui.	Maybe in women there has not been an esquinencia, so that the extraction of the heel is avoided, as it is not of any use for the healing of all the veins and the greater part of the illness is here.</start_of_turn>
Mays en aquels que han apostemas cautz en la boca o guolayro o dos aurelhas, quan la malautia no es en la cana, cove husar de la seccio de epilhot a fugir la perdicio la qual es fayta per perfocacio. Therefore when we want to perform it, let them puncture the heel leaving three circles of the circles of the heel, or four at a small distance for the width in that which it is between two circles in quantity, that the incision is in cartilage, not in the cartilage, and that this place is convenient for incision, because it is private of flesh and the vessels of the sanctuary are loosened.</start_of_turn

De seccio sobre apostema le qual accideys en le golayro defora, e es apelat hernia del golayro.	Of the section concerning the swelling which occurs outside the groin, and which is called an hernia of the groin.</end_of_turn

E en le natural no es engen de curar.	And in the natural it is not the work of healing.</end_of_turn

The extremities of those with which incision is made are acute, and the others are not acute. And you must take these three kinds of syringes because they are necessary to obstruct the flow of blood with velocity in necessity, and when you first arrive it is not medicine.

De la cura de las mamillas dels homes las quals so asembladas de femnas.	Of the care of the breasts of men which are composed of women.
Alcunas veguadas so infladas las mamillas de alcus homes deves le compliment del dormir cum comensan esser pellutz, e aprop so infladas las mamillas, e so asembladas las mamillas de las femnas, e romano apostemosas, lejas.	Some herbs cause the breasts of tall men to swell due to lack of sleep like the beginning of the pallus, and so they swell the breasts and assemble the breasts of women, and remove abscesses, leaving.
E ad aquel que avoreys aquo, cove que inscidisca aquelas am seccio lunar segon aquesta forma, de la linha de .B. entro a la linha de .G., e aprop excorja la groceza tota, e aprop uempla la plagua de medicament encarnatiu, e aprop ajusta las doas labias de la plagua am cosidura, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And to him who complains of this, I say that you must make an incision with a lunar knife according to this form, from the line of B to the line of G, and carefully remove the whole hardness, and replace the wound with a medicinal plaster, and adjust the two lips of the wound with sutures, and care for the inside that it should be healthy
Mays si la mamilla declina a las partidas dejos e es mollificada per la sua magnitut ayssi cum endeve a las femnas, lahoras sia fendut en dos latz sieus pus sobiras, am dos seccios semblantz a figura lunar, de las quals quascuna sia contenguda en l’autra deves la fi de quascuna, entro que sia que la linha major contengua la menor segon aquesta forma de la linha de .B. e la linha de .G. E aprop excorja la codena la qual es entre dos labias de la plagua, e osta la pingueza, e aministra aquo que havem dit de la sutura e de las polveras aquo que es necessari en la curacio entro que sia sanat.	More so if the breast hangs downwards towards the thighs and is softened by its magnitude just as it happens with women, when it is split into two lateral parts with two cuts resembling a lunar shape, of which each contains the other one because the major line contains the minor one according to this form of the line of B and the line of G. And so remove the cord which is between two lips of the wound, and keep the swelling, and administer what we have said of the suture and the powders that are necessary for the care until it is healthy

And if you do not comply with the incision to which I recommend for the discomfort of the patient and for the flow of blood, then I say that you must cover the wound with fat soaked in corrosive ointment and leave that which is dissolved by the ointment, and care for that which remains until it is healthy

Aquetz apostemas que veno dejos le titillic so de las specias de scrophulas, durs, las quals conte una pel que es sac.	Aquetz apostemas that remain tingling so from the species of scrofulas, persistent, which contain a bag that is sac

De seccio de apostemas que accideysso per arceria o per vena.	Of the section of boils that occur by arrow or by vein.
Quan arceria es rompuda, e la codena es consolidada la qual es sobre aquela, lahoras motas veguadas accideys apostema E les senhals per les quals es conoguda que imflamacio e apostema sian per la arteria o per vena: quar quan apostema es per arceria es lonc agreguat en le preon del cors; e que quan inpelleysses le apostema am les tieus ditz, sentes en lu quays sia stridor.	When an arrow is broken, and the cord is consolidated which is over that, then move the veins away from the wound that has occurred; for it is known that inflammation and swelling of the boil occur from the artery or vein: for when the boil is by arrow, it is long aggregated in the front of the body; and when it is by vein, sit on the thighs until the boil has subsided
E aquel que es per vena es redon al manifest del cors.	And that which is by vein is returned to the sign of the body.
E seccio sobre aquest apostema es error, e majorment en aquel que es dejos las aysselhas, e en les angonars, e en le col, e en motz locs del cors; e es mot gran, donc cove que la sua curacio am ferr sia esquivada, e aquel que es en las extramitatz, o al cap, cove que sia evitat.	And the section about this boil is wrong, and above all in those who leave the hairs, and in the armpits, and in the groin, and in many parts of the body; and it is not great, therefore cover that its cure by fire should be avoided, and that which is in the extremities, or at the head, should be avoided.
Mays sobre aquel que es de lor per imflacio de l’orrifici de la arceria, scindeys en la codena seccio en le lonc; e aprop huebre la seccio am uncis e aprop la arceria, e deliura de las tunicas entro que sia descuberta.	May about that which is from their for inflammation of the orifice of the arrow, split in the cord section in length; and immediately cover the section with lead and cover the arrow, and release from the tunics until it is discovered
E aprop met sobre aquel agulha e fay aquela penetrar entro al autre latz, e estrenh la arceria am fiel doble en dos locs, — la qual causa yeu a tu eyssenhegui en extraccio de doas arcerias les quals so en les templars.	And immediately put over that needle and make that penetrate through to the other side, and tighten the arrow with a double thread in two places, — which causes and helps in the extraction of two arrows that are in the temples
E aprop punh le loc le qual es entre dos liamentz am spatum entro que yesca le sanc tot que es en lu, e sia dissolvut le apostema.	And immediately put between two ligaments with some space until the wound is healed, and that the boil is dissolved
E aprop administra curacio en la qual es engendrat poyre entro que caian les liamentz; e aprop cura aquel am enguentz convenientz ad aquo entro que sia sanat.	And immediately administer care in which is engendered poor people until the ligaments fall down; and care that is convenient in water until it is healed
E si es apostema per seccio de vena, lahoras cove que tu tenguas am la tua ma aquo que es a tu possible del apostema am la codena, e aprop intromet la agulha dejos le loc le qual tu has tengut dejos la tua ma, e fay aquela penetrar; e sia en aquela fil doble entro que tu extraguas aquel del autre latz, e aprop ligua le apostema am bo liament segon que yeu he dit a tu en le liament de uva4 de doas partz am doas extremitatz del fil.	And if the boil is by cutting of a vein, then cover that you have at your hand over the boil with the cord, and immediately insert the needle except for the place where you have had your hand, and make that penetrate; and be in that fold double until you extract that from the other side, and immediately ligate the boil with good thread as I have said above in the section of two parts at two extremities of the fold.
Mays si temes que extraguam le fil, lahoras entromet le fiel am aquela agula dejos tot le apostema deves la inscizio de la agulha primieyra, e strenh les tieus fiels en quatre locs.	May if you fear that they will extract the thread, then immediately insert the thread with that needle except for that part where you put the first needle, and strengthen the thighs with four threads in four places.
Aprop secca le apostema en le mieg loc de lu entro que quan es yssit aquo que es en lu, lahoras tu inscideys la superfluitat de la codena, e layssa aquo que de lu es liat.	And immediately dry the boil in the middle of it until when it is wet that the cord will be split, and leave that which is bound to it.
E aprop pausa sobre lu pulvil le qual has submergit en vi e oli, e aprop administra la curacio la qual es fayta am calguas e enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And immediately stop over the dust that you have submerged in wine and oil, and immediately administer the care that is useful with lukewarm water and grease until it is healed
Capitol l del apostema le qual accideys per torcio de nervis.	Capital l of the boil that occurs by twisting of nerves.
Ayssi cum accideys apostema en arceria e en vena, e semblantment accideys apostema en les nervis quan accideys en lor percussio o accideys per trebal superfluable, e per semblantz.	Just as it occurs with an arrow and a vein, and in the same way that it occurs with nerves when it occurs to them for percussion or occurs by excessive work, and for a similar reason.
E es fayt le mays de lu en les locs dels adjutoris o del talo, o en tot loc en le qual so maugudas las juncturas.	And it is useful more in the places of the assistants or the thigh, or in any place in which there are swollen joints.
E es apostema greu, e es asemblat a la color del autre cors, e es en las majors de lu disposicios ses de lor e quan es streyt am vehementia, sent en lu le malaute semblant stupor.	And the boil is difficult, and is assembled like that of the other body, and is in the greatest part of the time accompanied by its discharge and when it is stretched violently, sitting in the place the patient is in a stupor.
E no es apostema agreguat en le preon del cors, e per so es dejos la codena, e el es maugut a tota partida e no va a las partidas denant ni detras.	And it is not aggregated in the front of the body, and for so it is left whole, and is swollen throughout and does not go to the parts before or behind
Donc aquo de aquels que es en las juncturas no cove que sia envasit am ferr, quar fort leu endevenguera contracio.	Therefore, that which is in the joints should not be enclosed with iron, for that would cause greater contraction.
Mays aquel que es en le cap o en le front fen la codena am spatum.	Do not put anything on the head or face, for that would burn the skin.
Mays si es apostema pauc, lahoras te aquel am les forfecs e abscindeys aquel de razitz.	If there is only a little swelling, then do not force it, but cut away that which is causing the swelling.
E si es gran, lahoras tu le suspen am unci, e excorja aquel, e aprop osta aquel; e ajusta la plagua am sutura, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And if it is large, then suspend it with a bandage, and remove that which is causing the swelling; then place another bandage over that; and suture the wound securely, and care for that until it is healed.

De seccio de apostema le qual accideys de cheil que accideys al ventre.	From the excision of the swelling which happened from the cheek to the belly.
Endeveno ad alcus homes motas veguadas en les ventres de aquels e en las autras partidas del cors de aquels theils les quals son apelatz funguals per similitut de aquels am funges, dels quals la razitz es subtil e·l cap de aquel es gros; e ja las labias de aquels so conversas, e es de aquels que es petit, e es de aquels que es mot magnificat.	Therefore, those people who are suffering from wounds caused by fungi on their chests and other parts of their body because they are similar to those which are on the fungi, of which the root is subtle and the head is large; and their lips are dry, and it is from these that the swelling arises, which is small and not significant.
E yeu ja e vist un, e en le ventre de lu eran dos theils les quals eran mays a funges semblantz, e no era diferencia entre aquels blancs, de menuda razitz.	I have already seen one of these, and in their belly were two others which were like fungi in appearance, and there was no difference between those which were white, of little root.
E ja las labias de aquels eran enversadas e se fendian, e humiditat corria de aquel tot temps.	And their lips were cracked and bled, and moisture ran from their bodies all the time
Donc yeu inscidegui aquels e atrobegui en la un en pes quays xviii unc. e l’autre quays vi unc.	Therefore I advise you to immerse them in cold water until the pain subsides and the other until you see an improvement
E la operacio en la inscizio de lor es que consideres lahoras si·l malaute es humit, e la color de atheil es blanca, humit, de subtil razitz; lahoras tu le inscideys am spatum lat, e sian en la presencia tua cauteris en le foc, quar motas veguadas deves la seccio de lu es expellit mot sanc; e si te ventz le sanc, cauteriza aquel.	And as for the operation concerning the wound, you must consider if the illness is acute or chronic; and if the color of the wound is white, moist, of subtle root. Then you should burn with a spatula made of lead, while you are in my presence, and evacuate the swelling with the cautery; and if you think the illness is healed, burn that which remains.
E si vezes le malaute pauruc e temeros, guarda te de inscizio am ferr; mays lahoras pren fiel de plom recent fayt, e strenh am aquel atheil, la manieyra del qual es aquela que havem dita; e leyssa aquel per dos dias.	And if sometimes the illness is slight and the patient is fearful, do not burn with iron; but rather take a recent blister and strengthen that wound, for which the manner is that which we have learned; and let it rest for two days
E aprop ajusta en la strictura del fil de plom; donc, no cesses strenher le plom granre devetz en theil, entro que sia abscindit e cayha per se ses trebalh.	Then adjust the tension of the thread of the blister; therefore, do not cease strengthening the blister greatly until it is detached and falls off by itself
Mays si theil es de grossa razitz, lahoras en la inscizio de lu es alcuna causa de temor e de paor, e majorment en aquel que es en le ventre.	And if the wound is large, then in the incision there is some cause for fear and anxiety, especially in that which is in the belly
Mays possibla es que tu inscindas la maytat de lu , e aprop cauteriza aquel per que no retorne.	It is possible that you must cut away the greater part of it, and then burn that which remains to prevent it from returning
E aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanada la plagua.	And take care of that until the wound is healed
E guarda te que tu no presumas inscidir theil le qual es de fusca color, de pauc sentiment, de leg reguardament, quar aquel es absi cancros.	And keep in mind that you should not attempt to burn that which is of a yellowish color, of little sensation, of regular consistency, for that which is abscess is dead flesh
E yeu vindre am rememoracio de cranc aprop aysso.	And I recall that there is a similar custom to this.

De curacio de eminencia del umbilic.	On the care of the umbilical cord.
Eminencia del umbilic es fayta per motas causas; o per fissuras del ciphac le qual es sobre le ventre, e yeys de lu la tela o budel segon que endeve en las autras rupturas; o per sanc le qual flueys de vena o de arceria segon que es denant dit, o per ventositat coarctada en lu.	The umbilical cord is useful for many causes; or for fissures of the pericardium which is over the belly, and these you should cover with a cloth or bandage as in other ruptures; or to heal which flows from veins or from arteries as it is said, or for excessive wind that is constrained in it
Mays si es per fissura del ciphac e per yssiment de la tela, lahoras la color del apostema es semblant a la color del cors; e es leon ses dolor, e aprop appar de divers situament.	And if it is for a fissure of the pericardium and for the swelling of the cloth, the color of the swelling is similar to the color of the flesh; and it is painful, and it appears in various situations
E si es per egressio del budel, lahoras le situament de aquel am lu de aquo que havem recontat, de mays vehement diversitat, e cum tu premes aquel am les tieus ditz es occultat, e aprop retorna; e fort leu es am lu so, e es magnificat mot deves le introt de banh e vehement trebalh.	And if it is for the discharge of the intestine, the situation of that which we have mentioned above is more diverse, and as you have heard that which is said to be hidden is occultated, and you should return it; and it is painful for it so, and is magnified more than is necessary to remove the intestines and excessive work
Mays si per humiditat, lahoras es leon e no es occultat quan premes am la tua ma, ni es constrengut, ni es cregut.	And if it is for moisture, it is painful and is not occultated when you put your hand on it, nor is it constricted, nor is it tense
E si es per sanc, lahoras am aquestz senhals apareys le apostema a negror declinant.	And if it is for healing, the swelling appears black and declining.
Mays si es per carn nada, lahoras es apostema greu, gros e dur, e es ficat segon una quantitat.	And if it is for nothing, the swelling is difficult, large and hard, and is fixed according to a quantity
Mays si es per ventositat, lahoras le tocament de lu es leon.	And if it is for excessive wind, the touch of it is painful
E la operacio en lu es que consideras lahoras si la eminencia de l’umbilic es per sanc de arceria, o de vena, o per ventositat; lahoras cove que sias prohibit de la curacio de lu, quar en aquela es temor e paor ayssi cum t’e ensenhat en le capitol en le qual he dit les apostemas per arceria e per vena.	The operation is that you must consider if the prominence of the navel is for the safety of the gut, or of a vein, or for infection; that you must abstain from its cure in such a case, for there is fear and danger in doing otherwise as you have been taught in the chapter where I mentioned the apostemas for gut and vein.
E si la eminencia del umbilic es per le budel o per la tela, lahoras cove que comandes al malaute que tengua le ale sieu, e sia stant extendut; e aprop senha am tenta en le circuit de tot le umbilic, e aprop comanda a lu que stia envers entre las tuas mas sobre le sieu dos, e aprop circunda am spatum lat en le circuit del umbilic sobre le loc le qual has senhat am la tenta; e aprop exten la maytat del apostema a las partidas desus am unci gran; e aprop lia en le circuit am fiel fort o am ceda e la manieyra del liar decent.	If the prominence of the navel is for the intestine or for the flesh, you must command the patient to lie still, and be extended; and you must tie at the circumference of all the navel, and command him to stay between your thighs over the two buttocks; and you must surround the circumference of the navel around the area where you have made the incision; and you must extend the greater part of the apostema to the parts below with one hand; and you must bind firmly or loosely in the circumference with your other hand and the manner of the surgeon.</end_of_turn>
E aprop huebre le mieg del apostema extendut sobre le liament e intromet le dit tieu en aquel indic e quereys le budel; e si tu l’as atrobat ni guardat per le liament, lahoras tu extratz alxorati e impelleys le budel a las partidas dedintz del ventre.	And you must cover the extended part of the apostema over the ligament and introduce the thumb of your hand into that place and you will search for the intestine; and if you have found it or retained it for the ligament, you must extract the foreign body and bring the intestine back to the parts below the belly.</end_of_turn>
E si has atrobada la tela, lahoras pren aquel am unci; e inscideys las superfluitatz de lu.	If you have found the flesh, take hold of it with one hand; and cut away its excess.</end_of_turn>
Mays si es contraria a tu arceria o vena, lahoras circunda aquel mot, e aprop retorna a la tua operacio; e pren dos agulhas e met en aquelas dos fiels fortz e entromet dos agulhas en le circuit le qual has feyt entorn le apostema en manieyra de crotz, las quals fassas penetrar; e aprop strenh le apostema en quatre partidas sobre las agulhas.	May it be contrary to your incision or vein, you must circle around that area, and return to your operation; take two needles and pierce through those two holes firmly, and insert two needles into the circumference which you have made around the apostema in the manner of a cross, which will pass through; and then strengthen the apostema in four parts over the needles.</end_of_turn
E si tu vols, osta las agulhas e leyssa le loc entro que poyresca la carn extenduda e caia per si; o inscideys aquel quan es subtiliat e se poyreys, e aprop cura aquel am aquo que cove dels enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And if you wish, leave the needles in and leave the extended flesh until it falls off by itself; or cut away that which is subtle and falls off, and take care of that which covers the intestines until it is healed.</end_of_turn>
E si la eminencia del ombilic es de carn nada en lu o per humiditat, lahoras cove que tu conquaves le apostema ayssi cum havem dit e estraguas le sanc o la humiditat, la qual atrobas en lu, e aprop cura aquel am aquo que cove e que consolide le loc.	And if the prominence of the navel is from nothing in it or for moisture, you must compress the apostema as we have said and extract the abscess or moisture which you find in it, and take care of that which covers and consolidates the area.</end_of_turn>

De curacio de cranc.	On the treatment of abscess.</end_of_turn
Ja havem dit, en la divisio, de specia de cranc e en qual manieyra es via a la curacio de lu am medicinas, e que es squivador en lu la curacio am ferr per so que no sia ulcerat; e havem dit cranc engendrat en la mayra e cautela de la curacio de lu.	We have already said, in the division, about the species of abscess and how it is best to treat it with medicine, and that it is dangerous to treat it with iron so that it does not become ulcerated; and we have said that abscesses are produced by great heat and caution in treating them.</end_of_turn
E diyssero les antics que alcunas veguadas cranc es en loc on es possibla la eradicacio de lu, ayssi cum de cran le qual es en las mamillas o en la coyssa e a lor semblantz dels membres allocat a estrayre tot aquel, e majorment quan es comensant petit.	The ancients say that some abscesses are in places where it is impossible to eradicate them, thus as those which are in the armpits or in the groin and to whom it is ordered to extract all of them, and more especially when they are starting small.</end_of_turn
Mays quan es antiquat e es gra, no cove que te propries a lu, quar yeu non pogui sanar de aquel alcu ni no he vist autre, ni que sia pervengut ad aquo.	More when it is old and hard, do not attempt to touch it, for I have never seen it healed by any means, neither have I heard of any, nor is it possible that it should be healed by anything.</end_of_turn
E la operacio en lu es quan es allocat ayssi cum havem dit, es que tu precedescas e laysses le malaute e purgues de colera negra alcunas veguadas, e aprop sagna aquel, si es atrobada replecio manifesta.	And the operation for it is when it is ordered as we have said, that you precede and make the patient vomit, and purge with black bile several times, and then apply a poultice if it is found to be soft.</end_of_turn
E aprop prepara le malaute am preparacio en le qual sia locat am operacio, e aprop prohiceys en le trauc uncis les quals cove ad aquel; e aprop concava de tota part am la codena sego bona perexcrutacio entro que no romangua alcuna causa de las razitz de lu.	And prepare the patient in the preparation in which he is located in the operation, and order in the tract needles which cover that; and compress from all parts of the wound as much as the bandage will permit until no cause of the cause of the abscess remains.</end_of_turn
E layssa correr le sanc, e no abscidas aquel leugierament, e exprem les locs, e abstergeys le sanc gros tot am la tua ma o am instrument am le qual es a tu possible dels instruments.	Let it drain naturally, and do not prick it deliberately, and press the wounds, and dry the wound thoroughly with your hand or any instrument at your disposal.</end_of_turn
Mays si a tu fa contrarietat de sanc gros inscizio de vena o de arceria, lahoras cauterisa aquela entro que·l flux del sanc sia cessat, e aprop cura aquel am l’autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	More if in your opinion there is great pus in the vein or artery, cauterize that so that the flow of the pus is stopped, and take care of the other treatment until it is healed.</end_of_turn

De curacio de ydropici.	On the treatment of hydrosis.</end_of_turn
Nos ja havem recomtat, en la divisio, de las specias de ydropici de l’aygua, e les senhals de quascuna especia, de la curacio de lu am medicinas.	We have already mentioned, in the division, the species of hydrosis of the water, and their signs, and how to treat them with medicine.</end_of_turn
E aquela la qual es curada am ferr no es sino la specia de althitas sola, e no es aproximat am ferr a la specia de timpanistres ni a la especia de yposarcha, quar aquo es mortal.	And that which is treated with iron is nothing but the simple kind of hernia, and is not approached with iron to the kind of tympani or the kind of fistula, for that is deadly.</end_of_turn
E quan tu ja has medicat aquesta especia de ydropici timpanistre am medicinas e no comfereys la tua medicacio, lahoras considera, quar si al malaute ja es conseguida debelitat, o es am aquel autra malautia otra ydropici, ayssi cum si es en lu tos o cos de ventre e semblant ad aquels, lahoras guarda te que no le mediques am ferr, quar temor es sobre aquo.	When you have already medicated this kind of tympanic hydrosis with medicines and do not find comfort in your medicine, consider that if the patient has already achieved recovery, or is suffering from another disease, even if it is in the head or belly and resembling those, do not give him iron, for fear of that.</end_of_turn
Mays si tu vezes le malaute de vertut exuberant, e am lu no es autra malautia sino ydropici tant solament, e no enfant ni vielh, lahoras la manieyra de la operacio de lu es que tu eleves le malaute entre las tuas mas, e le ministre aprop lu exprema le ventre de lu am la sua ma, enpellen la aygua a la partida dejos del pentenilh, e aprop pren spatum spinos segon aquesta forma:	May it be that sometimes the patient is affected with excessive thirst, and that this is not another disease but only hydropathy alone, neither young nor old, for the manner of the operation in this case is that you elevate the patient's thirst between your hands, and minister to them with your hand the expression of their belly, filling the water to the level of the fifth rib, and immediately take a sponge of thorns in this fashion:
sia de dos partz agudas lonc, de aguda extremitat ayssi cum spatum; mays empero sia en lu alcuna brevitat petit a petit, per so que en la operacio am aquel no passes entro al budel, e que ledas aquel.	Both parts of the sponge are acute in length, with an acute extremity like a sponge; however, take each one in small degrees, so that in the process there does not pass into the belly, and that you leave each one behind.</end_of_turn>
E aprop considera si la generacio de ydropici es de part dels budels, quar lahoras cove que tu am la seccio te alonhes del ombelic per la quantitat de tres ditz a las partidas dejos, en le dreyt de lu sobre le pentenilh.	And consider if the generation of hydropathy is from the bowels, for in this case you must remove the section from the navel for the amount of three fingers below the fifth rib.</end_of_turn>
Mays si la generacio de hydropici es per malautia del fietge, lahoras la tua seccio sia sinistra del ombilic per tres ditz.	However, if the generation of hydropathy is due to a disease of the spleen, then the section must be taken to the left of the navel for three fingers.</end_of_turn>
E si la generacio de lu es per la melsa, lahoras la tua seccio sia en le las dreyt.	If the generation is from the liver, then the section is in the right.</end_of_turn>
E no cove que la tua seccio sia sobre le costat sobre le qual vol jaser le malaute per que no corron las superfluitatz ad aquel loc freul.	And do not let the section be over the rib on which the patient is vomiting, for it does not run the risk of causing the juices to leak to that area.</end_of_turn
E aprop perfora am le instrument tota la codena, e aprop entromet en aquela seccio, e eleva la tua ma am le spatum entre la codena e·l siphac, e tu excorja aquel; e si’ la quantitat de una ungla o enviro.	And with the instruments pierce the cord, and enter into that section, and elevate your hand with the sponge between the cord and the liver, and extract that; and if there is the amount of a nail or two.</end_of_turn
E aprop perforo le ciphac entro que pervengua le spatum al loc vuoyt, e es loc de l’aygua.	And pierce the liver until the sponge reaches the level of the water.</end_of_turn
E aprop extratz aquel e entromet un instrument del qual aquesta es la forma:	And immediately extract that and insert an instrument of this shape:
e es semblant a canula de argent subtil; es fayt de argent o de eram o de lato leon, al qual en la partida pus bassa de lu es un petit trauc, e en les costatz de lu so tres traucs: dos de una partida e un del autra partida; e fayta es la extremitat de lu insciza segon la manieyra de pluma, ayssi cum vezes:	It is similar to a silver needle; it is made of silver or ebony or gold, and in the lower part of it is a small hole, and on the sides of it are three holes: two on one side and one on the other; and the head is blunt according to the manner of a feather, as sometimes.</end_of_turn
E en la extramitat de lu pus sobirana es armilla, quar quan le instrument perve al aygua, lahoras aquela tantost deysen sobre le instrument, donc evacua de l’aygua en la ora miega quantitat, quar si tu evacuas de aquela mes que no cove en la hora, fort leu mor le malaute per resolucio del sieu spirit animal, o accideys a lu cincopi que es appropinquada la mort.	And at the end of the instrument there is an arm, for when the instrument reaches the water, so that much water comes out of the instrument at that moment, for if you evacuate less than that in an hour, it will be too little to cure the disease for the resolution of the vital spirit, or for the injuries to the fifth pair, which is near death.</end_of_turn
Mays evacua de aquela segon la quantitat de la vertut de lu e segon que significan a tu las disposicios del malaute de la vertut del pols de lu e de la bontat de lu.	Evacuate in this way according to the quantity of the virtue of the water and according to what you understand from the patient's disease of the virtue of the pulse and the hardness of the water.</end_of_turn
E aprop extrats le instrument, e rete l’aygua la qual causa es quar tantost es retenguda per la codena la qual rete le trauc que es sobre le ciphac del qual e recomtat a tu que perfores aquel segon aquela manieyra.	And immediately extract the instrument, and retain the water that causes this because it is retained by the cord that is over the hole that is on the liver, and command you to perform this according to that manner.</end_of_turn
E aprop itera le instrument al autra dia si vezes le malaute tollerant aquo, e extratz de la aygua petita quantitat, e fay aquo per alcus jorns sobre temor, e guarda te de error entro que no romangua de l’aygua sino pauc.	And repeat the instrument again the next day if sometimes the patient tolerates this, and evacuate a small quantity of water, and do this for several days for fear, and keep yourself away from error until there remains little water left.</end_of_turn
Mays si tu temes sobre le malaute, e leyssas de l’aygua gran quantitat, lahoras cura aquel am sepultura en arena cauda, e mota suzor en banh, e al solelh espere per lonc temps; e cura aquel am medicinas dessicativas entro que sia sanat.	However, if you fear about the patient, and you see a great quantity of water, then cure him by burying him in warm sand, wash him with bath, and expose him to the sun for a long time; and cure him with drying medicines until he is healed.</end_of_turn
E cauteriza sobre le stomac, e la melsa e·l fitge aprop la extraccio de l’aygua, segon que yeu he recontat en aquo que es precedit.	And cauterize over the stomach, the liver and the spleen according to the extraction of the water, as I have recounted in what precedes.</end_of_turn>

De la curacio dels enfants les quals so natz les locs de la urina no-perforatz.	Concerning the care of children who are born with unperforated bladder.</end_of_turn
Alcunas veguadas alcun dels enfantz es eyssi del ventre de la sua mayre e·l cap de la sua mixtio no es perforat (o es trauc streyt o no es en son loc).	Some of the children are born with their bladder still connected to the womb, and the head of the mixture is not perforated (or is slightly torn or is not in its place).</end_of_turn
Donc cove coytar am perforacio de lu tantost que es nascut am spatum mot subtil segon aquesta forma:	Therefore it is necessary to pierce it as little as possible as is born with a sponge moist without being harmful according to this manner.</end_of_turn
E aprop pausa en le trauc un clavil subtil de plom e ligua aquel, e te per tres jorns o per .iiii.tre.	And immediately stop the bleeding with a lead nail and bind it, and keep it for three days or for three quarters.</end_of_turn
E quant vol urinar sia remaugut e hurine; e aprop retorne aquel.	When he wants to urinate, he will be able to urinate; and immediately return that.</end_of_turn
E si tu no pauses le plom, ja es possible que la urina la qual va sobre le loc, no leysa aquest claure.	And if you do not stop the lead, it is possible that the urine that goes over the area will not be able to go through this nail.</end_of_turn
Mays aquel del qual le trauc es streyt sia medicat am clavil de Plom, ayssi cum havem dit, per trops dias entro que sia amplificat.	The pain is immediate and severe, like that of a thumb that has been struck by lightning.
Mays aquels en les quals es le trauc no en son loc, so leditz, la qual causa es quar de aquels, aquel que es nat e·l trau es deves la fi del cap de la vergua per que no pot urinar a las partidas dedintz, entro que eleva la vergua am la sua ma a las partidas desus; e no es a lu generacio, per so quar le sperma no pot pervenir a la mayre segon rectitut, e es malautia mot laga.	The pain that causes the swelling is not in the joints, so it is not a normal gout; rather, it is caused by the head of the kidney being swollen up so that it cannot urinate downwards, until the kidney is lifted up by the hand to the parts below; and it is not due to any other cause, for so the sperm does not reach its maturity according to its course, and is a disease of the bladder.
E la manieyra de la operacio en lu es que·l malaute sia envessat sobre le sieu dos, e aprop exten le cap de la vergua de lu am la tua ma sinistra am vehement extraccio, e inscideys le cap del cap de la vergua del loc del perpucii am spatum agut, ayssi cum es inscizio de pluma, o que tu ne razas alcuna partida, per so que·l mieg de lu vengua semblant al cap de la vergua e que le trauc caia en le mieg loc segon que cove.	And the way of operating in this case is that the patient is placed on the two hips, and then the head of the kidney is grasped by your left hand with violent extraction, and the head of the kidney is pierced at the place of the perineum with a pointed instrument, just like a puncture of the quill, or that you do not take away any part of it, for so the semen will remain like the head of the kidney and the pain will fall in the middle of the belly as it should.</end_of_turn>
E guarda te que en la tua operacio de flux de sanc, quar motas vetz accideys aquo; e pausa te a lu am aquo que abscindeys le sanc, e cura la plagua entro que si’ sanada.	And take care that in your operation for the flow of urine, no other matter occurs; and stop when you have opened the bladder, and care for the wound until it is healed.</end_of_turn>

De albater le qual accideys en le prepucii en le cap de la vergua e de corropcio e negror e adherencia del prepucii del cap de la vergua.	Concerning the swelling that occurs in the prepuce and the head of the kidney, and corruption, blackness, and adhesion of the prepuce to the head of the kidney.
Motas veguadas accideys aquest albater en la vergua e es eminencia de carn laga.	These matters are observed to cause this swelling in the kidney, and is an ailment of the bladder
E de aquela una es maligna e autra es no-maligna.	And from these two there is one that is malignant and the other that is not malignant.</start_of_turn>
No-maligna, cove que suspendas am unci subtil e abscindas aquela entro que aquela mondes tota; e aprop pausa sobre aquela coto submirgit en enguent egipciac; e aprop aquel, cura le am enguent diafinicon entro que sia sanat.	Non-malignant, because you suspend with a single sponge and evacuate it when it is done; and then stop over that cavity covered in Egyptian unguent; and do the same with the other, cure it with the unguent diafinicon until it is healed.</end_of_turn
E si albater es maligna, de lega color, lahoras cove que tu aministres cauteri aprop la inscizio de lu e la razio de lu.	And if the swelling is malignant, of dark color, then you must administer pointed cautery near the incision and the ratio of the cautery.
Mays si albater es en le prepuci del cap de la vergua no-circumcis, e la una partida de albater es dedintz le prepucii e l’autra partida es defora, lahoras cove que tu ostes albater le qual es dedintz al comensament entro que es consolidat; e lahora tu cura aquel deforo, quar quan tu curas aquel ensemps le prepuci, no es asegurat que no sia trinquat.	Moreover, if the swelling is in the prepuce of the head of the kidney, it is not a circumcision; and one part of the swelling is downwards the prepuce and the other part is outwards; then you must keep the swelling that is downwards until it is consolidated; and when you have cured that which is outwards, for when you have cured that the prepuce will not be torn
E ja eysamen accideys en les genetius e en le prepuci negror e corruccio, adonc cove que tu conquavas tot aquo que ja es denigrat e que ja se vol corrompre o que ja es corrumput; e aprop lineys sobre aquel aprop aquo am mel, le qual es contusit am farina de scorsa de milgrana e de errs trissatz e crivellatz.	And indeed, these matters occur in the genitals and in the prepuce of blackening and corruption, where you must conquer all that has already become degenerate and that has already become corrupted or that has already become rotten; and then apply pressure over that until almost all that has been softened is like millet flour and tears that are split and crushed.</start_of_turn
E aprop cura aquel am l’autra curacio entro que sia sana.	And do the same with the other cure until it is healed.</start_of_turn>
Mays si endeve flux de sanc, lahoras aministra cauteri lunar segon aquesta forma:	Moreover, if the flow of urine is delayed, then administer lunar cautery in this way:
quar cauteri juvatiu es a dos disposicios ensemps, so es a flux de sanc e a la plagua quan es corrumpuda.	because the lunar cautery is two-faced, so it is with the flow of urine and the wound when it is corrupted.</start_of_turn>
E si le cap de la vergua es corrodut e es destruit tot en la hora, lahoras cove que tu intrometas en lo meat del prepucii una canula de plom per so que le malaute urina per aquela.	And if the head of the kidney is corroded and is destroyed in an hour, then you must insert into the meat of the prepuce a a plum catheter so that the patient can urinate through that.</start_of_turn
En la adherencia del prepucii am le cap de la vergua (et aquesta adherencia no accideys sino en aquel del qual le prepucii es sa, e sobre lu no es exhigida circumcizio; e quan accideys adherencia per plagua o per apostema) cove que excorjas am spatum obtus entro que sia dissolvut le liament e sia deliurat le cap de la vergua de tota partida.	In the adhesion of the prepuce to the head of the kidney (and this adhesion does not occur except in the one in which the prepuce is soft, and over which circumcision is not required; and when it occurs by ulcer or fistula) you must scrape with a blunt spatula until the ligament is dissolved and the head of the kidney is freed entirely.</start_of_turn
E si es dificil desirnir aquelas exquisidament, lahoras cove que tu excorjes am spatum alcuna causa del cap de la vergua e del prepucii, e aysso es quar le prepucii, quan es subtil, fort leu es perforat per la sua subtilitat leugierament.	And if it is difficult to remove these things, then you must scrape with a spatula over the head of the kidney and the prepuce, and you must know that when the prepuce is soft, when it is fluid, it is easily perforated by its softness.</start_of_turn
E aprop separa entre·l prepucii e·l cap de la vergua am dra7 de li subtil, le qual ja es mulhat en l’aygua frega per que no adherescan autra veguada. De mundificacio dels enfants e de la curacio de aquo que accideys ad aquels de circumcisio.	Of the upbringing of children and the care of what occurs to those undergoing circumcision.</start_of_turn
Circumcisio no es solucio de continuitat ayssi cum las autras plaguas: mays empero cum sia de la nostra operacio e de nostra voluntat, e lus de aquela sia propriament en les enfants, es necessari que asignem en aquela milhor operacio e via pus leugiera perdusent a salut.	Circumcision is not a solution to continuity as indeed other diseases: however, since it is in our operation and our will, and because of that it is properly done in children, it is necessary that we assign in that manner a better operation and a less painful loss of health.</start_of_turn
Donc dic que les antics no diyssero circumcisio en alcu dels lors libres, quar no n’usan en las suas leys, e no es sino quar havem aquisit per speriment, la qual causa es que yeu he atrobat la major partida dels artifexs e dels barbies usar circumcisir e mundificacio am novacula e am torores; e usan de liament am fiel e de inscizio am la ungla.	Therefore I say that the ancients did not speak of circumcision in any of their laws, for they did not use it in their customs. It is true that we have learned through experience that it causes aversion among the artificers and barbers. They now use circumcision and mutilation with new and unfamiliar instruments; and they use thread of fine quality and incision at the nail.
E yeu ja he prohadas totas aquestas manieras e no atrobegui milhor mondificacio am forfexs, am liament am fiel que en mondificacio cum la ungla, quar motas vetz efugeys la codena pus desus, quar la codena del prepucii a dos tunicas, e roman la tonica pus dejos, e fort leu es forsat ad autra inscizio e dolor sicura.	I have already tried all these methods, and I do not approve of any mutilation with forceps, thread of fine quality like that used in circumcision, for in mutilation with the nail the pulp often escapes, as the pulp of the prepuce is doubled over two tunics, and remains tense beyond, and it is forced to another incision and severe pain.
E am mundificacio le qual es fayta per alphecati, e es digital, del qual usan les sabatiers, no es segurada la inscizio de la extremitat del membre viril, quar fort leu intra en le trau de lu.	As for digital mutilation, which is useful for alphbetization, and which is practiced by barbers, it is not accompanied by the incision of the extremity of the member viril, for it penetrates the tissue of it.</end_of_turn>
Mays en la operacio am ungla, fort leu obazeys ferr e corromp la tua operacio.	Moreover, in the operation with the nail, one must observe great caution and avoid breaking the skin, for this will corrupt your operation.</end_of_turn>
E la codena del enfant es breu per natura, e motas veguadas nays en tal manieyra que no ha necessitat de mondificacio, e yeu he vist aquel.	And the cord of the child is short by nature, and often it is not necessary to mutilate in this way, for I have seen many who have escaped without mutilation.</end_of_turn>
Mays de la mondificacio que·s fa am forfexs e liamentz am fiel, la bontat, experiment descrobic a mi, quar las forfexs so de proporcional inscizio, per aquo quar la acuitat que es desus es ayssi cum la acuitat que es dejos; e donc cum tu premes la tua ma so proporcionadas dos acuitatz, e inscideysso segon una comperacio en un temps; e es fayta compressio del fiel am figura contenent la codena de la vergua de tota partida, am le qual no catz error de tot.	Moreover, from experience I have learned that the use of forceps and fine thread is better, for the acute sensation that arises from the incision is equal to that which remains when the hand is placed over the area; and therefore when you press your hand in proportion to the acute sensation, and make the incision according to a comparison in a timely manner, it is useful to compress the thread with a figure containing the whole of the cord, so that there is no error of any kind.</end_of_turn>
E la manieyra de la operacio primeyra es que tu fassas estar le enfant majorment si es de aquels que entendo un petit, que no fassas sino que tu lies le fiel en la sua vergua tant solament, e que leysses aquel entro al autra dia.	The first way to perform the operation is that the patient should be in a state of greater calmness if he is of those who understand little, do not hesitate but bind the thread to his member alone, and observe whether he has bled by the next day.</end_of_turn
E aprop fay aquel alegrar en tota aquela manieyra que es a tu possibla de aquo que recep la sua intelligencia.	Therefore do whatever you can to make him happy in this way that is within your power, for he receives your intelligence.</end_of_turn
E aprop fa aquel estar entre las tuas mas estatuir preparadament, e no sia ges cezent; e occulta las forfexs en la tua ma o dejos le tieu pe, que l’enfant no veia aquelas ni degun autre dels instruments.	And do whatever you can to make him appear more poised, and do not be absent-minded; and conceal the forceps in your hand or place them on the foot of the patient, so that the child does not see them or any other instruments.</end_of_turn
E aprop entremet la tua ma a la vergua de lu e suffla en la codena, e tira aquela entro que sia eyssit le cap de la vergua, e aprop mondifica aquel de aquo que es agregat en ela de sordicia.	And put your hand on the member and blow on the cord, and pull that out until the head of the cord is completely severed, and then mutilate that which is added to it by moisture.</end_of_turn
E aprop lia le loc signat am fiel dobla, e aprop ligua pus bas de aquel un petit le segon liament, e aprop te am le dit pous e endic tieu le loc del liament dejos am bona retencio, e inscideys entre dos liaments.	And tie the area marked with thread in a double knot, and then tie another small one below that. Then put your thumb and index finger over the place where the thread was left, and hold the area firmly in place, making the incision between two threads.</end_of_turn
E aprop eleva la codena sus leugierament e estratz le cap de la vergua; e aprop leyssa le sanc corre petit e petit, quar es milhor ; e pausa polvera desus e sobre la polvera pausa drap en le qual es spandut mugol de huou coyt en ayguaros concosit am oli rozat recent bo; e layssa aquel sobre aquel entro al autra dia; e cura aquel am curacio entro que sia sanat.	And lift the cord upwards cautiously and grasp the head of the cord; and wait a little while, for it is better. Then sprinkle some powder over it and over the powder put on the dressing in which there is a sponge soaked in vinegar with olive oil recently boiled; and leave that on until the next day; and care for it until it has healed.</end_of_turn
La forma de las forfexs a mondificacio, aquesta es la forma:	The way of the forceps in mutilation, this is the way:
Sian las unas extramitatz no-talhantz e las autras sian talhant, que non sia yssit le ram del clau, e sia la longitut de las doas acuitatz ayssi cum la longitut de dos manubres engualment.	They are blunt at the extremities and sharp in the middle, so that it does not catch the skin of the clitoris, and the length of the two acute angles is equal to the length of two thumbs clasped together.</end_of_turn
Mays la error en mundificacio es quar fort leu efugeys la codena intrinseca tota, o partida de lu deves la inscizio.	Moreover, the error in mutilation is that it often escapes the intrinsic cord entirely, or part of it must be left out of the incision.</end_of_turn
Donc cove que tu extendas aquela de la tua hora am la tua ungla denant la apostemacio del loc e que inscidas aquela segon equalitat.	Therefore you must extend your hand at the opportune moment with your nail to indicate the swelling of the area and make the incision according to equality.</end_of_turn
E si no la podes tenir am la tua ungla, lahoras extratz aquela am unci e inscideys aquela.	Or if you do not have your nail, you can extract that with your hand and make the incision.</end_of_turn
Mays si son passatz tres dias, e roman aquo que es imflat dejos la vergua apostemat, lahoras tu leyssa aquo entro que sia cedat le apostema caut, e excorja aquel am fecilitat, e inscidex aquel segon que a tu es preparat.	Moreover, if three days have passed and the swelling of the member has subsided, when the cord has become softened again, you must wait until it has receded completely, and then gently extract it, making the incision as before.</end_of_turn
E guarda te del cap de la vergua, quar no nosera a lu aquo.	And take care of the head of the cord, so that it does not swell up again.</end_of_turn
E donc cura aquel am aquo que la plagua consolida de las polveras las quals havem recomtadas en le tractat de las polveras.	Therefore care for it as we have recommended in the treatise of powders.</end_of_turn
E si es inscidit de la codena sobre mesura, e obezeys a las partidas desus, aquo no notz a lu.	If it is necessary to make the incision deeper, and you obey these parts, then you will not notice it.</end_of_turn
E mays cura aquel am aquo que havem dit entro que sia sanat.	E mayes cura aquel am aquo que havem dit entro que sia sano.
Capitol .lviii.	When joint pain is caused by cold humors that infiltrate each part of the body, and pain occurs in the feet, it is customarily called gout by doctors.
De curacio de urina retenguda en la vesiqua.	Treatment for retained urine in the bladder.
Retencio de urina en la vesica es fayta per oppulacio fayta per peyra o per sanc congilat, o per poyre o per carnada, e semblantz ad aquels de aquo que havem dit de las manieyras de curacio en la divisio.	Retention of urine in the bladder is caused by full bladder due to stones or sand, or by weakness or paralysis, or by tumors, and is treated in the same way as the methods mentioned in the division
E si no es dissolvuda la urina, e veses retencio de lu esser per peyra le qual ja es en le col de la vesica, lahoras cove que le malaute sia encorbat sobre les sieus denolhs.	If the urine is not dissolved, and you see that the retention is due to stones which are already in the bottom of the bladder, then you must encourage the patient to walk a lot.
E aprop conponeys les pes de aquel sobre le sieu dos e extendas le sieu ventre de la partida pus desus del sieu dos, e le malaute estrengua le sieu ale tant quant es a lu possible.	And put the patient's feet on the two heels and extend their legs from the hip downwards, and the patient should strain as much as possible to expel the stone
Donc lahoras le col de la vesica es costreyt ha espulsio de la peyra a las partidas detras, per que la urina es absolta.	Therefore when the stone has been expelled from the bladder downwards, the urine will be completely expelled
E si no es dissolvuda am aquo que havem dit he vehement es fayta la causa sobre le malaute, lahoras cove que aministres extraccio de lu am instrument le qual es apelat siringua, del qual aquesta es la forma: Sia de argent e sia subtil leon conquau, ayssi cum canula de pena de ausel am subtilitat de ray lonc en similitut d’un palm e mig, al qual sia cana subtil en le cap de lu.	And if the stone has not been dissolved by the methods mentioned above, it is useful to make an extraction with an instrument called a siringue, which is like this: made of silver or bronze, with a tube like a pen with a bulb at the end like a palm and a half, and a tube of the same material at the top.
E la manieyra del eyssiment de la urina per aquel es que prenguas le fiel doblat e lies en la extramitat de lu lana o coto per bona liadura; e entrometas las extramitatz del fiel en la partida dejos de la ciringua, e inscideys am las forfexs si superflueys alcuna causa de la lana, mays intromet la en la canula am vehemencia E aprop enongeys la ciringua am boder e am album de huou.	And the method for extracting the urine is as follows: grasp the catheter tube doubled and tie it at the end of the bladder or the hip bones for good support. Insert the catheter tube into the opening of the bladder through the forfexes if necessary, but do not force it. Then advance the catheter slowly and steadily through the tube into the bladder.
E fay cezer le malaute sobre la selha, e embroca la vesiqua de lu e la vergua am olis umitz, e oli de oliva e ayguaros.	And make the patient sit up, and bandage the bladder with a cloth and olive oil and urine.
E aprop entromet la ciringua am facilitat entro que pervengua a la razit de la vergua; e aprop dobla la vergua desus a la partida del embelic; e aprop empelleys la ciringua dintz aquela; e aprop empelleys aquela entro que pervengua a la vesica, e aquela centa le malaute esser pervenguda a la causa vuoda, e no es fayt asso segon aquest orde, sino le meat en le qual va a tortuositat.	And then insert the catheter slowly and steadily through the opening of the bladder; and when it has reached the bottom of the bladder, bend the bladder downwards at the level of the umbilical cord; then hold the catheter firmly in place with one hand, and with the other hand massage the area around the bladder. The patient will feel relief when the stone has passed, and not before
E aprop exten le fiel am la lana petit a petit, quar la urina siec la lana.	And gradually withdraw the catheter along with the stone, so that the urine will flow freely from the bladder
Aprop extratz aquela e fay per curacio urina, e usa ciringua, no cesses fer aquo e usa ciringua entro que sia evacuada la vesica e le malaute atrobe alleviacio.	Then extract the stone and care for the urine, and use the siringue, do not do anything else and use the siringue until the bladder is empty and the patient is relieved of the pain.

De qualitat de clisterizacio de la vezica am clampcedra e am semblantz instrumentz les quals sian acordants ad aquo.	Of the quality of the cleansing of the bladder with clamps and instruments that are in agreement with the aforementioned things.
Quan accideys en la vesica ulceracio o apostema, o sanc congilat en aquela, o es coartat poyredura, e vols en aquela destillar ayguas e medicinas, lahoras sia fayt am instrument le qual es apelat clampcedra, e aquesta es la forma de lu:	When in the bladder there is an ulcer or swelling, or a stone, or if it is coarsened by reduced power, and you wish to drain urine and medicines, then it is useful to use a clamp to extract them. This is how it is done:
sino que en la extramitat de lu es sorda, so es clausa.	But if the urine is silent in the extraction, then it is closed
Et en aquela so tres traucs: dos de la una partida , ayssi quo vezes.	And there are three veins: two from one side, thus as many times
En le comensament es loc concau, en le qual es aquo que es enpellit, e sia segon quantitat que oppile aquel, ses addicio, entro que quan alcuna causa es ab aquel tirada de las humiditatz, sia atirada, e quan es expellida, am aquo sia atirada, e quan es expellit lonc, segon que fa clampcedra am la qual es phicat naphta en las batalhas de mar.	At the beginning is the bladder, which is filled with urine, and according to the quantity that fills it, so many veins. When any cause is overcome by that which is taken away from the humors, it is thrown out, and when it is expelled with the urine, it is thrown out with the urine, and when it is expelled far away, as the clamp throws it out which remains on the battlefield of the sea.
Donc cum tu vols prohicir humiditatz en la vesica, entromet la extremitat de clapcedra en la humiditat, e atira am aquel aquo que es empellit a las partidas desus, quar la humiditat es atirada en la conquavitat de clapcedra.	Therefore when you wish to remove the humors from the bladder, insert the clamp into the humor and pull out the urine that is filled in the parts above, because the humor is expelled in the concavity of the clamp
E aprop entromet la extramitat de clapcedra en la vergua segon que havem recomtat en la ciringua; e aprop empelleys la humiditat am aquo que empelleys, quar aquela humiditat perve a la vesica tantost, e le malaute cent aquela.	And then insert the clamp into the bladder according to what has been recommended in the siringue; and hold the humor with the urine, because that humor will reach the bladder again and relieve the patient of that.
Forma del cristeri subtil am le qual la vesica es cristerizada, e es aquela la forma:	Method of sub-uro-cutaneous crystallization of the bladder, which is as follows:
E sia fayta de argent o de lato, de la qual le cap pus aut sia semblant a petita pluma, e dejos lu cana dedintz liament.	And it is useful to make it of silver or of lead, of which the head is similar to a small pen, and to hold it with a ligament
E aprop pren vesica de moto, e pausa en aquela la humiditat que vols cristirizar en la vesica, e aprop lia aquela entre dos am fort liguatura am fiel doble, e escalfa aquela humiditat sobre le foc.	E aprop pren vesica de moto, e pausa en aquela la humiditat que vols cristirizar en la vesica, e aprop lia aquela entre dos am fort liguatura am fiel doble, e escalfa aquela humiditat sobre le foc.
E aprop entromet la extremitat del cristeri en la vergua.	E aprop entromet la extremitat del cristeri en la vergua.
E aprop estrenh la tua ma sobre la vesica am la humiditat am strectura descent entro que·l malaute centa que aquela humiditat ja es pervenguda a la vesica.	E aprop estrenh la tua ma sobre la vesica am la humiditat am strectura descent entro que·l malaute centa que aquela humiditat ja es pervenguda a la vesica.

Mays si a tu no es present vesica, lahoras tu pren una pessa de parguames e fay de aquel cercle; e perfora aquel de tota la sua retonditat; e aprop entromet fiel fort en aquels traucs, ayssi quo so revolgut; e aprop agregua le cercle ayssi quo es agreguat alsofatur, pus que tu pausas en aquel aquo que tu vols de las humiditatz, e olis e ayguas.

Nos ja havem dit en la divisio las specias de peyra e curacio de lu am medicinas, e la diferencia entre peyra engendrada en los ronhos e peyra engendrada en la vesica, e les senhals de aquela.

e scindeys en lu aquo que es entre·l cul e·ls genetius, no en le mieg loc, abantz al latz de la coyssa sinistra; e sia la seccio sobre aquela peyra e·l tieu dit sia en le cul, e sia fayta seccio transversa, per que la seccio defora sia ampla e dedintz streyta segon la quantitat que egrecio de la peyra sia a lu possibla, e no major, quar fort leu comprem le tieu dit le qual es en le cul la peyra deves la seccio, e es foro-getada ses defacultat.	and tears between the hip and the gluteal region, not in the middle of the limb, from the side of the left thigh; and let the incision be made upon that stone, that is to say on the heel of the little toe that speaks, and let the incision be transverse, so that the incision outside is wide enough and deep according to the quantity that comes out of the stone, and not more, for fear that it compresses the little toe which is in the heel of the stone from which the incision is made and is forced out by its defect.

De seccio sobre ernia acoza.	Of incision concerning hernia.</end_of_turn
Hernia ayguoza no es sino agregacio de humiditat en le ciphac blanc lo qual es dejos la codena dels genetius contenent le huou, e es nompnat ciphac.	A hernia is simply an accumulation of moisture in the white sac which contains the codename of the thighs, which is called the sac of hernias.</end_of_turn
E alcunas veguadas es en le propri pannicol le qual a lu preparec natura en la partida del huou, entro que sia cuyat que ja es autre huou; e es la codena del genetiu entre le ciphac blanc le qual havem dit, e no es aquo sino tart.	And sometimes the cause is in the proper belly which nature has prepared in that place for the fluid, until it is understood that there is already another fluid; and that is the codename of the thigh between the white sac which we have mentioned, and it is not simply water but pus.</end_of_turn

These are the signs by which we know that the accumulation of fluid is in the white sac which we have mentioned: when it is in the sac of hernias, the opening is rounded, declining slightly in length like a figure of water, and the thigh appears, for the fluid contains all around it.</end_of_turn
