E dic que cove que fassas sezer le malaute sobre una cezelha elevada; e aprop enpelleys le suspensori dels testiculs a las partidas dejos; e aprop te la codena dels genetius am les tieus ditz am les baysels que so probdas a la vergua; e tengua aquels autre ministre que tu, e extenda aquels am extencio vehement.	I say that you should place the patient on a high cushion; and in the thighs place the hooks of the testicles to the sides; and take hold of the hook of the genetius with the thumbs of the hands which are to be operated on; and have those other attendants whom you have, and extend those with violent extension.</start_of_turn
E aprop inscideys am spatum lat agut per seccio traversa en le dreyt dels vaysels entro que sian les vayssels descubertz.	And insert with a blunt knife a cutting incision through the middle of the veins until the veins are uncovered.</start_of_turn
E aprop excorja de tota partida ayssi quo a tu havem dit en extraccio de arceria las quals so en las templas.	And extract from every part as much as you have said in the extraction of arteries which are in the temples.</start_of_turn
E aprop fica en aquelas un’agulha en la qual sia fiel doble, e lia aquel en le primier del locs en les quals accideys vit, e lia aquel autra veguada en le derier de lor.	And leave in those a needle with a double head, and tie that in the first place of the area where the vital hit, and tie that other thread at the back of them.</start_of_turn
E aprop inscideys aquels en le mieg loc per seccio dreyta segon la longuesa del cos, e extratz aquo que es agreguat de las humiditatz fetulentas e corruptas.	And insert those in the middle of the belly for transverse incision according to the length of the body, and extract what is added of the foul and corrupt humors.</start_of_turn
E aprop cura la plagua am curacio de las autras plaguas en las quals vols sania esser engendrada per so que caian les vaysels les quals noyreysso un de dos genetius, quar no es mal per aquo.	And so treat the plague with the care of other plagues from which you desire to be cured so that they fall from the veins that would cause one of two genes, which is not harmful for this.
Mays si accideys vit a totz les bayssels, lahoras cove que·ls testicols sian extragutz o que les testicols per aquo se cequo am les vayssels, per que sia privat de tot nutriment per la inscizio dels vayssels, e que sian estaborits, o que cequo per so que no sia juvament am aquels.	May be the veins may be burst, but it is necessary that the testicles be extracted or that they be softened by the veins, for that is private of all nourishment for the beginning of the veins, and that they be established, or that they be softened so that they are not harmful to those.
Capitol .lxv.	Chapter 65
De la cura de hernia entestinal.	Of the treatment of an intestinal hernia
Le adveniment de aquesta hernia es per seccio que endeve en le ciphac extendut sobre le ventre de part dels angunars del mirac del ventre, per que deysendo les budels de aquela ruptura ad alcu dels budels.	The coming of this hernia is because of a tear that runs into the extended sac over the belly from the angles of the miracle of the belly, because giving way the bulges of that break are to some of the bulges
E aquesta ruptura es o del ciphac o de excencio de lu, e accideysso aquestas doas specias per motas causas: o percussio, o per sautz, o per clamor, o per elevacio de alcuna causa greu, o per semblantz.	And this break is either of the sac or of the hernia, and this happens for various causes: either percussion, or sneezing, or crying, or elevation of any difficult cause, or for lying down.
E·l senhal de aquo, quan es per extencio del ciphac, es que accideys pauc a pauc en lonc temps, e no accideys soptament, e es apostema engual entro ves le preon per so quar le ciphac comprem le budel.	And the sign of this, when it is for the extension of the sac, is that it happens gradually over a long time, and does not happen immediately, and is appeased as soon as the pressure is released from the belly by the pain
E le senhal de lu es quan es per seccio del ciphac, quar al comensament fa accidir dolor vehement sobtament; e es apostema divers aparent dejos la codena propdana aparent, e aquo es per eyssiment del budel, e·l cos de lu a las partidas deforo del ciphac.	And the sign of this is when it is for a tear of the sac, that at the beginning it causes sharp pain immediately; and it is appeased differently from the apparent cause, except that the corden is close to the apparent cause, and that is for the bruising of the belly, and the body of the hernia to the parts surrounding the sac
E alcunas veguadas es fora-getat am le budel la tela, e es apelada aquesta hernia entestinal zirbal.	And every other food is forgotten in the belly, and this hernia intestinal is called for this reason.
E alcunas veguadas es fayta am ventositat, e alcunas veguadas corr en le budel fenda, e aqui es retenguda, e es am aquo gran pernitia3 del malaute, e alcunas veguadas fa endevenir dolor malvada e majorment quan es premut.	And some foods are fat with wind, and some foods run in the belly wound, and here it is retained, and that is very harmful for the illness, and some foods cause great pain and especially when it is pressed
E en la curacio de las especias de aquesta malautia am ferr es temor, per que cove que sia esquivat le cazament en aquela.	And in the treatment of this illness it is feared, for that it covers that it be escaped from the wound in that place
E la manieyra de la operacio de aquela es que comandes al malaute que redugua le budel am la sua ma a las partidas dedintz de la sua conquavitat si obezeys al sieu retornament, e aprop sia envessat sobre le sieu col entre las tuas mas, e eleva las cambas de lu.	And the manner of performing the operation of that is that you command the patient to reduce the belly with his hand to the depths of his concavity if he obeys the surgeon's command, and then you are to wrap around his belly with a cloth between your hands, and elevate his legs.
E aprop sten la codena la qual siec la codena dels testicols a las partidas desus, e inscideys la codena dels testicols tota per le lonc; e aprop fiqua en doas labias de la seccio uncis segon que indigeysses a hubrir la seccio am aquels.	And so tighten the cord that ties the testicles to the parts below, and cut the cord of the testicles throughout; and then fix two fingers of your hand at the two angles of the incision as you would to open the incision with those
E si’ la seccio segon la quantitat que a tu sia possible que de aquela le huou sia foro-getat.	And if it is possible for you according to the quantity that you are able to do that from that there should be no remains left
E aprop excorja aquela ciphaqueth les quals so dejos la codena dels testicols, entro que sia descubert le ciphac blanc dur de quascuna partida.	And so remove that purulent liquid that is left from the cord of the testicles, until the white sac is discovered from any part
Lahoras tu entromet le tieu dit en aquo que siec le testicol, en aquo que es entre ciphac blanc, le qual es dejos la codena del huou, e entre le ciphac segon, e absolve am aquel’adherencia que es en la partida detras del huou.	Then you will enter the intestine said to be between the testicles, between the white sac which is left from the cord of the urine, and between the sac according, and remove that adhesion that is in the part behind the bladder
E aprop mau am la ma la codena dels testicols a las partidas deforo, e am aysso exten le ciphac blanc en sus am la ma sinestra, e eleva le huou am le ciphac a la partida de la seccio; e comanda al ministre que extenda le huou ensus e tu dissolveys la adherencia que es detras am solucio complida.	And so touch with your hand the cord of the testicles to the parts surrounding, and with my left hand extend the white sac downwards, and elevate the bladder with the sac towards the incision; and command the assistant to extend the bladder outwards and you will dissolve the adhesion that is behind with a completed solution
E cerqua am les tieus ditz que lay no sia alcuna causa del budel envelopat en le ciphac blanc dur.	And look that there is no cause for the belly being covered with the white sac again
Mays si tu atrobas de lu alcuna causa, lahoras tu enpelleys aquel al ventre dejos.	And if you find any cause of this in it, then you will leave it in the belly behind
E aprop tu pren una agulha en la qual sia fiel gros fayt de x fiels, e entromet aquel deves le derier del ciphac, le qual es jos la codena dels testicols, la qual siec seccio; e aprop inscideys las extremitatz las quals emineysso del fiel entro que sian quatre fiels, e aprop compausa alcus de lor sobre alcuna figura en manieyra de crotz; e lia am aquel le ciphac del qual havem dit que es dejos la codena dels testicols am fort liament de dos partz.	And so take a needle which is thick enough to make four holes, and enter that into the belly under the cord of the testicles, which is the incision; and when you have pierced as far as four fingers, and have made a cross, then bind around that with the gut of two parts.
E aprop envolveys las extremitatz dels fiels e lia aquelas am liament vehement entro que alcu dels vayssels que noyrrisso aquels no puscan trametre alcuna causa per so que de aqui no accida apostema caut.	And so cover the ends of the strings and bind them firmly until such time as some of the veins which nourish those do not suffer from any cause that they may not be able to transmit any more cause for that from here no further pain should arise
E pausa autra veguada liament segon foro le primier liament, lonh de lu mens tres ditz; e aprop aquestz dos liaments layssa del ciphac le qual es dejos la codena dels testicols la quantitat de la grandeza del dit, e inscideys tot le romanent segon redondeza, e osta de lu le huou.	And so suspend another portion of the intestine by a ligament as far as three fingers beyond the first ligament; and so suspend two ligaments so that they hold the belly which is left from the cord of the testicles as much as the greatness of the finger, and pierce all the rest according to the roundness, and leave out the urine.
E aprop inscideys en la partida dejos de la codena dels testicols per seccio de la qual corra sanc e sania ayssi cum havem recomtat en aquo que havem dit.	And then we penetrate the area below the testicles for the section of which runs clean and healthy again as we have recommended in what has been said.
E aprop aministra lana submersa en oli, e pausa en la plagua; e aministra le liament le qual havem recomtat (e alcunas veguadas le ciphac blanc es cauterizat, le qual havem dit aprop la inscizio de lu temen de flux de sanc, quar motas veguadas accideys aquels) e leyssa le liament entro que per si caia.	And then we apply soaked wool in oil, and leave it on the wound; and we apply the bandage that we have recommended (for several veins have been cauterized white in this place where we feared excessive bleeding, which may happen because of these veins).  We leave the bandage in place until it falls off by itself
Mays si le cazement de lu es tardat, lahoras de aygua cauda sia embrocat, e pausa sobre aquel entro que caia segon que havem dit.	Even if the case is prolonged, however, cold water must be applied, and leave it on until it falls off as we have said.
E aprop cura la plagua am l’autra curacio de las plaguas entro que sia sanat.	And then care for the wound like any other wound until it is healed
Capitol .lxvi.	Chapter 66
De hernia ventosa.	Of windy hernia
En aquesta hernia no e vist alcu que sia estat ardit sus la curacio de lu am ferr.	In this hernia nothing has been seen that has been omitted in its care.
E les primiers diyssero que es fayta ayssi cum havem recomtat en la hernia que es am vi; la qual es que tu lies les vayssels aprop la seccio sobre aquela am fecilitat de lu; e aprop secca en le mieg loc en enviro le apostema am aquo que obro aquel, entro que caian les vayssels.	And first say that it is useful as we have recommended in the hernia that is seen; that is to say, you tie the vessels close to the section above where it facilitates them; and then dry in the middle area around the tumor as much as possible until the vessels fall off

Capitol .lxvii.	Chapter 67
De la disropcio que es fayta en les anguonars.	Of the disorder that is useful for the joints
Alcunas veguadas endeve ruptura en les angonars ayssi cum havem dit, e emineys le loc.	Several veins have burst in the joints as we have said, and examine the area
E no deyssen als genetius alcuna causa dels budels al genetius; e si deyssen, aquo es pauc; e retorna s’en en totas horas.	And do not cause excessive bleeding in the knee; and if there is any, it is little; return immediately in all cases
Mays si es prolonguat le temps am aquo, es ajustada fissura en le ciphac entro que deysenda le budel en le ciphac; e accideys aquo per la extencio del ciphac le qual es en le angonars ayssi cum havem dit, la qual causa es quar le ciphac es estendut, e aprop es mollificat e·l loc es apostemat e emineys.	Even if the time is prolonged, however, adjust the fracture in the limb until the bleeding stops; and this happens because of the extension of the limb which is in the joints as we have said, which causes the limb to be extended, and therefore it is softened and the area is dehisced and examined
E la cura de lu es am cauteri ayssi quo es precedida la narracio de lu.	And the care for it is like that which precedes the narration of it
E alcunas veguadas es curada am ferr segon aquesta manieyra: e es que·l malaute jagua sobre le sieu dos entre las tuas mas, e aprop secca le loc de la ruptura dels apostemas emineys am seccio per la latitut segon la quantitat de tres ditz.	And every vein is cured with iron like this: the patient sits on the stool between your two legs, and then dry the area of the rupture of the bones examined with a section towards the outside according to the quantity of three fingers.
E aprop strenh le ciphac blanc que es jos la codena entro que sia descubert.	And then strengthen the white limb that is under the testicles until it is revealed
E aprop pren le ray e pausa aquel sobre le loc eminent del ciphac, e prem aquel al preon del ventre.	And then take the thread and leave it on the highest part of the limb, and hold that on the flank of the abdomen
E aprop cus le dos locs eminentz sobre la extremitat del ray del ciphac, e ajusta am la sutura un de aquels am l’autre.	And then suture the two highest parts on the extremity of the limb, and adjust with the suture one to the other
E aprop extratz la extremitat del ray, e no inscidas del ciphac de tot, ni no extenda le huou, ni autra causa ayssi cum yeu te fi saber en la curacio de hernia entestinal.	And then extract the limb from the artery, and do not insert any part of the limb, neither do not extend the bone, nor any other cause like I told you in the care of intestinal hernia
E aprop cura aquela am la curacio de las plaguas, e cum inscideyses les fiels, mundifica aquela e restaura la plagua entro que sia consolidada; quar le ciphac es contrayt e no es ajustada la eminencia de ruptura.	And then care for it like the care of wounds, and when you have incisions, soften that and restore the wound until it is consolidated; for the limb is contracted and the swelling is not adjusted
E cauteri es milhor en aquest loc, quar es pus propda a salut.	And it is better in this place, because it is more likely to be saved
Capitol .lxviii.	Chapter 68
De mollificacio de la codena dels testiculs.	Of the softening of the testicles' cord
Motas veguadas la codena dels testiculs en alcus homes es mollificada per aysso quar las carns que so entre aquela son mollificadas, e es fedat le reguardament de lu.	Many veins of the testicles' cord in several men are softened to help soften the flesh that is between them, and it is fed from it accordingly
Adonc necessari es ad aquel que es preguat en la curacio de lu que fassa jazer le malaute segon le sieu dos, e enscida tota la codena la qual es mollificada sobre la codena natural; e aprop que ajuste doas labias am la sutura.	When it is necessary for the one who is being treated to sit with his two legs apart, and he tears all the cord that is softened over the natural cord; and then that two lips are adjusted with the suture.
E si vols, cus en le comensament la superfluitat de la codena mollificada am tres cozeduras o quatre e am ferma sutura.	And if you wish, you can also ligate the excess of the softened cord with three stitches or four with a firm suture

Capitol .lxix.	Chapter 69
De castracio.	Of castration
Sapias que castratio en nostre ley es excomengada, mays per causa es legut a mi que·m remembre de lu en aquest libre; e no es necessaria la rememoracio de lu sino per doas manieyras, de las quals es la una per so que aquo sia en la sciensa del metge quan es enterroguat de aquela, que sapia la curacio de lu al qual accideys; e l’autra manieyra es que nos motas vetz havem necessitat de castracio de autras bestias per les juvamentz nostres per aquelas, ayssi cum de motos, e de bocs, e de porcs, e de semblantz a las bestias.	Wisdom dictates that castration is forbidden in our law, however, I remember it in this book; and it is not necessary to recall it except for two instances, of which the one is that the physician should know how to care for it when asked about it, since he knows the care of it when it happens; and the other instance is that we must sometimes castrate other beasts for our young people for their pleasures, as well as mares, and sows, and goats, and pigs, and in the same way as beasts.
E donc dic que castracio es fayta en dos manieyras: o per atrissio, o per fissura a seccio.	Therefore I say that castration is caused in two ways: either by extrusion or by incision at the root.
Mays en aquela que es fayta per atrissio, la via de la opera es que nos fassam cezer la bestia en aygua cauda entro que·ls genetius de lu sian mollificatz e sian linhitz e que pendan.	In the case of extrusion, the method of the operation is that we must cut off the beast in cold water until the testicles soften and become limp, and hang them down.</end_turn>
E aprop pren aquels am la tua ma entro que sian resols e no apparescan dejos le tocament.	And then take hold of them with your hand so that they do not appear to touch.</end_turn>
Mays en castracio fayta per fissura e seccio, cove que tu tenguas la bestia e premas la codena dels testicols de lu am la ma senestra.	In castration caused by incision and section, because you must hold the beast and press the testicles with your left hand.</end_turn
E aprop lia le suspensori, e inscideys sobre quascun huou am una seccio entro que dos huous proceseysso.	And then join the supporters, and make an incision on each side of the belly with two incisions proceeding from the belly button.</end_turn
E aprop inscideys aquels pus que auras quascu excorjat.	And then make the incisions when there is any swelling.</end_turn>
E no leysses sobre aquels del ciphac alcuna causa, sino le ciphac subtil le qual es sobre les vazes.	Do not neglect any cause of swelling, but take for granted the subtle swelling that is on the vessels.</end_turn><end_turn>
E aquesta manieyra de castracio es milhor la qual es fayta per atrissio, quar atrissio fort leu layssa alcuna causa dels testicols per que la bestia desira coyt.	And this method of castration is better than extrusion, because extrusion causes great swelling of the testicles, which would cause the beast to desire to bite.</end_turn><end_turn>
E aprop cura la plagua entro que sia sanada.	And take care of the wound until it has healed.</end_turn><end_turn>
Capitol .lxx.	Chapter LX.</end_turn>
De la cura de hermafrodozia.	Of the care of hermaphroditism.</end_turn>
Hermafrodozia en les homes es segon dos manieyras: la una es quar o appar en aquo que siec l’espazi en la codena de testiculs, en aquel que es entre dos testiculs figura quar cunh de femna en la qual so pels.	Hermaphroditism in men is in two ways: when or if there is an opening in the belly of the testicles, in which there is a bulge like that of a woman in which there is a swelling between the testicles.</end_turn
E alcunas veguadas de aquel corr urina le qual es en la codena dels testiculs.	And some women have a urinary bladder in the belly of the testicles.</end_turn
Mays en las femnas es una specia: e es que·l conh de la femna sobre le pentenilh es ayssi cum dos testiculs de home un pauc de tot yminiheys a la partida deforo ayssi cum le perpucii de home e dos testicols.	And in women it is a kind: and it is that the woman who has a penis like a man between the testicles has two testicles like a man, a little smaller than the normal testicles of a man.</end_turn
E la curacio es de tres specias: de dos dels homes e de una specia de las femnas.	And the care is of three kinds: two of the men and one of the women.</end_turn
E es que cove que tu inscidas aquelas carns ajustadas entro que efuga la emprecio de aquela, e aprop que cures aquelas am curacio de las autras plaguas.	And it is that you must cut away those fatty parts until the tumor is expelled, and that you take care of them with care like other wounds.</end_turn><end_turn
E en la segonda specia dels homes de la qual yeys urina la qual es en la codena dels testiculs, no es curacio ni opperacio en lu.	And in the second kind of the men of which there is a urinary bladder in the belly of the testicles, there is no care or operation for them.</end_turn
Capitol .xxi.	Chapter XXI.</end_turn
De lentinge e de carn eminent per causas de las femnas.	Of leech and ointment for the causes of women.</end_turn
Lentige fort leu es ajustada sobre causas naturals entro que es etressat e es fayt leg le reguardament; e alcunas veguadas es magnificada en alcunas femnas en tant entro que es spandit ayssi cum en les homes e perve entro al coito.	The strong leech is applied to natural causes until it is relaxed and is used legally; and some women are plagued with it as much as in men and even during coitus.</end_turn><end_turn>
Adonc cove que tu tenguas la superfluitat de lentinge am la tua ma o am unci e inscidas.	Therefore take hold of the excess of leech with your hand or with a sponge and apply it.</end_turn><end_turn
E no ultimes en inscizio, majorment en le preon de la razit, per so que no endevengua flux de sanc.	Do not hesitate to make an incision, especially in the groin, so that the blood does not clot.</end_turn><end_turn
E aprop cura aquela am curacio de las plaguas entro que sia sanada.	And take care of that like with the care of wounds until it has healed.</end_turn><end_turn
Mays carn nascuda es carn que nays en le horrifici de la mayre entro que umple aquel, e fort leu es eyssit a las partidas deforo segon semblansa de coa (e per aquo alscus primiers appelero aquo “malautia caudada”); donc cove que nos inscidam ayssi cum inscidem lentinge, e curem aquela entro que sia sanada.	And no new ointment is born except that which is in the horror of the mother until it fills that up, and the strong ointment is ejected to the parts like a sponge according to custom (and for this reason it is called "caudal disease"); therefore we must apply it just as we apply the leech, and care for that until it has healed.</end_turn><end_turn
Capitol .lxxii.	Chapter LXII.</end_turn
De curacio de alratica.	Of the care of wound.</end_turn
Alratica es que le conh de la femna no sia perforat, o sia le trauc petit.	A wound is when the woman does not have a hole, or has a small hole.</end_turn
E es o natural o accidental.	And it is either natural or accidental.</end_turn><end_turn
Accidental es per malautia la qual ha precedit, e aquela es fayta o per carn nada ajustada o per ciphac subtil o espes.	Accidental is for a disease that has preceded it, or that is caused by no adjustment of the flesh or by a subtle or thick wound.</end_turn><end_turn
E es fayt o en le preon de la mayre, o en les costatz de lu, o en le pus sobira de lu, o en le pus bas de lu, e prohibeys de cuoyt e de enprenguacio e de enfantament, e fort leu prohibeys las mestruas.	And it is found in the groin, on the sides, on the navel, or on the buttocks, and prevents sweating, movement, and intercourse, and strong ointment prevents menstruation.</end_turn><end_turn
E la cognicio de aquela es fayta per reguardament de la metrona, si la oppilacio es apparent, propdana; mays si no es apparent, lahoras tu cerqua aquela am les tieus ditz o am le ray.	And the knowledge of that is useful for the regulation of the womb, if the swelling is apparent, it is necessary; but if it is not apparent, when you touch that area you will feel it.</end_turn><end_turn
Mays si oppilacio es per ciphac subtil, e es propda a las doas labias, lahoras tu coyta e disromp aquela.	The patient is experiencing pain in various parts of the body, likely due to cold humors. The physician suggests that this is likely gout. If necessary, the physician instructs the assistant to make small incisions on the foot's surface using a pointed cautery. Additionally, the physician advises reducing any swelling or blisters and placing a hand over the area to prevent any internal organs from protruding.
E es que pauses sobre las doas labias pulvils, e aprop pausa les tieus ditz indicz de amdoas las mas encemps.	When the thighs are powdered with flour, and the assistant indicates that the bowels are full, then it is a sign of imminent discharge.
E la femna sia sobre le sieu dos, las sieuas coyssas extendudas, e aprop exten las doas labias am forsa entro que aquel ciphac subtil sia romput e la oppilacio sia uberta.	The female should sit on the two hips, the cushions should be spread out, and extend the thighs with force until the subtle swelling has burst and the swelling has opened
E aprop pren lana e enbeu le4 en oli e pausa aquela sobre·l loc, e jagua am home le dia per so que·l loc inscis no sia consolidat.	And take some wool and soak it in oil, place that over the area, and hold that there for so long as the area does not solidify
Mays si le ciphac es gros e espes, lahoras cove que tu inscidas aquel am spatum lat o am fuelha de mirta.	If the swelling is large and thick, then cover that with some thick fat or a sprig of myrtle leaf
Mays si la oppilacio es per carnada, lahoras suspen aquela am unci, e inscideys aquela.	If the swelling is bloody, then suspend that for a while, and make an incision there.
E sian am tu las medicinas que fan cessar flux de sanc ses mordicacio, ayssi cum ahacatia, e sanc de drago, e enses, ajustat am album de huou.	And give the patient the medicines that stop the flow of blood that causes swelling, such as vinegar, alum, and saffron, adjusted with oil of hyssop
E aprop aministra una canulha de plom ampla per so que la plagua no sia consolidada leugierament.	And give a wide needle of lead so that the wound does not solidify too much.
E tengua aquela per alcus jorns e aministra calgua de li sec.	Keep that for four days and give a dry gauze
E aprop sia curada am l’autra curacio de consolidacio entro que sia sanada.	And take care of it with the other care of consolidation until it is healed

De perforacio de eyssedura accident en la mayre.	On the perforation of an abscess that happens in the belly
Motas specias de apostemas accideysso en la mayre, ayssi cum cranc e apostema lapident e ulceracios e adhubelat e erpetromens e fistulas emorroyas e raguarrias e thyl e autres apostemas. A ensenhar las matronas en qual manieyre les enbrios bius sian medicatz quan yeysso segon figura no-natural.	To teach the midwives in what manner they should administer these remedies when necessary according to figures that are not natural.</end_turn
Necessaria causa es que la matrona conogua en le comensament la figura del enfantament natural per senhals de lu, e es que quan tu vezas la femna expremar a las partidas dejos e desira odorar le ayre, e sobre aquo es enleujada per aquo que sobre ela es del part, e festina le eyssiment del enbrio, lahoras sapias que aquest part es segon figura natural, e es l’eyssiment de lu sobre le sieu cap, e la segondina am aquel o suspensa o pendent del ombelic.	There is a necessary reason because the midwife at the beginning knows the natural figure of childbirth by its signs, and that when the woman goes into labor and wants to smell the air, and when this happens there is an expulsion from the parts below and she wants to vomit, the hour is that this part is in a natural figure, and that is the expulsion of the head, and the second one is that of the navel or suspension or pendency.</end_turn

De extraccio del fet quan es mort.	Of the extraction of the fetus when it is dead.

Aquesta es la forma de strenhedor en le qual so engualhatz les libres, al qual engualhament sian dos virtitges en doas extremitatz de dos futz.	This is the form of tweezers in which two handles are grasped, to which two vertigos are attached at the ends of two thumbs.</end_of_turn

De curacio de las fistulas que endeveno dejos.	From the care of fistulas that arise from the joints.
Las fistulas que endeveno en la partida dejos pus bassa so nodacio e grossetut las quals endeveno prop del cul defora o en l’espazi de la una partida.	The fistulas that arise in the lower limbs are noticeable and numerous, which arise from the groin or in the space of the buttock.
E es una fistula o motas.	And it is a fistula or swelling.
E cum aquela nodacio es antiquada e corr de la humiditat aygosa blanca o poyridura subtil, e alcunas veguadas so de aquestas fistulas alcunas penetrantz.	And when that swelling is old and corrupted by excessive wetness of white or pale color, and some veins are seen to penetrate these fistulas, some penetrate.

And that in which the penetrating fistula is known to enter the groin and not penetrate, is that you must tell the patient that it is in the groin, and when you do not penetrate with the thumb or with the finger in the fistula, it is swelling.

May be if it penetrates into the joint or into the bone and bruising of pain in the limb, the meaning of it is that the thumb has penetrated here if not swelling into the bone, and bruising of pain in the limb of the lower part; and that from this it is reduced in all its parts; and that it is of no use in this medicine, neither is it consolidated at once.

And the wounds that are in the places of the body are also like a wound that occurs on the head, or the shoulder, or the foot, or the belly, or the genitals, or like those of the limbs.</end_of_turn
E yeu so recomtant la curacio de alcunas plaguas per que pauses aquela ratiocinacio e regla sobre las autras plaguas.	And I recommend the care of some wounds so that they stop that ratiocination and rule concerning the others.</end>
E yeu comensare de las plaguas del cap simplas, quar la rememoracio de las compostas vindra al comensament del tertz capitol.	And I will begin with the simple head wounds, for the memory of the compound ones will come at the beginning of the third chapter.</end>
Donc dic que quan accideys en le cap plagua simpla e no es fractura, lahoras considera: si es per getament de peyra o de semblant, e ja ha trinquada la codena tant solament e es gran plagla e temes sobre aquel malaute havinement de apostema caut, lahoras tu te coyta e fleubotoma la cephalica tantost, e no tardas aquo; e extrats ad aquel del sanc segon la quantitat de la vertut de lu si no mes alcuna causa prohibent de fleubotomia, majorment si·l sanc que es eyssit de la plagua es pauc.	Therefore I say that when there is a simple head wound and it is not a fracture, consider: if it is from a stone or something similar, and if it has already bled alone and is a large wound, and you fear that there will be a fistula, cover the wound and apply the plaster of Paris immediately; do not delay until later; and extract according to the quantity of the virtue of the plaster if there is no other cause that prohibits its application, especially if the wound is small.
E sia la flaubotomia del contrari de la partida plaguada; e guardase le malaute de replecio e de vi e de viandas grossas.	The pain of the joints is caused by cold humors which infiltrate all the parts of the body; and when the pain is in the feet, the doctors usually call it gout.
Mays si de la minuicio prohibeys alcuna causa, lahoras sia aminorat de la vianda e no apropinque a carn ni a vi.	Even if the cause is slight, do not allow any indulgence, for the hour should be diminished from the wine and do not approach meat or wine.
E pausa sobre la plagua, si a lu accideys apostema caut, coto enfus en oli rozat solet o en vi en le qual es stipticat.	And rest on the plague, if it should happen that after the cautery some pus comes out, soak it in olive oil or in wine where it is stipped.
Mays si est segur de apostema caut, lahoras pausa sobre la plagua, si es recent am le sieu sanc e le ayre no ha mudat aquela la polvera la qual yeu recomtare aprop petit.	Even if you are certain that the cautery is finished, rest on the plague, if it is recent and the air is still clean and the powder which I recommended is still there.

Even if the abscess is great or is for lack of space and for the swelling, and the lips of the wound are not adjusted for pupils, the hour adjusts those by suture as I recommend for the suture of them
Mays si la plagua ja es discuberta del os e pen, e no es retencio de lu sino un petit suspensori, lahoras inscideys aquela e aprop cura la plagua am medicinas e restaura la carn aprop en loc de codena, e comanda al malaute que sia pescut de viandas en las quals es groceza: caps e formen coyt e semblantz a lor, entro que sia compost.	Even if the abscess is already exposed from the bone and skin, and is not retained but for a slight swelling, the hour incisions that and immediately care for the abscess with medicines and restore the limb immediately in its place instead of codena, and command the patient to abstain from eating coarse food: heads and brains, kidneys and fat, until it is digested.
E si atrobas en la codena putrefaccio e no adhereys al os, lahoras tu inscideys tot aquo poyrit e geta aquo, e aprop cura aquo.	And if in the codena there is decay and it does not adhere to the bone, the hour incisions all that is putrefying and removes it, and immediately care for it
Mays si en aquestas plaguas es arteria o vena de la qual fluxs de sanc pot evenir, e no es abscindida per medicinas, lahoras tu inquier sobre la arteria, e si atrobas aquela no-inscidida, lahoras tu inscideys aquela am spatum, o lia aquela; e si necessitat te provoca que aquo que havem dit no comfereys, lahoras tu cauteriza entro que·l sanc sia abscidit.	Even if in these abscesses there is an artery or vein from which blood flows of a clean nature that does not require excision by medicines, the hour inquires about the artery, and if you find that it is not incised, the hour incisions it with a sponge or ligature; and if necessary you must provoke that which we have said must not be eaten, the hour cauterizes until the blood is evacuated.
E si aquestas plaguas son simplas e petitas, lahoras la causa de lor es leugiere; enayssi que tu polverizas sobre aquelas aquesta polvera, quar consolidada aquela denant que l’ayre mude aquelas.	And if these abscesses are simple and small, the cause of them is slight; even if you powder over those very powders, which solidify when the air changes those.
E la manieyra de la polvera es aquesta: recipe oli de enses partida una, de sanc de drago partida doas, de caus no-extincta partidas tres; sia tot mot trissat e crivellat, e de lu sia la plagua omplida, e sia constrengida per bona constriccio entro que be sobre aquela aderesca, e sia coagulada am le sanc.	And the manner of the powder is this: take part olive oil, two parts blood of a virgin, three parts non-extinct alum, mix them all together and grind them, and let the abscess be full of them, and keep it compressed by good constriction until it sticks to the wound, and let it coagulate with the blood.</end_turn>
E aprop strengeys aquela desus am pulvils e leyssa aquela, e no la deslias mentre esta ayssi que no es apostemada, quar no es eredicada de lu la medicina entro que sia sanada.	And immediately strengthen that which comes out with the powders and read that, and do not remove it while it is still moist, because it is not driven out by medicine until it is healed.</end_turn>
E alcuna vetz fa aquo sola cautz, quan no es a tu en present enses e sanc de drago.	And every time that you do this alone, when I am not in your presence oil and blood of a virgin.
E ja fa aquesta meteyssa operacio en las grans plaguas quan conveneys que sia pausada sobre aquelas e sian streytas, e so plaguas recentz am le lor sanc, las quals le ayre no ha alteradas.	And I have already performed this operation in great abscesses when you considered that it should be delayed over those and that they are stretched, and only in recent abscesses where their blood has not been altered.</end_turn
E si le ayre las ha alteradas, e majorment quan es en temps d’estiu, lahoras no es entencio a la posicio de aquesta polvera, mays adonc cura aquelas am aquo que havem dit, enayssi que tu pauses sobre aquelas alcus enguents degistius, o que pauses sobre aquelas pols de la farina del ordi am aygua e mel entro que getan poyredura; e aprop cura aquelas am l’autra curacio entro que sian sanadas.	And if their blood has been altered, and especially when it is in summer, the hour does not understand the position of this powder, however, I advise that you care for those with water which we have said, or that you care for those with barley flour and water until the swelling goes down; and immediately care for them with the other care until they are healed.</end_turn
Mays si accideys am la plagua fractura en os, e es petita, lahoras tu extratz aquo am gesti.	Even if in the abscess there is a fracture in the bone, and it is small, the hour extracts that with the hand.
E yeu diyre la cura de las fracturas del cap en aquo que es envenidor.	And I say the care of the fractures of the head in that which is venomous.</end_turn
De las plaguas del col.	Of the abscesses of the knee.
Mays si la plagua accideys en le col, lahoras no es en lu differencia en medicacio, e entre la plagua del cap quan es simpla.	Even if the abscess occurs in the knee, the hour is no different in its treatment, and between the abscess of the head when it is simple.</end_turn><end_turn>

Even if the nerves of the knee are incised or an artery, the hour if it is a nerve, it is not in its engineering but that it is avoided care of them with water which makes gentle stypticity, as with vinegar and celery which is old and resembles them because it does not touch the nerves and relaxes that.</end_turn><end_turn>
E no pauses sobre la plagua alcuna causa de tot freja, quar la sustancia dels nervis es freja e la continuacio de lu es am le cervel, le qual es le pus aut de totz les membres. If it appears that the ailment is not curable by medicines, thus when the cause is washed out by water, every vegetable matter infused in olive oil, roasted or unroasted, and then when washed out by water again and the other small stones are removed according to this manner, and humi is added.

Mays si a la plagua es profunditat o accideys en lu a la pus bassa partida poyredura, lahoras perfora aquela en le loc mays depremegut.	If the plague is deep or accidental at the lower part, then pierce that in the area most depressed

If in the plague the artery has already been cut and the blood flow has become healthy, then separate or dry that, or ligate that, or cauterize that if necessary to prevent further bleeding.

If the spondylitis of the groin has already been incised and all, and the veins of the thigh have been preserved, then you adjust the edges of the wound with sutures over the thigh of the groin and do not touch that; elevate that and reduce that to its natural figure, and strengthen that which is stretched downwards, and rest that for several days; and indeed cure that which is infected with swelling and inflammation until it is healed

De las plaguas del col o de semblantz quan fayta entre las spallas e es fayta am spaza o am cotel o am lansa o am semblantz.	Of the plagues of the thigh or of similar ones when there is pain between the bones and is caused by space or by swelling or by stretching or by similar things.
Si es percussio de lansa o de cotel, e vezes de lu la profunditat, lahoras considera mays si de la plagua yeys ventositat quan le malaute elena; lahoras sapias que la plagua es mortal.	If it is percussion of the thigh or of the hip, and sometimes of the depth of the wound, then consider more if it is the plague which has been produced by excessive heat; the doctor must know that the plague is deadly
E si en lu no es profunditat e la plagua es recent am le sieu sanc, lahoras tu pauses en lu de la primieyra horo polvera, e no strenhas aquel per que no sia le sanc retengut en la profunditat de lu e que retorne al cor e que aucigua le malaute, mays pausa en lu enguent atractiu, e deslia aquela doas veguadas le dia.	And if in it there is not depth and the plague is recent at the surface of the limb, then you wait in it for the first hour to sprinkle, and do not strengthen that lest it be retained in the depth of the wound and return to the head and cause the disease to worsen; rather wait in it until it is attracted, and loosen that two vegetables a day.</start_of_turn>
E si l’enguent no es a tu present, lahoras tu pausa en le orrifici de la plagua coto viel per que sucque aquo que yeys de las humiditatz; e fay que le malaute dorma sobre la plagua per que corra aquo que es en lu ajustat.	And if the vomit is not at your present, then you wait in the orifice of the plague until it is cold because of the moisture; and make the patient sleep over the plague so that it runs out what is in it adjusted.
Mays si ja de la plagua son passatz tres dias o mays e no accideys al malaute spasme ni tremor de cor mal ni strictura de ale, e vezes las autras dispozicios bonas de lu, lahoras sapias que plagua es salva; e adonc cura aquela am calguas e am l’autra curacio entro que sia sanada.	If already of the plague more than three days have passed or more, and no spasm or tremor of the limb or bad stiffness results from it, and sometimes the other good symptoms of it, then indeed the plague is saved; and indeed cure that which is cold and the other cure until it is healed.
Mays si la sanacio de lu es excusada, e ja tot temps es uberta, lahoras sapias que ja es fayta fistula; cura donc aquela per le sieu capitol.	If the recovery from it is excused, and already all the time is open, then indeed the fistula is already finished; cure therefore that for the head of the limb.
E si la plagua es per inscisio de spaza o de cotel, e es simpla en la superficia del pietz o del dos, lahoras cura aquela am aquo que es precedit de sutura, si es gran, o am polvera, si es petita.	And if the plague is by incision of space or hip, and is simple on the surface of the foot or of the thigh, then cure that with water which precedes the suture, if it is great, or with powder if it is small.</start_of_turn>
Mays si ja ha fayta enprecio en le os, e so ja de lu inscizas pessas, lahoras tu torqua la plagua e coyta ad extrayre aquelas pessas, si so separadas.	If already in the bones there has been price, and so already has been cut pieces, then you extract the plague and cover to extract those pieces, if they are separated.</start_of_turn>
Mays si no so separadas, lahoras leyssa las entro que se poyresca la plagua, que la extraccio de lor es alleujada.	If they are not separated, then rest until the plague has subsided, for the extraction of them is alleviated.</start_of_turn
E de las autras plaguas accidentz en les autres membres le juvament en curacio es le juvament de aquo que havem dit.	And as for the other plagues that happen in the other members, the help in their cure is the help of the water that has been said.</start_of_turn
De las plaguas del ventre.	Of the belly plagues.</start_of_turn
L’indisposicio la qual accideys en le ventre es o gran, o pauc, o migiera.	The indisposition which happens in the belly is either great, or little, or mild.</start_of_turn
De la gran alcunas veguadas yeys le budel o nervi del budel, per que es fayta intromissio de lor e la sutura de lor esser pus vehement e pus subtil.	From the great many vegetables there are some which cause the budel or nerves of the belly to be affected, because of the excessive introduction of them and the suture of them to be more harsh and subtle.</start_of_turn
E disrupcio petita es fayta dificil per autra manieyra, e siec se que la reduccio de lor es pus dificil, si no te coytes de la intromissio de lor al sieu loc tantost, quar se ubre e es engrossat per que le intrament de lu es fayt difficil.	And a slight wound is difficult for another way, and if you do not protect yourself from the introduction of them into the limb as much as possible, it swells and becomes difficult because the instrument of them is already finished.</start_of_turn
E donc la milhor disrupcio es migiera, quar en aquela no es dificil la reduccio del budel, ayssi cum es dificil en las doas specias denant ditas.	Therefore the best disruption is milder, for in that case the reduction of the intestine is easier, just as it is in the two preceding species mentioned.
E sapias que sutura del ventre es segon quatre manieyras, mays doas suturas son comunas que conveneysso en suturas de las autras plaguas del cors.	You are right, the next sentence is:
E duas autras suturas proprias comunican a las autras plaguas, mays empero so mays proprias en la sutura del ventre.	Two other sutures are sufficient for the other wounds, but in the case of the intestine suture these are usually the most proper
E yeu recomti a tu quascuna am exposicio e declaracio.	I recommend that you take care of any exposed parts and declare them
Donc dic que quan la plagua es petita e es eyssit alcuna causa del budel per aquela, e es fayt dificil a reduzir aquel, lahoras aquo es en una de doas manieyras: o per parvitat de la disrupcio ayssi cum havem dit, o quan al budel es venguda inflacio per la frigiditat de l’ayre.	Therefore I say that when the wound is small and there is no cause for the hernia to exist, and when it is difficult to reduce it, the hour is in two ways: either because of the smallness of the disruption as we have said, or because the hernia is caused by cold air.
E donc quan aquo es ayssi, lahora cove que tu scalfes aquel enayssi que tu submerges una sponga ho drap humit en aygua tebeza sola, o que coguas en aygua squinant, e cyperum, e spic, e embroques am aquela le budel entro que la imflacio sia resolvuda.	Therefore when it is like this, the hour is that you cover that area with a sponge moistened with warm water, or that you soak with vinegar, saffron, pepper, and cloves until the inflammation has subsided
E alcunas veguadas fa aquo vi en le qual ha stipticitat, e es milhor que la aygua sola en resolucio de la imflacio.	Some herbs make the water in which they have been steeped more effective for the reduction of inflammation. It is better than plain water for resolving the inflammation.</start_of_turn>
E donc cum tu vezes la imflacio esser resolvuda, lahoras tu humecta le budel am aygua en la qual es coyta altea e malvas, quar per aquo es alleujat le intrament de lu am pauca causa.	Therefore when the inflammation has subsided, the hour is to moisten the hernia with warm water in which salt and mallow have been soaked, because this alleviates the pain of the intestine due to little cause.</start_of_turn>
Mays si es escusat le intrament de lu aprop aquesta curacio, lahoras scindeys la disrupcio un petit am strument am le qual so inscididas emorroydas.	However, if the intestine has been freed from the adhesion, this treatment should be omitted. The hour is to cut the disruption with a small instrument that has been soaked in lard, which will leave no scars.</start_of_turn>
E la curacio primieyra es milhor, quan es propriada que no es seccio, e no sia occupacio a seccar aprop necessitat e defaliment.	The first treatment is better when it is appropriate, that is, without being excessive, and does not require excessive drying.
Del instrument, sec se la forma de lu:	Then describe the instrument in shape.</start_of_turn
La una partida de lu torta aguda, e l’autra partida no-acuta, e la extremitat subtil, e no sia am la subtilitat de spatum, abantz sia obtusa un pauc.	One part is sharp, the other is not, and the handle is thick, not blunt, with a slightly obtuse tip.</start_of_turn

Therefore when the wound is large and the hernia is coming out, the hour is to reduce it according to its natural shape, in its proper place, if possible over the intestine, because that is better.</start_of_turn

Moreover when the disruption is wide and is in the lower part of the abdomen, the hour is to place the patient on their side, and to suspend their legs higher than the chest; and if it is in the upper part of the abdomen, the hour is to suspend the chest and the legs more than the lower parts.</start_of_turn

Similarly, if the disruption is on one side of the abdomen, the hour is to stop your attention and your thoughts for a moment so that the part where the wound is should be higher than the other.</start_of_turn
E ayssi cove que tu aministres aquo en las plaguas grans e en las plaguas migieras.	And also that you administer water in the large wounds and in the smaller wounds.</start_of_turn
E en las plaguas petitas, pausa aquo que es a tu preparat, e aprop fay que·l ministre sia entre las tuas mas pyatados, le qual tengua la disrupcio tota am la sua ma e ajusta las labias de lu, e aprop descuebre de aquela ad aquel que siec la sutura alcuna causa aprop autra.	In the small wounds, stop the water that you have prepared and give it between your greatest wounds, which have the whole disruption in their hand and adjust their lips, and take away from that which if necessary causes another suture.</start_of_turn
E aquesta es la manieyra de sutura comuna: una que prenguas la agula, o comte de agula segon la cantitat de la amplitut de la plagua; e aprop layssa de la extremitat de la disrupcio del dit anular, e strenh la agula una, otre que tu no metas fiel en las doas extremitatz de la codena, am doas extremitatz del ciphac que es dejos la codena de las partidas dedintz, entro que fassas aquela penetrar de aquela partida; e tu ja has agreguadas doas extremitatz de la codena e doas extremitatz del ciphac, e so faytas quatre ordes.	This is the common suture technique: you grasp the needle or the needle handle according to the width of the wound; and you leave the tip of the disruption from the ring finger, and you tighten the needle one or two times so that you do not leave the knot at the bottom of the wound, between the two extremities of the codena, until you have pierced through that part; and you have already added two extremities of the codena and two extremities of the ciphac, and so there are four in total.</start_of_turn
E aprop strenh am fiel doble en le circuit de la agula, e alcunas veguadas de doas partz ensemps, e aprop agregua las doas labias e la plagua per agreguacio decent; e aprop layssa la grossitut del dit e fiqua una autra agulha en aquela, e aprop lia aquela am fiel ayssi cum fiest am la primieyra agulha; e no cesses far aquo si es necessitat am las agulhas entro que ajas complida tota la contriccio de la plagua.	And tighten the knot firmly double in the circuit of the needle, and mix some herbs from two parts together, and add the two lips and the wound together to make it stronger; and leave the thickness of the finger and fix another needle in that place, and tie that one to the first needle as tightly as the first; and do not stop until the whole contraction of the wound has been completed.</start_of_turn
E sian las agulhas migieras entre groceza e subtilitat, quar las agulhas subtils mot leugierament insciden la carn; e las grossas so de dificil intrament en la codena, e donc per aquo cove que sian migieras en subtilitat e grosseza.	And the fine needles between thickness and thinness, because the fine needles do not bite too aggressively; and the thick ones are difficult to handle in the codena, and therefore because of this it is necessary that they be handled in thinness and thickness.</start_of_turn
E no cove que la agulha sia ficada en doas extremitatz de la codena propdana mot, per so que la carn no sia inscidida leugierament e que la plagua se huebra devant la sua consolidacio.	And do not let the needle be fixed at both extremities of the codena too much, so that the flesh is not bitten too aggressively and that the wound does not open before its consolidation.</start_of_turn
E no sian prolonguadas de sutura per que la plagua no sia prohibida de consolidacio.	And do not prolong the sutures too much, so that the wound is not hindered in its consolidation.
E aprop inscideys las extremitatz de las agulhas per so que no ledescan le malaute deves le sieu dormier; e pausaras sobre la sutura pulvils expanduts de tota partida, les quals tenguan las extremitatz de las agulhas; e layssa aquelas entro que sapias que la plagua ja es consolidada.	And take out the ends of the needles so that they do not irritate the patient's wound; and leave the sutures loose from all sides, which hold the ends of the needles; and leave them in place until you believe that the wound has already consolidated.</end_of_turn>
E aquestas specias de sutura am agulhas en cal manieyra es pus convenient en las plaguas petitas, quar habasta en la sutura de lor una agulha o doas o entorn aquelas.	And such fine sutures with needles held in this manner are more convenient for small wounds, where there is only one or two needles or around those.</end_of_turn>
Mays la segonda sutura es cominal: e es que tu aministres am sutura las quatre extremitatz, de la codena e doas extremitatz del ciphac, en una veguada, am agulha en la qual sia fiel envolopat engual en subtilitat e grosseza.	More commonly, a second suture is administered: and that you administer the suture at four extremities, the shoulder and two extremities of the armpit, together, with one needle in which be faithful envolopat engual in substance and size.</end_of_turn
E aprop quan am la agulha auras penetrat aquestas quatre extremitatz, reduzeys la agulha de aquela meteyssa partida de la qual comensest, per so que le fiel retrayt caja de la pus subirana partida a la plagua, per so que la sutura sia segon sutura de drap am la qual les draps so strengutz.	And when the needle has penetrated these four extremities, reduce the needle from that middle part from which you began, so that the faithful thread retracts box from the lower part to the wound, so that the suture is as strong as the other which is to the cloth.</end_of_turn
E pausa entre quascuna sutura la quantitat del gros del dit mendre.	And pause between each suture the quantity of the thickness of the middle finger.</end_of_turn>
E aquesta sutura sabo les homes.	And this suture is for men.</end_of_turn
E am tal sutura yeu cozegui la plagua la qual era accidida a un home en le sieu ventre le qual era stat plaguat am un cotel, e era la disrrumpcio de la plagua major de un palm, e era eyssit dels budels entorn dos palms del budel del mieg loc e era la disrupcio en le mieg del membre; e adonc yeu reduzegui aquel depus que le budel havia stat foro la plagua per xxiiii horas.	And such a suture was enough to cure the wound which had occurred in a man in his belly which was affected by a wound caused by a nail, and was the disruption of the greatest wound of a palm, and was seen from the buttocks around two palms of the heel and was the disruption in the middle of the limb; and when I had reduced it, the wound had been outside for xxx hours.</end_of_turn
E la plagua fo consolidada en le spazi de xv dias o entorn, e curegui aquel e es sanat; e aprop aquo visquec per motz ans, e es conversat en las suas disposicios.	And the wound was consolidated within fifteen days or so, and it healed that way; and thus I saw for a month, and it is reported that it has healed completely.</end_of_turn
E les autres metges havian jutgat que no fora sanat; e per miracle foc, quar yeu no curegui aquel am enguent, quar era en loc en le qual enguent no era atrobat ni deguna medicina, mays pausegui sobre la plagua coto viel dos veguadas lo dia e ablucio assiduo am aygua de mel entro que foc sanat.	And other doctors had given up that it would not heal; and by a miracle, behold, it healed without any other treatment, except that I kept the wound covered with two layers of cloth every day and I washed it diligently with honey water until it healed.</end_of_turn
Mays yeu diyre dos specias de sutura proprias segon narracio de Paraula.	And I say two kinds of sutures are proper according to the narration of Paraula.</end_of_turn
E es que tu comenses am sutura de la codena, e entrometas agulha de la partida deforo a la partida dedintz.	And that you begin with a suture of the shoulder, and enter the needle from the back part to the front part.</end_of_turn
E donc cum la agulha penetra en la codena e en aquel meteys lacertz segon rectetut e en longetut de tot le cos, e layssa la extremita del ciphac en le qual has entromesa la agulha; e fay penetrar en la autra extremitat la agulha de la partida dedintz a la partida deforo en l’autra extremitat del mihat.	And thus when the needle penetrates the shoulder and in that middle lacerate according to the rule and in length throughout the body, and leave the extremity of the armpit in which you have introduced the needle; and make penetrate in the other extremity the needle from the back to the front in the other extremity of the limb.</end_of_turn
E don cum tu auras fayta aquela penetrar, lahoras tu fay aquela penetrar autra veguada en aquela meteyssa extremitat del mihat de la partida deforo a la partida dedintz; e leyssa la extramitat del ciphac que es en aquest latz, e fay penetrar la agulha en l’autra extremitat de la partida dedintz a la partida deforo.	And thus when you have finished that penetration, the hour comes to make that penetration once more in that middle limb from the back to the front; and leave the armpit extremity that is in this wound, and make penetrate the needle in the other extremity from the back to the front.</end_of_turn
E fay penetrar am aquela la tua penetracio am la qual fas aquela penetrar en le ciphac en la extremitat del mirat la qual es en la partida de lu entro que tot aquel penetre.	And make penetrate thus the needle in that way that you make penetrate it in the armpit in the limb in the part of the body where all those penetrate.</end_of_turn
E aprop comensa de aquest meteys costat e cus aquel am la extremitat que es del ciphac en l’autra latz, e extratz la agulha de la codena la qual penetrec, e aprop redutz aquela en aquela codena e cos la extremitat del ciphac que es en l’autra costat am aquesta extramitat del mirat; e extratz aquela de la codena la qual es de part de lu.	And thus begin from this middle side and go to that extremity of the armpit in the other side, and extract the needle from the shoulder which has penetrated, and then reduce that in that shoulder and fix the limb of the armpit which is in the other side to this limb; and extract that from the shoulder which is part of it.</end_of_turn
E fay aquo una veguada e autra, e fay aquo una veguada aprop autre veguada entro que tu cozes tot aquo que es deforo segon aquel eysemple.	And do this once and another time, and do this once more about another time until you have completed all that is before according to that example.</end_of_turn
E la suma de aquesta manieyra de sutura es que tu cozes am sutura de pellicies am la qual cozo las pels, enayssi que tu cozes le ciphac una veguada de la part de la extremitat de la codena, e que leysses aquela autra veguada entro que la ajas complida.	And the sum of this way of suturing is that you sew with thread of the same kind as the one with which you sew the skin, in such a way that you sew the armpit one palm from the part of the shoulder, and that you leave the other palm until it is finished.</end_of_turn
Mays la segonda specia de sutura propria la qual dieys eyssament Gualia , e aquest es de sermo de lu e per lu recomtat, es que tu cozas aquela segon semilitut am la qual alcus medicantz cozo aquela, enayssi que agreguan tota partida a la sua compar partida a lu convenient per natura; e aplican la extremitat de autre de lu e la extremitat del mirat al autra extremitat de lu, e aquo es fayt segon que yeu a tu recomti.	And the second kind of proper suture which I say is excellent for women is as follows: you must sew according to the same custom as the doctors who sew it, in such a way that you add every part to its proper part; and press the limb of the armpit to the other limb and the limb of the body to the other limb, which is done as I have recommended to you.</end_of_turn
Cove que tu fiques la agulha en la extremitat del mirat a tu propdana de la partida deforo, e fassas aquela penetrar a la partida dedintz en aquel sol, e leysses dos extremitatz del ciphac; e aprop revolveys la agulha e fay aquela penetrar de foro a la dedintz en dos extremitatz del ciphac.	Since you have kept the needle in the limb at your will from the front part, make it penetrate to the back part in this way, and leave two armpits; and then turn the needle and make it penetrate from the front to the back in two armpits.</end_of_turn
E aprop revolveys aquelas cascunas, e fay penetrar quascunas de la partida dededintz entro a la partida deforo en dos extremitatz del mirat autras que so en le latz contrari.	And thus rotate those cascunas, and make penetrate any part of the thumb into the part of the little finger at two extremities of the mirror or as much as in the side opposite.
E aquesta manieyra de sutura es milhor de la sutura comuna leugiera, e es sutura de la qual precedic rememoracio.	This method of stitching is better than the common loose stitching, and is a stitching from which memory proceeds.
Aquest es le sermo de Gualia	This is the saying of Gualia
E mays le diyssero alcus, sutura del ventre es rectificada am dos agulhas, so es que tu entrometas en aquestas a quascunas un fiel, e comensa am intromiccio de agulha de aquo que es deves tu, e fay aquela penetrar entro al autra latz segon sutura de aquels les quals cozo les cuers engualment.	And I tell you this, a belly stitch is rectified with two needles, so that you enter into these with any thread, and begin with the needle that is farthest from you, and make that penetrate into the other side following the manner of those which hold the guts firmly together.</end_of_turn>
E sapias que quan disrupcio es en le mieg loc del ventre, lahoras la sutura de lu es pus difficil que dels autres locs del ventre.	And you know that when disruption is in the middle of the belly, then the stitching of it is more difficult than that of the other parts of the belly.</end_of_turn>
Mays le juguament de medicacio de plagua es jutgament de las autras plaguas.	More important than the treatment of the plague is the treatment of the other plagues.</end_of_turn
La qual causa es quar quan tu consieguas la plagua recent am le sieu sanc denant que l’ayre altera aquela, e reduses le budel e cozes aquela e aptas aquela decentment, lahoras pausa sobre aquela polvera encarnativa.	The cause is that when you become conscious of the recent plague in the air, the air itself changes that, and reduces the swelling and boils that accompany it adequately, and then stops over that dusty powder.</end_of_turn
E si le ayre ja ha alterada la plagua, lahoras pausa sobre aquela alcus enguentz les quals so a tu presens entro que fassan peyra dura e cajan les fiels, e sian consolidatz ciphac e mirat; e aprop cura aquela ayssi cum es la curacio de las autras plaguas entro que sia sanat.	And if the air has already altered the plague, then stop over that thick liquid which is at your presence until it has become like hard stone and has closed the wounds, and has solidified; and then care for that as for the care of the other plagues until it is healed.</end_of_turn
Mays si a tu no so presens las medicinas, lahoras pausa sobre aquela tantost, pus que comensa a getar brac, coto viel, e permuta aquel dos veguadas le dia, ayssi cum a tu e ensenhat, entro que sia sanat, quar tu no indigeysses de autra medicacio en motas disposicios quan las plaguas so simplas.	And if you do not have the medicines at your disposal, then stop over that for the time being, because it begins to vomit bile, cough blood, and change two meals a day, as you have been taught, until it is healed, for you must not take any other medicine in large quantities when the plagues are simple.</end_of_turn
Mays si tu temes que la plagua comunique en lesio als membres principals, lahoras cove que tu submergas lana leon en oli de trempada qualiditat, o en oli rozat, e pausa aquela en le circuit dels locs que so entre les angonas e dejos las aysselas.	And if you fear that the plague communicates by wound to the principal members, then cover that with honey-soaked linen in quality oil of rosemary, or in sweet oil, and stop that in the circle of the places which are between the armpits and leave the rest covered.</end_of_turn
E si sent dolor o putrefaccio en les sieus budels, quar motas veguadas aquo s’endeve, lahoras cristeriza aquel am vi stiptic negre tebe, e majorment si la poyredura es pervenguda en le budel e es fayta exitura penetrant entro la conquavitat de lu.	And if you feel pain or putrefaction in your buttocks, when many meals have been eaten, then crush that with a black vinegar plaster, especially if the discharge is purulent and penetrates the cavity.
E sapias que aquela que es del budel gros es de pus leugiera sanacio que aquela que es en les budels subtils.	And you know that the one that is of the large intestine is easier to heal than that which is in the small intestines.</end_of_turn
E es de dificil sanacio quar le budel le qual es apelat “gegunu” no recep sanacio de plagua que caja en lu de tot; e aquo es per la gran multitut de venas que so en lu e per la magnitut de lu que so en aquelas, e per subtilitat del cos de aquel, e per propinquitat de aquel a natura de nervis.	And it is difficult to heal because the gut which is called “gegunu” does not receive the healing of the plague like the rest; and this is because of the great multitude of veins which are in it and for the greatness of it, and for the subtlety of the body of that, and for its proximity to nerves.</end_of_turn
Mays si aquo que procezeys de la plagua es la tela, e conseguas aquela recent, redutz aquela segon la tua rectetut am la qual reduzes les budels engualment.	And if what proceeds from the plague is the cloth, and you have recently obtained it, reduce that according to your custom which you reduce the swelling of the guts adequately.</end_of_turn
Mays si es passat a lu spazi e ja es feyt vert o negre, lahoras que tu strenguas aquela am fiel sobre le loc que es denigrat de lu, per so que vengua fluxs de sanc, quar en la tela so venas e arterias.	And if it has passed to the space and has already become green or black, then strengthen that thread over the place that is degraded by it, so that there comes a flow of health, because there are veins and arteries in the cloth.</end_of_turn>
E aprop inscideys aquo que es otra aquel liament, e pausa dos extremitatz del fiel pendentz de la partida dejos de la plagua foro lu, per que sobre tu sia alleujada la atraccio de lu deves le cazement de la tela e emissio del brac de la plagua.	And thus it is necessary to say that another ligament must be taken, and stop two extremities of the thread pending from the part from which the plague has departed, so that over you there may be relief from the attraction of it due to the loosening of the fabric and the emission of the vomit of the plague.</end_of_turn
Rememoracio de las plaguas quan accideysso en le budel.	Remembering the plagues when they happen in the gut.</end_of_turn>
Quan accideys disrupcio en le budel e es petita, lahoras es possibla que sia resteurada en alcus homes, per aysso quar yeu vi aquel le qual era stat plaguat en le sieu ventre am percussio de lansa et era la plagua de la part dreyta del stomac, e la plagua era antiquada e fayta fistula, e eyssic de lu gestio e ventositat.	When disruption occurs in the gut and is slight, it is possible that it is only temporary in thick liquid, to help so that you see that which was affected by the plague in the belly is now in the left side of the stomach, and the plague was ancient and had made fistula, and egesis of it is its management and expulsion.</end_of_turn
Adonc yeu pansegui la curacio de lu ja sia que no era confizat en la sanacio de lu, mays cessegui subtiliar aquel entro que foc sanat e le loc es consolidat.	And thus I follow the treatment of it already, even though I did not have confidence in the healing of it, but I cease to subtilize when it is healed and the place is consolidated.</end_of_turn
E yeu pus que vi le loc ja consolidat, timegui sobre le malaute que endevengues sobre lu accident de mal en le sieu ventre; e no endevenc alcu per aquo mal accident e romas en las suas milhos disposicios mangant e bevent, e aprop entrec en banh e es exercitat en sos ditz.	And I have seen that when the place is already consolidated, time passes over the illness that you have suspected about it in the belly; and do not think of any other mishap that has happened and remain in your thousand anxieties eating and drinking, and approach in bath and exercise in your saying.</end_of_turn
E ja diysero alcus experimentados que quan endeve plagua en le budel, e es petita, lahoras cove que sia liada segon aquesta manieyra: e es que tu prenguas fromiguas de grans caps; e aprop ajusta las doas labias de la plagua e pausa una fromigua de aquelas que aja la boca uberta sobre las doas labias de la plagua; donc quan pren sobre aquelas e strenh la sua boca, abscindeys le cap de lu, quar adhereys e no es dissolvut.	And I have heard from experienced people that when the plague is in the gut, and is slight, it is necessary to tie it up according to this manner: take large peppercorns; and having adjusted the two lips of the plague, place one peppercorn at the entrance of the mouth over the two lips of the plague; and when you take hold of these and stretch out your mouth, the head of the plague will break off, which adheres and is not dissolved.</end_of_turn
E aprop pausa autra formigua prop la primieyra, e no cesses aquo a far am formiguas una aprop autra segon la quantitat de tota la plagua.	And immediately stop another bleeding from the first one, and do not cease until another bleeding stops at the same rate as the first.
E aprop reduzeys aquela e cos la plagua; e romanguan aquels caps annexces en le budel entro que·l budel sia sanat; e no accideys al malaute degun nocument.	And immediately reduce the swelling and pain; and keep those extremities included in the swelling within the gut until the swelling has disappeared; do not cause any further harm to the patient.</end_of_turn>
E ja es possible que·l budel sia liat am fiel subtil lo qual es fayt del budel de bestia annexs am lu, pus que es mes en agulha; e es que tu prenguas la extremitat de aquestz fiels de budel, e sia mot descarnat, e aprop lia la extremitat de lu am fiel de li, envolopat, e aprop entromet aquel fiel en agulhas e cos am aquel le budel, e areduzeys aquel en la disrupcio.	And indeed it is possible that the gut is adhered to the surrounding fat which is the cause of the gut of the beasts that are attached to it; for it is more like a needle. And that you take hold of these fat tissues of the gut, and that you do not tear them, and that you bind them together with a ligature, covering them with a covering, and that you introduce that ligature through needles and sew them up again.</end_of_turn>
E aquesta manieyra de sutura am formiguas no es sino segon via de fiducia e d’esperansa.	And such a stitching of these wounds is nothing other than by way of hope and trust.</end_of_turn>
Mays si la plagua es gran e ampla, majorment si es en un dels budels subtils, quar lahoras no es engen sino subtiliacio, e no es sanacio de lu de tot.	May be if the plague is great and wide, mostly if it is in one of the small intestines, the hour is not that of violence but of subtility, and not of their healing but of their preservation.</end_of_turn
De curacio de zuchem e fistula.	Take care of the wound and fistula.</end_of_turn>
Sapias que tota plagua e apostema quan se envilheseys e se Antiqua, e es fayt ulcus, e no es consolidat e geta braç tot temps e no es abscindit, lahoras, en qualque membre sia, universalment es nompnada fistula e nos la apelam aquela azukem.	You know that every plague and swelling, when it has passed its prime and becomes old, is transformed into a wound; and that it is not solidified but escapes everywhere, and is called an ulcer in any member at all times, and we call that bleeding.</end_of_turn
E fistula segon veritat es nodacio feutrada, dura, blanqua am la qual no es dolor e a la qual es conquavitat ayssi cum es conquavitat de pena de ausel; e per aysso nompnat aquela alcus rizatz, id est pena.	And fistula, truly, is a foul, tough, white wound that causes no pain and which is concaved just as a wound of suffering; and for this reason it is called a wound of penalty.</end_of_turn
E es en alcus homes humida, la qual geta brac; e fort leu la humiditat es abscidida en alcunas horas.	And the home of the wound is moisture, which escapes quickly; and when the moisture has escaped, the wound is healed in a few hours.</end_of_turn
E alcunas veguadas aquesta humiditat es mota, e es pauca, e es grossa, e es subtil.	And many herbs have this moisture, which is soft, little, great, and subtle.</end_of_turn
E yeu ja he denant dit en la divisio, lahoras cum yeu diyssi las plaguas, que tot ulcus que no es sanat ni no es en lu nuda carn, no es aquo sino per una de ix causas: de las quals la una es o per pauquesa de sanc en le cos; o per malicia de lu; o quar entre lu e las labias es carn dura prohibent nativitat de carn; o quar es de mota legesa; o quar aquel ulcus en si meteys es poyrit e la materia que es a lu tramesa es de mala qualitat; o quar la medicina es enconvenient en la curacio de lu; o quan corrupcio catz en la regio, e es pestilencia; o per proprietat de regio ayssi cum endeve a Saragossa , en la qual es fayta difficil degestio de las malautias, e es tardada en aquela sanacio de apostema per natura; o quar en lu es os un, o motz osses.	And indeed I have already said in the division that whenever a wound is not healed or is not completely bare, it is not because of anything other than one of these causes: that it is for want of health in the body; or for malice; or because there is hard cartilage between the wound and the lips, prohibiting the birth of flesh; or because of soft matter; or because there is bad quality material at the wound; or because the treatment is inappropriate for the wound; or because of corruption in the area, which is pestilence; or because of the property of the area itself, as it is in Saragossa for example, where it is difficult to digest diseases and slow in the healing of swellings by nature.</end_of_turn
Ja e mostrat totas aquelas causas, e·ls senhals de aquelas e la curacio de lor am medicinas en la divisio.	I have already shown all these causes, and the signs of these and their treatment with medicines in the division.</end_of_turn
E cove assi que yeu fassa a tu saber la curacio de fistula la qual es fayta per via de operacio am ma.	And thus I tell you the treatment for fistula, which is by means of surgery with the hand.</end_of_turn
E sapias que fistula accideys en totz les membres del cos; quar de aquelas son fistulas que perveno a las venas grantz e arterias, o als nervis, o al ciphac, o al budel, o a la vesica, o ad alcuna de las costas, o ad alcu dels spondils del dos, o ad alcuna de las juncturas compostas per composicio ayssi quo de la ma e del pe; e de aquelas so que dan a lu propinquitat del membre principal e de semblantz.	And you know that fistula can occur in all parts of the body; for there are fistulas that arise from the great veins and arteries, or from the nerves, or from the liver, or from the gut, or from the bladder, or from any of the vertebrae, or from any of the compound joints such as the hand and foot; and from those that give proximity to the main limb and resemblance.</end_of_turn
E donc aquela de aquestas fistulas que es segon aquesta manieyra es de las malautias de dificil sanacio, e no recep curacio, e occupacio am aquela es trebalh e ignorancia.	Therefore, of these fistulas, which are treated in this way, are among the diseases of difficult healing, and do not receive cure, and are occupied with work and ignorance.</end_of_turn
E si es de las fistulas alcuna la profunditat de la qual no perve ad aquestz locs que e dit, e esperas e confizas en la curacio de lu, e vols pervenir a cognicio de lu, lahoras pren tenta de eram o de ferr, e si la fistula va segon rectetut, e perquireys aquela am lu.	And if it is one of these fistulas of which the depth does not reach these places that I have said, and you hope and trust in the cure of them, and you wish to learn of them, then you must attempt to remove or cut out the fistula, and if the fistula goes according to rule, ask for it.</end_of_turn
Mays si la fistula es tortuissitat, lahoras investigua aquela am tenta de plom subtil, quar plom am la levitat del sieu cors es alleujat e curvat deves la tortuositat.	And if the fistula is crooked, then investigate the cause of the curvature, for the swelling of the belly is relieved and curved because of the curvature.</end_of_turn
E si la fistula es havent motz horrificis, no es a tu possible que signifiques sobre lu am tenta.	And if the fistula is full of pus, it is not possible for you to know about it by attempting.</end_of_turn
Adonc cristeriza le orrifici per sos orrificis, quar la humiditat per la qual clisterizas aquela va deves las autras orrificis e corr de lor.	Therefore, glorify the Lord for his works, for the humidity by which you cleanse these others goes from them and runs away from them.</end_of_turn
E aprop inquier exquisitament, segon qual manieyra a tu es possible que conoguas si aqui has os o nervi, e es la conquavitat de la fistula longinqua o propdana, o es una fistula a la qual so motz orrificis e esta sobre aquo tot am la suma de la tua fortaleza, am la tua enterroguacio, am la qual enterroguas le malaute, e la invencio de la dolor deves la tua compressio am la ma sobre le loc, e semblantz de las significacios e de las causas accidentz al apostema.	And inquire cautiously, according to what manner it is possible for you to know if here you have bone or nerve, and whether the curvature of the fistula is long or short, or whether it is a fistula to which there is pus or not, and this is over all that you can do with all your strength, with your prudence, with which you question the patient, with which you ask about the pain, and the invention of the pain due to your compression with your hand over the area, and the resemblance of the symptoms and the causes of the swelling.</end_of_turn
