E cum tu auras stat sobre totas aquelas causas am stacio veraya, lahoras ve a la curacio segon confidencia: e es que tu consideras lahoras si es fistula apparent propinqua o en loc sal, longinqua de junctura, o de nervi, o de arteria, o de vena, o de un dels locs les quals yeu a tu e ditz.	E when thou art stood over all those causes art thou at rest: then go to the cure according to confidence: that is, consider whether it is an apparent fistula near or in the limb, distant from joint, or nerve, or artery, or vein, or any of the places which thou hast mentioned before.
Lahoras tu secca la fistula segon que denant es dit de la naracio de lu, e osta aquo que es en aquela filtracio e de carns corrumpudas, e aquo que es nascut en le orrifici de la carn, o de theil e de semblantz, e cura aquela entro que sia sanada.	Then dry the fistula according as it is said in the narration: and stay until that which is in that filtration and corrupt flesh is gone, and what is born in the orifice of the flesh, or in bone and marrow, or anything else that is there, be cured thereby
Mays si la fistula es de longinqua profunditat, e es segon rectetut, lahoras cove que inscidas aquela en le preon atant quant a tu sira possible, e aprop mondifica aquela de totas las suas carns corrompudas; e aprop administra calguas envolopadas en medicinas acutas, e intromet aquelas entro a la conquavitat de la fistula, la qual has conprenduda am ferr.	May be if the fistula is of great depth, and is according to rule, then cover that in the prepuce as much as possible, and make soft all the corrupt flesh; and give tepid poultices covered with medicines that are acute; and introduce them into the cavity of the fistula, which thou hast comprehended with iron.
E fay aquo am aquela alcunas veguadas entro que la medicina acuta corroda tot aquo que es romas en la conquavitat de la fistula de la corrupcio.	And do thus until any vegetable matters have been consumed by the acute medicine that has corroded all that is rotten in the cavity of the fistula of corruption
E aprop restaura aquela am enguentz les quals engendran carn sana entro que sia sanada.	And then restore that which was removed from the parts that engendered sound flesh until it is healed.
Mays si no es sanada per aquo, lahoras tu cauteriza aquela segon que havem recomtat.	Or if it is not healed by this, then cauterize that as we have recommended.</start_of_turn>
Mays si la causa de fistula es os e es deves tu certificat aquo, lahoras tu inquireys aquela e secca aquela segon que havem recomtat, si tu no prohibeys alcuna causa de vena o de nervi o de membre principal ayssi cum havem dit.	Or if the cause of the fistula is bone, and you must certify that, then inquire about that and dry that as we have recommended, if you do not prohibit any cause of vein or nerve or major limb as we have said.</start_of_turn>
Mays si le os es a tu descubert e es en lu alcuna corrupcio e negror, lahoras tu ratz aquel entro que la corrupcio sia hostada tota; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que lu encarne entro que sia sanat.	Or if the bone is to you discovered and is in it any corruption and blackness, then burn that out until the corruption is completely consumed; and then cure that which is in it until it is healed.</start_of_turn
E si no es sana e gieta brac ayssi cum fazia, lahoras sapias que tu no est pervengut a la eradicacio tota de la corrupcio; e adonc tu descuebre sobre lu segondanament e exquisitament fay la razio de lu e la mundificacio de lu am la deriera fortalasa tieua, e aprop restaura aquel.	And if it is not healed and yields blood as well as before, then know that thou art not arrived at the entire eradication of the corruption; and then thou shalt uncover it further and diligently inquire about it and make the reason and the treatment of it more powerful, and restore that.</start_of_turn
E donc si es sanat, bo es; e sino, lahoras sapias que aquela corrupcio es en la profunditat longinqua del cors, la qual no ha conseguida, e adonc a tu en aquel no es engen sino laysar aquela.	And therefore if it is healed, well; but if not, know that that corruption is in the profound depth of the body, which has not been overcome, and then leave it to that which does not suffice, but lay aside that.</start_of_turn
E si le os corromput es petit, o es a tu possible atirar aquel, lahora tu le atira am forceps subtils las quals conveno ad aquo.	Or if the corruption of the bone is small, or you are able to pull it out, then pull that out with fine forceps which are convenient for that.</start_of_turn
E si so motz osses, lahoras exquisitament fay la extraccio de totz aquels, e de aquels no laysses denguna causa am la tua fortaleza.	Or if there be multiple bones, then diligently perform the extraction of all of them, and of those do not leave any cause for your strength.</start_of_turn
Mays si a tu fa contrarietat alcuna causa de las humiditatz, e en lor inscizio no ha temor ni error, lahoras inscideys aquelas liaments o carns si so aqui, e deliura les osses.	Or if there is any cause of the humors, and in their incision there is no fear or error, then cut those ligaments or flesh if they are there, and deliver the bones.</start_of_turn
Mays si a tu no es preparacio de ostar les osses de la tua hora, lahoras pausa sobre la plagua aquo que poyresca la plagua aquela, e layssa aquela entro que aquo es al enviro de aquels osses de carns e de liamentz, e guarda la plagua que no sia consolidada, e sia constrengida la seccio la qual tu has inscidida en la tua operacio.	Or if you are not prepared to bear the bones of your time, then stop over the plague that is in the wound, and leave that until that which is around those bones of flesh and ligaments is expelled, and keep the wound from solidifying, and restrict the incision which you have made in your operation.</start_of_turn
Habantz, si temes, pausa sobre lu coto submers en sopre trissat am oli, o coto submers en anguent egipciac, o en alcu dels enguentz vertz, quar quan poyriran aquelas liaments, e les osses son de lor seperatz la ablacio, e de aquels atraccio es alleujada.	Having said that, if thou fear, stop over the wound covered in warm broth with olive oil, or the limb covered in Egyptian unguent, or in some other similar salve, because when they are softened those ligaments will be separated from the limb, and the bones will be loosened from the incision, and the pain will be relieved.</start_of_turn
Mays si es un gran os ayssi cum le os de camba o de coyssa o semblantz ad aquels, e aquo que de lu es corromput es la facia de lu tant solament, lahoras ratz aquela am resio tant solament derriera entro que sia ostada aquela negror e corrupcio, e aprop restaura la plagua.	Or if it is a great bone such as the bone of the limb or the bone of the thigh or the bone of the hip, and what is corrupted is only the face of it alone, then burn that only behind until that blackness and corruption is consumed, and then restore the wound.</start_of_turn
Mays si aquo que de lu es corrumpyt es gran partida, e la corrupcio ja ha conseguida la medulla del os, lahoras es causa necessaria cerrar aquel e aquel tot inscidir entro al loc on es pervenguda la corrupcio, e lahoras cura aquel entro que sia consolidada.	Or if that which is corrupted is a great part, and the corruption has already reached the marrow of the bone, then it is necessary to close that and that completely by incision until the corruption has passed, and then cure that which is left until it is consolidated.</start_of_turn
E yeu recomti a tu aquo que endevenc ad un home en la sua coyssa per que pausez aquela a eyssempli e adjutori sobre la tua operacio.	And I recommend that you ask a man in his household to stay with you so that he can watch over you and be of assistance in your operation.</start_of_turn
Foc un home jove per etat entorn xxx ans, al qual accideys dolor en la sua cueyssa, e de las partidas dedintz mauguda es sobre la materia dedintz le cors entro que la materia es pervenguda a la cueyssa, e es materia de apostema am gran apostema, e no foc a lu causa extrinseca.	For a young man of about thirty years of age, who has happened to him pain in his heel, and the parts around the bone which is above the ankle have become inflamed, and the matter is extended to the heel, and the matter is of great quantity, and there is no external cause.
E adonc foc extendut le temps am aquela per la error dels metges entro que l’apostema es hubert, e acorrero de lu materias motas, e la sua curacio foc aprop pausada entro que la camba foc fistulada, e faytz son en lu motz orrificis les quals totz getavan poyredura e las humiditatz del cos.	And therefore the time must be extended for the error of the doctors until the swelling has gone down, and reduce the matter of bones, and the cure must be stopped until the fistula has formed, and make incisions in all the orifices through which the matter has escaped and the humors of the body.</start_of_turn
E adonc le curec multitut de metges entorn dos ans, e no foc en aquels savia ma en la art, entro que yeu fu appelat.	And thus the multitude of doctors surrounding him for two years, and not only those who knew him well in this art, entered that he should be called.
E vi la camba de lu e las materias que corrian de lu aquels orrificis per gran cors; e ja le cos de aquel home era tot stabozit e la color de lu era citrina.	And behold the swelling of his limbs and the matter that flowed from him from those wounds for a great body; and already the color of that man was quite unstable and of a sickly yellow hue.</end_of_turn>
E adonc yeu intromesi la tenta ad un de aquels orrificis e pervenguec la tenta al os.	And thus I introduced the needle into one of those wounds and reached the bone.</end_of_turn>
E aprop yeu e perscrutat tostz les orrificis e trobegui aquels pervenir a lor de totas partidas de la camba.	And I saw that they all bled profusely from all parts of the swelling.</end_of_turn
E adonc yeu me coytegui e inscidegui sobre un dels orrificis aquels entro que descrobegui una partida del os, e atrobegui aquel corromput, e ja era terros e corrumput e denigrat; e era ja corrumpuda una partida de la camba entro que havia penetrat entro a la mezola.	And thus I fainted and pierced my finger on one of those wounds until I scraped a part of the bone, and clotted that corruption; and it was already dead and corrupted and blackened; and a part of the swelling had already perished before I had penetrated it.</end_of_turn
E adon yeu serregui aquo que a mi era discubert e preparat del os descubert.	And thus I did what was recommended to me and prepared from the exposed bone.</end_of_turn
E yeu cujegui que no fos en le os sino aquela corrupcio la qual abscidigui e serregui, e yeu ja havia derraziguada.	I say that it was not in the bone itself but in that corruption which I evacuated and prepared, and I had already drained it.</end_of_turn
E aprop pausegui la restauracio de la plagua am medicina consolidativas per lonc temps, e no es consolidada.	Then I stopped the restoration of the plague with healing medicines for a long time, and it is not solidified.</end_of_turn
E aprop yeu iteregui e descubregui sobre le os segondament sobre le descubriment primier, e atrobegui continua corrupcio am le os.	And thus I repeated the process and discovered the bone again as before, and there continued corruption in the bone.</end_of_turn
E serregui aquo que a mi apares de aquela corrupcio, e aprop yeu fo perforsat fayre la curacio de lu e restauracio, e no es restaurat.	I say that from that corruption appeared to me, and thus I had to make an incision to perform the cure and restore it, and it is not restored.</end_of_turn>
E adonc yeu descubri sobre lu autra veguada e no cessegui inscidir le os petit a petit particuladament e perforsa la restauracio de lu, e no es restaurat entro que inscidigui entorn un palm de lu, e aquel extraxi am la medula sua, e aprop restauregui aquel am medicinas, e es consolidat leugierament e sanat.	And thus I discovered another vein there and I did not cease to prick the bone little by little until I had pierced the restoration of it, and it is not restored until I had pricked around a palm of it, and I extracted that with the marrow, and I restored that with medicines, and it is consolidated firmly and permanently.</end_of_turn>
E no es necessaria iteracio en la operacio de lu e seccio de lu sino per la disposicio de la freulesa de lu e per la paucitat de la tollerancia de lu e paor de lu de mort, quar a lu accidia en totas horas per superfluitat de evacuacio sincopi mala.	And it is not necessary to repeat the operation of cutting and scraping, but for the evacuation of the purulent matter and for the scarcity of its tolerance and fear of its death, which is in all its hours for excess of useless evacuation.</end_of_turn
E donc sanat es per sanacio entiera, e nada es en loc de os carn dura; e es fayta bona la disposicio de lu en le sieu cors e retornec la vertut de lu; e es conversat en las suas disposicios e no fec a lu contrarietat en ambulacio ni nocument en denguna causa.	Therefore health is for whole healing, and nothing is in place of the hardness of the bones; and it is good to dispose of them in the belly of the body and restore their virtue; and it is preserved in their disposals and it does not make them deviate in walking or at any time in any way.</end_of_turn
Mays si es os eminent en loc del cors ja trauquat, lahoras cove que tu secces aquel segon aquesta manieyra: e es que tu prenguas liament e strenh aquel en la extremitat de aquel os eminent, e comanda ad alcu que extenda aquel en sus; e pausa aquel liament de lana pus gros del primier liament; e aprop lia aquel sobre la carn que es dejos le os, e exten la extramitat de lu per que atires la carn a las partidas dejos, e tu descuebras la carn sobre le loc le qual voles serrar per que la serra no leda la carn.	But if it is prominent in the body of the limb already brought to an end, the hour is that you take a ligament and stretch that at the extremity of that prominent bone, and command someone to extend that; and stop that ligament of wool as thick as the first ligament; and then lay that over the bone which is left behind the bone that you are closing, and extend the limb so that you drive the bone to the parts beyond, and you uncover the bone over the place where you want to close it so that the saw does not burn the bone.</end_of_turn
E pausa fust o taula dejos le os decentment, quar quan tu fas aquo no es prohibida la serra que no secce la carn corrumpuda.	And stop fasting or tableting lest the bone be damaged by that; for when you do that, the saw is not prohibited from cutting the corrupted bone.</end_of_turn
E cove que sia la serradura sobre le loc corrumput petit a petit, quar si es en la concavitat del os corrupcio e no appar en la sua apparicio al sentiment, e forssa a serratura de lu autra veguada.	And cover that the sawing be done little by little over the corrupted place, for if it is in the cavity of the bone corruption does not appear in its appearance to the feeling, and forces the closure of the other vein.
E si le os es corrumput e no-eminent, abantz es la una partida continuada am la autra, e la corrupcio es al mieg loc o en partida de lu, lahoras tu descuebre la carn de totas partz tota; e aprop pausa fust dejos, e aprop serra aquel de la primiera partida la on es la corrupcio entro que sia continuada la serratura del autra partida.	If the bone is corrupted and not prominent, advance one part continuously with the other, and the corruption is in the middle of it or in part of it, the hour is that you uncover the bone throughout; and then stop fasting, and saw that of the first part where the corruption is until the closure of the other part is finished.</end_of_turn
E sia la serradura segon le loc de la corrupcio un petit, segon que havem dit.	And let the sawing be small according to the place of the corruption.
E si la corrupcio es en la junctura, inscideys aquela junctura corrumpuda, e serra le os la on es continuat del autra part.	If the corruption is at the joint, prick that corrupted joint and saw the bone that is continued from the other side.</end_of_turn>
E si de la corrupcio es en la continuacio de doas juncturas, lahoras no es en lu razio sino engen.	And if the corruption is in the continuation of two joints, the hour is not in their ratio but ingenious.</end_of_turn
E si la corrupcio es en le pecte de la ma o del pe, es mot dificil; empero cove que tu inquieras la corrupcio en qual manieyra appareys a tu, e que abradas aquela, e mondes aquela segon quascuna disposicio la qual es a tu possibla, e am cascum engen sia rectificat a tu, quan no fa a tu contrarietat vena o nervi.	And if the corruption is in the part of the hand or foot, it is not easy; however, cover that you inquire about the corruption in what way it appears to you, and that you open that, and tell me what you find according to any possible disposition that is at your command, and in this way either the vein or the nerve will be rectified, when it does not make you contradict the vein or the nerve.</end_of_turn
E sapias qual es inscididors e las serras a inscidir aquestz osses son motz segon le situament dels osses, e la preparacio de aquels, e la grosseza de aquels, e la subtilitat e la grandeza e la parvitat de aquels, e la duricia e la lor raritat; per que cove que tu prepares a tota specia de operacio estrument convenient ad aquela opperacio.	Therefore you must know what instruments to use and what saws to use to cut these bones are not always suitable according to the situation of the bones, and the preparation of those, and the size of those, and the thinness and greatness and smallness of those, and the hardness and rarity of those; for it is necessary that you prepare for every kind of operation a convenient instrument for that operation.</end_of_turn>
E sapias que aquela operacio significa a tu sobre la specia del strument del qual indigeysses; quan am tu es gran studi e lonc e conoyssensa de las manieyras de aquesta art, e testimoni de manieyras de malautias, quar lahoras ja tu las avias per tu meteys aquo que es convenient a lu dels sturmentz a tota malautia.	You know that this operation signifies for you the great study, length, and knowledge of this art, and the testimony of the methods of diseases, which you already have in your mind for your own practice in relation to all diseases.
E yeu so a tu formant en la fi de aquest capitol le nombre dels instrumentz les quals pausaras cum eyssimples am les quals proceziras a la tua prohibicio la qual experimentaras sobre las autras.	And I say to you at the end of this chapter the number of instruments which you will find mentioned as simple, with which you must proceed at your peril, which you will experience on the others.
Forma de serra:	Form of greeting:
Forma de autra serra:	Form of another greeting
Forma de autra serra:	Form of another greeting
Forma de autra serra gran:	Formal greeting of great importance
Forma de ray:	Praise be to God
Sia le cap de aquest ray segon la forma de cap de clau stellat, e les puntz de lu sian segon la forma dels puntz alstefegi.	Thus be the head of this prayer according to the form of the star-studded claw, and the points of it according to the form of the points of the starfish.</start_of_turn>
E no conveneys sino que am aquel sian confricadatz les caps de las juncturas quan so corrumpudas, o es la boca gran ampla.	And it is not proper that the heads of the joints should be confronted when they are corrupted, or that the great mouth be wide open.</start_of_turn
Forma de razori major dels autres:	Greater form of reasoning than the others.</start_of_turn
Forma de razori menor:	Lesser form of reasoning.</start_of_turn
Forma de razori lat:	Formal reasoning.</start_of_turn
Forma de serra autra decentment fayta: sia fayt arc de lu pus sobira e la acuitat de lu de ferr, e le membre de lu de boys punhal descentment fayt.	Thus be a decent farewell: let him make an arch of his beard so as to make it broader and the sharpness of it of iron, and let the members of his hands be punched downwards so that he makes a bow.</start_of_turn
Forma de lu:	Let us depart.</start_of_turn
Forma de razori en la qual ha concavitat:	Reasoning in which he has bowed.</start_of_turn
Forma de razori autra subtil:	Subtle reasoning.</start_of_turn
Forma de autra razori de curvada extremitat:	Reasoning of curved extremities.</start_of_turn
Forma de rasori petit semblant a tenta:	Reasoning like a small tentacle.</start_of_turn
Forma de incisori am le qual so inscidit les osses:	The incisor with which the bones are inscribed.</start_of_turn
Forma de inscisori autra minor:	The other smaller incisor.</start_of_turn
Forma de un autra inscissori; aquest semblant a ray, e la extremitat de lu es cum serra, e es exhibit en motz locs en la razio dels osses:	The other incisor; this one resembles a a ray, and its extremity is like a claw, and it is exhibited in many places in relation to the bones.</start_of_turn
Forma de ray lo qual conveneys a rasio de aquel que es perforat dels osses:	The ray which convenes in proportion to that which is perforated by the bones.</start_of_turn
E la extremitat de lu es triangulada e de aguda extremitat.	And its extremity is triangular and acute.</start_of_turn
E es fayt de ferr de India , e semblantment cove que totas las causas que havem ditas de rasoris e de inscissoris e de serras.	And it is made of Indian steel, and it resembles all the causes which we have mentioned of razors and of incisors and of saws.</start_of_turn
De inscizio extremitatz e de la serratura dels osses.	From the incision of the extremities and the closing of the bones.</start_of_turn
Las extremitatz se poyresso o per causa intrinseca o per causa extrinseca, o cum tu auras medicat aquela corrupcio per curacio de aquelas medicinas e la curacio no comfereys, o vezes la corrupcio anar deves le membre la qual no percuteys denguna causa, lahoras cove que tu inscidas aquel membre entro aquo la hon acossec la corrupcio, per que le malaute evasesca per aquo de mort o de malicia que es major defeliment del membre.	The extremities are sometimes affected either by an intrinsic cause or by an extrinsic cause, or when you have treated that corruption for the care of those medicines and the care does not suffice, or sometimes the corruption goes away from the limb without your having perceived any cause, for in such a case you must inscribe that limb within that space which the pain has spared, so that the disease may be driven out by that means or by some other more serious defect of the limb.</start_of_turn
E le senhal de aquel al qual accideys, es que·l membre es fayt negre entro que sia cujat que foc la ja comburit, o se poyreys aprop la negror entro que la poyredura aquela ane entro aquel membre que siec lu e que prengua tot le cors; e donc coyta te am inscizio de aquel.	And the sign of that to which this applies is that the limb is black within before it is healed that the fire has already consumed it, or that it grows pale near the blackening before the blackness has passed from that limb in which you saw it and which preserves all the parts; and therefore I advise you to inscribe that limb of you.</start_of_turn
E semblantment si es causa de la corrupcio percussio de alcunas causas venenosas ayssi cum de scorpio mari o de vupera o de rutela e de semblantz.	And in the same way if the cause of the corruption be a blow from some venomous causes such as a scorpion of the sea or a viper or a worm and of the like.</start_of_turn
E si la corrupcio o la percussio es en la extremitat del dit, lahoras tu inscideys le dit e no dones spazi a la corrupcio per que ane entro a la ma.	And if the corruption or the blow is in the extremity of the finger, then you must inscribe the finger and do not leave space for the corruption to enter your hand.</start_of_turn
E semblantment si accedeys a la ma, lahoras tu inscideys aquela de la razit del focil, e no dones spazi a la corrupcio entro que prengua en le focil del bras.	And in the same way if you reach the hand, then you must inscribe that of the root of the bone, and do not leave space for the corruption to enter until it has passed from the bone of the arm.</start_of_turn
E si envezeys aquel, lahoras inscideys le bras entro al coyde en la junctura.	And if you do not know it, then you must inscribe the arm within the groove in the joint.</start_of_turn
E si passa otra la corrupcio e la vezes enviro le coyde, lahoras en aquel es la mort del malaute; e aministrar autra causa otra aquo en curacio es quantitat de vertut.	And if another comes, the corruption sometimes passes from the groove, then in that case is the death of the disease; and to administer another cause another time in care is a quantity of virtue.</start_of_turn
E semblantment fay del pe quan corrupcio envezeys le dit del pe, lahoras tu inscideys aquel entro ad un dels nozes.	The pain in the foot is like that which arises from corruption within the bone of the foot, and in such a case you must pierce that which has penetrated one of the nails.
E si pren en la pente del pe, lahoras tu inscideys tot le pe.	If you take hold of the foot, then pierce the whole foot.</end_of_turn>
Mays si pueja entro al denol, lahoras tu inscideys la camba entro a la junctura del denol.	Or if it has gone deep inside, pierce the cavity within the joint of the bone.</end_of_turn>
E si la corrupcio ja es pervenguda sobre le denol, lahoras en lu no es engen sino dimissio, e layssar le malaute a la mort.	And if the corruption has already spread over the bone, then do nothing but allow the pain to die, and let the patient rest in peace.</end_of_turn>
E la manieyra de inscidir le membre o de serrar lu es que tu strenhas le liament en la partida pus dejos la qual voles inscidir, e strenh autre liament sobre le loc; e extenda le ministre un liament a las partidas dejos, e extenda le ministra autra liament en sus; e tu separa la carn la qual es entre dos liamentz ain spatum lat entro que sia descuberta tota la carn; e aprop sia inscidit o serrat.	The manner of piercing the limb or of cutting it is that you grasp the ligament in the place where you wish to pierce, and grasp another ligament over the area; and extend the minister a ligament to the lower parts, and extend the minister another ligament on the upper parts; and you uncover the marrow which is between two ligaments without breaking through all the marrow; and then either pierce or cut.</end_of_turn
E cove que sia pausat drap de li de totas partidas per so que no toque le loc sa, e que vengua al malaute lesio ajustada e apostema caut.	And that you keep the limb perfectly still from all parts so that you do not touch the bone itself, and that you bring the patient relief by means of adjusted treatment and afterwards apply cautery.</end_of_turn
Mays si accideys flux de sanc quan obras, lahoras tu cauteriza le loc coytadament, o pausa sus lu alcunas polveras restrenhentz le sanc; e aprop retorna a la tua medicacio entro que sia complida.	Or if blood flows forth when working, then you cauterize the area superficially, or suspend your work until the blood vessels are narrowed; and then return to your treatment until it is completed.</end_of_turn>
E aprop lia le membre plaguat am liament al u convenient, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And then bind up the affected limb with a ligament as desired, and care for the area until it is healed.</end_of_turn
E yeu recomti a tu aquo que endevenc a un home en le sieu pe, aquest meteys accident le qual yeu e a tu recomtat, le qual es quar accidic a lu negror en le sieu pe am adustio que era asemblada a combustio de foc.	I urge you to take counsel from a man skilled in surgery, for this method of treatment which I have recommended is one which is very dangerous to the soul of the patient, like a fire which has been kindled in the soul.</end_of_turn
E aquela corrupcio accidic primierament en le sieu dit entro que tendec tot le pe.	And that corruption is first of all in the marrow of the bone until it extends throughout the whole foot.</end_of_turn>
E adonc aquel home preparec per si meteys pus que vic la curacio anar al membre am la vehemencia de lu que atrobec de dolor e de adustrio de lu, e el inscidic aquel pe entro a la junctura, e foc sanat.	Then that man should prepare himself for this treatment more than if he were going to undergo the care of an expert, for the violence of the pain and the suffering of the limb, and he should pierce the foot within the joint, and the fire will heal.</end_of_turn
Lonc temps accidic a lu aquela meteyssa corrupcio en le dit de la ma indic.	For a long time that method of treatment has been indicated for the disease of the thumb.</end_of_turn
E adonc venc a mi, e so me perforsat repercutir aquela superfluitat am aquo que pausegui sobre la ma de las medicinas, aprop la mundificacio del cos de lu; e no es repercussa la superfluitat e comensec anar al autra dit entro que comensec en la ma.	And thus I came to know that this excessive procedure has been shown to have no effect in relation to the practice of medicine, for it does not remove the cause of the disease; and it is not useful in the treatment of the body, but rather it begins to cause suffering in the hand itself from the outset.</end_of_turn
E el apelec me a inscidir la ma de lu, e yeu no volgui far aquo sperant sobre la repercussio de aquela superfluitat, e mays que temegui deves la inscizio de la ma de lu mort, quar la vertut del malaute era sobre cazement.	I ask you to pierce the hand, and I do not fear the result of that excessive procedure, for I believe that the power of the disease is greater than the danger of the incision.</end_of_turn
E pus que el se desperec de mi, es retornat en la sua terra e pervenguec a mi que aquel home preparec e inscidic la sua ma tota, e es sanat.	And when I awoke from my sleep, I learned that that man had prepared himself and pierced his entire hand, and he was healed.</end_of_turn
E no he adhuzida aquesta narracio sino per que sia adjutori sobre aquo que catz de aquesta malautia, e que sia significacio per la qual sia significada e segon la qual sia obrat.	I tell you this story only in order to illustrate the cause of this disease, and the reason for its significance and its efficacy.</end_of_turn
De cura sinuum et qualitate clisterizationis cum medicinis.	Beware of physicians who lack skill and whose knowledge of treatment is inferior to that of common people.</end_turn>
Quan accideys apostema en alcus membres carnozes e·l spazi de l’apostema es prolonguat entro que fa colleccio de sania, e aprop es romput e perforat, e es eyssida de lu la sania, e roman le loc vuoyt quays cum si era vayssel, e la codena que es desobre lu ayssi cum drap subtiliat, e no es pervengut a deriera corrupcio, e no inprimeys en le os o en nervi ni en liament, es apelat sinu, e no es nompnat fistula.	When an abscess forms in a fleshy limb, the space of the abscess is prolonged until collection of pus has occurred, and then it is ruptured and perforated, and the pus is evacuated, and the limb is left as if it were a vessel, and the surrounding tissue which has been subjected to this treatment appears as if it has been finely ground, and no further corruption is found in the bone or nerves or ligaments. It is simply swelling, and is not called fistula.</end_turn
Mays empero si le spazi es prolonguat entro que la corrupcio enprema en alcun membre, lahoras es appelada fistula e no zukem.	However, if the space is prolonged until the corruption spreads throughout the limb, then it is called fistula and does not abate.</end_turn
E la cura de lu es que inscidas aquela codena tota ayssi cum es revolvut, e majorment quan es subtiliada e es fayta cum drap, e comfizas que no adhereys al loc per la sua corrupcio.	The treatment for this is to pierce the entire surrounding tissue as if it were twisted, and more importantly when it is finely ground and is effective like mercury, and comfort yourself that it does not adhere to the bone due to its corruption.</end_turn
Mays si tu speras que la codena adheresca e que aquela corrupcio no aja conseguit per deriera consecucio, e en la codena ha spassitut de cara, lahoras tu cura aquel am clisteri.	Or if you hope that the surrounding tissue will adhere and that the corruption will not have further consequences, and in the surrounding tissue there has been bruising, then you should treat that which is clustered.</end_turn
E es que consideras al sinu, e lahoras si es gran, e·l brac que yeys es de fetent odor, lahoras clisteriza aquel am medicament egipciac le qual es de oli e vi agre e ziniar recebent partidas enguals, e sian ajustadas en un vayssel, e sian coytas sobre le foc entro que’l medicament se fassa rog e pervengua a specitut de mel.	And consider the soul, and if it is great, and if the limb which is being treated emits a foul odor, then you should treat it with an Egyptian medicine which is composed of olive oil, vinegar and lead, which you should place in a vessel and cover with lead until the medicine has become soft and reached its perfection.</end_turn
E aprop tu pren de lu aquo que es necessari e dissolveys lu am aygua e mel; e clisteriza am aquel le sinu, e strenh le orrifici de lu, e layssa la medicina en lu per la quantitat de doas horas.	And immediately take from them what is necessary and dissolve it with vinegar and honey; and instill it into that area, strengthen the orifice, and leave the medicine in for two hours.
E aprop extratz aquela am sprecio; e fay aquo per tantz dias entro que sia mundificat le sinu e sia remauguda la pudor.	And immediately extract that which is superfluous; and do so until the area is healed and the pain is gone
E alcunas veguadas es clisterizat am aygua de cendre, quan no es a tu prezent aquest medicament; e es que tu prenguas la cendra de vitz, e met sobre lu aygua; e aprop cola aquela e clisteriza aquel am ela entro que te confizes que·l sinu lahoras es ostat.	And every morning it is cleansed with vinegar of ashes, when it is not necessary to use this medicine; and take ashes of vinegar, put it on it, and do so until you confirm that the area is healed at the hour.
E si le malaute no ha tollerancia sobre le medicament egipciac ni l’aygua de la cendre, lahoras clisteriza aquel am aygua e mel e quays sia mesclat ziniar trissat, e clisteriza aquel am vi e mel mesclat, quar de proprietat de mel es que mondifique e lave, e le vi fa adherir le sinu, e majorment quan en le vi ha superfluitat de stipticitat e de siccitat.	And if the patient does not tolerate the Egyptian medicine or the ash water, then do this: instill vinegar and honey and add sulfur powder, and instill vinegar and honey with some mustard, because honey has the property of softening and washing away, and mustard makes the area adhere to the skin, and more so when there is excess of stickiness and dryness
E cum tu fas aquo alcunas veguadas e te comfizes que·l sinu ja es remaugut, lahoras clisteriza aquel am aquo que fa naysser la carn en lu.	And when you have finished doing these things and you confirm that the area is healed, then instill vinegar into the area that makes the flesh rise up in it.</start_of_turn>
E es que prenguas de enguent dyafinicon e dissolveys aquel am oli rozat e vi stiptic; o que clisterizas aquel am alcunas medicinas e enguentz autres que hajan las proprietatz les quals ja he yeu scritz en le tractat dels enguents.	And take of fennel seed and dissolve it with olive oil and vinegar; or instill some medicine into the area and put others that have the qualities that I have already written in the treatise on remedies.</start_of_turn>
E si le orrifici del sinu es streyt en le qual no es recebuda la canula del clisteri, lahoras tu le amplifique aquel am ferr petit a petit, e pausa en lu calgua envolopada en enguent egipciac o en enguent basilicon entro que sia amplificat.	And if the orifice of the area is strict in which the catheter of the syringe is not received, then do this: gradually expand the area with a small needle, and stop when it is covered with soft gauze soaked in Egyptian or balsamic ointment until it is enlarged.</start_of_turn
E semblantment si le orrifici es ample, lahoras tu agregua las labias de lu am sutura e layssa de lu quantitat en la qual intre le clisteri ses addicio.	And in the same way if the orifice is wide, then suture the edges of the area and leave it for the amount of time necessary for the injection to take effect.</start_of_turn
E si le orrifici de lu del qual corr le brac es elevat a las partidas desus, lahoras secca aquel en le pus bas loc que es en lu per que le brac corra entro dejos, quar quan le brac es coartat en la preondeza de sinu la carn esser en lu engendrada.	And if the area from which the limb hangs is elevated to the lower parts, then dry that part of the limb that is below because the limb will run outwards, because when the limb is contracted in the swelling of the area the flesh will be pressed outwards.</start_of_turn
E si no es a tu possible seccar le sinu entro al enviro del os pus bas segon que voles, lahoras te perforssa que prepares le membre am preparacio per la qual corr de lu le brac leugierament segon que es a tu apparelhat e que no sia en lu retengut alcuna causa del brac.	And if it is not possible to dry the limb externally around the bone according to your desire, then I tell you to prepare the limb with the preparation that is usually used for it and that it should not be retained by any cause of the limb.</start_of_turn
E pren medicinas consolidativas que sian pausadas sobre le sinu convenientz ad aquo que vols exxten aquelas sobre drap de li.	Take consolidating medicines that are applied to the convenient area until you wish to extend those over the wound of life.</start_of_turn
E le drap sia de tan gran quantitat cum fa la comunicacio de tot le sinu; e aprop inscidey am las forfexs en le dreyt del orrifici del sinu un trauc pus ample un pauc que l’orrifici del sinu; e aprop exten sobre autre drap de li dels enguentz leons segon la quantitat del trauc, e pausa le sobre aquel per posicio longinqua del orrifici del sinu per que sia aleujat le eyssiment del brac de lu e no ostes le drap gran sino aprop alcus dyas una veguada.	And the wound should be of such great quantity as to facilitate communication of all the limbs; and immediately insert into the cavity of the area a sponge wider than the area itself; and extend over other parts of the limb the soft dressings according to the quantity of the wound, and leave them over that area for a long position of the area so that the limb is relieved of the pressure of the area and does not suffer excessively except for a few days once or twice a day.</start_of_turn
Mays aquel que es sobre le orrifici del sinu, le qual remauguas en tota hora per so que yesca aquo que es ajust en lu del brac.	May that which is over the area be kept for an hour in order that the swelling that is caused by the limb be reduced.</start_of_turn
E per que sapias si aquo que corr de lu del brac es mot o pauc, o es digest, o es no-digest.	And to know if the swelling that comes from the limb is much or little, or is digested or undigested.</start_of_turn
E am aysso tu considera le loc de aquel sinu, si en lu sent le pacient dolor o no, e si es en lu apostema.	And take into consideration the state of that area, if in it the patient feels pain or not, and if there is swelling.</start_of_turn
E cum la tua medicacio es prolonguada en la tal manieyra, e vesas la matiera que es gitada sobre le orrifici del sinu ja adhereys, o se apropria adherencia, lahoras le mayti tu le deslia o le tertz dia, e quan deslias la plagua, lahoras muda le drap per autre e renova le enguent.	And when the treatment is prolonged in this way, and you see that the matter that has adhered to the area already adheres, or has appropriate adherence, then do this: remove it for a day or two, and when you remove the dressing, change the dressing for another and renew the ointment.</start_of_turn
Mays si del sinu aprop lon spazi yeys virus subtil, lahoras no te desperes de la adherencia de li, quar la sanacio de lu se apropria, quar so alcus homes en les quals tarda generacio de carn en las lors plaguas, e de aquels so en les quals es fayt le contrari de lu.	And if there is some slight space left in the area, do not be afraid of the adherence of the dressing, for the healing of the area is appropriate, for in some it is late for the generation of flesh in the wounds, and in others it is useful to the contrary.</start_of_turn
E si del sinu aprop motz dias es yssit brac indigest, lahoras sapias que·l sinu no adhereys; e si es tardada la adherencia del sinu e es la causa prolonguada, lahoras tu ajusta en exsiccacio de las medicinas, e si las medicinas so humidas en lor substancia e en la sua vertut, son seccas ayssi cum enguent dyafinicon, quan es en lu ajustada superfluitat de addicio de zegi.	And if the limb has been swollen for several days and the limb is undigested, then I tell you that the limb does not adhere; and if the adherence of the limb is delayed and is the cause of the prolongation, then do this: adjust in the exclusion of the medicines, and if the medicines are humified in their substance and in their virtue, they are dry just like fennel seed when adjusted in excess.</start_of_turn
E le mays derier am le qual es curat, es que prenguas de enguent dyafinicon e sia dissout en oli rozat, e sia sobre lu vojat vi antic engual en la sua substancia, e aprop comfeys aquel am lu, e usa de aquel.	And if you wish to expedite the healing, take fennel seed and dissolve it in olive oil, and pour it over the area with vinegar that has been previously diluted in its substance, and do this until you feel comfortable with it.</start_of_turn
E ja fa semblant en aquela accio, quan no y a brac, enguent dyafinicon, mel quan es coyt entro que sia engrossat, e usa de lu; o que prenguas mirra e aloen e enses, e trissa tot e polveriza sobre le mel quan es sus le foc, e aprop lineys aquo sobre drap e strenh aquel sobre le sinu; e lineys aquel am le mel le qual has cuoyt entro que es engrossat, e polveriza sobre drap e strenh aquel.	And thus it appears in this action, when not braced, that the drug called diafinicon is better when it is cold than when it is warm, and use it; or that you take myrrh, aloes, and incense, grind them all together and sprinkle them over the warm bath, and line the bath with vinegar and strengthen the sponge over the limb; and line the sponge with the cold drug that you have just put in, and sprinkle it over the sponge and strengthen the sponge again.
E alcunas veguadas so administratz am lu aristologia longua e razitz de lili celesti (e es lili celesti) e farina de errs e centaurea, e usa de aquels simples o ajustatz, trissa aquels e cribela e polveriza sobre le mel le qual he recomtat; e husa de lu.	Some physicians also administer rhubarb, angelica root, lily of the valley (which is a celestial lily) and barley, centaury, and use these simples alone or combined, grind them up and sprinkle them over the warm bath that I have recommended; and use it.</end_of_turn>
E si es prolonguat le sinu, e no es sanat per aquesta curacio, lahoras sapias que la corrupcio es en le preon de lu, e ja fa enquisicio en les osses o en les autres membres durs o als liaments; lahoras tu le cura am curacio fistular, ayssi cum desus es dit.	And if the pain persists and is not healed by this treatment, it is necessary to know that the disease is in the bones or in the other limbs or joints; then you must perform an inquiry concerning the bones or the other parts of the limb, as is usually said.</end_of_turn>
De curacio de panarici et unguis attritae et incisione digiti additi et sectione.	Treatment of boils and nails, attraction and incision of the finger added to section.
Panarici es apostema le qual nays dejos la ungla del dit pous de la ma o del pe, e fort leu nays en les autres ditz, e cum es prolonguat e la sua curacio es mens prezada, o es apostemat de apostema caut, o es corrumput, e gieta brac entro que corrodeys la razitz de la ungla, e fort leu corromp aquela tota, e fort leu perve la sua corrupcio al os entro que es a lu odor fetent, e es fayta la extremitat del dit lada, e la color de lu es fayta fusca.	Boils are swelling that does not leave the nail of the finger bent from the palm of the hand or foot, and which is strong in the other fingers, and when it is prolonged its treatment is less valuable, or it is gangrenous, and it lets out a stench as long as it consumes the root of the nail, and it is strong in consuming the whole, and strong in causing its corruption to the bone as long as it has a foul odor, and is beneficial to remove the limb when it is rotten, and its color is pale.
E donc quan tu auras aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu inscidas am ferr tota la superfluitat que es romasa de la ungla e aprop cauteriza la plagla aprop aquo, quar cauteri mot es juvatiu en aysso.	And therefore when you have done what we said in the division and it does not relieve your pain, then you must know that you must burn away all the superfluous parts that remain of the nail and then cauterize the ulcer nearby so that the cautery does not cause further harm.</end_of_turn>
Mays si le os es sa e la ungla es sana, e las addicios de la ungla vuoydas ja compremen las carns a las partidas dedintz, e comensan lu punger e ledeysso aquela, lahoras cove que tu pauses ray subtil dejos le angle de la ungla que pungeys la carn, e impelleys aquela sus e inscideys aquela carn am facilitat, e pausa sobre aquo que roman de la carn de las medicinas comburentz corrosivas entro que sia tot remaugut; e aprop cura aquel am enguentz entro que sia sanat.	If the bone is sound and the nail is healthy, and the surrounding parts of the nail have already become soft and begin to decay, then you must know that you must leave the angle of the nail that is biting the flesh alone, and remove the surrounding tissue with your fingers and instruments; and leave over only the part that remains of the flesh from the corrosive medicines until it is all consumed; and then treat the remaining part until it is healed.</end_of_turn
Mays si la corrupcio ja enprem en le os, lahoras cove que tu inscidas le os aquel e le extraguas, car nul temps no es sanat que sia en lu le os corrumput.	If the disease has already progressed in the bone, then you must know that you must extract the bone and remove it, for no time is it beneficial to keep it rotten.</end_of_turn>
E si vezes la corrozio e la corupcio anar en le dit, lahoras tu inscideys aquel en un dels nozes segons que es premesa la sua rememoracio, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And if sometimes the corruption and the decay go down to the finger, then you must know that you must remove it at one of the joints according to the nature of the wound, and treat the remaining part until it is healed.</end_of_turn>
Mays si a la ungla endeve percussio o atricio, e endeve en aquela dolor vehement, lahoras cove que tu al comensament fleubotomes le malaute, e aprop secca la ungla am spatum agut am seccio transversa desus en jus, e guarda te que la seccio no pervengua entro a la carn que es dejos la ungla, quar tu faras accidir al malaute dolor vehement, e sira causa a nativitat de la carn ajustada superflua en le loc; e aprop cura aquel loc am aquo que ceda dolor.	If the nail has percussion or cutting, and there is acute pain, then you must know that you must initially apply pressure to the patient, and then dry the nail with a rough sponge or a transverse section of lint, and take care that the section does not penetrate the flesh which is left under the nail, because this will cause the acute pain to worsen; and if there is any excessive flesh remaining, remove it carefully.</end_of_turn
Mays dit ajustat, le qual es nat en las mas de alcus homes, fort leu es carnos tot, e fort leu so en lu osses, o fort leu es en lu ungla.	Just as it is natural in many households, it is strong in meat, and strong in bones, or strong in nails.</end_of_turn>
E alcus de lu son natz en la razit de la junctura, o es la nativitat de lu en alcus nozes dels ditz.	The cause of these is the origin of the joint, or the origin of the bones of the limb.</end_of_turn
Mays aquel que es nat en alcus nozes del dit no se mau, e aquest que es nat en las juncturas fort leu es maugut.	The one that is originated in the bones of the finger does not cause harm, but that which is originated in the joints is harmful.</end_of_turn>
E de aquels que son natz carnoses, la seccio es leugiera, e es que tu inscidas aquel deves la sua razitz am spatum lat.	As for those that are fleshy in origin, the section is slight, and you must remove the root with a blunt sponge.</end_of_turn
Mays de aquel que es nat en la razitz de la junctura, la curacio es dificil; e donc guarda te de la abscizio de lu.	As for that which is originated in the joint, the treatment is difficult; and therefore beware of the amputation of the limb.</end_of_turn
Mays en aquel que es nat en dit deves les nozes, cove que tu inscidas al comensament la carn de lu am inscizio redonda entro al os, e aprop serra am una de aquelas serras convenientz ad aquo, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	If the origin is in the bone, you must know that you must at the beginning pierce the flesh around the bone to the bone, and then insert with one of those sharp instruments that are convenient at that time, and treat until it is healed.</end_of_turn
Mays consolidacio la qual accideys als ditz entre lor motas veguadas o per nativitat del home que nays enayssi, o per consolidacio de plagua o per combustio de foc, o per semblantz, adonc cove que secces aquela consolidacio entro que les ditz retorno a la sua forma natural.	When consolidation happens between the bones due to the heat of the summer or the birth of the child, or by the consolidation of the wound or by the burning of fire, or by remaining in place, then you must know that you must remove that consolidation until the limb returns to its natural shape.</end_of_turn
E aprop pausa entre lor draps de li enfuzes en oli rozat per que no sian consolidatz leugierament, e separa entre aquels, o pausa entre aquels una lamina de plom subtil entro que sia consolidat segon que cove.	And thus you must stop between their layers of fat with olive oil so that they do not stick together, and separate between them, or place between them a layer of soft lead until it is consolidated as you see fit.</end_of_turn
E semblantment si accideys consolidacio en alcus ditz am la palma, lahoras tu secca aquela consolidacio segon que es preparada e conveneys a la figura del membre.	If something solid adheres to the palm of the hand, dry that solid according to its preparation and bring it back to the limb's shape.
De inscizio de vices, so son varicas.	From the beginning of the vice, so are varices.
Vices so son varicas, e so venas envolutas grossas plenas de superfluitatz melencolicas las quals veno en motz dels membres del cors, e le major adveniment de lor en las cambas, e majorment en las cambas dels itinerantz e dels laborantz e dels portantz.	Vices are varices, and these are veins surrounded by large veins filled with black bile that flow in the limbs of the body, and their greatest movement is in the thighs, and most of all in the thighs of travelers, laborers, and porters
Adonc cove que tu administres purguacio del cors de colera negra alcunas veguadas am expulcio fort, e aprop sangna le pacient de la vena basilica.	Then when you administer an purgative of the body of black bile some vegetables along with strong expulsion, and bring blood to the patient from the basilica vein
Mays la curacio de lor am ferr es segon dos manieyras: la una es que sia inscizas e sia atirat aquel sanc negre, e l’autra manieyra es que sia elevada la vena e sia extrayta tota.	May the care of them be according to two methods: one is that it is without knowledge and that one black sand is cast upon it, and the other method is that the vein is elevated and all is extracted
La seccio de lu es segon aquesta manieyra: embroca al comensament la camba am aygua cauda mot entro que le sanc gros sia resolvut, que es feculent de la camba, e aprop strenh la camba del malaute a la partida pus sobirana de la coyssa entro a la partida dejos del denol am una benda, e aprop secca la vena en un loc, o en dos, o en tres am seccio ampla, e aprop eleva le sanc negra am la tieua ma de la partida dejos de la camba entro en sus, e desus en jus, entro que del sanc sia yssida la quantitat que voles e que vezes habastar, e la qual tollera la vertut del malaute.	The incision is done in this manner: grasp the limb at the beginning with cold water until the large black sand is resolved, which is beneficial for the limb, and then stretch the limb of the patient towards the upper part of the thigh with a bandage, and then dry the vein in one place, or in two, or in three in a wide section, and elevate the black sand towards the lower part of the thigh until it reaches its proper place, and let it fall, until the quantity that you want has fallen, and which will tolerate the virtue of the patient
E aprop lia aquela, e comanda a lu que abstengua de las viandas colera negra engendrantz.	And so do that, and order them to abstain from foods that produce black bile.
E itera la curacio per fleubotomia quan las venas so umplidas e aquo notz al malaute.	Repeat the treatment for phlebotomy when the veins are swollen and when the patient feels better
Mays la elevacio de lor es segon aquesta manieyra: tu que razas la camba del malaute, si en lu so motz pels, e aprop met le en banh e embroca la camba de lu am aygua cauda entro que s’enrogesesca e las venas sian exuberadas; o que sia exercitat per exercici fort, si banh no es a tu present, entro que·l membre sia scalfat.	May the elevation of them be done in this manner: you raise the limb of the patient, if there is movement in it, and put it in water and grasp the limb with cold water until it turns red and the veins are relaxed; or that it is exercised by strong exercise, if there is no water at your disposal, until the limb is scorched
E aprop secsa la codena en le dreyt de la vena per seccio en le lonc o en le derier de lu deves le denol, o en le pus bas de lu deves lo talo.	And so dry the cord in the root of the vein by cutting in the long or in the back of it must give it a blow, or in the lower part of it must cut it off
E aprop uobre la codena am uncis e excorja la vena de tota part entro que appara al sentiment, e es deves la appericio de lu que vezes aquela roga declinant a negror.	And so close the cord with nails and remove the vein from all around until it appears, and when it appears you must know that sometimes that request is diminishing towards blackening
E donc cum evazeys e de la codena tu vezes aquela blanca quays sia corda.	And so avoid it and the cord when sometimes that white thing that is cord.
E aprop tu met dejos aquela le ray entro que sia elevada e sia gitada de la codena, e sospen aquela am onci orp leon.	And so put your hands down when it is elevated and is freed from the cord, and suspend it with an egg-shaped weight
E aprop secsa autra seccio aprop aquela seccio per tres ditz, e aprop excorja la codena de la partida desus de la vena entro que apparia.	And so make another incision near that incision for three fingers, and so remove the cord from below the vein until it appears.
E aprop eleva aquela e inscideys aquela en deriera seccio deves le talo, e aprop extratz aquela e eleva aquela entro que sia yssida per la seccio segonda, e aprop extratz aquela de la seccio que es sobre aquela.	And so elevate that and make an incision in the lower part of the second incision must cut it off, and so extract that and elevate that until it is expelled through the second incision, and so extract that from the first incision.
E fay aquo entro que extraguas aquela de la seccio que es pus sobirana o pus auta de totas las seccios, entro que tota es yssida; e lahoras inscideys aquela.	And do that until you have extracted that from the most superior or highest part of all the incisions, until everything is expelled; and when that is done make the incision again
E si no obezeys a tu ad extrayre e elevar, lahoras intromet una agulha am fiel fort doble e ligua aquela e extratz la, o intromet dejos lu le ray e revolveys la tua ma a tota part entro qu’en sia getada.	And if you do not obey my order to extract and elevate, then put in a strong needle and double it and tie it off, or put your hand over it and rotate it all around until it is numb
E guarda te que no sia inscidida; quar si es trencada, es fayt a tu dificil elevar aquela mot e es vengut sobre le malaute per aquela nocument.	And take care that it is not injured; for if it is fractured, it is useful for you to have difficulty elevating that because of that document.
E cum aquela tota auras fora-gitada, lahoras pausa sobre le loc de la plagua lana submerssa en vi e oli rozat e oli no-rozat, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	When that is all over, then pause over the place of the wound with a greasy cloth soaked in wine and oil rubbed with oil that is not greasy, and care for that until it is healed
E si la vit es contrayta havent tortuositat a la qual sia envolucio a las partidas, e no es segon rectitut segon que havem dit, lahoras cove que tu fendas sobre aquela a tota partida de tortuositat de lu e als locs de envolucio de lu, e aprop suspen aquela am uncis entro que eleves aquela tota.	And if the bite is contracted without having a wound at the place where the covering has been placed, and that is not according to our instructions, then you must cover that the bite is over the whole area of the wound and the places where the covering has been placed, and suspend that with nails until you elevate that whole thing
E guarda te deves la tua seccio que no inscidas la vena e que no plagues aquela, quar dificil sira a tu elevar aquela; e serva la tua prudencia en aquela.	Take care that you do not cut the vein or that you do not damage that, for that would make it difficult for you to elevate that; and use your prudence in that
Forma del inscident am le qual es seccada vit:	The manner in which the incident is done in which the bite is dried
Forma de unci orp:	Method of making an egg-shaped weight
No es a lu accuitat ayssi cum als uncis ni es de aguda extremitat per so que no plague la vena; e es de grossa flexibilitat leon, quar si era subtil, inscidira la vena per la sua subtilitat; habantz es en lu superflua grosseza ayssi cum havem dit.	It is not necessary to be accurate with nails or to have acute ends so that it does not damage the vein; and it has great flexibility like a lion, because if it were brittle, it would break the vein because of its brittleness; having in it a great excess of greatness as we have said.
De extraccio venae cruris.	From extraction of the vein in the thigh.
Aquesta vena es engendrada en las cambas en terras caudas ayssi cum al- Ategi en terra de Arabics e en las terras de India caudas e aridas de pauca teneritat e en las quals no nays erba ni aybre.	This vein originates in the buttocks as well as in Arab lands and India, in dry and arid regions where there is little vegetation and no rain.</end_of_turn>

And thus when you have come to the extremity, then cover that with a plum of lead whose weight is equal to two drachmas. De sectione super vermes generatos sub cute et dicitur aegritudo bovina.	From the cutting above, worms are generated under the skin and is called bovine dropsy.</end_of_turn

This disease is called in many lands bovine dropsy because it is often seen in cows and is like that which is between the skin and the bone, and it goes through everything pushing and swelling, and is shown by the patient's feeling of stiffness in the limbs until the bone is broken and the skin is discharged.</end_of_turn
E la generacio de lu es per putrefaccio de alcunas humors ayssi cum accideysso verms e serpentz e lombrics e ascaridas en le ventre.	And the origin of this is from the putrefaction of some humors as well as from worms and serpents and worms and fleas in the belly.</end_of_turn

It is feared for its malice, for when it enters the body and is elevated to the head, it causes great swelling and pain, and that is what causes the swelling of the limbs.</end_of_turn

De sectione super aegritudinem nafir.	From the cutting above, dropsy.

This disease is called in our land nafir, and it is a pain that is seen in various parts of the body, and it is often confused from one part of the body to another.</end_of_turn
E yeu ja e vista aquela segon que yeu te recomtare.	And indeed, I have already seen such a case in which I recommended it.

I was called to a woman in pain at a village, and I found a small swelling in the groin vein of her arm, and when I rested for an hour, I saw that swelling disappear as quickly as it had appeared, as if it were gold that had been thrown around.

And as you wish the care of them, and the patient has that pain, do not be afraid of its appearance as it has been said, but strengthen your hand over that area and leave it excited and dry over that until the rapid movement is stifled, and cauterize the place.</start_of_turn>

De extraccio de sagetas.	From the extraction of arrows.
Sagetas son diversificadas segon las specias, e segon les locs dels cors en les quals cazo, quar la lor diversitat es que de aquellas so que han grans puntas, e petitas, e concavas, e sordas, so es solidas; e de lor so que han tres angles, e de aquelas a las quals so que han lenguas; e de aquelas a las quals so astelas.	Arrows are diverse according to their species and the places of the body in which they are cast, because their diversity is that of those which have large heads, and small, and concave, and solid; and of those which have three angles, and of those which have tongues; and of those which have handles.</start_of_turn
E aquela que es segon les membres e las pessas en las quals cazo es segon dos manieyras: quar les membres o so membres principals concaus, ayssi cum le cervel, le cor, e·l fitge, e le pulmo, e les ronhos, e les budels, e la vezica, e a lor semblantz; e donc quan catz en alcu de aquestz membres e aparo a tu senhals de mort, la qual causa yeu recomtare aprop, lahoras cove que tu evites extraccio de aquela sageta en aquels quar la mort siec aquel en le qual en las majors disposicios, e quan a tu no appareysso aquestz mals senhals, e la sageta no es amaguada en la profunditat del membre, lahoras tu extratz aquela e cura la plagua.	And that which is according to the limbs and the parts in which it is cast is according to two methods: because the limbs or the main limbs with cause, such as the head, the heart, the liver, the lungs, the belly, the bladder, and the testicles, and therefore when you touch any of these limbs and you perceive at your throat the danger of death, which I recommend to you in this case, when you do not perceive this danger and the arrow is not hidden in the depth of the limb, then you must extract that and cure the wound.</start_of_turn
E dels senhals del servel es quan catz en lu sageta, e trespassa le os, e es yssit del cyphac le qual es sobre le cervel, quar accideys per lu soda vehement, e scotomia, e vertige, e rogor en les huels, e imflamacio e rogor de la lengua, e spasme e permixtio de entendament e vomi de colera, e fort leu es abscindida la paraula e es destruida la votz, e es yssit del loc de la plagua humiditat blanca semblant a pols, e yeys de lu semblant ad aquositat de la carn. However, the signs of the arrow when it touches the heart are that it is near the left breast, and that it is in a solid cause, and not a soft one; and the movement of the arrow is similar to the movement of a worm, and runs with the black plague, and if it reaches that degree of coldness of the extremities, and sweating, and faintness; and therefore you must know that death approaches at all times.</start_of_turn

And the signs when the arrow has pierced the lung are that it immediately brings out blood-stained sputum, and the veins that are in the belly are clotted, and the color of the sickness changes, and great breath is exhaled, and there is a request for fresh air.

And if the arrow hits the small intestines, and the pain is that of the lower back, it is very great with great heat and with great breath, and it does not move all the muscles of the limbs.</start_of_turn

E si catz la sageta en le ventre, e es ficada en lu, yeys alcuna fenda de la plagua, o la tela, o budel le qual es disromput, e no es speransa en la curacio de lu extraccio de la sageta.	If the arrow is lodged in the belly and remains there, there will be some wound of the plague, or the dressing, or the intestine which is ruptured, and no hope of recovery from the extraction of the arrow.

Likewise, the other members such as the face, the jaw, the chest, the armpits, the spine, the scapulae, the ribs, the breast, and the limbs are saved as far as possible when the arrow does not hit a vein or artery and is not a venomous arrow.

And there was no significant accidental damage to the area where the arrow had entered; and I continued to keep the plaster on for several days, and there was no further pain; and the plague consolidated steadily, and the pain from the extraction of the arrow disappeared after a few days, since on the seventh day I found the arrow had come out by itself and I learned of it from the patient.

E yeu recomti a tu la qualitat de extraccio de alcunas sagetas per que pauses aquo regla e significacio sobre aquo que no he dit, quar las partidas de aquesta art e las difinicios de aquela no so conprehendudas am narracio ni no comprehen aquelas le libre. E aquela que es gitada per le loc don es intrada, o es sageta procedent en loc carnos, e es atirada e fora-gitada.	And that which is placed by the tissue in which it is introduced, or is a needle proceeding from flesh, is thrown out and excluded

E cove que la ventozacio sia guardada denant de banh; habantz cove que sia aministrada aprop issiment del banh per una hora o per doas, e cove que dorma aprop la ventozacio.	And cover the area from the bath; because it has to be given immediately after the bath for an hour or two, and cover the area with a cloth.</start_of_turn
Quid est quo oportet ut regatur ventosandus aus phlebotomatus ante ventosationem.	What should be done so that the wound does not bleed before the dressing is applied?</start_of_turn>
Cove que consideras al comensament: lahoras si le ventozador o aquel que·s deu fleubotomar es coleric e ventz sobre lu sanc agut e imflamacio, lahoras cove que prengua causas infrigidantz, ayssi cum milgranas acetosas, e endivia an vi agre e laytuguas, e secanabin, e julep, e a lor semblantz.	Consider at the beginning: if the attendant or the one who should extract the blood is bilious and has a sudden pain in the area and inflammation, cover that you should first prevent the causes of heat, thus with cloves of garlic, and vinegar and vinegar of roses, and bay leaves, and thyme, and so on.</start_of_turn
E pausa a lor viandas ayssi cum poletz, e carns de auzels serbiges, e viandas conditas am agras, e a lu semblantz.	And stop their meals thus as poultry, and bony meats, and cooked vegetables with spices, and those with vinegar, and so on.</start_of_turn
E de aquel del qual la compleccio es freja, cove que prengua en beure eyssarop almiva, o eyssarop de alsecanabin de semensas, e sumac, e vi mot odorant migier entre viel et noel; e que a lu sia comendat que use de paucitat de beure e de mangar, e pausa las viandas de lu poletz e canabir e pissers e petitz auzels e colombat.	And if the area is cold, cover that it should be given almond milk, or almond meal of poppy seeds, and sage, and fragrant oil between wheat and barley; and that it should be recommended that he drink little and eat sparingly, and abstain from poultry and meat and fish and eggs and legumes.</start_of_turn
E cove que en lo dia de ventozacio e de fleubotomia le beure sia major que la vianda.	And that in the days of bleeding and phlebotomy the liquid should be more abundant than the food.</start_of_turn

Mays las ventozas que so ses scarificacio sian ventozas que so pausadas sus le fetge, e sobre la melsa e podagra, e sobre le umbelic, en les locs dels jonolhs, e la pixida del ancha, quar aquestz membres no suffertan scarificacio sobre si.	More, the winds that are to be burned are those that are on the face, and on the belly and on the heel, and on the flanks, and the navel, because these members do not suffer from the burn.</start_of_turn
E no es querit per aquelas sino atraccio de sanc de membre, ayssi cum pausam ventosa sobre mamilha en malautia de flux de sanc del sanc de las nars; e usam de aquela per que sia dissolvuda ventositat freja inviscade del membre, ayssi cum pausam sobre le ventre e l’umbelic; quar aquela rarifique le membre e scalfa lu e ramau la dolor quar resolveys ventositat. Forma de ventoza aministrada am foc: sia la amplitud del orrifici de dos ditz, segon que nos la havem formada; e la quantitat del preon sia la maytat de un palm; e sia en lo latz de lu, en le loc que es en le circuit, la maytat de lu, le trauc sia petit segon la quantitat que intre en lu una agulha.
Sia fayta de eram rog o citri, de grosses marges, leon, enguals e terses per so que no leda le membre deves la sua posicio sobre lu.	Sia fayta de eram rog o citri, de grosses marges, leon, enguals e terses per so que no leda le membre deves la sua posicio sobre lu.

E la qualitat de pausar aquesta ventoza am foc sobre le membre es que extenda la meca am foc de lenha decentment denant una pauca candela de cera, e pausa aquela sobre le mieg de la vergua transversa en le mieg loc de la ventoza, per que le foc sia accendut enviro la partida dejos per que no sia comburit le cors del malaute. E aprop sia pausada sobre le membre del malaute, e le dit sia sobre le trauc que havem dit, entro que quan tenem las ventozas e non indigem que osten le dit e que yesca la vapor sobre aquel trauc, lahoras la ventoza sira tantost dissolvuda. Mays en ventosa que es aministrada en la malautia de plauressi, am aygua, en la qual no ha vergua transversa ni trauc, e no es aministrada sino que sia umplida de aygua, e es pausada sobre le membre tant solament.
