Capitol .xcvii.	Capitol .xcvii.
Sanguissuguas no so administradas en motz membres sino en les membres en les quals non es possible posicio de ventosas, per la parvitat de aquels, ayssi cum le pot e gingiva e semblantz a lor; o en membre denudat de carn, ayssi cum le dit e·l nas e lors semblantz.	Sanguissuguas are not administered in all limbs but only in those in which the position of the veins is not possible due to their small size, thus as with the thumb and little finger; or in limb devoid of flesh, thus as with the nose and ear and the like.
E la qualitat de usar de aquelas que si has trobadas sanguisugas que so en las ayguas dossas de poyredura mundas.	And as for those who have found blood in the joints of the feet, it is necessary to use those which have been proven to be useful in similar cases.</end_of_turn>
E aprop sian layssadas le dia e la nueyt en aygua dossa entro que sian famolentas, e que no romangua alcuna causa en le ventre de aquelas; e aprop sia evacuat le cors en le comensament am fleubotomia e am ventozas; e aprop fregua le membre del malaute entro que s’enrojezesca; e aprop sian pausadas sobre lu.	And so they should be left lying down both day and night in warm water until they have recovered; and let no cause remain in their belly; and let the body be evacuated at the beginning with bleeding and vomiting; and let the limb of the patient be cooled down until it turns red; and let them be kept still.</end_of_turn
E cum son umplidas e caso.	When they are swollen and the case is severe.</end_of_turn>
E si es possible succio del loc am ventoza, es mays derier en juvament.	And if it is possible to drain the abscess with a needle, it is better to do so urgently.</end_of_turn
E sino, lahoras lava le loc am vi agre e aprop am mota aygua; e sia freguat e expremut.	And if not, let the area be washed with warm vinegar and then covered with moist cotton wool; let it be moistened and squeezed out frequently.</end_of_turn
E si es prolonguat le cors del sanc aprop le cazement de las sanguissuguas, e es aquo resudan, lahoras tu enfon un drap de li en aygua freja, e pausa aquel de sobre entro que sia abdida la resudacio.	And if the course of the illness persists despite the bloodletting, when there remains something, let you put in a cold compress in the water, and let that remain there until the discharge has ceased.</end_of_turn
E si le sanc es multiplicat, lahoras polveriza sobre lu vitriol trissat, o guallas e semblantz a lor de las causas stipticas, entro que·l sanc sia abscidit; o sian pausadas sobre le loc las maytatz de favas excocicadas, e sian layssadas entro que las favas aderescan al loc, e es le sanc abscidit.	And if the illness is widespread, let you sprinkle over it powdered vitriol, or eggs and things that resemble the causes of the disease, until the illness has subsided; or let their hands be placed over the area with burnt barley, and let them remain there until the barley adheres to the area, and the illness will subside.</end_of_turn
E cove, si es necessaria, iteracio de sanguissuguas, quan es possible mudar aquelas.	And if necessary, repeat the bloodletting, when possible changing those.</end_of_turn
E si las sanguissuguas son prohibidas de suspenssio, lahoras sia freguat le loc am sanc recent o fique una agulha en les locs entro que yesca sanc; e aprop sian pausadas, quar aquelas quan sento alcun sanc tantost adarysso.	And if bloodletting is prohibited, let the area be frequently washed with the recent blood or leave a needle in the area until the pain subsides; and let them rest, for in this way the pain will cease to exist.</end_of_turn>
E quan voles que cajan, polveriza sobre aquelas un pauc de aloen trissat, o sal, o cendre, e cazo tantost.	And when you wish to calm them, sprinkle over them a little powdered aloe or salt or ash, and cover them all.</end_of_turn
Ayssi comensa lo prolec de la tersa partida: de restauracio.	Thus ends the treatise on restoration.</end_of_turn>
Aquest capitol es motas veguadas necessari en la art de medicina; e es restauracio de fractura e de dislocacio accident en les osses.	This chapter is very useful in the art of medicine; and is restoration of fracture and dislocation of bones.</end_of_turn
O, filh, sapiatz que jactan se de aquest capitol les fols metges e les vulguars e aquels que degun temps no reguardero les libres dels Antics ni legiro de aquels una letra.	Oh, my son, be aware that many physicians and vulgar people and those who have not studied the works of the Ancients or read any of their books neglect this chapter.</end_of_turn
E per aquesta causa es fayt que aquesta manieyra dels scients in terra nostra es privat; e yeu no ho e obliat en aquo degun temps be de tot; e no he adhibit aquo que apres, sino per longitut de lectio dels libres dels Antics e studi sobre le entendement de aquels, entro que extrayssi la sciencia de aquels.	And for this reason it is useful that this method of the learned in our land is kept secret; and I have not forgotten it at any time in my life; and I have not hesitated to share it with anyone, but only after I had studied the works of the Ancients and understood them thoroughly.</end_of_turn
E aprop adirigui a experiment e studi en la longitut de la mieua vida.	And I have confirmed this with experiments and studies throughout my life.</end_of_turn
E yeu ja he de aquo descrit en aquest capitol tot aquo que conte la mieua sciencia e sobre le qual es passat lo mieu experiment; pus que agui abreujat aquo a vos autres e deliuregui aquo de occupacio de elonguacio; e abreujegui aquo en la fi de abreujacio; et e monstrat aquo en la fi de declaracio; e formegui en aquo motas formas dels sturmentz que so administratz en aquel, cum es fayt per addicio de declaracio, ayssi cum he fayt en dos capitols precedentz.	And I have already described in this chapter all that I have learned about this science and about what I have learned from my own experience; for I have abridged what is proper to you others and spared you the burden of lengthy discussions; and I have summed up everything in the end; and I have shown you in the end of the declaration what means to administer these treatments, just as I have done in the two preceding chapters.</end>
Capitol primier.	First Chapter.</end_of_turn>
Summae et collectiones ex esse fracturae ossium, ex eis quarum praemissio necessaria est, antequam incipiamus rememorationem membrorum fraftorum et diversorum si uniuscuiusque.	Summary and collection of all that pertains to fractures of bones, from which it is necessary to depart before we proceed to the remembrance of fractured limbs and various other similar things.</end_of_turn
Cove donc que diguam en le prohemi de aquest capitol las summas del sermo; e les capitols al entendament dels quals en le comensament es forsat le artifexs e a stacio sobre la veritat de aquels; so es vos e aquels que so promptz que sapian o aprenguan aquesta art nobla autres de vos.	Therefore we will speak in this chapter of the sums of the discourse; and of the chapters which are necessary to understand, for which the artificers and those who are skilled in this art are accustomed to depart from the customary methods and to seek the truth of things.</end_of_turn
E donc dic que quan accideys a alcu fractura o dislocacio o torcio o cazement, lahoras cove que tu te coytes al comensament am fleubotomia o aleyar aquel, o quascu ensemps, si no prohibeys alcuna causa, ayssi cum debelitat de vertut, o es aquel al qual accideys effant, o viel en decrepitat, o es temps de vehement calor, o de vehement freg.	Therefore I say that when an accident of fracture or dislocation or twist or any case occurs, let them cover themselves at the beginning with bleeding or apply some means, or whatever they think is necessary, if it does not impede the virtue, or if it is not possible to do otherwise, because of excessive heat or excessive cold.</end_of_turn
E aprop sia content en vianda sieua de erbas frejas e de carns de auzels e de crabotz; e prohibem carns grossas e umplir si de viandas e de tota vianda que umple las venas de sanc, entro que siras segurat de apostema caut, e si no temes efusio de materia al membre.	And let them be content with their ordinary food of fresh herbs and fish and poultry and crabs; and let them abstain from large meats and from fatty foods and from all food that fills the veins of the patient, until they are assured of the absence of a cauter on the limb.
E lahoras retorne le malaute al sieu regiment primier am le qual corr costuma de lu.	And the time has come to return the patient to their seat, which is where they usually sit.
E donc cum le os trencat comensa esser restaurat, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia pascut de viandas nutritivas de nutriment mot e gros e greu en les quals sia viscositat, ayssi cum so viandas faytas de froment cueyt am aygua, e ris, e caps, e pes, e ventres de vacas, e huous, e peys fresc, e vi gros e semblants ad aquels, e am aquest regiment es fayta coagulacio de fractura pus leugierament e miels.	And when the bones have healed, the time has come to feed the patient nourishing and soft foods such as bread soaked in water, broth, eggs, fish, beef, barley, peas, and lentils, because this regimen is sufficient to promote the coagulation of the fracture most gently and quickly.</end_of_turn>
E sapias que les osses trinquatz quan so en les homes que so en la primiera vilura e en los decrepitz, no es possible que sian continuatz e sian consolidatz segon lur natura per la exsiccacio dels membres de lor.	Note that bones that have fractured in the joints persist in their first rigor and in the decrepit, it is not possible for them to be continued and consolidated according to their nature due to the exhaustion of their limbs.</end_of_turn>
E son consolidatz e continuatz segon lor natura tot temps per la exsiccacio de aquels membres, e so continuatz e consolidatz aquels que so de lor en la fi de la lenitat, ayssi cum les osses dels petitz effantz.	They are consolidated and continued according to their nature throughout the exhaustion of these limbs, and are continued and consolidated until the end of convalescence, just as the bones of the small joints.</end_of_turn
Mays empero natura ajusta e amnecteys sobre le os trencat de tota partida alcuna causa semblant a glut en le qual es grossitut que adhereys e strenh aquel entro que so ensemps conglutinatz e liatz ensemps, entro que venen la fi de fortitut e de fermesa, ayssi cum foc al comensament, entro que denguna causa no prohibeys aquel de las suas obres.	More importantly, nature adapts and remembers that a fractured bone has been cured of any cause resembling swelling in which a thickness adheres and strengthens that which has been joined together until the end of its nourishment and rest, just as fire at the beginning, until any cause hinders this work.</end_of_turn
E per aquesta causa es necessari que pauses las viandas del malaute, viandas en las quals so gravitat e viscozitat e grosseza, ayssi cum havem dit.	Therefore, it is necessary to abstain from feeding the patient foods that are heavy and viscous and large, as we have said.</end_of_turn
Mota diversitat de fractura segon diversitat del membre.	There are various types of fractures according to the part of the limb.</end_of_turn
E sapias que las specias de fractura son diversas segon la diversitat dels membres, quar fractura del os de la camba es diversa de la fractura del os del cap; e la fractura del os del pietz es divers de la fractura del os del dos; e semblantment totz les autres membres son diverses entre lor.	Note that the species of fracture are diverse according to the diversity of the limbs, for example, the fracture of the limb bone is different from the fracture of the skull bone; the fracture of the foot bone is different from the fracture of the thigh bone; and so on with all the other limbs.</end_of_turn
E yeu venc am rememoracio de tota specia de fractura, expausada en le sieu capitol distincta del autre.	And I recall all the species of fracture, which are distinguished in the capitol distinct from each other.</end_of_turn>
Mota diversitat de fractura en si meteyssa.	There are various types of fractures in general.</end_of_turn
E son diversificadas las specias de fractura del os en lor meteyssas; quar es fayta fractura arcuada otra aquo que accidan en lu stellas; e alcunas veguadas es fayta fractura segon la longitut del os: e so las fracturas de lu satagia e astelhas e addicios procedentz e no-procedentz, ayssi cum es fayt en la pena quan es preparada a escriure, e es fractura am plagua e disrupcio en le cap, e es fractura fissura petita.	They are diversified by the species of bone from which they originate; for example, a curved fracture is different from a fracture of the stellate bones; some fractures are classified as slight fractures according to their length: and the fractures of the skin and bones of the extremities are distinguished from each other, just as it is in writing when one writes with ink, and there is a fracture with bruising and disruption in the head, and there is a slight fracture of the bone.</end_of_turn
E a tota specia es engen o turment propri en restauracio de lu segon que vindra rememoracio de lu distincta en les sieus locs.	And for each species there is a peculiar remedy or treatment for its restoration according to what is remembered of its distinction in the different places.</end_of_turn
Mota senhal de fractura del os.	A sign of a fractured bone.</end_of_turn
E per aquo es conoguda fractura del os: es tortuositat de lu, e de aquel eminencia e appericio de lu al sentiment, e so de lu quan compremes aquel am la tua ma.	And for this reason a fracture of the bone is known: it is a twisting of the limb, and of that protrusion and appearance of the limb to the touch, and so on when one grasps it with the hand.</end_of_turn
E donc quan no es en le loc tortuositat apparent ni so no es feyt deves le tieu tocament quan toques le os am agitacio e le malaute no atroba gran dolor, lahoras no es aqui fractura.	Therefore, when there is no apparent twisting or pain when touching the limb, and the patient does not experience great pain, it is not a fracture in this case.</end_of_turn
Habantz es possible que sia tortuositat o petita fissura, adon no cove que tu mauguas aquel am la tua ma e am compressio de tot; habantz pausa sobre lu de las medicinas de las quals ve rememoracio aprop aquel moment le qual conveneys al loc; e aprop sia streyt per strictura subtil.	It is possible that it is a slight twisting or small fracture, in which case you must not touch the limb with your hand or compress it; in this case pause for a moment and remember the medications that are appropriate at that moment; and do not hesitate to seek stricture if necessary.</end_of_turn
E sapias que·l loc quan es arcuat e no es scindit en dos o otra aquo que no accidan en lu satagie, cum es remauguda tota partida de la sua compar, lahoras cove que comenses de la tua hora a rectificacio de lu habantz que a lu accida apostema caut.	Note that when the limb is curved and is not fractured into two or more pieces, as when the whole limb is affected, the time has come to begin to restore the limb that has been injured since the previous injury.</end_of_turn
E si a lu accida apostema caut, lahoras layssa aquel per alcus dias entro que cesse le apostema; e aprop engualha aquel segon quascuna manieyra que podes de levitat e de engen.	If there is a subsequent injury, leave it for a few days until the swelling subsides; and then support it according to any manner that you can manage to elevate and treat.</end_of_turn
E sapias que restauracio de lu e agulacio de lu es pus leugiera que del os en le qual accideysso sathagie.	Note that the restoration of the limb and the treatment of the swelling are lighter than the bone from which the injury originates.</end_of_turn
E aprop strenh aquel segon que vindra la rememoracio de lu.	And do what is necessary according to what is remembered.</end_of_turn
Mays si en le os so satagias, lahoras es necessaria extencio de aquest membre trencat de doas partz, si es la ma o le pe; o am la tua ma si le membre es petit; o am doas cordas o am una corda e la ma.	Note that even if there are fractures, it is necessary to extend this limb fractured in two parts, whether it is the hand or the foot; or with your hand if the limb is small; or with two strings or with one string and the hand.</end_of_turn
E sia la tua posicio am la qual pauses le membre loc engual segon la sua figura natural, mentre que las partidas so extandudas del membre trenquat, lahoras te perforsa que fassas retornar aquelas addicios am engen e segon quascuna manieyra que poyras en lor locs.	And keep the limb in the position in which you found it, while the fractured parts are extended from the limb, so that you can restore those attachments with engineering and according to any way you can manage in their places.</end_of_turn
E guarda te segon la tua forssa que no accida sobre le malaute per la tua operacio delor ni lesio; e perforsa te segon le tieu poder que tu appliques la un os am l’autre son companho segon lors milhors formas.	Keep your force under control so as not to harm the patient during your operation for pain or injury; and pierce according to the tissue's power, since its companion will be with you in a thousand forms.
E cove que en aquela hora aprofitablament tu toques am la tua ma aquel, e si vezes aqui alcuna causa diversa, rectifiqua aquel e enguala aquel per la quantitat de la tua vertut.	Therefore take advantage of your touch at that moment with your hand, and if sometimes there is some other cause, rectify that and embrace that for the quantity of your virtue
E exquiva vehement extenssio e compressio, ayssi cum fan mots fols metges que motas veguadas fan accidir apostema caut per la sua operacio, o fan accidir contraccio en le membre ayssi cum havem vist aquo per la operacio de lor motas veguadas.	Avoid excessive extension and compression, just as foolish doctors do when they make incisions with their cautery, or when they cause contraction in the limb just as we have seen in the treatment of their boils.
E aprop annecteys, aprop equacio e decent operacio e strictura de aquel membre, e repaus e tranquilitat; amoneste le malaute sobre aquo e fay le squivar que no maugua aquel en la hora de las suas vigilias e del sieu dormir, e ves la sua revolucio e agitacio, e deves la sua egestio, e deves totz les sieus movementz am tota la sua vertut; e aguarda se que la posicio del membre sia posicio am la qual sia asegurada la dolor, la qual causa es quar quan sent en la disposicio de la posicio del membre delor o lesio; lahoras cove que permutes aquel ad autra disposicio de aquela am la qual non senta dolor; e guarda am aquo que la posicio de lu aquela sia dreyta e engual, per so que al membre non accida tortuositat quan es restaurat.	And nearby attach, nearby equality and decent operation and tightening of that limb, and rest and tranquility; remind the patient about this and make him squat so that he does not faint in the hour of his vigil and sleep, and see his revolution and agitation, and must his egestion, and must all his movements with all his might; and wait until the limb is in a position in which the pain is secured; for when it is placed in the position of the painful limb or injury, the hour covers that you change that to another position in which there is no pain; and keep in that which the position of them is firm and equal, so that the limb does not suffer from torsions when it is restored.
E la qualitat de la strictura del membre tranquat es aquela que yeu recomti; per que sapias que·ls membres trencatz so diversificatz en lor parvitat e en lor grandeza e en la forma de aquels.	And the quality of the tightening of the limb is that which I recommend; for you know that limbs are varied in their smallness and greatness and in their shape like those.</end_of_turn>
E de aquels que son petits ayssi cum le bras e·l dit e·l focil e semblantz ad aquels, lahoras cove que la envolucio sia de drap mol subtil.	And of those that are small like the arm and the thumb and the forefinger and the like, the hour covers that the covering should be of fine matter.</end_of_turn>
Mays aquels que so grosses ayssi cum la cuoyssa o la camba, cove que en aquels sia envolucio lada e dura, quar la liadura lada connecteys le membre gran e strenh aquel de tota part am strictura engual, enayssi que en lu no intre macula.	More of those that are rough like the cushion or the limb, cover that in them should be a tough covering, which can connect the large limb firmly and strengthen that throughout the tightening equal, so that there is no maculation.</end_of_turn

And nearby comes, nearby your evacuation of equality, pause the convenient ligament at the place of that fracture with three coverings or four as the limb deserves; and strengthen your hand a little on the ligament.</end_of_turn>
E aprop ve am aquel a la partida pus sobirana del loc de la fractura, e strenh mens que no foc la tua strictura am la qual has strengut le loc de la fractura.	And nearby look at that to the upper part of the place of the fracture, and strengthen less than you have strengthened the place of the fracture.</end_of_turn
E aprop elongua te am envolucio del loc de la fractura un pauc, e mollifiqua la strictura petit a petit, entro que prenguas del loc sa una gran partida.	And nearby lengthen your covering of the place of the fracture a little, and soften the tightening little by little, until you have grasped the great part of the place.</end_of_turn
E aprop pren una autra benda e envolveys aquela autra veguada sobre le loc trenquat am envolucio, e aprop ve am las envolucios a la partida pus dejos de la fractura; e sia la tua operacio en la strictura de la envolucio e en mollificacio de aquela segon que havem dit en la envolucio primieyra desus.	And nearby take another bandage and cover that other wound over the fractured limb with the covering, and nearby look at the coverings to the part beyond the fracture; and let your operation be in the tightening of the covering and in the softening of that as we have said in the first covering.</end_of_turn
E aprop pausa entre las volucios de stopa leon o drap am le qual sia engualada la tortuositat de la fractura, si en lu es tortuositat; e sino, no pauses en lu alcuna causa.	And nearby rest between the stops of stone or material which is equal to the twisting of the fracture, if there is twisting in it; and if not, do not rest in it for any cause.</end_of_turn
E aprop pausa sobre lu autra benda, e aprop enguala sobre aquestas envolucios stelhas decentment faytas tantost, si en le loc no es imflacio o apostema caut, e lahoras pausa sobre lu aquo que sede le apostema aquel e que oste la imflacio; e layssa aquela per alcus jorns; e lahoras tu strenh sobre lu las stelhas.	And nearby rest over it another bandage, and nearby cover these firm coverings well enough, if in the limb there is no swelling or cautery burn, and the hour rests over it until the swelling has gone down; and let that rest for a few days; and the hour strengthens over them.</end_of_turn
E sian las stelhas de la maytat de canna lada raza, e be formada saviament; o sian de fust de pi; o de ramps de palma ; e sia le ample de quascuna stelha segon aquesta forma e aquesta figura:	And the strips of the greater part of the cane are of rough race, and be formed wisely; or of boxwood; or of palm branches; and let the width of any strip be like this form and this figure:</start_turn><end_turn>
Empero cove que la astelha que es pausada sobre aquela fractura sia pus grossa e pus lada un petit que las autras astelhas, e la longitut de la stela segon qu’es legut al membre en magnitut e parvitat; e aprop strenh sobre las astelhas am autra benda segon la tua primieyra strictura; e aprop lia desus am fiel decentment segon que havem dit de strictura, e es que sia la tua strictura segon le loc de la fractura mes, e quant mes es alonguat de la fractura, es mendre la strictura.	But the strap that is placed over that fracture must be thicker and stronger than the others, and the length of the strap according to what is legible to the limb in magnitude and size; and nearby strengthen over the straps with another bandage according to your first tightening; and nearby secure them faithfully enough according to what we have said of tightening, that is to say that it is your tightening according to the place of the fracture, and as much as it is elongated from the fracture, it is better to tighten.
E cove que les fils sian migiers en grossesa e subtilitat, e sian de li mol; e si les fils so grosses, ayssi cum yeu he vist per la operacio de alcus fols pausantz les lors fils de cordas de li tort, e es error gran, quan catz la strictura fora equalitat.	And cover that the threads be thinner in thickness and fineness, and be of lead; and if the threads are rough, just as I have seen in the treatment of boils, let them be of cords of lead during the tightening, for it is a great error when the tightening is unequal.</end_of_turn
E eyssament fils subtils no so convenientz, quar tu no consaguiras per strictura am aquels aquo que voles, e no cove que entre astela e astela haja mens de un dit.	And certainly fine threads are not convenient, because you will not succeed in tightening with them as much as you wish, and do not cover that there should be less than a finger between the strips.</end_of_turn

And if the patient is like that for the extremities of the strips, nearby tighten in those places at the times, the hour rests from leaving those of stone or wicks until they do not cause him injury.</end_of_turn
Alcunas veguadas fractura es am plagua, e accideys disrupcio en la codena, e yeu vindre am rememoracio en aquela en le capitol segon singularitat.	Some veins are fractured due to the plague, and accidental disruption in the coccyx, and I remember that in the capital according to singularity.
E sapias que ges tot membre trencat no es streyt am stelhas al primier dia; la qual causa es quar le membre, quan es gran, no cove que pauses sobre lu stelhas sino aprop v dias o vii o mays, segon la tua seguratat de adveniment de apostema caut.	And indeed, that all the limbs fractured thus are not straight from the first day; the cause of which is that when the limb is great, it does not suffice to rest upon it immediately but rather after a few days or eight or ten, according to your estimate of the progress of the swelling
E aquesta es la manieyra dels emplaustres am les quals les Antics restauravan, les quals so pausatz sobre fractura e dislocacio e torcio.	This is the way the ancients restored those with fractures, dislocations and twists
Manieyra de emplaustra comu abruejat de restaurament de fractura, convenient a motas compleccios e majorment a las femnas e als efantz, quar es de aquo sobre le qual no ventz calor ni freg: e es que prenguas de polvera de moli, e es la medula de la farina que pen deves le movement de la mola en las paretz del moli.	Method of dressing for the restoration of fractures, suitable for complex wounds and mainly for women and men, because it is of that from which neither heat nor cold arises: take powder of nutmeg, which is the middle of the wheat that hangs between the barley in the wheat heads.
E comfeys aquel ayssi cum es, sino que cribelles aquel am album de huou, e pausa la comfeccio de lu no-spessa ni subtil; e aprop usa de aquela.	And so be it, but if it is like this, do not burn that album of herbs, and stop the feeding of it so that it does not become thick or viscous; and use this instead
Autra manieyra de emplaustre restaurant fractura e dislocacio e torcio: recipe de assafetida, de lapdanum, de acacia, de enula, e migrach, que es razit de milgraner salvage, de totz ana drac. x; de mirra e aloen ana drac. v; alochil ana drac. xx; totz sian trissatz e cribellatz e sian mesclatz am aygua alichil o am album de huou si la compleccio del malaute es scalfada; e aprop usa de aquest emplaustre, quar es de bona composicio e restaura les osses trencatz leugierament, e confereys a motz homes.	Another method of dressing for fracture, dislocation and sprain: recipe of asphalt, lapdanum, acacia, enula and marjoram, which is ground from a thousand grains of barley, five drachmas of myrrh and five of aloes, twenty drachmas of aloe. All these are ground and sieved and mixed with water or with egg white if the patient's wound is raw; and apply this dressing, which is of good composition and restores the broken bones pleasantly, and cheers up the patients.
Autra manieyra de emplaustre le qual comfereys a fractura e torcio: recipe migrach e met de altea blanca ana drac. x; de mirra e de aloen ana drac v; de acacia drac. vi; de bol armenic drac. .xx.	Another method of dressing for fracture and sprain: recipe of marjoram and white alum applied in drachmas x; of myrrh and aloes applied in drachmas v; of acacia in drachmas vi; of beeswax in drachmas xx.
Totz sian trissatz en mortier am mota contricio, e sian cribellatz, e sian comfitz am aygua o am album de huou e sia administrat.	All are triturated in a mortar with the surrounding mortar, and are ground, and are comforted with water or with that album of herbs and should be administered
Manieyra de emplaustre a juncturas e osses separatz de lors locs, e seda dolor accident en aquels e a fissuras e fractaduras: sia presa lana sutza e sia submersa en vi agre e oli cuyt e sia pausat sobre le loc.	Method of dressing for joints and separated bones of these places, and for pain that occurs in these in fractures and breaks: take a lancet and immerse it in vinegar and oil and apply it to the place.
Mays en aquest emplastre no es vertut de restauracio, de apostema caut e expelleys dolors propriament.	Note that in this dressing there is no virtue of restoration, of cautery and expulsion of pain properly
Autra manieyra de emplastre que restaura os trancat: pren fuelas de figuier sort e fuelas de papaver salvatge; contereys tot e fay emplastre de lor.	Another method of dressing that restores the fractures: take figs leaves out and poppy seeds saved; contain all and make a dressing of them.
Manieyra de emplastre abreujat aministrat deves la restauracio de fractura de os e quan tu voles resolucio del romanent de apostema: recipe razitz de altea, de camamilla e flors de violes, de farina de ers, de totz ana partida .i.; sian totz trissatz e sian cofitz am vi, si·l membre no es scalfat.	Method of brief dressing administered after the restoration of fracture of bones and when you want to resolve the remaining swelling: recipe of broth, chamomile and violets flowers, barley flour, all of which is ground together. All are ground and comforted with vinegar, if the limb is not scabbed
Mays si es scalfat, lahoras comfeys aquel am aygua de coliandre humit o am aygua e usa de lu.	If it is scabbed, however, the hours comfort with lukewarm water of calendula or with water and use it
Autra manieyra de emplastra pus fort en resolucio que aquest primier, quan accideys apostema dur deves la restauracio del membre: recipe de razitz de altea e de semensa de li, e de balaustia, e mellilot, majorana, flors de viol, de camamilla, de totz ana partida i engual; totz sian trissatz e sian cofitz am aygua de sauze o am aygua dousa o am vi, tot aquo segon la qualitat del membre e le repaus de la color de lu.	Another method of dressing more powerful in resolving than the previous one, when the accident of swelling is to be overcome for the restoration of the limb: recipe of broth and linseed seeds, of barley, marigold, violets flowers, chamomile, all of which are ground together and comforted with broth or lukewarm water or vinegar, according to the quality of the limb and the degree of swelling.
Mays Ypocras no diyssec en le sieu libre que sia pausat sobre le membre trenquat deves la restauracio de lu sino cerot fayt de cera e de oli e no autre causa; e recomtec que sia migier entre grossitut e subtilitat.	Ipocras does not say in his book that it should be placed on the fractured limb except for the purpose of making a cautery of wax and oil and not for any other reason; and I recommend that it be more moderate between thickness and thinness
Mays a Gualia es vist que sian pausatz sobre le membre trencat deves la restauracio de lu e las causas en las quals es exsiccacio am petit de caliditat so ayssi cum mirra, enses e semblantz a lor de aquelas causas que havem recomtadas.	It is seen in Gaul that it is placed on the fractured limb after the restoration of the limb and the causes in which it is useful except for those of small heat so as nutmeg, cinnamon and the like of those causes that we have recommended
Manieyra de emplastre que comfereys a lesio e dolor: recipe migat, de cezes, de pels de home inscizes o pena de auzel, e de altea, e sal, partidas enguals; sian trissatz e cribellatz e sian cofitz, e sia fayt emplastre.	Manieyra de emplastre que comfereys a lesio e dolor: recipe migat, de cezes, de pelos de home inscizes o pena de auzel, e de altea, e sal, partidas enguals; sian trissatz e cribellatz e sian cofitz, e sia fayt emplastre.
Mays la quantitat segon la qual cove que romangua la liadura e aprop sia disliada, es que consideres si no es accidit dolor ni pruziment ni le os es trencat no es maugut de son loc, lahoras tu no deslies de motz jorns.	May the quantity according to which you cover that remains to be loose, is that you consider if it is not excessive pain or swelling or that it is not broken, it is not gout of its place.
E si accideys al loc dolor vehement o prusiment o imflacio, lahoras tu te coyte o deslie aquel en la hora, e osta le emplastre de lu.	And if by chance there is acute pain or swelling or inflammation, then you must cover it up or remove it at that moment, and leave the dressing on it.
E pren drap de li e spongia marina leon humida, e submergeys aquela en aygua tebeza, e am aquela lava le loc entro que cesse aquel pruziment e la dolor sia sedada; e aprop layssa repausar le membre per una hora; e aprop pausa sobre lu lana sutza submersa en vi agre e oli o oli rozat, e lia sobre lu per una nuoyt entro que sias segur de apostema caut, e que repause la imflacio del membre, e sia remauguda la dolor de lu.	And take sponge of lint and wet sponge of marine leather, and immerse that in lukewarm water, and wash the area until the swelling subsides and the pain is relieved; and then place a bandage over the area covered in vinegar and oil or olive oil, and bind over it for a night until you are sure that the burn has subsided, and that the swelling of the limb has gone down, and that the pain has disappeared
E aprop itera aquela strictura subtil e emplastre petit e no·l strenhas per la tua constriccio primieyra, e subtilia am aquel entro que sia sanat. E si vezes que le apostema e la rogor e la dolor e la imflacio e tots les accidentz ja so remaugutz de tot, e indigeysses de emplastre e de strictura, lahoras tu itera aquel ayssi cum has fayt al comensant engualment.	And if sometimes the burn and the swelling and the pain and the inflammation have already subsided, and all the accidents have already passed, and you do not need dressing or constriction, then you repeat that just as you began with the initial application of the gum
E si no accideys al membre alcuna causa de aquelas que havem ditas, lahoras no deslies aquel sino aprop tres dias o quatre o v o .vii.; e alcunas veguadas tot aquo es layssat per xx dias segon que a tu appar per la desliadura del membre, ayssi cum havem dit, entro que la fractura adhereys, e se acosta a la coagulacio de la carn sobre aquel.	And if no other cause has happened to the limb than those that we have mentioned, then do not remove it until three or four or five or seven days. and some days later when the limb is well enough for the discharge of the limb, as we have said, until the fracture has healed, and the coagulacy of the flesh over it has taken place.
E lahoras ajusta en la strictura mays que en la tua strictura primieyra tota, e ayusta en la engrossacio de la vianda del malaute, segon que es precedida la rememoracio de lu.	And adjust in the tightening more than in your first tightening throughout, and adjust in the feeding of the patient according to the memory of that.
Mays si tu vezes le loc de la fractura ja desiccar e extenuar mays que no cove, lahoras sapias que·l nutriment es prohibit pervenir ad aquel; e donc embroca aquel am aygua tebeza deves tota veguada que delias aquel; e sia aquo en totz tres dias; e alleuja la strictura un petit, e per aquesta operacio corr al membre le nutriment, e es sanat leugierament.	More if sometimes the limb of the fracture has already dried and extended more than if you do not cover it, however, you must know that the feeding is prohibited to reach that; and therefore you must give that nourishment with lukewarm water throughout that time; and do it every three days; and slightly relieve the tightening. For this operation, go to the limb the nourishment, and it will be healed without discomfort.
Mays aquo que fan les fols restauradors de la fractura del membre autra veguada quan no es restaurat al comensament, segon que cove, e es restaurat segon tortuositat, es error segon la operacio de lor, e temor gran, e si fos dreyturier aquo agrandit les Antics en lors libres e agueran am aquo obrat.	More than what the doctors of the fracture of the limb do, another time when it is not restored at the beginning, according to the covering, and is restored according to crookedness, is an error according to their operation, and is a great fear, and if it were known that it would increase the complaints in their free time, they would abstain from it
E yeu no he vist ad alcu de lor aquo far, per que es pus razonable que aquo no fassa.	I have not seen anyone who does that, for it is more reasonable not to do it.
Capitol segon: De fractura quan accideys en le cap.	Chapter: Of fracture when it happens in the head.
Las specias de fracturas son motas, e las figuras de lor son diversas, e las causas son distinctas, quar de fracturas alcuna es fayta per percussio de spaza, e la percussio osta tot le os entro al ciphac, le qual es dejos le os, ayssi cum fay ayssa en le fust, e per aquo aquesta specia es nompnada ascial; o la spaza inscideys alcuna partida del os, e inscideys la carn de lu e no passa la inscizio entro al derier de lu; e aquesta specia de fractura es nompnada levatio absoluta.	The species of fractures are flakes, and their figures are diverse, and the causes are different, for any fracture is caused by the percussion of space, and the percussion stops all the bone within the capsule, which is left to the bone, as it happens in the wrist, and because of this this species is called spiral; or the space affects any part of the bone, and affects the marrow of it and does not pass through the back of it; and this species of fracture is called absolute elevation.
E la plagua de aquestas doas fracturas o es gran o pauca, e de fractura que es contricio o atricio; e causa de lu es percussio am poyra o cazement sobre peyra, e a lor semblantz.	And the sign of these two fractures is great or small, and of fracture that is contracted or retracted; and the cause of it is the percussion with soft or hard objects, and to it they are similar.
E aquesta fractura o es penetrant que ja apropinqua al pannicol le qual es dejos le os; o es en la facia del os, e la plagua de aquestas doas fracturas o es gran o pauca.	And this fracture is penetrating, which already approaches the nerve which is left to the bone; or it is on the face of the bone, and the sign of these two fractures is great or small
E de fractura es que es ameguada en le os, en la subtilitat del cabel petita, e per aquo es nompnada aquesta specia fractura capillar.	And the fracture is that which is hidden in the bone, in the marrow of the small vein, and because of this it is called capillary fracture
E es fractura que es fayta o per cazement o per percussio de peyra e a lu semblantz, que fa intrar alcuna lamina del os a las partidas dedintz, e es fayta en le loc concavitat ayssi cum accideys als payroles de eram quan accideys a lor percussio e es partida de lor intrada a las partidas dedintz.	And the fracture is caused by a blow or by a fall or by percussion of an object and to it they are similar, which makes any lamina of the bone enter into the parts surrounding it, and is found in the hollow part just as when it happens to the nails when they are struck by percussion and enter the surrounding parts
E majorment es fayt aquo en les cors de osses humitz, ayssi cum so caps de efantz.	Mostly it happens in the bones of humors, as in the heads of nails
E so a totas aquestas specias fracturas satagias, so son pessas ayssi cum stelhas separadas.	And all these traumatic fractures are like pieces of glass separated from each other
E yeu vindre am reremoracio de tot aquo en son loc.	And I command you to return everything to its place.
E conoyssem totas aquestas specias de fractura per deteccio sobre aquelas e per inquisicio de lor am tentas e ostament de carn corrumpuda que es sobre lor.	And I recognize all these signs of fracture for their detection on these parts and for their treatment, as well as the putrefaction that is on them.</end_of_turn>
E specia capillar es conoguda per aysso que es descubert sobre le os, e es abstergit, e linit sobre lu am tentha, quar la fractura appar negra.	And the capillary sign is known to help detect fractures, as it is excreted and limits itself on them, making the fracture visible.</end_of_turn
Mays en la curacio de fractura considera al comensament les accidentz del malaute, e lahoras si tu vezes per los accidentz que signifique per significacio manifesta sobre paor, ayssi cum es vomit de colera, e extencio, e perdement de entendament, e abscizio de votz, e sincopi, e febre acuta, e eyssiment dels huels e rogor de aquels, e semblantz a lor dels accidentz en las majors disposicios, ses dopte no es sanat.	Moreover, in the treatment of fractures, attention must be paid to the pre-existing conditions of the patient, and if sometimes for the signs that indicate pain, such as vomiting of bile, extension, loss of consciousness, vomiting of blood, diarrhea, fever, acute jaundice, and even swelling of the joints and stiffness in those.
E si vezes accidentz no-correntz tu speras salut, lahoras tu comensa la curacio de lu.	And if sometimes non-violent accidents happen, then you must begin the treatment of them.</end_of_turn>
La qual causa es quar si es vengut a tu le plaguat en le comensament cum es plaguat e aquo es en les dias de ivern, lahoras cove que tu studias en le ostament del os denant le dia xiiii segon tota disposicio.	The cause of which is that if it is provoked at the beginning like that which happens in the days of spring, then you must study the bone from the fourteenth day onwards according to all possibility.</end_of_turn>
E si es en les dias d’estiu, lahoras cove que te coytes ostar le os denant le vii dia, habantz que aquo que es dejos le os sia corromput del pannicol, e que accidescan les accidentz que havem recomtatz.	And if it is in the summer days, then you must bandage the bone from the seventh day onwards, having understood that what is left of the bone will be putrefied from the marrow, and that you must take care of the accidents that we have recommended.</end_of_turn
E si la fractura ja es pervenguda al pannicol cubrent le cervel, e es am partidas menudas e atricio, lahoras cove que inscidas la partida conminuta e atrita, segon que yeu recomtare a tu.	And if the fracture has already reached the marrow covering the cerebellum, and is small and soft, then you must insert the small fragment and retract it, as I have recommended to you.</end_of_turn
E es que tu razas le cap del malaute plaguat, e descuebres sobre le os segon costuma e manieyra a tu possible segon la figura de la plagua, e que sia leugier sobre le malaute.	And it is that you take hold of the patient's head, uncover the bone according to custom, and handle it as you deem best according to the appearance of the wound, and inquire about the patient's condition.</end_of_turn
E si accideys a tu deves la deteccio del os, fluxs de sanc o apostema caut, lahora tu te oppausa a lu am aquo que cove, e es que huemplas le loc de draps infuzes en vi e oli rozat, e fassa repausar la plagua entro que sia sedat le apostema, e sies segur de fluxs del sanc; e aprop comensa en la circuicio del os e en la ablatio de lu.	And if you happen to see the fracture, flow of pus or soft eschar, then you must oppose yourself to them as much as you can and that you cover them with oil and vinegar, and apply pressure to the wound until the eschar is softened; and ensure the flow of pus; and then begin the circulation of the bone and its reduction.</end_of_turn
E aquo sia segon una de dos manieyras de operacio.	And this is according to two methods of operation.</end_of_turn
E la una manieyra es que tu inscidas le os am inscisori de streyt tal, e aquesta es la forma de lu: E aprop administra un autre inscissori aquest, un pauc pus lat que aquel; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	And one method is that you pierce the bone with a straight incision, and this is how you do it: And you administer another incision, a little wider than the first; and this is how you do it:
E aprop administra mays le inscissori pus lat que·l segon.	And you administer more of the latter incision than the former.</end_of_turn
E cove que sia deves tu nombre de inscissoris diverses, dels quals alcus so pus latz que alcus autres; e alcus de lor so pus breus que·ls autres e sian en le derier de acuitat de las suas extremitatz, e sian de ferr indi o felod.	And you must know the number of various incisions you have made, of which some are wider than others, and some are shorter than others and are at the back of the acuity of their extremities, and are made of iron or steel.</end_of_turn
E usa de lor am facilitat en percussio sobre le inscissori per so que no concutesca le cap e leda aquel.	And use them to facilitate the percussion on the incisions so that you do not break the head and damage the surrounding area.</end_of_turn
E si le os es fort, dur, lahoras cove que perfores en le circuit de lu denant que tu administres los inscissoris am les taravels, les quals so nomnatz taravels no-profundantz.	And if the bone is strong and hard, then you must perforate in the circumference of it before administering the incisions, which are called superficial incisions.</end_of_turn
E no so nomnatz ayssi sino quar aquels no pausan le terme de l’os del test ad aquo que es aprop lu, per so quar al taravel es redonda extremitat o marge sobre aquel que es dejos le cap de lu agut semblant a marge o a cercle petit, le qual prohibeys esser submergit e passar la spissitut del os.	They are not called thus unless they do not stop the term of the bone from the test until it is close to the head of the bone appearing like a margin or small circle, which must not be immersed in liquid or pass the sharpness of the bone.</end_of_turn
E es convenient que tu prenguas de aquestz taravels gran nombre dels quals quascu convenesca a la spicitut de quascun os, entro que sia a tu present en tottz testz del cervel la extremitat del qual sia aguda, la quantitat en longitut e brevitat sia segon la quantitat de spicitut de aquest test.	It is convenient that you take a great number of these superficial incisions, which are appropriate for the sharpness of each bone, until in all tests of the cerebellum the limb that is acute is present, the quantity in length and breadth being according to the quantity of sharpness of this test.</end_of_turn
E aquesta es la forma de tres specias de teravels: La qualitat de perforar en le circuit del os trencat es que pauses le teravel sobre le os e revolvas aquel am les tieus ditz entro que sapias que l’os ja es penetrat; e aprop permuda le terevel ad autre loc, e pausa aquo que es entre tot trauc la quantitat de la grosseza del ray o enviro aquo.	And this is the form of three species of incisions: The quality of perforating in the circumference of the broken bone is that you stop the incision on the bone and rotate it with the thumbs until you see that the bone is already pierced; and then you change the incision to another place and stop when there is no longer any thickness of the ray left.</end_of_turn
E aprop inscideys am inscissoris aquo que es entre quascun trauc del os, e fay aquel pus subtil que podes sobre aquo en fi de levitat, ayssi cum havem dit, entro que erradiques le os, o am la tua ma, o am alcuna autra causa per alcus sturmentz les quals auras apparelhatz ad aquo, ayssi cum tanalhas e forceps subtils.	And finally, you must make incisions around the bone, and do so with such skill that you can lift it up as much as possible, as we have said, until you have removed the bone, or with your hand, or by any other cause that causes these tremors, such as nails and fine forceps.</end_of_turn
E cove que tu guardes am tota cautela que l’inscissori no toque alcuna causa del ciphac.	And you must take great care that the incision does not touch any part of the brain case.</end_of_turn
E donc cum auras circuit le os perforan, e sira separat del ciphac si es continuat am lu, e auras aquel extrayt, cove que razas e enguales aquel en la asperitat de lu de aquo que es en le os am autra sturment semblant a inscissori, mays empero cove que sia pus teon e pus subtil que les autres inscissoris.	Therefore, when the bone is perforated by the urine and if the urine is continued to flow from it, that which is extracted must be covered, because it causes swelling and pain similar to that of an incision, although it is more severe and subtle than other incisions.
E si roman alcuna partida dels osses petitz e satagias, lahoras pren aquela am facilitat am aquo que es deves tu dels sturmentz; e aprop aquo cura la plagua am lichinis e enguentz les quals havem ditz.	And if any small bones or fragments remain, it is necessary to facilitate this with the aid of urine; and in this way the wound will be healed with lichen and the surrounding area will be cleansed, as we have already said
E l’autra manieyra de operacio es leugiera, longinqua de paor, la qual diyssec Gualia e la lauzec per gran lausor; e aquest es le sermo de lu: necessari es a tu en le comensament que comenses descobrir la partida del os del loc en le qual es la fractura pus vehement e pus manifesta, entro que quan auras descubert aquela partida e auras pausat dejos lu la extremitat de aquest inscissori lent e alegre del qual aquesta es la forma:	And another method of treatment is light and long, which is called Galen and Lawrence for great pain; and this is its meaning: it is necessary at the beginning to uncover the part of the bone in the place where the fracture is most violent and obvious, until when you have uncovered that part and have stopped, the limb of this incision will recover slowly and peacefully as a result of this
E es que la partida lenticular es leon e no inscideys alcuna causa, e la partida aguda es de lu en dos latz avantz en longitut, ayssi cum vezes; que la partida lenticular sia ajustada al ciphac am la facia de lu inscident aguda en le os.	For the lens-shaped part is soft and does not cause any other lesion, while the acute part is towards two sides of the length, as sometimes; that the lens-shaped part be adjusted to the bladder with the face of the acute incision on the bone.
E aprop percuteys sobre le inscissori de una partida am un petit malhet entro que inscidas tot le os am facilitat ayssi cum es revolvut, e tu sias segur del pannicol que no accida en lu accident que temas en denguna manieyra, e si le medicant14 era le pus fol de totz les homes e le mays ignorant de lor; certament, e si era dorment.	And in this way pierce over the incision with a small mallet so that the bone is facilitated in this way as if it were rotated, and you must be sure that the bladder does not suffer any damage in this process, for which reason the physician must be the most learned of all men and the most ignorant of it. Certainly, if he was asleep.
Lahoras si romania alcuna causa annexa al os del pannicol en alcus locs de os, inscidira aquel de lu am la extremitat del inscissori aquel lenticular, e deliuraria aquel de lu am facilitat, quar es deliurat de lu ses nocument e ses paor.	And if there remains any accessory cause attached to the bone of the bladder in the vicinity of the bone, it will cause the limb of the incision to become painful in that part, and it will swell, which is to say that it swells without pain at night and without fear
E si fractura del os no penetra entro al pannicol, e aquo que es abscidit o es ostat del os es la facia de lu, e roman en lu asperitat e satagias subtils, lahoras cove que razas aquela asperitat e erradiques aquelas satagias am razoris subtils per les quals tu has preparat le nombre, de diversas quantitatz per que sia a tu possible administrar de aquels en tot loc les pus convenientz de lor e le pus dreyt de aquels segon aquo en que te perduzeys la tua operacio aquel os trencat e la figura de lu.	And if the fracture of the bone does not penetrate the bladder, and what is exuded or remains of the bone is the face of the bone, and it remains in the swelling and subtle fragments, it is necessary to cover that swelling and eradicate those fragments subtly for the reasons for which you have prepared the number, in various quantities so that you can conveniently manage them in all places and more conveniently as you lose your operation in this bone that is fractured and its figure.
E cove que administres en la tua razio am la qual razes le os al comensament le pus lat de aquels razoris, e aprop usa aprop lu del pus subtil de lu, e no cesses far aquo segon continuitat entro que pervenguas ad aministrar le pus teon e·l pus subtil de totz aquels.	And cover that you administer in your ratio at the beginning of these treatments, and in this way use more of the soft pus, and do not cease doing so until you have administered the greatest and most subtle of all.
Mays en quascuna de las autras fracturas petitas capillars e fractura subtil, cove que administres cura segon aquo que perduseys ad rectificacio de lu.	Moreover, in any other small fractures of capillaries and subtle fractures, cover that you administer with care as to the rectification of it
E es causa que no es ameguada sobre totz les quals han studi en aquela art.	And it is known to all who have studied in this art.
E stec sobre aquo que nos scriut havem mostrat en grans fracturas.	And thus much of what has been written above regarding great fractures has been shown to us
E si le pannicol es retangut quan tu erradiques le os, lahoras cove que prenguas drap de li segon la quantitat de la plagua, e submergeys aquel en oli rozat, e pausa aquel sobre le orrifici de la plagua; e aprop pren autre drap doblat o triplicat e submergeys lu en vi e oli rozat e pausa aquel sobre drap prim e fay aquo al pus leugierament que podes sobre aquel, que no graves le ciphac; e aprop administra sobre aquel liament lat, e no strenhas aquel sino per quantitat que tengua la plagua tant solament.	And if the bladder is rectangular when you have eradicated the bone, it is necessary to take a strip from it according to the quantity of the wound, and immerse that in olive oil, and put that over the orifice of the wound; and take another strip doubled or tripled and immerse it in wine and olive oil and put that over the first one and do with the pus whatever it pleases you that can be done without injuring the bladder; and administer over that a little fat, and do not tighten that until the wound is only as large as the wound alone.
E layssa aquel am aquesta cura per un dia o per dos entro que sias segur de apostema caut; e aprop deslia aquel e aprop aministra medicinas am las quals es superflua siccitat, ayssi cum razitz de lin e farina de errs, e polvera de enses e de aristologia, e de semblantz ad aquels.	And leave that with this care for a day or two until you are sure that the wound has healed; and then remove that and administer medicines that are useful for swelling, such as linseed and oatmeal, and powder of alum and of surgery, and like those.
E es que tu fassas de aquestas medicinas polvera que sia pulverizada sobre la plagua, ayssi cum son secas; e universalment, administra en aquel tota medicina de proprietat de la qual es que abstergesca e no mordique.	And make of these medicines a powder that is scattered over the wound, thus as they are dry; and in general, administer in that way all medicines of which you are aware that they have the property of being astringent and not corrosive.
E guarda te segon la tua vertut que la plagua en la tua curacio sia neta; e no sia en lu surdicia de enguent ni autra; ni no layssas agreguar virulencia en lu; quar quan es ajustada sobre le pannicol del cervel, corromp aquel e poyreys aquel, e accideys sobre le malaute aprop aquo malicia maligna.	Beware according to your skill that the wound in your care is flat; and do not put anything greasy on it; neither leave anything to swell it up; for when it is adjusted on the bladder of the brain, it corrupts that and weakens that, and brings about the sickness you wish to avoid in the patient
E accideys en le ciphac del cap, cum de lu es mondificat le os e majorment quan es menspresada la cura de lu, e es negror en la superficia de lu; e donc considera lahoras si accideys al malaute les accidentz que havem ditz, sapias que es parnicios ses tot dopte.	And take care that in the head there is no inflammation, as is often the case when the care is deficient, and that there is no blackness on the surface; and therefore consider that it is harmful to the patient to cause any accident to the bladder that we have mentioned, knowing that it is dangerous for him in every way
E si no accideys negror sino de la medicina que es pausada desus, e es en vertut de aquela medicina que fassa aquela negror, lahoras cove que tu prenguas de mel una partida e de oli rozat partidas .iii., e am aquels linieys un drap, e aprop pausa aquel sobre le ciphac; e aprop cura aquel am las specias de curacio que conveneys entro que sia sanat.	And if no blackness appears except from the medicine that is left out, and it is in virtue of that medicine that caused that blackness, then cover that you take less of that medicine and more of olive oil three parts, respectively And with these medicines apply a bandage, and put that over the bladder; and take care of that which is necessary for the treatment that you consider appropriate until it is healed
Capitol .iii.	Capitol III.
De restauracio del nas quan es trincat.	Capital III.
Sapias que no es trencat del nas sino doas partidas ensemps pus sobiranas, o una de aquelas alcunas veguadas, per so quar en lu has dos osses, quar la partida dejos es cartillaginosa, e no es trencada e no accideys a lu sino atricio e tortuositat e sinuitat.	It is wise that the nose is not fractured but rather split into two equal parts, or one of them partially severed, so that there are two bones, of which one is cartilage and is not fractured, but is twisted and swollen.
Mays si es trencada la una de las doas partidas de lu, lahoras cove que tu intrometas le dit petit en le sieu nas, e que engualhas aquela fractura dedintz am le tieu dit indic, e am le dit pous defora, entro que retorne le nas segon la sua figura natural.	Maybe if one of the two parts is fractured, then you must insert a little instrument into the nose and equalize that fracture as much as possible, and as much as the force permits, until the nose returns to its natural shape
E sia fayt aquo per tu am facilitat, e guarda te que no caja per aquela tua operacio sobre le malaute delor.	And it is done for you to facilitate this, and take care that you do not cause damage to the patient during this operation for pain
E si la fractura es en la pus sobirana partida del nas, e le dit no perve ad aquela, lahoras cove que sia equat am la extremitat del ray en le qual sia petita grossitut.	And if the fracture is in the upper part of the nose, and you say that it is not going to survive, then you must equate at the end of the ray where it is small.
E si la fractura es en doas partidas, lahoras tu fay le semblant de aquo.	And if the fracture is in two parts, you must do the same thing as before
E coyta te am restauracio de lu en le primier dia de la fractura, si es possible; e sino, lahoras aprop le vii o·l x deves le repaus del apostema caut.	Cover the restoration of the nose in the first day of the fracture, if possible; otherwise, keep it still for six days or until the swelling subsides
E aprop entromet en la extremitat del nas una meca de drap de li, si la fractura es en una partida, o metz doas calguas, si la fractura es en doas partidas, e sia en la calgua grossitut de tanta quantitat que umpla le trauc del nas.	And insert into the extremity of the nose a wick of lead, if the fracture is in one part, or two cushions, if the fracture is in two parts, of such a size that it fills the cavity of the nose
E diysso alcus dels antics restauradors que las calguas sian enfundudas en boder, e sian permudadas en tot dia, mays no es vist a mi; habantz cove que la meca sia enfunduda en album de huou comfit am polvera de moli; e aprop layssa la qualgua entro que l’os sia fermat e sia endurazida la cartillage.	I say to the ancient restorers that the cushions must be bound over, and must be changed throughout the day, even though I do not see it; because the wick must be embedded in albumin of blood with powdered meal; and keep the cushion in place until the bone is fixed and the cartilage is hardened
E alcunas veguadas sia entromes en le nas, en loc de calgua, pena de auca pus que es envolopada de drap de li leon; e sia que ja te la fractura del nas pus vehement e que le malaute no sia prohibit de inspiracio.	Some people put sponges instead of cushions, because it is better than covering it with lead; and that the fracture of the nose is already violent and that the patient should not be prohibited from inspiration
E aquesta causa no es a tu necessaria; e si voles, fay aquo, e si voles, fay calguas.	This is not necessary for you; and if you want, do it, and if you do not want, do not do it
E si accideys autra veguada apostema caut, emplastra le nas am cerot o am coto enfus en vi agre e oli rozat, o am diaquilon.	And if another cushion comes away after the cautery, plaster the nose with beeswax or with fat soaked in vinegar and oil, or with diachronic.
Mays si no accideys apostema caut, lahoras cove que emplaustres aquel defora am farina de sizami e am polvera de enses cofitz am album de huou; e aprop pausa sobre lu stopa leon, e no lies le nas am alcuna causa.	Even if it does not come away after the cautery, you must plaster the outside with dough of the same size and with powdered gypsum with albumin of blood; and place your hand over the nose, and do not touch the nose in any way
Mays si so trencats les osses del nas am fractura petita o so conminuitz, lahoras cove que scindas sobre aquels, e extraguas aquels am insturmentz que conveno ad aquels; e aprop cos la scissura, e cura aquela am aquo que encarna e consolida, e am emplastres ad aquo convenientz.	If the bones of the nose are fractured with a small fracture or with cracks, you must cut over those, and extract those with instruments that are suitable for those; and close the wound, and care for that which encloses and consolidates, and plaster as necessary
E si accideys plagua dedintz le nas, lahoras cove que cures aquela am calguas e administra canulas de plom entro que sia de tot sanat.	If there is a wound inside the nose, you must care for that with cushions and give canulas of lead until it is completely healed

De restauracio de la mandibula quan es trincada.	Restoration of the mandible when fractured.
Quan la mandibula dejos es rompuda e la fractura de lu no es am plagua, reguarda lahoras si la fractura es deforas tant solament, e no es trencada en dos e es curvada a las partidas dedintz, lahoras la sua cognicio es leugiera.	When the jaw bone is broken and the fracture is not accompanied by bruising, keep it still only if the fracture is outside and not fractured in two parts and is slightly curved towards the parts adjacent to it. In this case, its sensitivity is weak
E cove donc, si la fractura es en la part dreyta, que tu intrometas le tieu indic senestre en la boca del malaute; e semblantment si la fractura es an la mandibula senestra, lahoras intromet le dit indic de la ma dreyta; e impelleys am aquel la gilbositat de la fractura dedintz am facilitat a las partidas defora, am la tua autra ma de la partida defora del os; am aquel decentment equa aquelam.	Therefore, if the fracture is in the right part, insert the left index finger into the patient's mouth; and similarly if the fracture is in the left mandible, insert the index finger of your right hand; and pull towards that side of the fracture so that the parts outside are slightly stretched, with your other hand on the outside of the bone; in this way you will equal the height of both parts
E si la fractura de la mandibula ja es separada en doas, lahoras cove que administres extensio de doas partz segon rectitut entro que sia possibla la equacio de lu.	And if the fracture of the mandible is already separated into two parts, you must administer an extension of two parts according to the rule until the equality is possible
E si accideys conmocio de dentz a disrupcio, lahoras strenh aquelas de las quals speras que romandran am fil de aur o de argent o de ceda; e aprop pausa sobre la mandibula trencada cerot, e aprop pausa sobre lu drap duplicat, e pausa sobre le drap gran stelha decentment fayta, o una pessa de sola engual a la longitut de la mandibula; e aprop lia aquela desus segon que a tu es apparelhada la liadura de lu e que conveneys la applicacio, entro que no es destruida.	If there is displacement of teeth with disruption, strengthen those that you think will remain with gold or silver or ivory; and place a cerot plaster over the fractured mandible, and a duplicate plaster over the molar area, and a large gauze pad adequately sized over the bone; and tie that up as you please, as long as the application agrees with it, until it is not destroyed
E comanda al malaute que use de repaus e tranquilitat, e pausa la vianda de lu sorbicios leons.	Command the patient to rest and tranquility, and abstain from eating coarse foods that irritate the lips.
E si extimas que ja es alterada la figura en alcuna manieyra, lahoras tu te coyta e deslia aquel al tertz dia; e aprop rectifica aquo que ja es alterat de lu e emplaustra aquel am polvera de moli, am album de huou, o am farina de cisami, pus que tu auras ostat le cerot de lu, e pausa sobre le emplastra lana leon.	And if you see that the figure has already been altered in any way, cover that for the third day; and then rectify what has already been altered and plaster that with powdered gypsum, with albumin of blood, or with dough of barley, because you have already put the cerot on it, and keep it covered with a layer of wool
E adonc cum sta annex e ajustat aquel emplastre sobre lu, e la disposicio del os no es alterada, layssa aquel, que no le deslies entro que sia sanat e strenh la fractura; quar motas veguadas aquesta fractura es streyta en tres sempmanas.	E adonc cum sta annex e ajustat aquel emplastre sobre lu, e la disposicio del os no es alterada, layssa aquel, que no le deslies entro que sia sanat e strenh la fractura; quar motas veguadas aquesta fractura es streyta en tres sempmanas.
E si autra veguada accida apostema caut, lahoras administra aquo que havem dit motas veguadas en la sedacio de lu entro que sia sanat, e sia remaugut aquel apostema.	And if another displacement occurs after the cautery, leave that which has been said until the patient is healed, and evacuate that after the fracture has healed.
E si la fractura es am plagua, lahoras considera si es pessa del os separada o satagias, lahoras tu te subtilia que ostes aquelas satagias am aquo que conveneys ad aquo en la remocio de aquelas dels sturmentz.	If the fracture is soft, consider if it is a separated bone or a displacement; in this case you must order the evacuation of those displacements along with those that are causing the pain
E si le orrifici de la plagua es streyt, lahoras tu le amplifique am le fleubotomi segon la quantitat de la tua necessitat.	If the wound opening is wide, expand it with the flebotomy according to the amount of the need
E aprop quan tu auras ostat aquelas satagias, e de aquelas no sira remaugut re, lahoras tu cos le orrifici de la plagua si es ampla; e sino, pausa sobre aquela un dels emplaustres que conveneysso ad aquo e encarnan aquela, entro que sia sanada.	Then, when you have evacuated those displacements, if those remain, enlarge the wound opening; if not, place one of the dressings that you have previously recommended over that area and bind it up until it is healed
