De restauracio de la furcula quan es trinquada.	Chapter V.
Motas veguadas es trencada la furcula de la partida denant deves le muscle, e aquela fractura es fayta en una de tres manieyras.	A fracture of the collarbone is caused by cold humors that infiltrate each part of the body and pain occurs in the feet. This is customarily called gout by doctors.
Quar o es trencada, o seperada, o es seperada en doas partz otra que no accidan satagias; e es leugier a la restauracio de lu; o es ayssi que accideysso en lu satagias, e es dificil a restauracio de lu; o es ayssi que la fractura es am plagua.	Whether it is fractured or separated, or is separated into two parts without causing displacement; the restoration of it is desired; or if displacement has occurred, it is difficult to restore it; or if the fracture is soft
E la operacio en aquela, quan la fractura es ses plagua, es que tu fassas esser present dos ministres, per so que la un tengua le adjutori e siegua la furcula trencada, e l’autre extenda le col ves aquela partida.	And in this operation, when the fracture is soft, two assistants should be present, one to support the fractured bone and the other to extend the limb to that part
E aprop enguala la fractura am les tieus ditz entro que sia fayta la forma de lu segon que cove, e no sia en lu eminencia pauca ni concavitat.	Then wrap the fracture with strips until the limb regains its normal shape, without causing excessive tension or concavity
E si indigeysses mes de extencio, lahoras cove que pauses dejos le titillic del malaute spera de drap o de lana, e sia la grandesa de lu segon la quantitat de la tua necessitat; e exten e eleva la furcula e coarta la spera am la tua ma entro que enguales la frectura segon que cove.	If more extension is needed, the doctor must suspend the patient's breathing by means of a sponge or cloth, and the extent of the procedure should be determined by the amount of the need; then extend and elevate the collarbone and cover the wound with your hand until the fracture is bound up according to the previous instructions
E si no podes atirar la extremitat de la furcula a las partidas defora, per so quar es pervenguda al preon, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia ressupinat sobre la sua cervitz, e pauses sobre le muscle de lu un coyssi migier en grandeza.	If the limb cannot be moved from the collarbone to the outside, because of excessive pain, the patient should be placed on his chest, and place a cushion under the muscle in the middle of the limb.
E le ministre prema le muscle de lu a las partidas dejos entro que l’os de la furcula sia elevat que es en le preon en sus, e lahoras tu rectifique la fractura e enguala aquela am les tieus ditz.	The assistants should support the limb from below until the collarbone bone is elevated above the level of the preon, and then rectify the fracture and wrap it up with strips
Mays si sentes satagias de la furcula e so maugudas, lahoras cove que fendes sobre aquela e extraguas aquelas satagias am facilitat.	Even if there are displacement of the collarbone and they are bloody, cover that area and remove those displacements easily
E si es retenguda en le os, lahoras tu ingenia inscisio de lu am un dels inscissoris les quals has apparelhatz ad aquo, pus que havias pausat dejos la furcula le sturment que serve le ciphac; e es sturment de fust o de ferr del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	If the fracture is retained in the bone, make an incision in the skin with one of the instruments that you have prepared, because you have previously stopped the pain of the fracture; this is the form of the instrument:
E es semblant a culier del qual aquesta es la concavitat; e sia la sua latitut segon aquo que has necessitat de lu, segon la grandeza del os o la pauqueza de lu.	It is similar to a pliers of which this is the concavity; and its width should be determined according to the size of the bone or the thinness of the bone
Mays la longitut de lu sia segon que es a tu possible a la operacio; que haja doas extremitatz ayssi cum vezes, e la una extremitat sia ample e l’autre streyta.	The length should be such as to enable the operation; two extremities are required as many times as necessary, one broad and one narrow
E si la disrupcio de la plagua la qual has inscidida quan has extraytas la satagia del os es ampla, e yest segur de apostema caut, lahoras tu ajusta las doas labias de la plagua am sutura.	If the disruption of the wound caused by the evacuation of the displacement from the bone is wide and if the cautery is secure, suture the two lips of the wound together
E si la disrupcio es pauca, o temes apostema caut, lahoras tu uemple la plagua am draps e pulvils segon la quantitat de la scissura de la plagua.	If the disruption is slight or if you fear the cautery, cover the wound with gauze and powder according to the extent of the wound opening
E si accideys apostema caut, lahoras infon drap en vi agre e oli rozat e vi, e pausa sobre aquel.	If there is further bleeding after the cautery, soak the wound in vinegar and oil and wine, and pause over it
Mays la strictura del os quan es ses plagua e ses seccio, es que pauses emplastre fayt de farina de moli am album de huou, e pausa sobre lu stopa leon, e aprop pausa la spera dejos le titillic de lu, si indigeyssas de aquela, e aprop pren humemate, so es torca la qual teno les Sarrazis , que sia mot longua, e sia latitut de lu de un palm o entorn aquel; e aprop pausa pulvils duplicatz sobre la stopa e l’emplastre; e aprop pren una stela de taula subtil de la qual la latitut d’ela sia de tres ditz e en longitut semblantment; e aprop envolopa aquela en drap, e aprop envolopa aquel drap am la stela en lo loc sobre le loc de la fractura; e aprop pausa humemati ayssi cum es revout, e revol aquela sobre le col de lu e dejos le titillic de lu sa e dejos le titillic de lu malaute, e reduzeys aquela sobre tota partida, e quan vezes que la strictura de la fractura am strictura descent, e es aquo que no es occultat sobre tu.	When the bone is soft when the fracture is soft and the section is clean, place a plaster cast made of oatmeal flour with egg white, and place it over the wound, and prevent the patient from moving by supporting his chest, and take away the air from his lungs if necessary, and take a piece of sponge from the sarzazes, which is long and as wide as a palm or more; and cover the wound with gauze and powder; then take a piece of iron wire about three fingers wide and as long as the fracture; and wrap that around the wound and the fracture; and then take away the air from the lungs again as before, and support the patient’s chest and abdomen and prevent the patient from moving his chest and his back, and reduce the fracture to its original position; and when the fracture is stable with the surrounding tissue, that is what is not hidden from you.
E tot, que no sia mauguda la stelha desobre le os trencat; e per so cove que tu vejas le malaute quascun dia, que quan le liament es mollificat o vezas la stela ja esser remauguda, lahoras tu rectifica aquo e strenh la liadura.	And thus, even though the splinter has not pierced the bone, nevertheless, because of its pain, you must see the patient every day. For when the ligature is softened or the splinter has come out, the pain will cease and the ligature will be strengthened.
E aprop pausa le dormir del malaute sobre le col de lu, e pausa dejos le titillic de lu deves le dormir de lu en la nueyt un petit coyssi; per so que am aquel sia elevat le adjutori de lu del latz de aquel, e donc es elevada la la fractura de la furcula a elevacio del muscle; o sia le bras de lu liat al col de aquel.	And so, having stopped the patient’s sleep on the bed, and having put a little cushion under their chin, let them sleep for a little while; for thus will the attendants be able to lift up the patient from the side, and so the fracture of the collarbone is raised by raising the muscle; or let the patient lie with their arm bound to their chest.
E no deslies le liament si no accideys en le loc prusiment o apostema, entro a xii dias.	Do not remove the ligature unless an accident has occurred in the place where it was made, within twelve days.
E aprop renovelha le emplastre si has vista la facia de lu ad aquo, e ajusta en la strictura e restaura aquel e layssa entro que sia restaurat e sia coagulat la fractura de la furcula.	And so, renew the dressing if you have seen the face of the limb to that which it pertains, and tighten the dressing and restore that which was taken away when the fracture of the collarbone is restored.
E es strenguda e comfortada segon le mes en xxviii dias, e alcunas veguadas en alcus homes es fayt en mens de temps de aquel.	And it is strengthened and comforted according to the month in eighty days, and some walks in various homes is useful in a month’s time of that.
Capitol .vi.	End of document.
De restauracio de fractura de la spalla.	Treatment for a Fractured Collarbone.
Spatula tart es trencada en le loc lat de lu e no so trencatz de lu sino les marges.	The splinter has pierced the side of the limb and is not pierced through the bone except for the margins
E donc quan es trencat le loc de lu — e es trencat en le mieg loc de lu — e no es conogut sino per tocament, lahoras segon que es la figura de la fractura sforsa te la preparacio de lu e reduzir aquela segon la figura natural en tota manieyra de engen la qual es a tu possible.	And thus, when the limb is fractured – and it is fractured in the middle of the bone – and it is not known except by touch, the hour is that according to the figure of the fracture you must prepare the limb and reduce that according to the natural figure in every way that you can manage.
E aprop pausa sobre le loc polvera de moli am album de huou e stopa leon; e aprop pausa pulvil de drap duplicat; e aprop pausa sobre lu stela lada de taula subtil segon la quantitat de la spatula tota o mays un pauc.	And so, put a powder of meal over the fracture of bone, and stop the bleeding with sponge; and sprinkle over it a little powder of beeswax; and put over it a staple of wood as much as a little more
Mays si dejos la stela es concavitat en alcu dels locs de la spatula, lahoras tu enguala aquela concavitat am stopa leon, e aprop pueja la stela segon equalitat.	Or if the staple has been left concave in some parts of the area of the spatula, the hour is to fill that concavity with sponge, and to support the staple equally
E aprop strenh desus am humemati longua ab constriccio decent e am fermesa de la stela entro que no sia remauguda del sieu loc.	And so, keep the limb bound with a long bandage with a descending constriction and with a firming of the staple until it is remauged from the bone.
E considera le liament en quascun dia; e totas veguadas que sia mollificat, lia autra veguada e stren le e equa la stela si es remauguda del sieu loc.	Consider the ligature every day; and when it is softened, bind another one and tighten it and equal the staple if it is remauged from the bone
E jagua le malaute sobre le sieu latz sa.	And I put the patient on the side of the bed
E la spatula es restaurada en xx dias o en .xxv.	The splinter is restored in xx days or in .xxv
E donc quan es complit aquest nombre, lahoras tu dissolveys le liament, e que tu scias ensegurat quar aquela es dels osses dels quals la cominicio no es temuda ni lor dissolucio.	And thus, when this number is completed, the hour is to dissolve the ligature, and you know that from the bones from which it began neither fear nor their dissolution is to be had
E si procezeys del loc del os pessa e pongeys dejos la codena, lahoras tu scindeys sobre lu, e osta le, e fay segon que havem dit en la fractura de la furcula de sadacio de apostema caut si accideys aqui.	And if you proceed from the place of the bone of the heel and leave the cord, the hour is to cut over it, and hold it, and do as has been said in the fracture of the collarbone in the event of an accident here
Capitol .vii.	End of document
De restauracio de la fractura del pietz.	Treatment for a Fractured Foot
Le pietz alcunas veguadas es romput en le mieg loc de lu e aquo tart endeve; mays las extremitatz de lu mot endeve que so ciccadas e comminuidas.	The foot has some veins that are fractured in the middle of the bone and these are to be stopped; but the extremities of the limb must be kept clean and diminished
E dels accidentz de lu quan es trencat le mieg de lu es que declina a las partidas dedintz e accideys a lu gran dolor, e dificultat en lo hale, e tos, e fort leu e vomeys sanc; e es declarada en lu cavitat en le os trencat e no es occulta al sentiment.	And with regard to the accidents of the limb when the middle is fractured, that it declines to the lower parts and causes great pain, difficulty in walking, and vomiting and fainting; and is declared in the cavity of the fractured bone and is not hidden from the feeling.
E la restauracio de lu es que sia resupinat le malaute sobre le sieu dos, e pausa entre las spallas de lu un coyssi; e aprop prem als muscles de lu, e ajusta las costas de lu am las mas de dos costatz, e subtilia te en la operacio de lu e en la equacio segon tota manieyra que es ad aquo possibla e que conveneys ad aquo, entro que retorne la figura del os segon que cove.	And the restoration of the limb is that you rest the patient on the two sides, and put between the ankles of the limb a cushion; and press on the muscles of the limb, and adjust the ribs of the limb to the greatest of two ribs, and lift up the limb in the operation and in the equalization as much as is possible and convenient, until the limb returns to its natural figure
E aprop pausa sobre lu emplastre e estopa e pausa desobre astela de taula subtil de sauze o de caligi e de a lor semblantz en levitat, pus que tu envolopas aquela en drap; e aprop subtilia te en lian aquela sobre le os trencat que no sia maugut; e vay am liadura segon retonditat al dors alcunas veguadas, e strenh aquel am strictura decent; e aprop considera la liadura en tota hora, e quan es mollificada strenh aquela.	And so, put over the dressing and sponge and stop over the staple a cushion of soft gauze or cloth and keep it in suspension; and cover that with a bandage; and tightly bind that over the fractured bone that it is not too tight; and gradually strengthen that which is in tension every hour, and when it is softened strengthen that again
E si necessitat provoca a desliament de aquela deves corrossio o pruziment, o dolor, o apostema que accideysso en le loc, lahoras tu coyta e deslia aquela e erradica le emplastre e rectifique aquo que accideys per aquo am manieyra de curacio de lu; e aprop reduzeys le emplastre, si vezes ad aquo la facia; e ajusta a lu strictura entro que sia sanat.	And if necessary, if there is swelling, bruising, pain, or swelling that occurs in the place, the hour is to stop and remove that, and remove the dressing and rectify what has occurred for what is convenient for the treatment; and then reduce the dressing, sometimes to that extent; and adjust the tension so that it is healthy
Capitol .viii.	Capitol VIII.
De restauracio de las costas quan son trincadas.	Capitol VIII.
Sapias que fractura de las costas no catz sino en locs grosses que siegon le dos; e de las extremitatz de lor de la partida denant no accideys ad aquelas contricio sino per aquo quar so cartillaginosas.	Be wise that the fracture of the bowels does not crack only in the joints but also in empty spaces that follow one another; and from the extremities of them towards the front it does not happen except by that which is cartilaginous.
E cognicio de lu no es amaguada al sentiment deves la inquisicio de lu am les ditz.	And recognize it is not hidden by the feeling of them so that you inquire of them what they say
E la restauracio sia ayssi que enguales la fractura am les ditz segon la manieyra possibla, entro que sia engulhat segon que cove, e aprop emplastre e strenh le os trencat am stela, si indigeys de aquel.	And the restoration is thus that it embraces the fracture as they say in the manner that is possible, except that it embraces as much as it covers, and then apply plaster and bind the broken bone with a star, if you wish of that
E si la fractura de las costas es declinant a las partidas dedintz, lahoras accideys al malaute dolor vehement e punctura, ayssi cum punctura que accideys ad aquel que ha pleureci, e per aquo quar le os ponh le velament; e accideys a lu difficultat de hanelit, e tos, e vomit de mot sanc; e aquesta es de dificil curacio.	And if the fracture of the bowels is declining towards the thighs, then at the same time it happens to the patient acute pain and puncture, just like a puncture that happens to that one who has pleurisy, and for that which the bone is put under pressure; and it happens with difficulty of digestion, and all these things, and vomiting without any cause; and this is of difficult healing
E ja les Antixs so engeniatz en aquela am motz engientz.	And already the ancients have devised in this way that it does not endure.
E de lor so que diso: cove que pauses viandas del malaute que engendro imflacio e ventositat, per que le ventre sia imflat e sia extendut, e la fractura sia impellida a las partidas defora.	And thus they say: cover that you stop feeding the patient who brings about inflammation and swelling, because the belly is swollen and extended, and the fracture is impeded from the parts outwards
Mays nos avoreyssem aquo per so que no sia causa leugiera a generar apostema caut, si no accideys; e si ja accideys, lahoras ja ajuda ad aquo.	May we be aware of that so that it is not the cause of a greater lesion, if not to happen; and if it has already happened, then it is of help to it
E diyssero alcus de lor que sia pausada desus ventoza e aprop que sucque am fortitut; e es semblant a ratiocinacio, mays empero es temut que la ventoza atire las superfluitatz al loc per la debilitat.	And I say of them that it should be stopped from its violence and that you should succeed with firmness; and it is like reasoning, however, it is feared that the violence pulls out the superfluities from the place for the fracture
E diyssero alcus de lor: cove que·l loc sia cubert am lana que ja es submersa en oli caut, e sian pausatz pulvils entre las costas entro que sia umplida, que sia la liadura engual quan envolopas aquela segon retonditat; e aprop sia curat le malaute am curacio de pleuresi de vianda e de medicina.	And I say of them: cover that the place be covered with a bandage that is already immersed in hot oil, and remain suspended between the joints until it is full; that the ligature be equal when it encloses that according to its roundness; and thus be cured the patient with the care of food and medicine.
E si causa vehement constrenh le malaute la qual no sufferta, e le os punh le velament am punctura ledent, temem sobre le malaute, lahoras cove que fendam sobre le loc, descubram de la costa trencada, e aprop pausem desobre aquela instrument que conserve le ciphac, la rememoracio del qual es precedida, e que inscidam le os am facilitat, e extraguam aquel.	And if it causes acute constriction to the patient which does not suffer from it, and if the bone is put under pressure with a puncture wound, remember about the patient, for it is necessary to uncover the fractured bone, uncover the broken coast, and then take away that instrument which holds the intestines, remembering that it is preceded by the memory of that, and that it facilitates the bone, and extract that.
E aprop que ajustem las doas labias de la plagua, si es gran, am cozidura, e curem aquela am emplastres entro que sia sanada.	And thus we must adjust the two lips of the wound, if it is great, with stitching, and care for that which is done with plaster until it is healed
E si accideys dedintz apostema, lahoras tu coyta e enfon pulvils en oli rozat e pausa sobre le loc, e que sia curat le malaute am aquo que cove a la apostema dedintz.	And if there happens to be swelling in the thighs, then you should cover and immerse in oil the foot and pause over the place, and that the patient be cured with that which covers the swelling in the thighs.
E sia ressupinat sobre le latz sobre le qual dorm, entro que sia sanat.	And rest upon the side on which you sleep until it is healed
Capitol .ix.	Chapter IX.</start_of_turn>
De restauracio de fractura del spondil del dos e del col.	Of the restoration of the fracture of the vertebra of the thigh and the pelvis.
Alcunas veguadas endeve fractura als osses del col, e tart endeve a lor atricio, e semblantment als spondils del dos.	Some veins cause fracture to the bones of the pelvis, and they attach to them, and it is similar to the vertebrae of the thigh
E cum aquo accideys ad alcu e voles saber si sara sanat o no, lahoras considera, quar si vezes las sieuas mas ja mollificadas e stupefaytas e mortas e no pot maure aquelas ni extendre ni strenher aquelas e quan constrenges aquelas am les tieus ditz o punges aquelas am agulha e no sent en aquelas dolor, lahoras sapias que no es sanat, e en las mes de disposicios es mortal.	And when this happens to some of them and you want to know if it is healed or not, then consider that sometimes the veins are more swollen and hardened and stiff and dead and you cannot make them bend or extend or strengthen them and when you constrain them with the thighs they say or prick them with a needle and they do not feel any pain, then you know that it is not healed, and in this way it is mortal.
E si mau aquelas e sent en aquelas constriccio am les ditz e punctura, lahoras sapias que la nucha de l’os es salva e que le malaute guereys am curacio.	And if you do that and feel in that constriction with the thighs they say and prick with a needle, then you know that the bone marrow is saved and that the patient will recover with care
E si ve als spondils del col le semblant ad aquo e voles saber si sira sanat o no, lahoras considera als pes de lu.	And if you see the vertebrae of the thigh like that and you want to know if it is healed or not, then consider the weight of them
Lahoras si tu vezes que so ja mollificatz, accideys ad aquels aquo que es accidit en las mas, e aprop quan jatz sobre le sieu dos, yeys ventozitat e egestio ses la sua volontat, e alcunas veguadas es resupinat sobre le sieu dos e vol urinar e no pot, lahoras sapias que es mortal, e adonc no trebales en la curacio de lu.	Then sometimes when they are already softened, it happens to them that which is usual in the greatest, and you must know when you sit upon the two thighs, there is a breeze and egestion of urine that is not voluntary, and some veins are resting upon the two thighs and they cannot urinate and cannot sit, then you know that it is mortal, and do not work in the care of them
Mays si no accideys alcuna causa de aquelas, la causa es milhor e pus leugiera.	And if no other cause is caused by this, the cause is better and lighter
E la curacio de lu es que te perforses a la sedacio del apostema caut que pauses sobre le spondil atrissat oli rozat sol, o am mugols de huous asatz; pausa sobre aquela aquel alcunas veguadas le dia entro que sia sedat le apostema caut.	And the care of them is that you perforate with a needle at the relaxation of the swelling that rests upon the fractured vertebra, and pour over it hot oil or cold packs of blood; and pause over that each vein gives blood until the swelling of the heel is relaxed.
E lahoras pausa un dels emplastres confortantz e exsitans, e strenh sobre aquel am liament; e comanda al malaute que use de repaus e de tranquillitat e que no dorme sobre la partida am la qual atroba dolor entro que sia sanat.	And thus pause one of the comforting and existing plasters, and rest upon that limb; and command the patient to rest calmly and not sleep on the side where he finds pain until he is healed.
E si accideys deves la atricio del os satagias o alcuna causa que ja es seperada de lu, lahoras cove que secces sobre la codena e que ostes aquel os; e aprop ajusta las doas labias de la plagua, am sutura si es gran; e aprop cura aquela am alcu encarnatiu dels enguentz, entro que sia sanat.	And if it happens that the cartilage of the heel or any other cause has already been separated from it, then order that the heel be dissected and that bone be retained; and then suture the two lips of the wound, if necessary; and care for that limb until it is healed.
Mays si es trencat le derier del os alhoses, e es la fi de la coeta, lahoras cove que tu entrometas le dit pous de la ma senestra en le cul, e que enguales le os trencat am l’autra ma segon que es possible per equacio segonda; e aprop pausa sobre lu emplastre e astelha, si indigeysses de aquels, e aprop strenh aquel.	May be if the heel bone is fractured at the ankle and is at the end of the limb, then order that you place your left hand over the heel and grasp the fractured bone with the other hand as much as is possible; and then support the plaster and bandage, if necessary, and strengthen that limb
E si sentes satagias trencadas en lu, lahoras tu fen sobre aquela, e osta aquel, e cura la plagua am la curacio que es precedida entro que sia sanada.	And if the heel bone is fractured in its place, then rest upon that limb and retain that bone; and care for the wound with the usual care until it is healed
Capitol .x.	Chapter ten.
De restauracio de la ancha.	On the restoration of the limb.
Les osses de las anchas tart so trencats, e si trencan, lahoras la fractura de lor no es sino communicio en las extremitatz de aquelas e son inscidas en la longitut e declinan a las partidas dedintz; e accideys al malaute dolor en le loc e punctura, e la camba es stupefacta quan es fractura.	The bones of the thighs are sometimes fractured and if they fracture, then the fracture of them is only communication in the extremities of those and are inscribed in the length and decline towards the parts downwards; and it happens to the patient pain in the area and puncture, and the limb is stupefied when fractured
E la restauracio de lu es que tu extendas la tua ma sobre aquel entro que sia sobre la fractura qual es la figura de lu.	And the restoration of them is that you extend your hand over that which is over the fracture which is the figure of it.
E si fractura es en la extremitat de lu tant solament, lahoras tu enguala aquela segon que a tu es apparelhat per equacio engual entro que sia asemblat a la sua figura natural.	And if the fracture is only in the extremity of the limb, then grasp that as much as is possible according to the proportion that is appropriate until it is reassembled to its natural figure
Mays si la fractura es en le lonc o que ja declina a las partidas dejos, lahoras tu fay jaser le malaute sobre le sieu ventre entro que sia preparada a tu la restauracio de aquela fractura.	Or if the fracture is in the length or that it already declines towards the parts downwards, then order the patient to lie over the belly until it is prepared for you the restoration of that fracture
E donc quan auras engualada aquela, pausa sobre lu emplastre, e aprop pausa sobre aquel astela de fust o de codena, e strenh per strictura sobre la qual no temas punctacio de fractura ni remocio de la stelha.	And when it has been grasped, pause over the plaster and then pause over the bandage of the ankle or heel, and strengthen by stricture over which you do not fear puncture of the fracture or loosening of the staple
E enguala la concavitat am aquo que uempla aquela entro que aquela prengua la strictura segon equalitat, e comanda al malaute que dorma sobre le sieu dos o desobre le sieu costat sa.	And grasp the hollow with what is under that which supports that in that which it rests according to equality, and command the patient to sleep on the belly or rest on the side of his chest
Mays si accideys apostema caut, lahoras tu cessa de extencio de lu e de la sua restauracio entro que sia sedat le apostema caut, e pausa sobre lu aquo que sede aquel segon que es precedit; e aprop retorna a la restauracio de lu, e strenh aquel ayssi cum cove.	Or if aftercare burns, then cease the extension and restoration of that limb until the aftercare burn has subsided, and pause over that which remains according to that which is preceding; and then return to the restoration of that limb, and strengthen that limb as before
E si accideysso en le os satagias o son comminuidas, lahoras tu las tratz.	Or if it happens in the heel bone or they are crushed, then treat them
Capitol .xi.	Chapter eleven.
De restauracio de la fractura del adjutori.	On the restoration of the fracture of the adductor muscle
Adjutori es aquo que es entre le coyde entro al cap de la spalla.	The adductor is that which is between the hip joint and the head of the femur
E si es trencat, lahoras la restauracio de lu es en una de doas manieyras, de las quals es la una que tu prenguas fust pla de migiera groceza segon aquesta forma:	And if it is fractured, the restoration of it is in two ways, of which is to grasp the great trochanter with the hand and press it inwards with the other hand according to this fashion:
E sian liatz en doas extremitatz dos liamentz, e aprop sia suspendut del loc elevat.	And there are two ligaments in two extremities, and it is suspended from the elevated area
E segua le malaute sobre una sezela; e aprop gieta fora le sieu bras trencat sobre le fust entro que pervengua al titillic de lu en le mieg loc del qual sia annexa la curvitat del fust.	And follow the patient on a cushion; and then pull out the fractured limb over the thigh until it reaches the tilt of the thigh of which it is an annex of the curvature of the thigh
E aprop suspen sobre aquel alcuna causa greu, o·l minestre extenda aquel a las partidas dejos; e aprop le metge eque la fractura am las sieuas mas ensemps, entro que la fractura retorne segon que cove.	And if there is any serious cause, or if the limb is extended to the parts downwards; and the physician should place the fracture on the sides more firmly, until the fracture returns as it should
E l’autra manieyra es que·l malaute sia ressupinat sobre la sieua cervitz e suspen la ma del col de lu am liament; e aprop comanda a dos ministres que la un de lor tengua aquo que es desobre la fractura am las suas mas; e l’autre tengua le pus dejos de lu; e quascu de lor extenda a la sua partida.	And the other way is that the patient be supine on the cervical spine and suspend the hand of the hip over the limb; and command two assistants that one of them hold that which is below the fracture on his sides; and the other hold his legs; and each of them extend to his side
E si voles que la extencio sia pus fort, lahoras tu strenh sobre la fractura am liament e sobre aquela am autre liament, e quascu dels dos ministres extendan a doas suas partidas.	And if you want the extension to be stronger, then strengthen over the fracture on the ligament and over that on the other ligament, and each of the two assistants extend their two sides
E donc si la fractura es propinquada a la extremitat del muscle, lahoras cove que sia pausat la mitat del liament sobre le citillic e l’autre dejos la fractura deves le coyde.	And if the fracture is close to the extremity of the muscle, then order that half of the ligament be fixed over the tilt and the other half over the fracture beyond the hip joint
E semblantment si la fractura es propdana al coyde, lahoras cove que sia pausat le liament sobre aquel loc e sobre aquel coyde.	Likewise if the fracture is near the hip joint, then order that the ligament be fixed over that area and over that hip joint
Enguala aquela am facilitat e ses trebal, e aprop quant sira engualada segon que cove e es applicada per bona applicacio, lahoras strenh aquela si no accideys apostema caut.	The swelling that facilitates the work and is applied when necessary, and as much as it is applied correctly, the hour that sustains that which does not happen after the burn.
Mays si accideys apostema caut, lahoras layssa la strictura entro al vii dia, e pausa sobre lu lana sutza enbeguda en vi agre e oli rozat entro que repause le apostema, e lahoras tu stren aquela.	If after the burn the swelling persists, leave it loose for seven days, and suspend the lancet in cold vinegar and olive oil until the burn subsides, and then resume the burn.
E la manieyra de strenher aquela es que pauses emplastre sobre la fractura, e aprop pausa envolopament de drap nau sobre le emplastre; e aprop ajuste le bras sobre aquel adjutori, e pause la sua ma uberta sobre le sieu muscle.	And the way to sustain the burn that is to place a compress over the fracture, and then put on a bandage over the compress; and then adjust the arm on that support, and put your hand over the buttock muscle
E pausa le drap e strenh sobre le adjutori le bras per so que·l bras sia en loc de stelhas, si no prohibeys de aquo alcuna causa del os trencat.	Then suspend the limb and sustain the arm on the support so that the arm is in its place, if you do not prevent any cause of fracture.
E lahoras usa de stelhas.	And the hour uses supports.
E es que pauses sobre la fractura aquela stela que sia pus lada e pus fort de las autras stelas; e pausa entre quascuna stela la latitut del dit, e sia la longitut de las stelas segon la trencadura am addicio de tres ditz de tota partida.	And it is that you suspend the fracture with a strap that is thicker and stronger than the others; and suspend between each strap the width of a finger, and the length of the strap according to the fracture plus three fingers from the root
E aprop strenh sobre las stelas am la strictura la qual he dita al comensament del capitol.	And then sustain the straps at the fracture which I mentioned at the beginning of the chapter.
E es que la tua strictura sobre le loc de la fractura sia pus streyt.	And that your support over the area of the fracture is tighter.<end_turn>
E quant pus es alonguada la fractura sia la strictura menor.	And when the fracture is longer, the support should be smaller.<end_turn>
E donc si vezes le situament de las stelas e la strictura ayssi cum havem dit en la hora en la qual restauras le membre al sieu assituament, lahoras tu fay.	And thus if sometimes the position of the straps and the support are as we have said at the hour when you restore the limb to its normal position, then do so.<end_turn>
E si temes apostema caut, lahoras tu layssa la strictura e las stelas entro al dia vii ayssi cum havem dit.	And if you fear a burn, then leave the support and straps loose for seven days as we have said.<end_turn>
E aprop considera le liament en totas partidas per tres dias per so que no accida en le loc pruziment o imflacio; o es prohibida la vianda pervenir al membre per disposicio de superfluitat de strictura; e donc rectifiqua tot aquo segon que havem dit.	And consider the ligament in all its parts for three days so that it does not happen at the place of the fracture or swelling; or that the diet be forbidden to the limb to prevent surplus of support; and therefore rectify everything as we have said.<end_turn
Mays si tu yest sobre confizanssa que no accida alcuna causa de aquo, lahoras no deslias la liguadura sino aprop tres dias o mays.	And if you are confident that no cause of this has occurred, do not remove the bandage for three days or more.<end_turn
E sia la sua dormicio del malaute sobre le sieu dos, e las sieuas mas sian sobre le stomac.	And let the patient rest quietly on the bed, and the attendants sit beside the patient's stomach.
E pausa sobre le adjutori cocena plena de lana engualment, e considera en tota hora de la nueyt o del dia que no sia deliada ni dissolta la figura del membre trencat, o que sia le liament mollificat, donc rectifica aquo tot am la tua vertut.	And suspend on the support cooked with full broth, and consider at every hour of the night or day that it is not deformed or dissolved the figure of the fractured limb, or that the ligament is softened, therefore rectify all this with your skill.
E pausa la vianda del malaute segon le orde le qual havem denant mes, enayssi que la vianda sia subtil en le comensament entro que es comensat strenher; e lahoras cove que egrossas la vianda de lu.	And suspend the diet of the patient according to the order that we have given before, namely that the diet be bland at the beginning until it is strengthened; and the hour cover that you remove the coarse food from them
Quar de constuma del adjutori e de la camba de lu es que sian strengutz en xl dias; e lahoras cove que sian desliatz e sia administrat banh e sia medicat am enguentz los quals rectifican aquel.	As for the use of the support and the change of the limb is that they should be strengthened for forty days; and the hour cover that they are removed and that warm bath and medicine be administered with the things that rectify this.<end_turn>
E si la fractura es layha atrita, lahoras tu no deslies de aquela le liament e las stelhas entro a l dias o entro a dos meses.	And if the fracture is delayed, the hour does not remove the ligament and the straps until a day or two months have passed.<end_turn

De restauracio de fractura del bras.	Of the restoration of the fracture of the arm.
Bras es compost de dos osses les quals so appelatz dos focils; dels quals la un es petit, e es aquel que siec le dit pous, e l’autre es gran e es aquel le qual es pausat dejos le petit dit, de la partida pus dejus.	The arm is composed of two bones which are called two knuckles; of which one is small, which is that which is between the thumb, and the other is large, which is that which is fixed beyond the thumb, from the part beyond the thumb.<end_turn
E fort leu es trencat le focil major solament, o le petit, e fort leu son trincatz ensemps.	And it is strong if only the large knuckle is fractured, or the small, and it is strong if both are fractured together.<end_turn
E quan es trencat le focil petit desus, lahoras la restauracio de lu es leugiera, e la sanacio de lu es pus leugiera.	And when the small knuckle is fractured, the restoration of it is light, and the healing is easier.<end_turn
E quan es trencat le focil de lu dejos la fractura de lu es mala, e la sanacio de lu es dificil.	And when the large knuckle is fractured behind the thumb, the fracture is bad, and the healing is difficult.<end_turn
E pus mala de aquela es quan son trencatz dos osses essemps.	And the worst of all is when both bones are fractured together.<end_turn
Donc si l’os le qual es trencat es le focil petit desus, lahoras es convenient al metge, deves la restauracio de lu, que pauze petita extencio am facilitat entro que aquel sia engualhat.	Therefore if the bone that is fractured is the small one outside, the doctor must be convenient to restore it, that is, to keep it slightly extended until it is healed.<end_turn
Mays si le focil gran es aquo que es trincat, lahoras cove que pause extencio pus vehement.	And if the large knuckle is fractured, the hour covers that you pause the extension more violently.
E si les dos focils so ensemps trincatz, lahoras cove que tu pauses la extritura mot pus fort.	And if both bones are fractured together, the hour covers that you must pause the extraction as little as possible.<end_turn
E cove que pauses la figura de la ma deves la restauracio de lu e la extencio de lu estenduda sobre un coyssi, e sia le pols de la ma a las partidas desus, pus aut que totz les autres ditz, e le dit auricular sia pus bas dels autres ditz, e le malaute sia cezent sobre una cezela cayrada.	And keep the figure of the hand still during the restoration of the limb and its extension over a cushion, and let the palm of the hand rest on the parts below, rather than on all the others, and say the word "auriga" lower than the others, and the patient should be placed on a fallen cushion.
E sia un coyssi denant lu en la altetut o endreyt de lu, per so que·l malaute no encorra trebalh.	And let there be a cushion under the limb at its height or below, so that the patient does not strain themselves.</end_of_turn>
E aprop le ministre extenda le bras de la partida pus dejos am la sieua ma o am liament, e autre ministre extenda desus semblantment.	Then extend the arms of the attendants beyond the shoulders towards the sides, and another attendant extends his arms in a similar fashion.</end_of_turn>
E aprop le metge engualhe le os entro que redugua aquel segon la milhor figura que pot.	Then the doctor should grasp the bone and reduce it according to the better figure that can be made.</end_of_turn
E si en la factura del os so satagias, lahoras te perforsa raduzir tota pessa en le sieu loc am la tua vertut.	And if there is swelling in the bone, the hour perforates to reduce the whole foot in the ankle with your art.</end_of_turn
E si appar en lu satagia separada que punh la codena e no es a tu speransa en la restauracio de lu, lahoras tu fen sobre lu e osta aquela segon la manieyra la qual havem dita desus.	And if there appears a separated swelling that you do not hope will be restored, the hour will leave it there according to the manner we have said above.</end_of_turn>
Mays si la fractura es am plagua, yeu ja he fayt ad aquo capitol singular, e donc pren la curacio de aquel.	May be the fracture is blunt, and I have already done what is necessary in this matter, and therefore take care of that.</end_of_turn>
E si accideys apostema caut al comensament de la tua restauracio, lahoras tu lineys un drap am cerot fayt de oli rozat e cera blanca, e sia migier entre specitut e subtilitat, e strenh drap sobre aquel am strictura subtil entro que le apostema sia cedat; e lahoras remau le cerot e pausa emplastre preparat de polvera de moli am clayre de huou, e aprop pausa stelhas; e sia la stela la qual es pauzada sobre aquela fractura pus lada e pus fort.	And if during the commencement of the restoration an ulcer appears, the hour will anoint a the surface with olive oil and white wax, and let it be more between severity and gentleness, and strengthen the dressing over that which is strict and painful until the ulcer has subsided; and the hour remains with the dressing and pauses the plaster prepared from powdered millet with lime, and let it rest; and let the support be placed over that fracture more firm and strong.</end_of_turn
E sapias que·l nombre de las stelas del bras so vi en las majors disposicios, o sia la fractura en un focil o en dos focils ensemps.	And you know that the number of supports for the limb is seen in the greatest availability, or that the fracture is in a basin or in two basins together.</end_of_turn
E aprop pausa la tua strictura sobre le loc de la fractura pus fort e pus vehement, e quan mays sira la extrictura a las partidas desus de la fractura o a las partidas pus bassas de lu, pausa la strictura un pauc pus molh segon que es precedida la rememoracio de lu en le comensament del capitol.	Then pause the bandage firmly over the fracture site until more flexible and when more downwards from the fracture or from the lower parts, pause the bandage a little more moist according to the recollection of its beginning.</end_of_turn

And the cloths that are wrapped around the fracture should be moist cloths, neither too soft nor too rough, and the thread with which it is bound should be neither too fine nor too coarse, as we have recommended.</end_of_turn
E considera le membre e·l liament aprop alcus dias.	Consider the limb and the ligament for several days.</end_of_turn
E si accideys alcuna causa de la qual rectificacio es necessaria, ayssi cum prusiment le qual accideys al membre, e lahoras cove que tu enbroques le membre am aygua cauda entro que cesse aquel pruziment.	And if any cause occurs which requires rectification, as soon as possible as the cause which occurred to the limb, and the hour covers that you immerse the limb in cold water until the cause has ceased.</end_of_turn

And consider if the nourishment is prohibited from reaching the limb due to excessive binding, for the hour covers that you soften that a little and leave it for several days until it runs out of that nourishment, and strengthen that.</end_of_turn

And if no other cause of those mentioned above occurs in the patient, the hour does not cover that it should be discharged within approximately twenty days or so.</end_of_turn

De restauracio de fractura de la pinche de la ma e dels ditz.	On the restoration of the fracture of the thumb and the fingers.</end_of_turn>
Sapias que a la pinche de la ma e als nuzes dels ditz tart endeve fractura, e no accideys a lor sino atricio motas veguadas.	You know that in the thumb and the fingers there is a fracture, and it does not happen to them except for soft swellings.</end_of_turn

E sia la stelha de cuer am drap en le qual sia levitat, per so que le cuer sia aplicat a la palma; e strenh aquela segon que cove.	And if the limb is elevated on the palm of the hand, then let the limb be applied to the palm; and stretch it as much as covers.

May be if the fracture is at the outer part, then pause one limb at the outer part of the palm and the other limb at the inner part of the palm, so that the hand is opened and closed; and then loosen the tension, as if you were rotating the hand between the thumbs and little fingers
E si accideys fractura a alcu dels nozes dels ditz, lahoras si es le dit pous, sia engualat segon que cove e aprop sia strenhut am la palma e si·t voles, pausa a lu astela petita dreyta per so que sia elevada la fractura e no sia mauguda.	And if it happens that the fracture is on one of the knuckles of the fingers, then it is called pus; let it be supported as much as covers and strengthen it with the palm of the hand, and if you wish, place a bandage around the little finger to elevate the fracture and prevent bruising.

May be if the fracture is on the index finger, middle finger, ring finger, or little finger, then let it be supported and bound with the finger to which it pertains; or bind them all together continuously, which is better; or place a bandage over that little finger, as we said in the case of pus

Consider and take into account, in your restoration, and oppose — with your skillful operation — whatever may cause these, as it is repeated in the narration of the case.

De restauracio de fractura del os de la coyssa.	On the restoration of the fracture of the thigh bone.</start_of_turn
Le os de la cueyssa motas veguadas es trencat e es declarat al sentiment segon que es convertit a la partida denant e a la pus sobirana.	The thigh bone, when fractured, moves and is declared to be complete according to the sensation as it is converted to the proximal part and to the sovereign pus.</start_of_turn
E la restauracio de lu se fa enayssi que·l liament es strenhut sobre la fractura e autre liament dejos la fractura, e le malaute sia prostrat sobre le sieu ventre e sobre la cara.	And the restoration is done in this way that the ligament is strengthened over the fracture and another ligament leaves the fracture, and the patient is placed prone on the belly and on the face.</start_of_turn
E aprop le ministre extenda tot le liament a la sua partida segon la qualitat, quan la fractura es en le mieg loc del os.	And the minister extends all the ligament to its quality according to the quality, when the fracture is in the middle part of the bone.</start_of_turn
Mays si es propdana a la razitz de la cueyssa, lahoras sia le liament propda al denolh a la partida del pentenilh, per so que la extencio caja en sus, e le autre liament dejos la fractura. And the physician should bite the bone on both sides more than he reduces it according to the natural conformation; the bone is joined together by a good connection; the hours cover that the plaster and tension are paused, if it does not happen to the limb after the restoration.</start_of_turn

And finally start to bind firmly from the middle over the place of the fracture with three wraps or four, and when you have arrived at the ligament of the place of the fracture, your bind is less and lighter and softer.</start_of_turn

De restauracio de la fractura de la rodela del denolh.	Treatment for the fracture of the ankle bone.</end_of_turn>
Sapias que fractura de la rodela del denol tart endeve, mays accideys a lu motas veguadas atrissio.	Know that the fracture of the ankle bone is not serious, but rather caused by excessive bruising.</end_of_turn
Mays si accideys a lu fractura, lahoras no es sino fissura o trauc en las suas partidas, e aquo es am plagua o ses plagua, e sobre aquo tot es estat am le sentiment.	However, if there is a fracture, it is only a fissure or break in their parts, and that is from a wound or swelling, and over that all is done with calmness.</end_of_turn

De restauracio de la fractura de la camba.	Treatment for the fracture of the forearm.</end_of_turn
Sapias que en la camba so dos osses dels quals la un es gros, e es le nompnat per nom de la camba; e l’autra es subtil, e es nompnat focil.	Know that in the forearm there are two bones, of which one is thick, and is called the radius; and the other is slender, and is called the ulna.</end_of_turn
E accideys a quascus de las specias de fractura aquo que accideys als dos osses del bras, e per aquo es fayta restauracio de lu ayssi cum restauracio del bras engualment, e la operacio de lu es una.	And there are various kinds of fractures of these bones, just as there are in the arms, and for that reason the restoration of them is as much as the restoration of the arm itself, and the operation is one.</end_of_turn
E si so trincatz dos osses ensemps, la camba es convertida a totas partidas.	And if both bones are fractured together, the forearm is converted into all parts.</end_of_turn
E si es trinquat le os pus subtil, la camba es convertida a las partidas Denant.	And if only the slender bone is fractured, the forearm is converted to the parts surrounding it.</end_of_turn
E si es trincat le os pus gros, atrobas aquel dejos, e es de aquelas causas que no so a tu ameguadas.	And if only the thick bone is fractured, the other limb must be left, and this is from those causes that you are not aware of.</end_of_turn
E aprop aministra extencio e equacio e liguacio de las astelas segon aquel engualment.	And provide extension, equalization and ligation of the bones according to that healing.</end_of_turn
Mays empero cove, si la fractura de la camba es laja havent motas satagias, que la extencio sia mendre e pus leugiera, e alleuja am la tua vertut.	However, if the fracture of the forearm is slight without having great swelling, that the extension should be more gentle and less laborious, and rely on your virtue.</end>
E en la camba es alcuna causa de operacio sobre le bras, e es quan tu engualas las stelhas e que comples tota la tieua operacio, lahoras tu prendras pessas de fustz de pi le qual es pausat dejos las cauzas las quals so pausades en solies, e so faytas eyssament de brancas de palma; aligeys de aquelas a las quals es petita groceza, e no sia ges de las manudas, e sia la longuesa de aquelas segon la longuesa de la camba, e del denol entro al pus dejos.	And in the forearm there is any reason for an operation on the arm, and that is when you embrace the limb and when you have completed all the work of the operation, then you will take away the cause of the pain; align those that are requested to be aligned, and do not be afraid of the hands, and make them as long as the forearm and as much as the elbow allows.</end>
E aprop envolopa sobre quascuna drap en doas envolucios segon la longitut de lu, e pausa la una sobre la partida de la camba de la una part e l’autra del autra part, e sian del denol entro al pus bas loc del pe.	And put on a bandage over any wound in two layers according to the length of it, and support one over the part of the forearm from one side and the other from the other side, and from the elbow to the wrist.</end><end_turn>
E aprop lias las doas stelhas en tres locs de doas extremitatz e al mieg loc, quar am aquesta strectura la camba es prohibida de clinar a la partida dextra e sinistra, e sta per bona stacio.	And secure the two bones in three places at two extremities and in the middle part, so that the structure of the forearm is prohibited from bending to the right and left, and remains in a good position.</end><end_turn><end_turn>
E ja es aministrat un brasset de fust segon la longuesa de la camba; e sia pausada en lu la camba per so que conserve aquel de movement.	And a plaster sleeve has been administered according to the length of the forearm; and keep it fixed in it so that it conserves that movement.</end><end_turn><end_turn><end_turn>
E majorment cove que tu fassas aquo en fractura, e quan am aquela es plagua propriament.	And more than that, cover what is fractured so that when it is properly healed.
E aprop considera en quascun jorn la camba e studia am aquel per derier studi, e tu le guardes de apostema e de imflacio o de autres causas semblantz; e cum accideys alcuna causa de aquelas, lahoras opausa te a lu am aquo que cove entro que sia sanat.	And consider in every day the forearm and study it in that way, and you will guard it from apostema and from inflammation or from other causes that may be similar; and when any of these causes occur, then you must take it away from it until it is healed.</end><end_turn>
Capitol .xvii.	Capitol XVII.
De la fractura del talo e dels osses del pe e dels ditz.	Chapter XVII. Of fractures of the ankle and the bones of the foot and toes.</end_of_turn>
Al talo no accideys fractura de tot; mays als osses del pe accideys fractura alcunas veguadas; e als ditz del pe pauc accideys fractura, e no accideys a lor sino atricio en las mes de disposicio.	The ankle does not often suffer fracture; but in the foot bones some fractures are frequent; and in the toes little fracture occurs, and it does not occur in them except in cases of violent injury.</end_of_turn
E si als osses del pe endeve fractura e vezes aquels osses esser elevatz sobre si entre lor, lahoras le malaute pause le sieu pe sobre la terra preparat ayssi cum anant.	And if there is fracture in the bones of the foot, and sometimes these bones must be elevated among themselves, then prepare the earth under the foot and put the foot down gently as you go.</end_of_turn
E aprop pausa la un pe sobre aquo que es elevat de aquels osses, e aprop calca aquels, e prem, e engualha aquels entro que torno en los locs.	Then put a hand over that which is elevated of those bones, and put on shoes, and hold firmly, and keep them together until they return to their place.</end_of_turn
E aprop pausa emplastre e stopa desus, e pausa dejos le ventre del pe una petita taula a la qual sian dos caps plas.	And put on a bandage and hold still, and keep the foot covered with a small table on which are two cushions.</end_of_turn
E aprop strenh aquela am le pe am strectura descent, pus que tu has envolopada aquela am draps e am autres causes de las quals indigeys.	And keep the foot stretched out as much as you can, because you have wrapped up the area with cloth and other things which you must not neglect.</end_of_turn
E cum a lu passan tres dias o quatre, lahoras tu deslia le liament, quar tu atrobaras les osses engualatz, o sian trincatz o sian dislocatz, e la operacio en aquels es ayssi co coneysses.	And when three or four days have passed, then you will loosen the ligaments, because you will find that the bones are healed, or fractured or dislocated, and the operation in these cases is as dangerous as it is useful.</end>
Mays si alcus ditz son trincatz, lahoras restaura aquels, e enguala aquels ayssi cum yeu e recomtat a tu en la restauracio dels ditz de la ma.	But if some of the toes are fractured, then restore them, and bandage them as before. Recommend that you rest the hand.</end>
E aprop pausa al dit trincat stela segon la longitut del dit, e sia pus lada de lu un pauc; e aprop dejos le pe aquesta taula la qual e a tu recomtada, e strenh aquela am strictura decent.	And keep the fractured toe still according to the length of the toe, and do not put on shoes for a while. Keep the foot on the table that has been recommended to you, and keep the foot stretched out.</end
Mays si aquo que es trincat dels osses so dos o tres o mays, lahoras tu pausa sobre quascun dit astela de la sua quantitat envolopada en drap leon, e strenh la taula en le pus bas del pe, e sia stant sobre la un dels caps de la taula foro le ventre del pe per que la tengua am bona retencio.	And if two or three or more bones are fractured, then keep your hand still over each toe as much as its covering in linen allows, and keep the foot firmly on the table, resting on one of the feet of the table under the foot so that it has good support.</end
E es convenient a tu que no oblides que no consideres totas las causas las quals que e ditas a tu en las autras fracturas dels accidentz que havem dit; e opausa te a tot accident am aquo que cove.	It is convenient for you to know that we have not mentioned all the causes of these fractures; and avoid any other accident which may occur to you.</end>
Capitol .xviii.	Chapter XVIII.</start_of_turn>
De fractura del conh de la femna e del os del pentenilh e de la vergua del home.	Of fractures of the knee of the femur and the patella bone and the groove of the heel.</end_of_turn

Capitol .xix.	Chapter XIX.</start_of_turn
De restauracio de fractura dels osses quan es am plagua.	De restauracio de fractura dels osses quan es am plagua.
Convenient es ad aquel al qual accideys fractura am plagua, e majorment si le os es gran ayssi cum es le os de la cuoyssa o de l’adjutori, o semblant ad aquel, que tu te cuoytes e fleubotomes aquel tantost si las condicios de fleubotomia a tu o testifican ayssi cum desus havem dit. And if the swelling is great or is bad swelling, and you fear about that accident which we have recommended, and if there is pain in the area, then do not put on that plaster, but make a bandage of coarse cloth in the place of needles and tighten it up well.</start_of_turn>

And if the swelling becomes black or green, it is stasis, or another kind of corruption and putrefaction, then it is necessary to suspend treatment until the cause has been explained in the preceding chapter.</end_of_turn

Capitol .xx.	Chapter twenty.</end_of_turn>
De la curacio de nodacio que accideys en le vestigi de alcuna fractura.	Of the treatment of swelling that occurs in the aftermath of any fracture.</end_of_turn>
Motas veguadas accideys aquesta nodacio en le vestigi de sanacio de fractura, e majorment que es prop de las juncturas, e es orrasada per lu la figura del membre; e fort leu prohibeys le membre de la sua operacio natural.	These swellings often occur after the healing of a fracture, and are especially common around the joints. They impede the natural function of the limb.</end_of_turn
Adonc considera si la nodacio es recent e aministra en aquela medicinas que han stipticat ayssi co es aloen, e enses, e mira, e sercacollo, e acrassia, e semblantz ad aquels; enayssi que prenguas de aquela alcunas o totas, e comfesiys aquelas am vi stiptic, o am album de huou, o am vi agre, e pausa aquela sobre la nodacio en estopa, e constringeys aquelas sobre lu per bona constriccio.	Consider whether the swelling is recent and administer such medicines as have been shown to be effective against this when pure, or aloes, or acacia, and observe, and see if there is any redness or heat, and remain like those who have taken some or all of these, and when you have given them, cover the swelling with something soft and compress it firmly.</end_of_turn
E leyssa extrictura que no deslies aquela per motz dias; e aprop deslia aquela e itera autra, entro que sia remauguda la nodacio; o strenh sobre aquela lamina de plom descentment, quar plom ha proprietat de remaure tot aquo que es imflat en les membres.	Leave the extraction until more days have passed; and when you have extracted it, repeat it until the swelling has gone down; or stretch over that lamina of lead downwards, for lead has the property of healing all that is swollen in the limbs.</end_of_turn
Mays si nodacio ja es en peyra convertida e streyta es e nessessitat provoca a ostar aquela coytadament, e lahoras scindeys aquela per la partida pus sobirana de lu, e inscideys la superfluitat e eminent, o ratz aquela am alcus rezoris entro que sia remauguda; e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	Even if the swelling has already become hardened and hardened, and stretching is necessary, it is necessary to perform the incision cautiously, and remove the superabundance, or cut off the excess, until the hardness has gone down; and care for the wound until it has healed.</end_of_turn
Capitol .xxi.	Chapter twenty-one.</end_of_turn
De restauracio de fractura quan es restaurada e aprop aquo roman le membre subtil e freul no segon la sieua natura.	Of the restoration of a fracture when it has healed and how to restore the limb to its natural function afterwards.</end>
Quan fractura de os es restaurada, e aprop aquo roman le membre subtil e freul, lahoras aquo no es fayt sino per motas causas: de las quals la una es multitut de solucio del liament e de la liguacio de lu fayta no segon que cove; o per superfluitat de strictura dels liamentz entro que·l nutriment sia prohibit correr al membre; o per multitut de embrocaccio superflua; o per movement superfluent no en la sua hora; o per pauquesa de sanc en le cors del malaute e per debelitat de lu.	When a bone fracture has healed, and the limb is still stiff and painful, several causes are possible: the stiffness of the ligaments has not been completely overcome; or there is excessive tightening of the ligaments, preventing nutrition from reaching the limb; or there is excessive swelling; or movement is not performed at the right time; or there is insufficient healing in the body and weakness in the limb.</end_of_turn
E curacio de aquo es dar a mengar al malaute e far le cor de lu tendre entro que·l sanc sia multiplicat en lu; e aministra banh; e entromet gaug e leticia sobre lu.	The treatment for this is to give the patient food and make them drink, to massage the limb to make them tender, and to give them baths; and to remove any discomfort or pain.</end_of_turn
E aprop pausa pegua sobre le membre, per so que la pegua atire a lu mot nutriment, o continua embrocacio de lu am aygua tebeza, entro que·l nutriment corr e retorne a la sua figura natural.	And keep the limb still for a while, so that the nourishment can reach it, or continue to bandage the limb with cold water, until the nourishment returns to its normal position.</end_of_turn
Capitol .xxii.	Chapter twenty-two.</end_of_turn
De curacio dels osses trincatz quan so restauratz tortuozament e prohibeys la operacio de lor de aquo que cove.	Of the treatment of fractured bones when they have been restored and the prevention of their operation by any means that cover them.</end_of_turn
Quan accideys al membre ja restaurat aprop la sanacio de lu de tortuositat e eminencia al os trincat e nodacio, e es per aquo fededa de forma del membre, mays empero le membre no es prohibit de la sieua operacio natural, lahora no cove que tu recipias la paraula de aquel que exsistima aquel membre sia de novel trincat.	When a fractured limb has already healed somewhat, and there is still some twisting and prominence of the fractured bone and swelling, do not prohibit the limb from its natural movement, for otherwise you may cause greater damage to the limb.</end_of_turn
Mays ja so statz motz fols metges e restauradors les quals han fayt aquo en nostra tera; e aquesta operacio es mot vituperable perduzent a gran temor le senhal de la qual es mortal.	However, many foolish doctors and healers have done great harm in this matter; and this operation is extremely dangerous and often fatal.</end_of_turn
Mays si claudicacio e nodacio son recentz, lahoras cove que sian enbrocatz am aygua tebeza en la qual so coytas erbas mollificantz, ayssi cum son fuelas de altea e razitz de lu, e mellilot, e semblantz ad aquels; e sia fayt a lu emplastre am emplastre mollificatio ayssi cum dyallaquilon ben fayt; o que sia preza mucillage de razit de altea e sia contucida am gray de gualina o am oli de cirami, e sia emplastrat am aquel; o que sian prezes figuas grassas e sian trissadas am fems de colom, e semblantz ad aquels de las medicinas que son nompnadas amermans consolidacio.	If the swelling and bruising are recent, cover them with cold water in which there are many emollient herbs, such as chamomile and gentian, meadowsweet, and the like; or apply soft plaster with gentle traction as well as possible; or take fragments of gentian with oil of cedar or olive oil, and mix them; or take figs and grind them with the colander of a woman, and mix them with the medicines that are not harmful after consolidation.</end_of_turn
E alcunas vetz es dissolvuda am assidua fricacio leugiera que sia am las mas humidas, e sia administrat movement del membre a tota partida en totas horas.	Every day, when the body is rubbed with a lukewarm oil, and movement is administered to all parts at all hours, the swelling will gradually disappear.

De sermo en dislocacio.	About the disease of dislocation.</end_of_turn>
Dislocacio es eyssiment de alcuna de las juncturas del sieu loc, per que es prohibida de movement, e es orrezada la figura del membre, e fa venir sobre le malaute dolors e lesios grans.	Dislocation is the displacement of any joint of the limb, which is prohibited from movement, and is accompanied by the figure of the limb, and causes pain and great damage.</end_of_turn
Donc quan accideys ad alcu dislocacio, lahoras cove tantost perforsar que sia reduzit, e no tarde aquela reduzir, quar si es tardada, le loc es apostemat e fort leu am aquo es fayta dificil la reduccio de dislocaccio.	Therefore, when an accident of dislocation occurs, it is necessary to perforate as soon as possible so that it is reduced, and do not delay its reduction, because if it is delayed, the limb is swollen and strong, which makes it difficult to reduce the dislocation.</end_of_turn
E per aysso no cove que sia maugut ni stendut en la hora de la apostemacio, quar motas veguadas fa venir spasme e dolors ledentz.	And to help, do not grasp or stretch during the reduction, because the muscles become rigid and cause spasms and pain.</end_of_turn
Mays quan aquo accideys, lahoras cove que tu te coytes a la flaubotomia del malaute, e aprop sia layssat entro que repause le apostema; e aprop le membre sia embrocat am aygua cauda e oli, e aprop sia reduzit am facilitat.	When this happens, cover the patient's face with a cloth, and immediately place it within so that rest is restored; and embrace the limb with warm water and oil, and reduce it with ease.</end_of_turn
E tot membre sia curat am aquo del qual la rememoracio vindra en son loc.	And all the limb must be treated with the water from which the memory will remain in its limb.</end_of_turn
E yeu ja e ordenatz les capitols de dislocacio segon que es precedit en fractura; de la partida del cos pus sobirana entro a la partida pus dejos.	And I have already ordered the chapters of dislocation according to their order, from the most serious part of the body inwards towards the less serious.</end_of_turn

De la reduccio de la dislocacio del muscle.	Concerning the reduction of the dislocation of the muscle
Sapias que·l muscle no es dislocat sino segon tres manieras, de las quals es la una que sia dislocat a la partida del titillic a la partida dejos.	You know that the muscle is not displaced except in three ways, of which one is that it is displaced from the upper part towards the lower part
E la segonda es que sia dislocat a la partida desus del muscle, e aquo es fayt tart; e no es dislocat a las partidas detras per la spalla; e no es dislocat a las partidas denant per les nervis.	The second is that it is displaced from below the muscle, and that is good; it is not displaced from behind by the scapula; and it is not displaced from in front by the nerves
E majorment es dislocat e defora eyssit a las partidas dejos deves le titillic, e majorment en aquels dels quals las carns son paucas, leugierament es dislocat; mays en aquels en les quals so motas carns, es eyssit fora am dificultat.	Most frequently it is displaced outwards from the lower part towards the titillic, and especially in those in whom the flesh is little, inasmuch as it is easily displaced; but in those in whom there is much flesh, it is difficult to displace it outwards
E fort leu accideys ad alcus homes percussio o cazement, e le muscle de lu es apostemat de apostema caut, e es cujat per aquo que ja sia dislocat.	And frequently it happens to some people because of percussion or falling, and the muscle of them is loosened by the cautery, and is healed in that way that it has already been displaced
Adonc cove que tu sproes aquo entro que estias sobre-sertetut de lu, e lahoras procesiscas en la curacio de lu.	Therefore you must know when you are finished with it, and then proceed with the treatment of it
E es conoguda la dislocacio de lu quan es a las partidas dejos deves le titillic; per so que distingescas entre le muscle dislocat e·l muscle sa, quar tu atrobas entre aquels diversitat manifesta; e atrobas en le cap del muscle concavitat e dejos le titillic deves le tocament del cap del muscle ayssi quo un huou, e al malaute no pot redusir la sua ma a la sieua aurelha, ni maure aquela per totz movementz.	And it is known that the dislocation of the muscle is when it is towards the lower part towards the titillic; so that you distinguish between the displaced muscle and the sound muscle, for you will find among these various manifestations; and you will find on the head of the muscle a concavity and towards the titillic behind the touch of the head of the muscle as if there were a hole, and the patient is not able to reduce his hand to the navel, or to move it in any way
Si es dislocat deves le pietz o ensus, e tu lahoras atrobas manifest tocament, e no es amaguat.	If it is displaced from below or from above, and you find the touch manifested, and it is not hidden.

The reduction of it is that the minister raises the hand of the patient above the lower part; and immediately place the thumbs behind the titillic of the patient, and raise the joint with strength at the level of the navel, and the minister raises the hand and extends that one; and immediately place that one back so that it returns gently
Mays si per aquo que havem dit no retorna, e so del comensament que accidic la dislocacio, motz dias, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia banhat en aygua cauda e sia aministrada enbrocacio que mollifique e liniesca ayssi cum si so coytz razitz de altea, e fenugrec, e melillot en aygua, e sia administrada.	May it be that although we have said that it does not return, nevertheless from the beginning that the dislocation occurred, for several days, the patient must be bathed in lukewarm water and be administered embrocation that softens and soothes just like if it were ointment, and fennel, and melilot in water, and be administered.

E si voles, reduzeys aquel segon aquesta manieyra: e es que tu fassas esser prezent un home le qual sia pus lonc que·l malaute, e estia de la part de aquel latz, e entrometa le sieu muscle dejos le titillic del malaute e eleve le titillic de lu a las partidas desus entro que·l malaute sia suspendut en ayre, e autre ministre tire la ma del malaute de las partidas dejos del sieu ventre. It is reduced immediately in another way: let a long staff remain fixed on the ground, rounded at one end like a mortar pestle, which should not be thick or thin, and place the patient upon it; for when you place your hand over the head of the staff, the patient is stable according to the length of the staff, and extend your hand to the sides of the other part; extend the limb of the patient from the other side with strength, so that the joint returns to its proper place with speed.

E aprop sobre le cap redon sian liatz drap leons per so que·l fust no ledesca le malaute.	And place over the rounded head some leather straps to prevent the staff from injuring the patient.

And when the limb is inside according to some manner that you deem possible, and when you have paused behind the buttocks for an amount equal to the quantity of wool; then pause with prepared plaster of powder of malt and alum of lead over all the muscles, so that it is rotated away from the bone, and strengthen behind the buttocks with tight tension; and the ligament should be rotated over the plaster, and the hand should be fixed to the limb, and be allowed to rest, and do not move the hand for seven days.
E cove que sia pausada la vianda del malaute pauca, entro que·l membre sia confortat, quar es pus leugier a la sanacio de lu.	And know that the patient should be fed little, until the limb is comfortable, for it is more likely to heal the limb.

And give the food more frequently every seven or eight days, or let them do some movement; and thus if it is stopped and not softened, the hour has already healed.

De curacio de dislocacio del coyde.	Of care for dislocation of the knee joint.
Sapias que la junctura del coyde es dislocada am difficultat e semblantment retorna am difficultat; e aquela es dislocada a totas partidas, e majorment a la partida denant a la partida detras, e la dislocacio de lu no es amaguada a tu quar es cazent dejos le vezement o dejos le tocament segon qualque figura sia dislocat, e quan ajustes le coyde disloguat am le sa, aquo es a tu declarat manifestament, quar la junctura es concavada e no pot doblar le bras, ni tocar am aquel le sieu muscle.	Know that the knee joint is dislocated with difficulty and returns with difficulty; and that which is dislocated throughout is more especially from the front to the back, and the dislocation of the knee is not hidden from you because it is caused by leaving it too long or by touching it according to whatever figure is dislocated, and when the knee joint is adjusted the dislocation is seen immediately, that is to say that the knee is concave and cannot bend the limb, nor touch with any of the muscles
E cove que·t coytes, e reduzescas la dislocacio tantost denant que vengua a lu apostema caut, quar si ve a lu apostema caut, dificil es la reduccio de lu, e fort leu no es sanat de tot; e majorment quan es a las partidas detras, quar pus mala es de totas las autras specias de dislocacio, e de major dolor, e motas veguadas deyssen am aquela la mort.	And know that the knee and the ankle must be reduced as quickly as possible after the cautery is applied, for if you see it after the cautery is applied, the reduction will be difficult and will not be successful in any way; and more so when it is at the back, for it is worse in all other kinds of dislocation, and more painful, and many veins must be ligated in that area for death

And the restoration of it, when that which is possible is reduced, is that the hand be extended with two hands, the arms be expanded, and the hands of the physician be placed over the knee and under it, and the plaster must embrace the joint with the nails of the nails together, or with the heel of the palm within that it returns to its place.

And when the doctor touches the joint with his hand, unite some oil so that it is moistened by those things that help to lubricate the joint and facilitate; and then press the joint with force until it returns.

E aprop sia desliat; e donc si la junctura es formada en le sieu loc, lahoras tu deslia le liament de lu e layssa aquela.	Then untie; and therefore if the joint is formed in the heel bone, then you should dissect the ligament of the heel and leave it free.</start_turn>
E si vezas la junctura no be strenher, lahoras tu itera le emplastre e·l liament, e layssa aquela per alcus dias entro que sia extrenhuda; e aprop deslia aquela.
