Mays si accideys a lu gravitat aprop la reduccio de la junctura, e la disposicio de lu es en movement, lahoras aministra humectacio en banh e fricacio subtil, e comprecio, entro que sia aleujat; o pausa sobre la junctura aleliati, so es coyssa de moto grassa; e aprop sia liada, e layssa aquela sobre le os le dia e la nueyt.	May be if the accident has happened to it gravitated toward the reduction of the joint, and the condition is in movement, then administer humidity in vapor and friction in the air, and comprehend, until it is relieved; or rest over the joint relieved of greasy matter; and tie it up, and leave it for the day and the night.</start_turn
E aprop osta aquela, e met aquel en banh; e quan suza, lahoras tu fregua la junctura am fricacio temprada, e aprop itera sobre aquela aleliati, so es ronhonal de moto, una veguada, e la segonda, e la .iii.a.,	And do so again, and put it in water; and when it is evening, the doctor should gently massage the joint with temperate friction, and then repeat over that relieved of nausea, so that it is harmonious of movement, one third, and two thirds, and the third.</start_turn
corrupcio ja es pervenguda sobre le denolam intrament de banh, entro que sia linit.	Corruption has already spread throughout the bowels within the belly, until it is limited.
E si voles, pausa sobre aquela fenda de vaca humida e scalfada am boder e stren sobre aquel; e fay aquo alcunas veguadas, quar aquela es humida e reduzeys a la sua disposicio.	And if you wish, rest over that wound of the wet cow and scald it around the border and stretch over that; and make a few compressions, so that it is wet and reduces to its condition.</start_turn><end_turn>
Capitol .xxviii.	Chapter XXVIII.</start_turn>
De curacio de dislocacio de malassen, so es de la junctura que es entre·l bras e la ma.	Of the treatment of dislocation of the limb, that is between the arm and the hand.</start_turn
Malassen de la ma alcunas vetz es deslocada, e la reduccio de la dislocacio de lu es leugiera, e·l contrari es de las autras juncturas, mays empero cove que sia velocitat en la reduccio de lu en la hora en la qual es deslocada, denant que le loc sia apostemat o que accida en lu apostema caut.	The limb of the hand many times is dislocated, and the reduction of the dislocation of it is light, while the opposite is of the other joints, however cover that the speed in the reduction of it in the hour in which it is dislocated is not that the heel be apostematized or that something happens to it apostematized with the caut.
E la reduccio de la dislocacio de lu es que tu pauses la junctura de la ma del malaute sobre una taula e le ministre extenda la ma de aquel, e le metge pause la sua ma o o la sua palma sobre la iminencia de la junctura, e empellisca aquela entro que retorne al sieu loc.	And the reduction of the dislocation of it is that you rest the wrist of the patient over a table and the minister extends the hand of that, and the doctor places his hand or palm over the imminent of the joint, and press that until it returns to the heel bone.</start_turn><end_turn>
Mays empero cove que sia considerat si la palma ja es ostada al ventre de la ma, lahoras le malaute pause le dos de la sua ma sobre una taula deves la extencio e la reduccio; e si la dislocacio es precedent deves le dos de la ma, lahoras sia la posicio de la ma de aquel intrinicequement sobre la taula, per so que la ma del metge caja sobre aquela iminencia de la junctura.	However it must be considered if the palm is already twisted inside the hand, the doctor must place two hands of the patient over a table beyond the extension and the reduction; and if the dislocation is previous, you must place two hands of the patient, the doctor must place his hand intrinsically over the table so that his hand covers that imminent of the joint.</start_turn><end_turn
E donc si retorna tantost, bon es; e sino, lahoras strenh aquela am empastre cedant le apostema e layssa aquel; e no iteres aquo, quar sino, no soferta ni no podes sobre la reduccio de lu pus que passan a lu dias.	And so if it returns well, it is good; and if not, the doctor should tighten that with a bandage yielding the apostema and leave that; and do not repeat that, because if not, it will suffer or cannot be done over the reduction of it until they pass over it days.</start_turn><end_turn
Mays empero la junctura roman segon la sua tortuositat; e no notz al malaute alcuna causa, sino que la ma es mollificada e no pot strenher alcuna causa; lahoras sapias que les nervis son trincatz o trissatz, e lahoras no es engen en lu sino que sia strenhuda am cauteri prop le cazament de lu e fort leu aquo confereys alcuna causa.	However the joint remains according to its stiffness; and do not notice to the patient any cause, but that the hand is softened and cannot tighten any cause; the doctor should know that the nerves are cut or crushed, and that it is not due to it but that it is tightened with a pointed cautery as much as possible in the case of it and strong as much as it confers any cause.</start_turn><end_turn
Donc cum malassem es retornada, lahoras pausa sobre lu empastre le qual havem recomtat, e sia layssat e strenhut per v dias; e aprop sia desliat e sia layssat e la ma de lu sia excercitada.	Therefore when the limb is returned, the doctor should rest over it the bandage that has been recommended, and leave it and tighten it for five days; and then untie it and leave it and exercise the hand.</start_turn><end_turn
Mays si le movement de lu es ostat e accideys en lu alcuna gravitat, lahoras leniys aquela am aygua cauda e am fricacio alcunas veguadas, entro que sia alleujat.	However if the movement of it is last and the accident has happened to it in any gravity, the doctor should lengthen that with cold water and with some compressions until it is relieved.</start_turn><end_turn
Capitol .xxix.	Chapter XXIX.</start_turn
De la curacio de dislocacio dels ditz.	From the treatment of dislocation of the fingers.
Alcunas veguadas so dislocatz les ditz a tota partida.	Some veins are dislocated from their entirety throughout the limb
E quan es dislocat alcun dit de aquels al dos de la palma o al ventre de lu, lahoras sten le dit e impelleys la dislocacio de lu am les tieus pouses, entro que retorne.	And when any finger of those at the base or at the palm is dislocated, then it is said to be stiff and the dislocation must be driven back by placing the thumb and little finger against it, until it returns
E aprop sostenta le cap del dit, e suspen aquel deves la part a la qual es dislocat, e layssa aquel per dos dias.	And support the head of the finger, and suspend that part from which it is dislocated, and leave it for two days
E aprop suspen aquel e exten aquel entro que dreyt sia engualhat en aquel sieu dia.	And suspend it and extend it until it is equal in that limb on the next day
E quan sira noyt, lia aquel segon aquela narracio, e no cesses desliar aquel en le dia e exercitar am movement, e lia aquel en la noyt; e fay aquo per alcus dias entro que sia streyt.	And when night comes, bind it according to that narration, and do not cease to loosen it in the day and exercise it, and bind it at night; and do this for several days until it is healed
E fay semblant am aquo, si es dislocat al ventre de la ma, e lia aquel ad aquela partida e fay am aquo la tieua primiera operacio, entro que sia sanat.	And do the same in this way if it is dislocated at the palm of the hand, and bind it to that part and do the first operation again, until it is healed
E semblantment fay am aquo quan es dislocat a las autres partidas.	Similarly do the same when it is dislocated in other parts.
Capitol .xxx.	End of document
De la curacio de dislocacio dels spondils del dos.	From the treatment of dislocation of the vertebrae of the spine.
Quan accideys ad alcun dels spondils del dos o del col dislocacio complida, e so remaugutz motz spondils de lors locs, lahoras en aquela no es curacio, quar la mort se coyta al malaute.	When an accident happens to any vertebra of the spine or the pelvis dislocates completely, and some vertebrae are displaced from their places, in such a case there is no cure, for death is hidden under the sickness
E senhal de aquo es que la egestio del malaute es fora-eyssida ses voluntat, e no pot retenir aquela; e motas veguadas so mollificatz alcus membres de lu o doas cambas de lu o dos brasses de lu, o un de aquels; o es remaugut un spondil de son loc, quar motas veguadas es remaugut e motas veguadas es fayta la remocio de aquels a quatre partidas.	And a sign of this is that the evacuation of the sickness is beyond voluntary control, and cannot be retained; and some veins are softened in some part of the limb or two veins of the limb or two bones of the limb, or one of these; or a vertebra is displaced from its place, which is softened and that the evacuation is made to four parts
Donc aquela ja es remauguda a las partidas detras e es nompnada gelbozitat.	Therefore that has already been softened behind and is called gelliosis.
Mays la curacio de lu es que lahoras consideras si la gelbozitat accidey de puerissia, quar lahoras en aquela no es curacio ni de aquela no es sanacio de tot.	May the treatment of it be that you consider if the gelliosis happened in infancy, for in that case neither the cure nor the healing of everything is possible
Mays en aquela que ve per cazement o per percussio o per semblant ad aquels, ja diyssero les Antics las manieras de curacio am sermo prolixs, del qual lo mays retorna am profieyt; mays yeu ja e abreujat de aquel del qual lo pauc escusa del trop de lu, per la mieua propinquitat a la entencio mieua exposicio, am la qual he aquo expausat et format ex instrument divers de aquel am le qual mostrero aquo e espausero aquel.	May in that case where it appears by chance or by percussion or by sensation that the ancients spoke of long methods of treatment, of which the most useful returns with profit; but I have already mentioned that I will abbreviate from that which is little useful for the great number, because of my proximity to the understanding of my exposition, which is what I have exposed and learned from various instruments, which I will show you and explain that one.
E dic que en gelbosita que accideys de la partida denant en le pietz, no es engen ni sanacio de aquela; e semblantment en aquela que es fayta a dos latz.	I say that in gelliosis that happens from the front of the foot, neither cure nor healing of that exists; and in the same way in that which it is caused by two blows.
E de aquelas no es curada sino aquela que accideys en le dos propriament am aquo que yeu recomti.	And of those there is no cure except that which happens in the two parts themselves with that which I recommend
E es que·l malaute sia extendut sobre la sua cara sobre pug engual prop de paret, e sia extendut dejos lu esturment molh per so que no sia lidit le pietz de lu.	And that the sickness be spread over its face over the edge of the gut and be extended without stretching them so that it does not touch the bones of the limb.
E aprop un fust dreyt sia pausat, ficat en la terra en la extremitat del pug entorn le cap de lu, e autra fust en aviro les pes de lu en l’autra extremitat del pueg.	And put a vessel that has been torn to stop at the root of the gut surrounding the head of the limb, and another vessel in the belly of the limb in the other extremity of the limb.
E·l ministre tengua le fust, e no sia fermat en fossa; e autre ministre tengua l’autre segon aquela forma.	And the minister has the vessel, and it is not fixed in the fossa; and another minister has the other in that way
E aprop envolopa sobre le cap del malaute e dejos les titillic liamen leon ferm; e exten la extremitat del liamel al fust le qual es deves le cap de lu, e lia aquel en lu; e aprop strenh l’autre liament sobre las ancas de lu les denols de lu, e deves las cambas de lu; e aprop ajusta totz les liamentz e lia aquels en l’autre fust le qual es deves les pes de lu.	And put a bandage over the head of the sickness and leave the nails to be seen; and extend the limb to the vessel which is at the head of the limb, and bind that to it; and put the other ligament over the buttocks of the limb under the navel, and over the bones of the limb; and adjust all the ligaments and bind them to the other vessel which is at the feet of the limb
E aprop le ministre cascu extenda le liament a la partida del fust, e no sian remaugutz les dos fustz e les liamentz dels sieus locs en les quals son ficatz, mays empero no so fermatz ayssi cum havem dit.	And the minister grasps outside and extends the ligament to the part of the vessel, and they are not displaced from the two vessels and the ligaments of the limbs in which they are fixed, but nevertheless they are not fixed as we have said.
E le metge pause las suas palmas sobre le spondil am fortaleza entro que retorne, o que pause sobre aquela una taula, e aprop que ajuste sobre la taula les sieus pes entro que retorne.	And the physician puts his palms on the vertebra with strength until it returns, or that he puts them on a table, and that he adjusts on the table the limbs of the patient until they return.
Mays si no retorna per aquesta forma, lahoras pren una taula de la qual la latitut o la longitut sia en aviro de tres brassas, e cava en la paret de la qual havem dit que es prop le malaute un loc en le qual intre la extremitat de la taula.	But if it does not return in this way, the physician takes a board of which the width or length is equal to three bones, and which is hollow in the belly, and he makes a hole in the wall of which we have said that it is proper for the sickness to be a place in which to put the limb.
E aprop pausa la maytat de la taula sobre le spondilh, e·l metge pause les sieus pes sobre l’autre extremitat, e estrenha be entro que le spondil sia coartat e que retorne al sieu loc.	And the physician places the heel of the board on the vertebra, and the physician places the limbs of the patient on the other side, and he pulls until the vertebra is compressed and returns to its place.
E si tu voles, obre am torn le qual es revolvut am la ma; e es que tu fiques en terra deves le cap del malaute en le derier del pug dos fustz, la longitut dels quals sia d’un bras, e deves le cap de lu en le derier del pug eyssament dos fustz; e sia la longitut que es entre quascun fust un palm, e ja es fayt en quascun fust trauc en le qual corr torn, e quascun sia mot fermat en terra per so que no sia maugut.	If you wish, open the turn which is rotated among the hands; and that you remain on the ground keep the head of the patient at the back of the thighs, the length of one arm, and keep the head of them at the back of the knee with two fingers; and let the length be from one fist to the other fist, and already it is done in every fist where the turn comes back, and every one that remains on the ground shall not be moved.
E sia mes un fust redon en le qual es le torn, e sia revolvut en les dos traucs dels dos fustz.	And let one fist be round in which the turn is, and let it be rotated in the two joints of the two fists.
E en la extremitat de lu es un trauc en le qual es format le fust, la longueza del qual es un palm am aquo que es revolvut; e en les dos autres fustz es semblant de aquel.	And at the end of them is a joint in which the fist is formed, the length of which is a palm as much as that which is rotated; and in the two other fists it is similar to this one
E aprop strenh les liamentz que has streyt en le pietz del malaute en le trau le qual es deves le cap de lu, e les liamentz que has streyts en las coyssas de lu en le torn le qual es deves les pes de lu.	Then strengthen the ligaments that you have strained in the feet of the patient at the joint which is behind their head, and the ligaments which you have strained in the thighs of them at the turn which is behind their feet.
E aprop deves quascun torn e stia un ministre que torssa le torn am la sua ma, e le metge engualhe le spondil segon que havem dit.	And then you must do every turn and stay there with a minister who will support the turn with his hand, and the physician will stabilize the spine as we have said
E aquesta es la forma del torn:	And this is the way of the turn:
E aprop pus que le spondil es retornat, e le loc es engualhat, lahoras cove que pauses empastre exciccatiu am album de huou, e aprop estopa; e aprop pause sobre le empastre astela de taula de la qual la latitut sia de tres ditz o enviro aquels, e la longitut de lu sia quantitat que prengua le loc de la gelbositat, e sobre la partida del spondil sa.	And when the spine has returned and the limb has been stabilized, the hour covers that you keep pressing with your hand towards the heel, and stop; and then place your hand over the bandage which is under the table which is as wide as three fingers or more, and as long as it covers the area of the swelling, and over the part of the spine that is below
E aprop sia liat am liament le qual havem dit, e uze le malaute de nutriment subtil entro que sia sanat.	And as for the ligament which we have mentioned, use the patient’s natural nourishment until they are healed.
E si roman alcuna iminencia en le loc en la fi de la sanacio, lahoras cove que sian aministradas medicinas que moilifico e liniscan am aministracio de la taula per lonc temps, la qual havem recomtada; e ja es aministrada en aquel loc lamina de plom.	And if there remains any swelling in the limb at the end of the healing, the hour covers that medicines that soften and soothe are administered with the application of the table for a long time, which we have recommended; and they are already administered in that limb lamina of lead
E alcunas veguadas accideys imminencia en le derier dels spondils del dos, e es cujat per aquela dislocacio; e es aquel os le qual ja imineys per que no cove que sia fayta prosompcio a lu am aquesta medicina, quar fort leu fara a tu accidir mort.	And many times the swelling immediately disappears behind the spines of both, and it is cured for that dislocation; and that is the bone which has already been mentioned because it does not seem to be necessary for this medicine, for its strength will do you more harm than good.
Capitol .xxxi.	Chapter XXV
De curacio de anca dislocada.	On the care of a dislocated ankle.
Sapias que la junctura del ancha e la junctura del muscle no endeve sino dislocacio tant solament, e no accideys ad aquelas aquo que accideys a las autras juncturas de petita remocio e concavitat.	Know that the joint of the ankle and the joint of the muscle must not be dislocated only, but that it must not happen to the other joints of the foot that are remote from the concavity and the prominence.
E la junctura de la ancha es dislocada segon quatre manieyras, quar es dislocada a las partidas dedintz, o a las partidas defora, o a las partidas denant, o a las partidas detras.	And the ankle joint is dislocated in four ways, which is dislocated at the front, or at the back, or at the top, or at the bottom
E majorment es dislocada a las partidas dedintz, e pauc a las partidas denant o a las partidas detras.	Mostly it is dislocated at the front, and little at the top or at the bottom
E senhal de la dislocacio de lu a las partidas de dintz es quar, quan tu ajustas la camba del malaute sana am la malaute, es pus longua e·l denolh es pus heminent que de la sana, e·l malaute no pot doblar le sieu pe deves le lenguonar, e es le loc que siec le lengonar apostemat de apostema caut, per so que·l cap de la coyssa ja es pervengut aqui.	And a sign of the dislocation at the front is that, when you adjust the limb of the patient who is healthy with the limb that is sick, the ankle is longer and the heel is more prominent than the healthy one, and the limb cannot bend the knee over the ankle, and the limb is limp even after the cautery has been performed, so that the head of the bone has already reached here.
E·l senhal de aquel al qual accideys dislocacio es a las partidas defora, es que les accidentz de lu so contraris ad aquest accident.	The sign of the dislocation at the back is that the accident happens in the opposite way to this one
E senhal de aquel al qual accideys dislocacio a las partidas denant es quar expan la camba sieua segon compliment, mays empero no dobla aquela ses dolor que es en le denol, e si se perforsa ad anar e no pot sobre aquo a las partidas denant; e la urina de lu es retenguda e l’engonar de lu es apostemat, e deves la ambulacio de lu sobre le talo.	The sign of the dislocation at the top is that the limb expands slightly as you command, but nevertheless does not bend where it hurts, and if you force it to go down it cannot go over that which is painful; and the urine is retained and the swelling is stagnant, and you must ambulate the limb on the ankle
E senhal de aquel al qual accideys dislocacio a las partidas detras es que no expande le denol, ni no puesca doblar aquel denant que doble le engonar, e la camba de lu es pus breva que l’autra, e l’engonar es mollificat, e·l cap de la coyssa es deves aquel loc.	The sign of the dislocation at the bottom is that it does not expand the ankle, nor does it allow bending of that which bends the swelling, and the limb is shorter than the other, and the swelling is softened, and the head of the bone is over that place.
Mays reduccio de las specias de aquesta dislocacio es que tu consideras, lahoras, si la dislocacio es vetusta et antiqua, que ja es anticada am le havent aquela aprop tu aministras reduccio de lu e roman segon la sua disposicio, lahoras no es en aquela curacio de tot; e adonc no cove que en aquela sia fayta prosompcio.	More reduction of these species of dislocation is that you consider, the hour, if the dislocation is old and ancient, that it is already outdated with you having brought it to this state, the hour is not in this treatment at all; and when it is not necessary that in this case there is any benefit from this medicine
Mays en aquel del qual la dislocacio es recent, e es una de las quatre specias de dislocacio, lahoras te coyta ad aquo que volvas la junctura e extendas aquela a las partidas dedintz e a las partidas defora, e mau aquela a la dextra e sinistra, quar fort leu retorna e no indigeys de autra cura.	More in that one in which the dislocation is recent, and is one of the four species of dislocation, the hour will order you to return the joint and extend it to the front and to the back, and also to the right and left, for the force will return and will not need any other treatment
Mays, si no retorna en aquesta manieyra, lahoras cove que tu prepares ministre fort e extendas la camba de lu de la partida pus dejos, o am las suas mas, o am liament lo qual es liat sobre la camba desus le denol; e autre ministre extenda la ma de aquel desus enayssi que meta las suas mas dejos les titillics de lu; e aprop strenha am liament leon sobre la razit de la coyssa, e tengua autre ministre ters le extremitat del liament.	May, if he does not return in this manner, it is necessary that you prepare a strong minister and extend the limb from the part beyond where you have left it, or from the chest or from the limb that is bound to it; and another minister extend the hand of that which is nearest to the head and put his thumb on the nails of the limb. Then strengthen the limb with a tight bandage over the area and have another minister hold the extremity of the bandage.
E sia extencio de lu o de la partida dedintz a l’angonar a la partida de la furcula, o de la partida detras a la partida del dos.	And extend the limb or from the part towards the ankle to the part of the heel or from the part behind to the part of the buttocks.
E sia la extencio de totz aquels en una veguada entro que·l malaute sia elevat am le sieu cos de terra e que romangua pendent.	And extend all of them together until the patient is elevated on the seat of the earth and remains hanging down
E aquesta specia de extencio es specia cominal a totas quatre.	And this method of extension is customary for all four.
E donc si la dislocacio retorna am aquo que havem dit, sira bo; e sino, lahoras es necessari a tota specia aquo que dire de la propria curacio.	And thus if the dislocation returns where we have said, it is well; and if not, it is necessary to take all the measures that we have said of proper care
En la reduccio de lu propria, quan es dislocada, e la dislocacio es a las partidas dedintz, cove que·l malaute sia ressupinat sobre le sieu latz sa; e aprop pausa les liamentz sobre la razit de la coyssa en aquel loc le qual entre le cap de la coyssa e·l loc que es dejos le langonar; e aprop exten le liament en sus de la part del angonar a la pus auta partida de la furcula.	In the reduction of the limb itself, when it is dislocated, if the dislocation is at the heel, cover that the patient should be placed sitting on the buttocks; and then suspend the ligaments over the area of the joint at that place where between the head of the joint and the place that is left to hang down; and then extend the limb from the ankle to the highest part of the heel
E aprop autre ministre fort prengua les brasses de lu, e amerme le loc gros de la coyssa malaute e extenda a las partidas deforo per extencio vehement, quar aquela retorna en le sieu loc.	And another minister should firmly grasp the ankles and immediately immobilize the great toe of the painful joint and extend the limb from the other side for violent extension, so that that which returns to the seat of the joint
E aquesta specia es de pus leugiera curacio am la qual aquest membre es reduzit que las autres specias.	This method is less severe treatment than the others for which this limb is reduced.<end_turn>
Mays si es excusat sobre tu e no obezeys al entrament am aquesta specia de curacio de tot, lahoras cove que sian liatz les dos pes del malaute ensemps am liament fort, leugier, sobre amdos les talos e amdos les denols.	If it is excused about you and you do not obey the order according to this method of treatment, it is necessary that both feet of the patient be bound together with a strong ligament, loosely, over both ankles and over both toes.<end_turn>
E sia la longitut de quascun de son par la quantitat de quatre ditz, e sia la camba malaute extenduda mays que l’autre per quantitat de dos ditz.	And let the length of each part be equal to the quantity of four fingers, and let the painful limb be extended more than the other by the quantity of two fingers.
E aprop le malaute sia suspendut sobre le cap del fust, e que sia en la mayso; e sia la longitut de lu de la terra la quantitat de dos brasses.	And let the patient be suspended over the head of the foot, and that he should be in the major; and let the length of the limb from the earth be equal to the quantity of two ankles
E aprop comanda a un jove fort que minuesca le cap de la coyssa, e sia suspendut am le malaute autre jove, e l’autre jove minuent la coysa am fortaleza empellesca, quar la junctura retorna al sieu loc am velocitat.	And let a strong youth command that he flex the head of the joint, and that another youth should suspend himself with the patient, and the other youth should push down the limb with force, so that the joint returns to the seat of the joint quickly.
Mays en la reducio propria, quan es dislocacio a la partida defora, cove que·l malaute jaga sobre pug segon que havem recomtat en le havent gelbozitat; e sia strenhut le liament sobre la camba malauta propriament e sobre le pietz de lu.	And in the proper reduction, when it is dislocated at the outer part, cover that the patient should grab about the heel as we have recommended in the cold; and tighten the ligament over the painful limb properly and over the toes of the limb.
E aprop dos fustz sian pausatz, la un als pes de lu, e l’autre al cap; e aprop sian pausatz fustz ajustatz al mieg del pueg ficat sobre·l qual draps humitz sian envolopatz, per so que·l malaute no sia dampnajat per que·l fust sia entre las coyssas de lu, per que deves la extencio a las partidas dejos no sia atirat.	And two thighs should be placed, one at the foot of the limb, and the other at the head; and two thighs adjusted to the middle of the thigh that is left resting on which damp cloths are wrapped, so that the patient is not moistened because the thigh is between the patient's thighs, because of that the extension of the limb from the ankle should not be too violent.<end_turn>
E aprop quascun ministre extenda a la sua part, e·l metge am la sua ma enguala la reduccio segon l’art.	And let each minister extend his part, and the doctor with his hand grasp the reduction according to the art.<end_turn
Donc, si obezeys a revercio, sira bo grandament; e sino, pausa sobre aquela diligentment e ayssi quo havem dit en gelbozitat per aquela engualment.	Therefore, if you obey respectfully, it will be very good; and if not, suspend until you have diligently completed what we have said in cold for that engagement.<end_turn>
Mays cove que·l malaute jagua sobre les sieus latz sa quetament.	And cover that the patient grasps about the buttocks slightly.<end_turn
E quan la dislocacio es a las partidas denant, lahoras cove que la camba sia extenduda leugierament, e es segon aquesta meteyssa narracio sobre pueg; e le metge pause la palma de la sua ma dreyta sobre·l langonar malaute, e aprop coarte aquel am l’autra ma, e am aquela coartacio pausa aquel extendut a las partidas dejos a la partida del denol.	And when the dislocation is at the ankle, it is necessary that the limb be slightly extended; and this is according to the aforementioned method for the thigh; and the doctor should place the palm of his right hand over the painful limb, and let him take hold of that with his left hand, and with that hold the limb extended from the ankle to the heel.
E si la dislocacio es a las partidas detras, lahoras no cove que·l malaute sia extendut a las partidas dejos, e es elevat sobre la terra; habantz cove que sia pausat sobre causa dura, ayssi cum cove le eyssament si l’ancha de lu es dislocada a las partidas defora, segon aquo que havem dit del jasement de lu sobre dos anchas; e es sobre la sua cara e les liamentz sian extendutz, segon que havem dit, no ha guayre.	And if the dislocation is at the back, it is not necessary that the limb be extended from the ankle, but that it be elevated above the earth; and it is necessary that it be held firmly in place, just as if the ankle joint was dislocated outwards, as we have said of the position of the limb over two palms; and it is on its face and the ligaments are extended, as we have said, not too tightly.<end_turn>
E cove que sia aministrada compressio am taula sobre le loc al qual yeys la junctura.	And it is necessary that a bandage be administered around the area around the joint which is painful.<end_turn
Donc cum la reducio es complida segon que cove — e·l senhal de la reduccio de lu no es amaguat a tu, e es que tu extendas del malaute doas cambas, e quan tu vezes aquelas enguals e le malaute extrenh la sieua camba e expandeys aquela ses excusacio, lahoras sapias que·l membre segon que cove es retornat — e lahoras tu ajusta doas coyssas e pausa empastre e extrenh am benda ayssi que la ancha no sia mauguda en alcuna de las partidas; e adheresca le malaute a repaus per tres dias o per quatre.	Therefore when the reduction is completed as we have said – and the sign of the reduction of the limb is not hidden from you, that you extend two limbs of the patient, and when you have once again pulled those bandages and the patient pulls his seat limb and expands that excuse, you will know that the limb as we have said is returned – and then you adjust two cushions and place them under and extend with a bandage so that the ankle is not bruised in any of the parts; and keep the patient still for three days or for four.
E aprop deslia le liament e l’empastre, e compara la una camba am l’autra.	And remove the ligament and the paste, and compare one limb with the other.
Lahoras, si vezas aquelas enguals en vustament, lahoras sapias que la dislocacio ja es fermada, e adonc layssa le malaute anar.	When, however, these inflammations remain in the limb, it is known that the dislocation has already ceased, and now you must let the patient rest.</end_of_turn>
E si vezas alcuna causa de mollificacio, lahoras tu retorna e emplastra aquel, e extrenh aquel segon la tua primiera strectura, e layssa aquel en tres dias.	And if any cause of discomfort remains, then you return it and cover that [affected area], and remove that according to your first structure, and leave that for three days.</end_of_turn
E aprop deslia aquel, e fay aquel tardar en ambulacio sobre quascu per alcus dias, entro que sia confortat.	And remove that [affected area], and make that walk slowly on crutches for several days, until comfort is restored.</end_of_turn>
Capitol .xxxii.	(The text continues with further medical instructions)</end_of_turn>
De curacio de dislocacio del denolh.	Treatment for dislocation of the thumb.</end_of_turn>
Le denolh es dislocat segon tres manieyras, quar es dislocat a las partidas defora, e a las partidas dedintz, e a las partidas dejos mays a las partidas detras; e a las partidas denant no es dislocat.	The thumb is dislocated in three ways, that is, dislocation at the base, at the middle, and at the distal joint; and not at the proximal joint.</end_of_turn
E le senhal de dislocacio de lu es que comandes al malaute que aplique la sua camba am la coyssa; lahoras sapias que·l denol es dislocat.	And the sign of dislocation is that the patient applies pressure to the limb; know that the thumb is dislocated.</end_of_turn
E la restauracio de totas las manieyras de lu es que fassas cezer le malaute dreyt, enayssi que ja extenda la sieua camba, si pot sobre aquo; adherir le tieu dos a la cara de lu, e pausa le pe de lu entre les tieus pes; e aprop fay adherir le denol de lu am las tuas palmas, e rete aquelas entre les tieus ditz sobre le denolh de lu am fortaleza, e autre ministre extenda le sieu pe entro que·l denol retorne a son loc.	And the restoration of all these positions is to make the patient flex the limb, extend the limb as much as possible; attach two fingers to the side of the limb, and suspend the foot of the limb between the thighs; and make sure to reattach the thumb to its place between the two metacarpal bones with force, and another assistant should extend the limb until the thumb returns to its place.</end_of_turn
E senhal de reddicio de lu es que la sua camba adharesca am la coyssa am levitat no-laboroza.	And the sign of recovery is that the limb rests easily without pain.</end_of_turn
E aprop emplastra aquel e fay adhirir la camba am la coyssa, e aprop lia aquelas emsemps am una benda per tres dias o per quatre, e aprop deslia aquelas.	And cover that with a dressing and make the limb adhere to the limb, and bind the two together with a bandage for three days or four, and then remove the bandage.</end_of_turn
E no uze le malaute de ambulacio per alcus dias, entro que sia sanat e cofortat.	Do not let the patient walk for several days, until they are healed and comfortable.</end_of_turn
Mays si la reduccio de lu a tu es excusada, lahoras aministra fort extencio am liamentz dels quals en la curacio de la hancha precedit narracio.	Moreover, if the reduction was performed by you, know that you must administer a strong extension of the ligaments that were previously treated for the swelling.</end_of_turn
Capitol .xxxiii.	End of treatment for dislocation of the thumb.</end_of_turn>
De la curacio de la dislocacio del talo.	Treatment for dislocation of the ankle.</end_
Le talo alcunas veguadas es remaugut per petita remocio, e alcunas veguadas es dislocat segon compliment, e la dislocacio de lu es fayta o a las partidas dedintz o a las partidas deforo.	The ankle may be slightly sprained due to minor dislocation, or it may be completely dislocated, and the dislocation can be located at the proximal or distal joint.</end_of_turn
E le senhal de la dislocacio de lu es que vezes le talo imflat procedent a la partida a la qual es dislocat.	The sign of dislocation is that sometimes the ankle swells as a result of the dislocation.</end_of_turn
Mays la curacio de la remocio de lu es de leugiera reddicio, e es que sia extendut am facilitat am las mas e sia engualhat entro que retorne.	The treatment for reduction is gentle recovery, that is, with ease and without pain, and is extended with the greatest ease when possible, and is reduced when it returns.</end_of_turn
Mays en la curacio de lu quan es dislocat segon compliment, cove que fasses cezer le malaute dreyt, e tengua aquel un ministre fort e valent de la partida detras del dos de aquel en le mieg loc de lu.	When the dislocation is complete, make the patient flex the limb and keep that finger held in place by a strong and valiant assistant at the back of the limb in place of the dislocation.</end_of_turn
E aprop te tu am la tieua ma dreyta le pe de la pus sobirana part, e am la tua ma sinistra de la part pus dejos del pe en le loc de la cavilha.	And put your right hand over the great toe and your left hand over the little toe of the foot in the place of the ankle.</end_of_turn
E aprop atira le pe a tu am la tua ma dreyta, e aprop am la sinistra per dos veguadas, e aprop exten am la sinistra; e empelleys le pietz del pe am la dreyta deves la camba ses trebalh.	And pull the foot towards you with your right hand, and with the left hand for two inches, and extend with the left; and support the foot of the limb with the right hand beside the bandage.</end_of_turn
E fay aquo doas veguadas segon que havem comtat.	And do this two inches as many times as necessary.</end_of_turn
E aprop empelleys le pietz del pe a la camba la tersa veguada, e tu es a la cavilha.	And support the foot of the limb to the bandage for the third inch, and you are at the ankle.</end_of_turn
Donc si retorna en una veguada o en dos segon aquesta manieyra, e si vezes le pe engualhat, es bo; e sino, lahoras sobre lu itera la operacio, quar aquel retorna.	Therefore, if it returns in one inch or two according to this manner, and if the foot sometimes swells, it is good; otherwise, repeat the operation until it returns.</end_of_turn
Mays si a tu es prohibida la reduccio de lu am aquo que havem recomtat, lahoras fay jaser le malaute sobre le sieu dos sobre terra, e estrenh un paysel mot en terra fermat, e que caja entre las coyssas de lu, e tu ja has envolopat sobre lu drap per so que no ledesca le malaute.	If the reduction is prohibited in this way, make the patient sit on the toes on the ground, and apply a cushion under the foot, and that you keep between the thighs of the patient, and you have already immobilized the limb with a bandage to prevent it from being injured.</end_of_turn
E aprop le ministre de lu tengua las suas coyssas, e aprop autre ministre extenda le pe am las suas mas o am liament que lie sobre le col del pe; e aprop extenda aquel quascun ministre contre extencio del sieu par, e le payssel sia extant entre las coyssas del malaute retinent aquel, per so que·l cos de lu no sia atirat a las partidas dejos deves la sua extencio.	And the assistants should hold the patient's thighs, and another assistant should extend the limb with their hands or with the ligaments that lie on the ankle; and extend whichever assistant wants against the extension of the limb, and the cushion should remain between the patient's thighs to prevent the limb from being pulled downwards from its extension.</end_of_turn
E aprop le metge enguala la dislocacio am las sieuas mas, e autre ministre tengua la coyssa sana a las partidas dejos, quar la dislocacio retorna am la facilitat.	And the doctor grasps the dislocation at the hip joint, while another assistant holds the sound limb away from the affected area, so that the dislocation can return easily.
E donc cum retorna la dislocacio e es declarada a tu la sanetat de la reduccio de lu, lahoras pausa emplastre e extrenh aquela am liamentz fortment, e ligua le pe am liament a la camba.	Therefore, when the dislocation has returned and its soundness has been declared, stop the plastering and gently stretch the limb again, and bind the foot to the limb with a bandage.</end_of_turn>
E cove que temes o te guardes dels nervis les quals so detras sobre le talo, per que le liament sobre aquel no sia vehement e leda aquel fortment.	And beware or take care of the nerves that are behind the ankle, so that the ligament on that side is not tight and the other side is not too loose.</end_of_turn>
E aprop layssa aquel per dos dias o per tres; e si le liament es mollificat, extrenh aquel.	Then leave it for two days or three; and if the ligament is softened, remove it.</end_of_turn>
E aprop deslia aquel en le ters dia o en le quart, e prohibeys le malaute de anament per xl dias.	And on the fourth day or the fifth, remove the dressing and prohibit the patient from eating for forty days.</end_of_turn>
Mays si es forsat de anar denant aquel spazi, no es fayta segurtat que la dislocacio no sia sobre lu dissolvuda e corrumpuda, e aprop aquo que no recipia curacio.	May it be necessary to go down again that space, it is not wrong to ensure that the dislocation is not dissolved and corrupted, and that it receives no treatment.</end_of_turn>
E si accideys a lu apostema caut, lahoras cove que tu aministre en la cedacio de lu aquo en lo qual precedic la nostra narracio, en autre loc de curacio e de embrocacio, entro que sia remauguda.	And if during the process of treatment the patient develops a fistula, cover that in the cede of our narration in another place of care and dressing, until it has healed.</end_of_turn>
Capitol .xxxiiii.	Chapter XXXIII.</end_of_turn>
De curacio de dislocacio dels ditz dels pes.	On the treatment of dislocations of the bones of the foot.</end_of_turn
Cove que aquel qu’es dislocat sia engualhat am pauca extencio ses trebal; e aquo que no es dificil, abantz es leugier.	Therefore, that which has been dislocated must be grasped with little traction; and what is not difficult, abstain from it.</end_of_turn
Mays si la dislocacio es en alcus nozes del dos del pe, lahoras cove que fassas cezer le malaute le sieu pe sobre loc engual de la terra o sobre taula, e sia estant ayssi cum si anava.	If the dislocation is in the ankle bone of the two feet, then cover the patient’s foot with the earth or a table, and remain in that way as if you were going.</end_of_turn
E aprop tu sta de pes, e pausa le tieu pe sobre aquo que imineys de las juncturas, e aprop calca aquel am le tieu pe am vertut entro que retorne, e que vejas aquel ja engualhat e no aparesca en le loc eminencia.	Then rest your feet, and keep the foot above the joints still over what you imagine from the joints, and keep your heel on the same level as before, until it returns, and that you see that it has healed and does not reappear in the immediate area.</end_of_turn
E aprop pausa dejos le ventre del pe de lu una taula que prengua tot le pe, a la qual sian dos caps, e aprop strenh aquel am strectura decent e ferma per tres dias; e aprop deslia aquel e fay aquel repausar de ambulacio per motz dias, entro que sia estrenhut e de reddicio sia assegurat.	And leave the patient’s foot under a board that covers all the foot, which has two caps, and keep that tight with a strap for three days; and then remove that and have the patient walk for a month, until it is healed and the recovery is ensured.</end_of_turn
Capitol .xxxv.	Chapter XXXV.</end_of_turn
De las specias de dislocacio que sian faytas am plagua o am fractura o am quascuna ensemps.	Of the kinds of dislocations that are caused by swelling or fracture or any other lesion.</end>
Quan accideys alcuna causa de aquelas, e tu te perforssas en la curacio de aquela e en la restauracio de lu, motas veguadas succezeys la mort.	When any cause of these has occurred, and you have perforated in the treatment of that and in the restoration of it, many times death follows.</end_of_turn
E per aquo no cove que sobre la curacio de lu presuma, sino aquel que es savi en l’art, de lonc uzatge, misericordios e pietados, tardiu, no-ardit ni presomptuos; e que use en le comensament de medicinas que cedan apostemas cautz tant solament, e leyssa le malaute al divinal jutgament, sino ad aquel al qual speras salut de perdicio, am de la malautia alleviacio, e en la qual appareys alcuna speransa.	Therefore, for this we do not presume that in the treatment of that we should trust, but he who is learned in the art, of long experience, merciful and humble, prudent, not arrogant or presumptuous; and that he use in the beginning of medicines that do not cause fistula so much alone, and that you read the patient to the divine judgment, rather than to that to which you hope for healing, from the disease relief, and in which you appear any hope.</end_of_turn
E adonc esforsa te tantost far de lu la reduccio en le comensament de la causa, denant que endevengua apostema caut.	And so do your best to make the reduction in the beginning of the cause, despite the fistula.</end_of_turn
E adonc si le membre retorna segon que volem, lahoras aministra regiment le qual ceda apostema caut e cura la plagua am aquo que conveneys a lu dels enguentz desiccatius.	And so if the limb returns as we want, then administer a regimen that yields fistula and heals the swelling in what way it seems convenient to you.</end_of_turn
E si dislocacio es am fractura e accideys en le os satagias separadas, lahoras tu perforsa le stement de lor, e fay en aquo so que havem dit en las malautias simplas de aquo que es precedit en les locz de aquels.	And if the dislocation is in a fractured bone and the fragments are separated, then you perforate the membrane of their cavity, and do what has been said in the simple diseases of what precedes these.</end_of_turn
E guarda e esquiva segon la tua vertut aquel del intrament en las vias de temor segon que a tu es precedida la mia predicacio; quar aquo es milhor a tu deves le tieu Creator, e mays permanent a la tua gloria, e mays saludos al tieu cos verays aquels en le tieu temps.	And keep and avoid according to your prudence that which is before you of the treatment of fear as I have foretold; for what is better for you must be attributed to the Creator, and more lasting for your glory, and more profitable for the true things that are in your heart.</end_of_turn
Ayssi fineysso las paraulas de Albucasim perfieytament de las quals Dieus ne sia benezeyt.	Thus ends the treatise of Albucasim perfectly blessed by God.</end_of_turn>
Amen.	Amen.</end_of_turn>
